text:

title: BEST HOTEL IN NEW YORK!!
text:
By far the BEST hotel in the United States!! From the bell hops to the front desk and concierge staff, to the Wonderful Smell of the entire hotel…. I could on and on about how wonderful our experience was!!  The housekeeping, maintenance and room service was even more impressive!! 

This will be the ONLY hotel I will at when I’m in NY! A true 5 star treatment! Money definitely well spent!!!

title: Terribly in need of updating
text:
My recent stay at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Columbus Circle, NYC, left much to be desired. Arriving on foot during a heavy rainstorm, I was struck by the stark contrast between my experience and that of the upscale guests being ushered into their waiting Escalades. While struggling with my malfunctioning umbrella, I felt overlooked by the front door staff, who seemed preoccupied with attending to more affluent visitors.

Upon reaching the upper level, I found the check-in process lacking the finesse I would expect from a premium hotel. Despite presenting my ID and credit card, I was not offered assistance with my bags until after completing the formalities. The manager's demeanor suggested skepticism regarding my presence, making me feel unwelcome from the outset. Moreover, the service at the reception desk appeared inexperienced, requiring my guidance even for basic tasks like processing my credit card payment.

My room, situated on the 48th floor with a park view, failed to impress. The hotel's dated décor and lack of upkeep were immediately evident, casting a shadow over the supposedly luxurious experience. The room felt far from clean, with stains on the carpet and frayed curtains that detracted from its overall appeal. The lighting was insufficient, making it challenging to read or engage in any activities that required adequate illumination.

While the in-room dining service was a standout, providing delicious meals and attentive staff, this was overshadowed by other disappointments. A late-night interruption by a staff member delivering unrequested snacks further marred my experience, raising questions about respect for guests' privacy and the necessity of such gestures after midnight.

Overall, my stay at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel left me underwhelmed and questioning the value of its lofty prices. For those seeking Manhattan standards and a truly premium experience, I would recommend exploring alternatives such as the Ritz-Carlton on Central Park South. Until significant updates are made to address the hotel's dated facilities and service shortcomings, it falls short of meeting expectations for discerning travelers.

title: An Unforgettable Experience that Exceeded All Expectations
text: From the first moment at the Mandarin Oriental, New York, my wife and I felt immersed in an atmosphere of unparalleled luxury, but it was the exceptional service, especially from Yarisol, that made our honeymoon truly memorable. Their attention to detail, from arranging romantic surprises in our suite to personalized recommendations for exploring the city, exceeded all of our expectations. Not only did Yarisol ensure our stay was perfect, she also added a personal touch that made our experience unique. The hotel itself is magnificent, with stunning views and prime location, but the warm service and genuine hospitality truly set it apart. Thank you, Mandarin Oriental - Yarisol and German, for making our honeymoon an experience that we will always remember fondly.

title: Very Good experience
text: Overall very good.  The room was comfortable  - Hudson River View Room - not bad at the corporate rare but not so sure at the full online rate.  Turndown service was a little erratic - most nights we had cloths by the side of the bed but, on one occasion, only on one side of the bed;  one night chocolates, one night cheese, other nights nothing.  Whilst I appreciate the  sustainable products (i.e. no little shampoos etc.) the toilet paper is probably the thinnest/worst I have ever experienced in a deluxe hotel.  All concierges were excellent, offering great advice and help, except for one who spoke so slowly and provided so much information that we couldn't wait for the conversation to end...and they didn't share any information which we couldn't easily find on the internet!   In all other respects, our experience was exactly as we would expect from a hotel at this level/prices.

title: Incredible place to stay right by Central Park!
text:
This was our second time at a Mandarin Oriental property and we were absolutely delighted with our stay.

From the moment we checked in everyone was super welcoming and made us feel at home. The views from our Hudson River Suite on the 48th floor were breathtaking, especially at golden hour and once the lights came up at night 😍

Breakfast was equally delicious and with a wide variety of options to choose from. Highly recommend you to have at least one breakfast in the room as it’s not everyday that you can have breakfast while enjoying the views over NYC, truly a remarkable experience during our stay!

The location is perfect, right in front of Central Park and just a few minutes walking away from the iconic Times Square.

There’s also a mall right below the property which is very convenient since you don’t even need to leave the building to access it.

We will return one day for sure 🙏🏼

title: Luxury hotel in a great location in Central Park
text: Ideal upscale hotel in NY as it is superior in every way to all the other 5 stars I have done including the Plaza and the two Ritz. Rooms overlooking the Park are preferred. Located above a 5-story upscale shopping center including a grocery market. Staff more welcoming than elsewhere in NY. Easier parking than elsewhere also with access either by valet or by yourself via website. Surprising food for a "main" hotel restaurant.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Perfect Location and A Wonderful Team
text: Thank you for making our stay a memorable one.  Your hotel is beautiful, has a perfect location, and you have a wonderful team.   I also want to take a moment to acknowledge Yvonne at the front desk, Riyadh and Patrick at the Door, the bellmen who helped us I forgot their names.  They are all fantastic customer service professionals.  I appreciate their excellent assistance and attention to detail.  Highly recommended to experience a true luxury hotel stay.

title: The NY that everyone dreams of
text: The hotel is located exactly where NY lovers want to go. Lovers of music and ballet, the proximity of the Met represents a real asset, as does that of Cenral Park (for morning jogging). The views are just dazzling! The particularly attentive staff.

title: wonderful stay at wonderful hotel
text:
excellent stay.  service and accommodations were superb, and the view of central park was amazing.  

everyone from the front desk to the bell staff went out of their to make our stay memorable.  

i can't wait to stay there again.  i can't imagine a better experience.

title: Closest and safest hotel to Mt Sinai Hospital
text: Mimi in reception was EXCELLENT!  My son was in Mt Sinai Hospital unexpectedly and I needed last minute reservations at the closest hotel.  She was so kind and understanding. The restaurant graciously prepared me very late to go food upon arrival from Texas. The staff was extremely professional. The room (and the restroom) was huge for NYC. I felt very safe walking to and from the hotel and hospital all hours of the day and night.  The restaurants in the connected center were amazing and prepared DELICIOUS food to go for my son and me daily. Thank you Mimi for assisting me!  You made a stressful situation so much easier to tolerate.

title: outstanding hospitality at MO New York
text:
We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental New York in March 2024 for 6 days. The stay was fantastic and the property is modern and very luxurious. We had a Hudson River view room and were very happy. 

The pool and gym area are very spacious and offer a great place to relax after sightseeing. The MO lounge has a spectacular view overlooking Columbus Circle and Central Park, a perfect place for a light dinner or drinks. 

Many thanks to Marcel Thoma and his staff for an outstanding service and exceptional hospitality! We will be back soon. Philipp and Raphael from Switzerland

title: Perfect place to stay
text: Beautiful property, very nice room with a spectacular view overlooking the Central Park and the Columbus square, the breakfast was superb and staff was great, reception team was very helpful. You can easily access top locations from the hotel, I liked it very much, thank you

title: Good Hotel in Good Location
text:
Hotel is good if you get a good price. Really enjoyed views from room, bathroom, location and access to restaurants and Whole Foods at Columbus Circle. The gym no pool area were also nice.
Service could use a bit of improvement. Was hit or miss at the lounge and at front door/bell desk. Room was also a bit worn and on the small side. 
Once again, would only consider if price was right.

title: Nice, but not up to their brand anymore
text: Since we stayed here almost eight years ago, it seems to have lost it's five star edge. It is conveniently located next to Central Park and has gorgeous views, for the most part, depending on your room. But, there was marijuana smoke in the lobby downstairs from who knows where, the bell staff was not so professional nor friendly, they do not have nespresso machines nor complimentary water in the room upon check in. You have to request it after checking in though. I found this very different than eight years ago. And the lobby did not seem to offer fresh artisan coffee, which they should if they do not have a nespresso machine in the room already. The fitness room attendants were not so friendly, but the cardio machines were nice and the view is nice there too. I  hope they maintain their brand.

title: Mandarin Oriental NY
text: I grew up in NYC and the Mandarin Oriental was one of the best in the city when it first opened.  Everything in the time warner building was quality.  I was very jealous of the condo owners cause they had access to the hotel facilities and spa.  The spa was in a class of its own.  Unfortunately the hotel has gone downhill.  The staff looks worn out and so does their uniforms.  The room was spacious and looks good in photos but it had Holiday Inn vibes.  Great view but that cost 50% more than standard rooms.  Not sure if it was worth it.  I always order a club sandwich at hotels to set the standard.  Unfortunately room service was not up to my club sandwich standards.  The deli downstairs could’ve done better.  It’s right across the street from Central Park and there’s quite a few Michelin stars in the building.  You should book Masa if you’re there.  He usually serves the bar himself

title: Stellar customer service
text: The entire staff in the Mandarin Oriental Hotels are exceptional. From the doorman’s to housekeeping. We have stayed in Brickell, Florida but this one in New York was amazing! The room service food is succulent and we totally can’t wait to return in a few months.

title: Wonderful for Events
text: Everyone at the Mandarin was so wonderful in making our gala event such a success. A special thank you to Albert in security, and Maureen for the time and attention they provided. It is so appreciated! Looking forward to working with you all again soon.

title: Memorable Stay for the Win
text: amazing stay as usual the staff always makes me feel at home. From the moment we walked into the hotel Tully is always so Kind and helpful . We arrived earlier than expected and thought we would be dropping off our bags and heading back out however there was a room available and were given the option for early check in. The front office agent was so welcoming and polite. Upon returning to our room we had a beautiful birthday surprise I can’t be more grateful for the attention to detail  and care we received. In room dining breakfast was amazing  as well !!! Can’t wait to come back soon  Thank You all  !!!!

title: Paradise Overlooking Central Park
text: Yulia at check in was so sweet and professional. I had a feeling the stay was going to exceed expectations. Everyone we came in contact with were supper warm and made me feel like I was welcomed.  I booked a regular Hudson view king and was upgraded to a very nice suite overlooking Central Park. It was beautiful. And just a 5 minute walk to Lincoln Center which is why we were in the city in the first place.

title: Almost top
text: Came here for a big work event, but with my wife and toddler. Room was fantastic and they prepared lovely touches like setting up a tent for our son. Overall the weekend was pretty seamless, the party itself was great and all the hotel facilities were what you would expect. The concierge was very helpful. A couple of minor details around housekeeping stop me from giving 5 stars - we had booked external babysitting but had asked the front desk not to ring the room when they arrived but to use our mobiles as this would wake our baby. Clearly this was too complicated an instruction as it kept happening, very annoying. Also housekeeping came at random times or not at all. But issues all fairly minor and we are still big fans of the brand.

title: Stay at the Mandarin Oriental New York
text: We had a great stay in New York at your hotel. We have not once been disappointed by your services. Everything was amazing! Each of your employees were attentive and very pleasant. We immediately felt welcome. Thank you for this incredible experience that we were able to live alongside you.

title: Wonderful weekend at the Mandarin
text: We wish to express our appreciation and gratitude for a perfect, truly perfect, experience at the M.O., NY during our stay over Jan 26 - 29, 2024.  We were visiting from Atlanta to shop for an engagement ring and i'm so happy we chose the Mandarin.   Upon arrival at the upstairs lobby check-in, we were greeted by Ms. Yarisol.  During our welcome, she asked what brought us to NY and I shared with her why we were visiting (i.e. engagement ring).  From there,  Ms. Yarisol architected an experience that we'll never forgot and that we'll always appreciate.  Thank you!  We'd also like to recognize Mr. Sam and Mr. Daniel in the M.O. Lounge.  Mr. Sam made us feel like old, welcomed friends each time we visited the lounge.  Once there, Mr. Daniel ensured that our experience in the lounge was nothing short of wonderful.  His attentiveness, smile and willing to take the best photo were amazing.  Unfortunately, we can't recognize each person that made our experience seem that we were the reason the hotel was built.   In conclusion, we sincerely appreciate what each member of the M.O. NY team did to make our special weekend in NY all the more special.  You've truly made us, Fans of M.O.".   Each time a friend asks about our trip, we tell them about you.  Thank you - Susan & Brian

title: Excellent service
text: The Mandarin Oriental in New York is celebrated for its luxurious amenities, including breathtaking views of Central Park, excellent service, and prime location. Guests have praised the attentive and personal service, the quality of the restaurants and gym, and the overall enchanting atmosphere. However, some guests noted that the decor could be updated and that the value might not match the steep prices, given the outdated rooms and occasional lapses in cleanliness. Despite these critiques, many find their stay at the Mandarin Oriental to be memorable and recommend it for its central location and opulent amenities.

title: FANtastic Family Stay
text:

Thank you so much for this FANtastic stay my family and myself had in New York.
From the first step entering the hotel until a warm and nice farewell, we did enjoyed every minute.
Thank you very much for everything you made possible.

Best Regards

title: Holy WOW!!
text: An amazing experience. That’s what it truly was. From the wonderful gentleman who met us curbside, to check in, to the bell staff, one was more fantastic than the other. Truly a must stay and experience. The lounge restaurant was also amazing. The wait staff, incredible. A+++++++

title: One of New Yorks very best hotels
text: Always a joy to return to the warm, attentive and very personal service offered by every member of the team. A hotel where your morning coffee order is remembered, your name always used and nothing seems to much trouble. The concierge was able to get me tables in sold out restaurants on more than one occasion. With a location and views to match it is one of the cities finest hotels.

title: Overall Great stay
text: Overall my stay was very good. The doormen, concierge and front desk people were very professional and helpful.The only issue I had was the car service to the airport which the driver was very rude and could tell this was a contract third party that the hotel used. To the credit of the hotel, they took the cost of transportation off my bill which I wasn't expecting but glad they did since it was very unprofessional for the driver to behave the way he did. And I would also say the front people you meet at the restaurant lobby have an energy of just working a job rather then making sure each guest feels like they're staying at a flagship property. This was my first time ever staying at this 5 star hotel for my birthday. They had a birthday cake in my room which I thought was very nice and room service was very good as well. I believe I would return again with my girlfriend this time but would also check out the Aman hotel to compare 5 star service

title: A Falsely-Advertised View and General Disappointment that Falls Far Short of the Mandarin Standard
text: The Mandarin NYC is a disappointment and detriment to the brand.  Firstly, what is advertised as a "park view" isn't; the view is obstructed by the Trump International, resulting in what every other hotel on the park refers to as a "partial park view."  This is tantamount to false advertising, and I am shocked that Mandarin does it.  Secondly, the walls are very thin; during my stay, I could regularly hear my neighbor conducting phone calls.  This is unacceptable for a hotel at Mandarin NYC's price point - one should never, ever hear their neighbors conducting routine business at conversation level in a $1000+/night room.  Additionally, the headboards in the Mandarin NYC's rooms are loosely connected to the walls; every time anyone gets in, out, or shifts in bed, the headboards bang the walls, resulting in loud noises.  I was routinely awoken by this noise.  Additionally, the general state of the building is poor; rooms feel threadbare, panels in the elevators are loose, carpets are stained, etc.  Finally, some of the clientele are unseemly; on several occasions, I rode the elevator with groups of people who were loud, rude, and reeked of pot - definitely not the sort I'd expect at a Mandarin.  While I understand a hotel open to the public can't control who stays in it, there is an impression of a proprietorship of questionable standards.  Staff service was on-brand and adequate, but it was grossly overshadowed by systemic issues with the property.  All of this meant that I cut my stay short and moved to the Ritz on 59th, which provided a much more satisfactory experience.  Even though I am a MO member, I will never stay at the Mandarin NYC again.

title: Best Hotel experience in NYC !
text:
Mandarin Oriental was the best hotel experience I've ever had in New York.

The hotel has an amazing location and excellent staff who are all incredibly friendly. The facilities , including the restaurants and the gym are world class. 

I had the perfect stay and would recommend Mandarin Oriental to everyone !

title: Great stay
text:
Hotel was really nice even if a tad old stylish. However the experience was great, with an amazing room view over central park. Breakfast stunning with an even better view! 
Only -ve Was a bit weird that we had to pay for a bottle of water in the room.

title: Great stay
text:
Fantastic stay at the Mandarin Oriental
hotel. Rooms were great -
Spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was a highlight as were the plush robes.The view and location was ideal. The service was excellent also. Highly recommend a stay here.

title: Visit in December for company party
text: I went there for my company December party and everything was great. The reception was great and attentive, the rooms are great and the views are incredible. Location is perfect, right next to the park so you can go for a run directly from hotel.

title: Christmas Party in New York at the Mandarin
text:
Overall I had a nice time, main plus were the staff - very friendly and welcoming. The views of Central Park are incredible and I found location second to none. As a venue for our annual Christmas party the  Mandarin was both well equipped and created and unforgettable atmosphere. 

Unfortunately, there were some drawbacks. Some of the food is very overpriced, the breakfast options in particular. I have no problem with the quality of the meals - but you are paying a premium above a New York-norm, which in itself is difficult. Additionally I would’ve hoped that a hotel in this bracket would have 24-hour members bar, this did not create a major headache - but it did mean we were made to move on at times we have rather enjoyed the views from the lobby area restaurant/bar.

title: Quality
text: Amazing location. Looked after our firm with high quality service and attention to detail. Would certainly recommend this hotel to couples visiting new york,  firms or families looking for a great location and service to match. Bravo well done I will be back.

title: 5* location, the rest a bit less so
text: Great location and very responsive, effective and friendly staff. The rest is good but not great. The view from the swimming pool is amazing but the pool itself feels a bit dated. An armrest of the desk chair in the room was loose. The faucet of the shower stayed in my hand (I could put it back).

title: Great Experience !
text: I recommend the Mandarin Oriental in New York, it was such a nice experience. Staff and location are top !!! In December, the atmosphere in the city is really nice so it was a perfect combo. The view over Central Park is unreal as it is for the skyline.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: The Mandarin Oriental in New York City is an exceptional hotel. It offers a stunning view over Central Park. The hotel staff embodied a 5 star mentality. There was an issue the arose at checkout that a staff member handled perfectly. Simply the best place to stay in NYC. 0 complaints.

title: 5 Stars
text: Great experience! The view, service, and overall experience was wonderful. Check in and check out was easy. Room service came to our room multiple times a day which was not something we expected. We had a business party on the 36th floor and it was incredible! 10/10 space

title: Great stay
text: Amazing stay! The ballroom is incredible and boasts the most amazing views. Rooms are a bit dated and you don’t get the New York charm like some of the more historic hotels. But, what it lacks in character, it makes up for in amenities.  Concierge and staff are world class.

title: Perfect weekend getaway
text: If you're looking for the perfect getaway for relaxation in NYC than there is no better place than Mandarin Oriental to energize yourself with their world class spa and other amenities. Quality,relaxation,luxury,and excellent hospitality all in one package. What more can you ask for? The perfect getaway. Pure bliss!

title: Weekend stay in New York for a Christmas party
text: The staff was incredibly helpful, both while checking in and during the entire stay. When we asked for an espresso machine in the room, it was delivered within minutes. Fresh fruit and chocolates in the room were made available every day. Housekeeping was discreet yet meticulous.

title: Holiday party at the Mandarin Oriental
text: The room was excellent, the only thing missing in my room was some body wash but I used the soap. I noticed that my account has been charged for something I did not consume and the front desk was very helpful getting rid of the charge. Most likely it was me moving things around. Overall was a pleasant experience.

title: Great Hotel- Lost Reservation
text: Exceptional quality hotel. Everything is as you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The front desk did lose my reservation however did quickly find an empty room (With two double beds...) I would assume this was a 1-off error since we had a large group.

title: Fantastic.
text: Wonderful experience all around.  Nothing negative to say whatsoever.  The food was great.  The location next to the park was top notch.  The view was unbelievable.  I had forgotten to bring my rental tux to the front desk, so I called later to have it shipped.  They were incredibly helpful and got it returned.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
My family and I enjoyed a long weekend here in December for a work event. Excellent service and accommodations. The views are amazing. The mandarin is in a great location near Central Park.
I highly recommend to anyone looking to be pampered while enjoying the city.

title: clean, comfortable and amazing service
text: One of the best hotel experiences I have had. The room was amazing and kept so clean between the early am cleaning the evening cleaning. Room service was fantastic---the mandarin breakfast was a 10/10 (the chicken congee/bubur was very authentic). Great views of the hudson river. staff were super nice and fast to respond to requests.

title: Stay in Dec 2023
text: Stayed at Mandarin Oriental for a company holiday party - the staff was excellent and accommodating considering how large our group was.  The location can't be beat for Christmas time in NYC.  Would recommend to anyone looking to stay in mid-town.

title: Recommend!
text: Great hotel in a great location on the upper west side. Close to the park, good restaurants, and the work event we were in town for. Minimal interaction with staff, but seemed friendly. Rooms were clean and they accommodated our child to our requests.

title: Beautiful hotel in prime location
text: The Mandarin Oriental is a beautiful hotel in a prime location. Visiting in December, the hotel was decorated for Christmas and there was also a Christmas market in Columbus Circle. We have small children and the hotel also had a Santa visit on Saturday with cookies and hot chocolate, which was very nice. Overall, we loved our stay, the room service food was delicious, the staff was always accommodating, and we would recommend this hotel to others visiting NYC.

title: December stay
text: The room was nice, and the view was great! The location right next to Central Park in Columbus Circle cannot be beat! My only complaint would be the layout of the bathroom doors made accessing the toilet a little awkward, particularly at night when it was dark, and the front desk did not give us our welcome basket when we checked it, but these are very minor issues.

title: Great stay at the Mandarin
text: My stay at the Mandarin Oriental in NYC was amazing. The fancy lobby and rooms with great views make you feel like royalty. The staff is super friendly and goes out of their way to make your stay as convenient as possible. Plus, the bar in the lobby was fantastic and had great views of Central Park. It's basically a luxury haven in the middle of the city – totally worth it!

title: the elevator RFID not working
text: The overall stay was fantastic but the only problem which was a highlight was with the elevator RFID scanner to access the floors. My colleagues and i were stuck in the elevator because our card was not getting detected and we tried calling the staff for help and therefore they came to help us get out leading to us not attending an important online meeting.

title: Beautiful Hotel with amazing views
text: This is an Extremely Beautiful hotel, with amazing views and an exceptionally helpful staff. The front desk was very busy but that was to be expected for December. I have no complaints and I would stay there again if I ever go back to New York City.

title: What a 5 star experience should be
text:
The room and service was amazing. Honestly what I would expect from a 5* hotel. They did not disappoint in any way which is not always the case when hotels report they are 5 star. 

Room was cleaned twice a day. Each floor had its own maid. Screen sharing capabilities with your phone which was really nice for watching Netflix. 

Bath and a shower in the room, useful amenities like a toothbrush and toothpaste in case you forgot your own. 

Highly recommend

title: Surprisingly disappointing.
text: I personally found this hotel to be a bit disappointing given my prior experiences with the brand.   While the staff were lovely, and the location is great, I thought my room looked pretty darn tired.  For instance, every single lampshade in my room was wonky.  My friend guessed that the room decor was about 15 years old, and I bet he was right.  I was also disappointed in the food and beverage service.  The only place to eat or grab a drink is in the MO lounge off the lobby.  While the view is, of course, spectacular, sometimes you just want to sit at an actual bar -- which does not exist in this hotel.  I found it annoying waiting to be seated, and then served, when all I wanted on a few occasions was simply a beer.  In short, while the location is great, I didn't feel particularly cossetted in luxury -- which is kind of the whole point of these hotels.  This one won't be on my short list when I return.

title: Love the Mandarin Oriental in NYC!
text: Staying at the Mandarin Oriental in Columbus Circle in Manhattan was fabulous. The service is above and beyond. Our stay was fantastic. There are amazing views of Central Park, Columbus Circle, and the Central Park South tall, skinny towers.

title: Best location in NYC
text:
We enjoy the unparalleled luxury and service and hospitality. The New York Mandarin is perfectly located for a jaunt into NYC equidistant from Broadway, and Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall, 
Bloomingdales and many museums and restaurants. We love the location and the doormen   make you feel right at home.

title: excellent!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
text: The Mandarin Oriental Team went above and beyond, making our stay a memorable one. The luxurious accommodations, coupled with exceptional service, made our stay truly memorable. The hotel's prime location made exploring Manhattan effortless. From the bellman, front desk, housekeeping, and concierge this hotel exceeded our expectations. Concierge took care of all our dining reservations, horse drawn carriage ride through central park, we wanted for nothing!! All the rooms have windows from the floor to the ceiling, the views were spectacular especially at night, wow we could see the entire city from all the windows. A special compliment to Andres, director of Guest Relations, who made our stay especially wonderful with personal service, he is professional and polished as the entire Mandarin Oriental Team. If there was an option for 10 star, this would be our rating!!

title: Mandarin Oriental - Loved It!  Highly Recommend!
text:
I plan to post this review on google as well.  My experience with Mandarin was awesome.  No complaints.

Special thank you to Garrett, on check-in on Jan 12th I was a little early yet he informed the room was ready (was around `10:30am).  He also was able to assist me in staying an extra night in the same room as same rate.  I understood it would be no negative reflection on Mandarin if that could not be accommodated (was literally last minute request).  Very pleased he checked and it worked out, for everyone.  Garrett informed he is a training assistant manager, I think.  Whatever the case, his demeanor was very gracious, well spoken and inviting.  He is a great asset, I give him high review for his professionalism and friendliness.

A shout out to Wendy who brought me chocolates, water, ice, a soft cloth and a bed side floor mat in the mid evening timeframe.  She was so friendly, kind and courteous.  She deserves a mention from "Mr. Aman" or "Mr. AJ." 

Recognition to the friendly staff all around without fail, namely:
Ener and Jonathan - Valet
In-room dining:  Mareesa, Christopher and Carlos.

The service was Excellent.  I stayed in premier central park king.  I'm going to try Hudson river suite next time, which is in March.

The room-service is very convenient and a good variety.  The hours are unparalleled.  I did not eat at the restaurant, yet I did have drinks.  The view is Amazing.  Would wish for perhaps a little more variety on overall menu, yet only reason I did not eat at the restaurant is because I went out for sushi both nights.  I did order room service both nights... and was not disappointed in the least.

I highly recommend Mandarin Oriental New York and can't wait to return.  Great location too!

title: Company Holiday party
text: Amazing rooms and great customer service provided by staff. The room was turned down every time we left and attention to detail was great. The banquet room rented for the company party was very festive and no detail was forgotten in regards to food, drinks or decorations.

title: Great Holiday Stay
text: The Mandarin Oriental was incredibly accommodating and the staff was wonderful! Our company party was in an amazing space with great views of the city! Overall very impressed with all that their hotel had to offer.

title: Accommodations
text: Great accommodations right near Central Park. I found it conveniently located near stores for last minute needs when we arrived. The room was well appointed with many mini bar options. I also was happy to arrive to clean room post turn down service. Thank you!

title: Great weekend in NYC
text: Good experience, great view on central park, lovely breakfast. Position is perfect to visit NYC. The room is really clean and the service comes twice a day. I would recommend this hotel. The only negative note is the moquette in the rooms, very old style

title: Mandarin Oriental the way it should be
text: Attended a large corporate celebration event early December. The staff did a very good job of delivering high quality consistent service. I felt very much like a VIP. Very impressive attention to detail from front door street side to our guest room.

title: Magical and Unforgettable :)
text:
The most magical experience of my life! It's a beautiful hotel with people who deliver hospitality from the heart. You cannot go wrong with MONYC! 

The rooms and amenities are a class apart. The food options are tasteful and a delight to enjoy. The views are breathtaking :)

title: Relax and enjoy
text: Spacious bathroom, large bedroom and view over Central Park is amazing, have breakfast by the window on 35th floor, stunning to start the day. All staff very kind and very helpful. We appreciated the direct access to the shopping area on the 3rd floor toi. Stunning!  We will return

title: Magnifique séjour inoubliable
text: Accueil excellent, literie et oreillers parfaits. Confort et services d'excellentes qualité. Merci à l'équipe du Madarin Oriental pour sa gentillesse et son dévouement. Séjour parfait pour se sentir détendu dans un endroit hors du temps.

title: Work trip
text: The hotel was excellent. The location was amazing and the views of the park were so nice! Really enjoyed the food in the restaurant and the staff at the hotel were very attentive all the time - they even offered a free shoe shine !

title: Luxurious Hotel High in the Sky
text: This was our first stay at MO New York - we loved the hotel. The location is great - there is a major subway stop (59th St/Columbus Circle) right outside the door. Theater district is a 10-minute walk. The hotel is also attached to a nice mall, so there is shopping and a Wholefoods attached - you don't even need to put on a coat to visit the mall. New York hotel rooms often have street noise. Here, because guest rooms are at least 37 floors up, the rooms are quiet. View of the city from our room was fabulous. Staff was smiling (even the housekeepers!) and very personable.

title: Unexpected otherworldly sunrise views
text:
Floor to ceiling windows of central park are breathtaking and make the suites worth the price they command. Sunrises are phenomenal and set your day off on the right foot. 

The hotel itself is very clean and the doormen and desk staff are attentive and pleasant. The restaurant is delicious and in room dining is fast.

title: Great location, excellent services..
text: We had a fantastic stay at Mandarin Oriental New York. The room was spacious and comfortable, and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel amenities, such as the gym and pool, were top-notch, and the location was convenient for exploring the  New York City. Overall, a 5-star experience!

title: Beautiful hotel with amazing views
text: The Mandarin is one of the most beautiful hotels I’ve ever stayed in.  The views of Central Park from my room and the skyline all lit up were amazing!  The bed was so comfy and room was huge for an NYC hotels. The  staff was all so accommodating and nice!   I hope I get the chance to stay there again.

title: Out of the European standard
text:
Non ha gli standard europei . Tra i vari Mandarin in cui ho alloggiato in Europa , e’ il peggiore . Lunghe attese per la colazione . 
Servizio medio . Poca attenzione nel riordino serale della camera.

title: Great stay in December 2023
text: I had a great stay at the Mandarin Oriental! The hotel itself was excellent, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Shandra in housekeeping was especially great! Would definitely recommend to others

title: Wonderful Experience
text: Great stay all around, the hotel staff were welcoming and professional.  The hotel is clean, in a great location and the room had a great view as well.  Right next to Central Park and close to many great restraunts.

title: Overall Good Experience
text: The Mandarin Oriental was a key part in having a great weekend out in NYC.  The location of the hotel is top tier and allows you to experience much of what NYC has to offer.  The views from the room and the restaurant were outstanding but, from the ballroom, it was another step above.  The amenities such as the gym, pool, and sauna were great as well.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Rooms we're a little dated but not enough to hinder the experience.  Overall good experience, I would definitely stay here again.

title: An Elite Hotel Experience.
text:
The Mandarin Oriental New Year overlooks Central Park and represents 5 star, Far East hospitality in close proximity to NYC's finest attractions. My Central Park View Suite was outfitted with floor-to-ceiling windows affording spectacular CP vistas.  Exclusive artwork on the walls, a wonderful black stained wooden desk and a melange of historic and contemporary furnishings contributed to elevating the luxury of the atmosphere. The spacious footprint provided a sitting area that inspired a coziness to the environment. The bath was endowed with a walk-in shower and other accoutrements in keeping with the stature of the Mandarin. The MO Lounge is an all day dining experience served in an American food-fare format with bar and views that overlook Central Park and the Manhattan skyline. The MO is not trying to take on the culinary world, but rather, provide a simple  straightforward menu with solid items. The MO spa is the kingpin amenity of the hotel. With 14,500 sq. ft. of 5 star spa space it is complemented by a state-of-the-art fitness center and a 75 ft. lap pool.
So, in the lap of luxury, if you would like to explore the shops and restaurants of Columbus Circle.............then try the .........Mandarin Oriental........an elite hotel experience.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Big clean rooms at the heart of New York City. Was definitely a nice stay there been there for 3 nights.

The staff is very courteous and helpful. Got help from hailing a cab while I was there to go to the airport.

Overall it was a nice experience

title: Our Home in the City
text: Our home in the City! In addition to regular business trips, each December we arrive at MONYC for my wife's birthday. Every year they make our experience even better than the last. They have the best concierge team in the city (special thank you to Colleen and her team) who attended to each of our diner and travel reservations. The spa and gym are excellent.  This was our 10th stay and our best one yet. The property is meticulously maintained and they had special festivities for the holidays (hot coco in the lobby was our daughter's favorite). MY NYC is our favorite and we cannot get enough of it. MONYC Team: Thank you for all that you do us each and every year!

title: Amazing stay
text: Went to the Mandarin Oriental, New York in December 2023 for a company holiday/birthday party.  The hotel was amazing, very clean and very near so many things to see and do.  The staff were friendly, courteous and went above and beyond.  Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Amazing stay
text: Top quality and excellent service from start to finish. The view from the swimming pool was breathtaking ! The rooms were very quiet, ans the bathrobes particularly comfy. Could include more free water bottles in the rooms though :)

title: Something to keep, something to improve
text:
+ large rooms, good bed and pillow quality, impressive ballroom, splendid service
- old-fashioned room decor, poor room tech (lighting/lamps, minibar sensor, etc), restricted room views from newer buildings, poor food quality and quantity to price

title: Great stay
text: The location is fantastic to visit Manhattan. The room was great, super clean and the staff is friendly and very helpful. Unparallel views of the Central Park from the top, proximity to fine dining and shopping.

title: Great location but needs a bit more love to justify the prices
text: Overall, it was a positive experience. Great location and views from the hotel. Kind and helpful staff. Regarding the rooms, the decor and furniture felt very tired and outdated. Breakfast was pricy for what it was, same for the mini bar and room service charges.

title: Great
text:
I had a very nice stay at the mandarin oriental. The room was perfect with a pleasant view and the staff very helpful. The conciergerie was a must, they made it easy for us to book restaurants. 
The location is great, short walk to Central Park. I would definitely come back again.
Thank you

title: Very good!
text: Great location, large rooms and friendly staff. Rooms were a bit outdated, especially the bathroom but everything was clean and comfortable. It is a large hotel but staff makes you feel at home, great service overall.

title: Good experience overall
text: Good experience overall, nice views from the room and the restaurant, staff really friendly and welcoming. The location of the hotel is really perfect. There are 2 or 3 subways near to the hotel, that definitely makes life easier

title: Bonne situation geographique, mais un peu vieillisant
text:
Tres bonne situation geographique, tres bon service, mais hotel vieillissant aurait besoin de refaire les salles de bains.
L'evacuation de ma baignoire ne fonctionnait pas, donc je n'ai pas eu le plaisir d'utiliser le sel de bain.

title: Class experience
text:
Wonderful experience, room was pristine and perfectly reflected my expectations. Views from the 50th floor are magnificent and the amenities offered a perfect environment.

Big thanks to all the staff that made this stay so unique

title: Great stay as expected of the price
text: Overall great room service and helpful concierge. Some indication during check-in of what in the room is complimentary and what isn’t would be helpful to avoid accidental expenses. Would recommend if price is within budget.

title: Great service and location
text: Excellent service.  Beds less comfortable than I would have expected and room a bit tired for that price point.  Excellent location and easy access to conveniences in shopping mall next door.  I would stay there again.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Great experience! Rooms are amazing and the service was exceptional.  Needed help from the concierge sewing a button on my jacket in a pinch and they helped within minutes before we had a Christmas event starting.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Friendly service, excellent amenities & the most comfortable bed. The food could be better considering the price but overall an excellent stay. Rooms were kept in immaculate condition & the staff were extremely polite & happy to assist. Would definitely stay again.

title: Great Stay!
text: As the hotel branding spells Luxury and Delighting & Satisfying Guests - the hotel amenities and staff at MO NYC live up to its name!  Room was clean and comfortable.  Staff were efficient and delightful to help.  Loved the location - Just name it and you are within walking distance to iconic attractions and a mall with restaurants, bars and a supermarket just downstairs the hotel!

title: A weekend worth remembering
text:
Great location, spacious rooms and a breathtaking view.

One of the best ballrooms I have seen overlooking Central Park. A must for personal/corporate events.

Very nice breakfast, good choice and great service.

title: Getting by on location and name brand
text: Location is great, and very convenient to be attached to the Columbus Circle mall.  Rooms and interiors are getting dated - in need of major remodel to keep up with competition.  The lobby bar setup is terrible - no actual bar, just a sit down lounge with very slow service.  Staff was nice, but nothing to write home about.  The Toto toilet had me looking at pricing for home install.

title: Great location and views
text: Location and view from the room and pool are excellent. Service was very good and helpful, too. The interior of my room was a tad on the dated side compared with other Mandarin properties I have stayed at.

title: Room overall feels luxurious. Bed is comfortable and view out the window is credible and has incredible skyline.
text: The room is spacious and comfortable. I love the layout of the toilet and there's a separate space for shower, toilet and bath tub. Bed is nice and I also like the fact my room gets cleaned so many times a day. (At least twice I am aware of daily)

title: Perfect and enjoyable stay
text: Pleasant stay at the hotel. Room is very clean and service of the hotel staff were amazing. Housekeeping were very prompt with requests. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family who will be in NY in the future.

title: Good hotel in NY
text: The location is good , it’s close to Central Park and museums and also lots of shops.  We stayed 3 nights there and the view is nice.  We had a company event there and it is memorable. Overall, we are happy with the hotel.

title: Great stay in MO!
text: Very good service overall , good room size and services from moment step in, they have good pillow choice as well, they even accommodate very early check in which really made huge difference for us after 18hrs flight!

title: Great!
text: The bed’s incredibly comfy, pillows are huge and fluffy, I had a great night’s rest. Hotel staff are friendly, they didn’t mind us using the gym facilities to refresh ourselves before our flight even after check-out.

title: Nightmare before Xmas
text: For $7,000/night and a loyal guest to not honor a high floor request to not know you frequent the hotel and to take 2 hrs and 4 calls to try and order a $300 bottle champagne (and not have a stopper) let alone have a room that is dusty, flowers are wilted and carpet too dirty to let your infant crawl on it. What else is there to say but - Ty Warner please bring the Four Seasons back

title: Home away from home
text: Weve been in this hotel several times and i always felt at home with the staff who attend to all our needs. Everybody seem so nice. I love the central park views from the room and the resto where i love to have breakfast

title: The staff at the hotel exceeded expectations and the ball room that hosted the party was elegant
text: Great housekeeping, overall very clean and luxurious. Plenty of space in the room along with very nice amenities inside the room including an ironing board and iron. The view from the room was incredible overlooking downtown area. Would stay again.

title: Work stay
text: Stayed for a work event. The room had terrific views, was very large,  clean, and had excellent service. The staff did an excellent job cleaning the room. The ballroom is a great place to host an event.

title: Nice cozy place with great service
text: The location is very good with easy access to lot of subway lines. The living experience is also great with clean room and fantastic services. Large space in the room and nice bed to sleep on. Whenever I called for any service there would always be somebody coming for help very timely

title: Exceptional Stay
text: I had the Hudson view room and I was greatly impressed! It overlooked the city skylines and had a great sunrise view each morning. The room was always clean and service from reception to room service to delivery of packages was superb. The workout facility was clean and modern (great equipments). I would definitely recommend to give it a try!

title: Weekend stay
text: Very comfortable room with great views over Central Park. The staff were very attentive throughout. Fruit and water provided in the foyer in the morning for runners. The only slight negative was that the room was a little dated

title: Great Overall
text: Overall the experience was great. They provided a nice turn down service which was appreciated. The room was clean upon arrival and the views throughout the hotel were great. All of the staff was polite.

title: Holiday Party
text: My stay was pleasant and the room was large for NYC and updated. Service was good. The location is prime near Central Park with plenty of options nearby. The ballroom is a great location to host an event.

title: Great Hotel!
text: The service was awesome, the rooms were amazing and so was the view!  The restaurant was also really good!  I had a great time at Mandarin and definitely recommend it. It is also conveniently located above a shopping area as well.

title: Mostly good - Cost probably not justified given alternatives
text:
The staff was friendly upon arrival, and the room was clean, spacious, and had a great city view. Housekeeping did a solid job refreshing our space.

However, the check-in experience was a bit lacking. The staff member seemed a bit off and skipped the usual amenities rundown. Just handed us our keys.  Despite this hiccup, the hotel's prime location and well-maintained rooms make it a reasonable choice for a comfortable stay in the heart of NYC. Overall, a decent experience with more positives than negatives.

title: Lovely stay at the mandarin
text: Great location and service all round. The staff were very helpful and welcoming! My king room was pleasant and came with a lovely view. The swimming pool and gym were very nice but the sauna was not hot enough unfortunately.

title: Excellent location and friendly staff
text: Superb location with very friendly staff. Views across Central Park are very impressive. The rooms could do with somewhat of a facelift considering the price point, however the Bar area and swimming pool are excellent. Would return & recommend.

title: Great views
text: Attentive and serviceminded staff in the upstairs reception. Central Park view amazing - as the Whole Foods in the basement. Property and range of services not on par with for example Mandarin, Tokyo.

title: Mandarin Oriental
text: I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel for two nights in December 2023. I really enjoyed the stay and the room was amazing with a great central park view. I will return to the Mandarin Oriental when I come back to New York in the future

title: Perfect location - wonderful hotel
text:
Beautiful hotel, high service, friendly and smiling staff, nice gym and pool. Perfect location.
We had a wonderful weekend and would defintely come back again giving the chance. Can highly recommend Mandarin Oriental to both business and pleasure.

title: Christmas in NY!
text:
Great stay, if a bit on the expensive side. Really great view, great shower and facilities. The spa is a highlight.

Only downside i would say was prices in bar - breakfast for 2 at 177 usd is a bit steep :)

title: Great location and staff. Needs to refresh some rooms.
text:
Very good location and very nice views from the rooms. The room was quite old and would need to be refurbished a bit. Staff has always been very helpful throughout the stay. 
I think the room service and the mini bar are relatively overpriced.

title: Nice centrally located hotel
text: I stayed at this hotel as part of my company's holiday/20 year anniversary party.  It is conveniently located near Central Park and close enough to walk to Times Square.  The staff was friendly and willing help.  I recommend getting a room with a view of Central Park.

title: Overall it was a great stay, beautiful hotel.
text: Everyone was very friendly and helpful.  There was a problem upon checking in where the room they had reserved for me wasn’t ready and it took awhile to sort it out.  You should have a bar on the 35th floor.

title: Excellent stay at the Mandarin Oriental, New York
text: I recently had the pleasure of staying at this outstanding hotel, and it exceeded all expectations. The staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and were incredibly helpful throughout our stay. The rooms were impeccably clean, and the nightly turn-down service added a touch of luxury. The attention to detail and commitment to guest satisfaction truly set this hotel apart. A memorable experience that I highly recommend to anyone seeking a top-notch stay with exceptional service.

title: Excellent hotel.
text:
Excellent stay. The hotel has amazing views, very well run and beautifully appointed. The staff were very helpful. 

Only small error on the part of the staff was from housekeeping. They were a little over zealous in disturbing us in an attempt to clean our room on our final morning. Ringing the bell and attempting to come straight in the room without waiting for a response at 0900 and then again exactly the same at 1000 despite our check out being in only 2hrs. The staff did see us after and apologise.

The sauna in the spa was not hot enough to be a sauna. It was just a warm room. It dried you, but it didn't produce a sweat.

title: Beautiful hotel, great service
text: Amazing, friendly service from check in until check out. Room was tidy and reset perfectly each day. Accommodations were fantastic. Would absolutely stay there again and would highly recommend to anyone looking for a luxury stay in NYC.

title: Great stay
text: Good size room, superb view, easy check-in / check-out, pool not busy (but sauna not warm enough !), convenient location, professionnal staff. I guess on the high-end regarding pricing but this is NYC..!

title: BEST NYC HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER
text:
We felt very welcome by the staff. Best hotel experience we have had in NYC 
Stunning views from guest rooms and restaurant
Cozy restaurant with a wide range of fantastic drinks and food 
Great location by the park and shopping area 
5⭐️ experience all the way through

title: Everything was perfect
text: The entire experience was amazing. Everyone was so helpful and courteous from check-in to check-out. I can never sleep the fort couple nights in a hotel but had no issues. The bed was comfy and the pillows were perfect.

title: Great stay
text:
Beautiful hotel located in a central location. There are several subway lines by the hotel, easy walking to Fifth ave and other places in NY. The views of Central Park were great.

We had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend!

title: Great views but service is a bit poor
text:
Came into my room without knocking. I had do not disturb turned on. Claimed to not have important documents from my company, but turns out they did. 

Building and amenities are a bit dated and could use some updating

title: Five Star Hotel with all you could want
text:
We had everything we needed and then some. A home away from home during our stay.

We visited for a holiday party. Would recommend. Being able to just go upstairs after the party was a very nice convenience.

title: 3 nights stay Dec 23
text: We spent 3 nights with my wife for a corporate event. Although expectations were high,  the location, the amazing design of the hotel and the employees dedication managed to make this a very special moment. Thank you

title: Pleasantly Pampered
text: Service was top notch from the moment we arrived.  The bath salts were an unexpected but much needed perk for tired, traveling feet!   Bottled water in the evenings to rehydrate after long days was also very much appreciated. Carolers and cocoa with cookies were a seasonal delight. The view of Central Park was incredible from our room. Fantastic experience!

title: Not a 5 star experience
text:
Hotel has extremely tired decor.  Carpet is dingy and hallways are dark.  Upon returning to hotel room yesterday, maintenance was removing a sofa from a nearby room which prohibited us from getting to our room for 5 minutes and then we had to tiptoe around shattered glass from a light fixture they broke.

Service was good and dinner at restaurant delicious .

I was very much looking forward to a good sleep in this morning but was wakened to door bell and housekeeping walking in at 8:20.

title: Review of the MO Lounge
text: We wanted a lunch spot with panoramic views of the city/central park. A quick google search indicated that the MO Lounge enjoyed such views. We were not disappointed.  Food was nice and service excellent.  Enjoyable experience. Would come back at night to enjoy the views of NYC glittering.

title: Disappointed
text: Total waste of money ,so let down by this hotel. Only good thing to say John in restaurant is a gentleman. Do not book the room with view for thanksgiving day parade, total waste of money!! So many things went wrong with this hotel considering you are paying a lot of money. This is not a 5* hotel. We go to New York most years trying different hotels this is the worst we have stayed at and paid the most. Mandarin oriental won't care I could list all the things that went wrong but probably a waste of time! Hate leaving a bad review as I know business are struggling in the current climate. When you are charging top dollar you need to back your service up. Was so looking forward to staying here but left totally gutted we had wasted our money on this hotel. Never to return to this hotel which is a first for New York as all other hotels we would return to, we just like trying different hotels.

title: Mandarin our favourite hotel in New York
text: The best hotel with amazing service fantastic location great pool gym and spa. This is our favourite hotel! Everyone tries genuinely to take care of all your needs while also respecting your privacy and preferences. We always get spa services and are never disappointed!

title: Worst 5 Star Ever
text: The worst 5 star hotel I have stayed at ever. Literally. No exaggeration. The place is closterphobetic at best and actually run down. The lobby is tiny, dark and poorly lit which is an indicator for the rest of the place. The entire property if you can call it that, only has one restaurant, no other amenities. The spa was closed without telling us in advance. Upon check in, we were shown to a room with a wind tunnel / noise pocket leak, one that no one could ever sleep in. After realizing we wouldn’t be Ok with it, they showed us to another with a small bathroom. At that point, we were too exhausted to keep moving. The rooms are dingy, and decorated in bad taste and worst of all, they feel dirty. Everything from the carpet, to the drapes to the finishes - all sort of gross. Dark, badly lit, hardly any closet space and no modern amenities. The rooms don’t even have coffee machines, old dingy bathtubs and dustballs in the corners. I walked in and saw housekeeping cleaning our wineglasses in the bathroom sink rather than changing them out - gross. The bar doesn’t even offer nuts or olives with cocktails. In fact, it sells them at $16 each.  At these prices, the entire place feels like a cross between a money pit and a jail.

title: Thanksgiving at the Mandarin Oriental
text: The room exceeded expectations. Property was very central to everything we wished to see on this trip. Staff were friendly, professional, and truly went above and beyond to ensure we had anything we needed or wanted.

title: Greatly overpriced and very underwhelming.
text: On a recent girls trip to New York it was suggested we do afternoon tea at the Mandarin Oriental. We thought it was a lovely idea and were looking forward to the experience. Upon booking we were aware that price was steep at $155 US per person with a glass of champagne (we’re Canadian so it was in fact more with the exchange) but we figured the whole experience would be worth it. Sadly it was not; not even close! The service was poor. Our server couldn’t remember any of our tea orders and overfilled all the teapots causing them to spill all over the table. The sandwiches were dry, they felt like they sat out too long and the bread felt crusty and stale. Were it not for the scones, which were delicious, we would have left hungry. On top of all of this the hotel was testing its fire alarm system so there were random alerts going off here and there. All in all with gratuity and tax it cost us $225 each (that’s $300 Canadian) for some stale sandwiches and poor service! I’m not one to complain but I don’t appreciate when the product does not warrant the cost. I couldn’t shake the waste of money the rest of the trip; I felt rip offed to put it lightly. There was so much potential for this experience as, I must admit, the view from the 35th floor was lovely.

title: Home away From Home love this Property.
text: Everything was amazing from Walking into warm smiles and helpful accommodating front office staff . Thank you for allowing a late check out  giving me more time to spend with family and friends . Housekeeping was on top of my  request.  I am so grateful and happy with the whole experience loved the amenity waiting in the room with a personalized card from the New General Manager  made me feel at home.

title: Worst Stay ever and waste of money
text:
We arrived expecting a 5 star hotel experience. However the rooms are super old, the carpets and curtains are yellow of dirt and age. The bedsheets and towels are overused. The room was full of dust and black hair was in the bathtub and stains in the toilet. 
The food in the hotel was poor,almost no variety. The staff were all moody and seemed like they were forced to work and don’t want to serve you. 
The minibar was never refilled. 
The hotel charged our credit card with false amounts and without our authorization. 
Worst MO we have visited so far

title: The worst hotel in the world
text: Hello, we stayed here for ten days. I stayed with my family. The rooms are very dirty and there is no coffee machine in the room. The employees at the breakfast restaurant are very sullen. The service quality is seriously bad. I gave my credit card for deposit at check-in. During my stay, my card was constantly charged without my knowledge or approval, which disturbed me very much. I will never, ever stay here again.

title: An excellent hotel, cozy and spacious rooms with an incredible view.
text: The Mandarin Oriental, along with the St. Regis and Peninsula are my three favorite hotels in New York City. Family has stayed at this MO atleast a half a dozen times, but we've been here on many occasions as well for spa visits, afternoon tea, dinner at the former restaurant, drinks at the bar, and even for an event in their ballroom. You can't beat the location which is within the heart of Columbus Circle, right on the edge of Central Park. Also, this hotel is attached to a shopping mall that has a number of great restaurants inside. All things considered, this Mandarin Oriental is probably the best hotel to stay at while visiting NYC.

title: ラグジュアリーなホテル
text:
チェックイン時に提供するされるはずのお茶が提供されなかった。
冷蔵庫の開け方が分からなかった。
他は全て良かった。

title: Fantastic stay at Central Park
text: The staff are very friendly and helpful. Since we were NYC newbies, they gave us great explanations on how to get around (routes were even printed) The room and bar/restaurant have spectacular views. Although the room was luxurious, it could use some redecoration.

title: Publicité trompeuse
text:
La réception se trouve à l’étage 35. Personne à la descente de la limousine pour prendre nos bagages, nous avons dû les monter seuls.
Nous 	avions réservé une suite avec vue sur Central Park. 

Sinistre, ameublement défraîchi, pas une fleur ni une coupe de fruit ni une bouteille de bienvenue. De plus on ne savait pas où ranger les affaires, pas de dressing, pas de grande commode ni penderie où regrouper les vêtements.

Le lendemain on nous a déménagés. Toujours pas de corbeille de fruits ni de machine à café ( pourtant demandée). Un petit chocolat sur l’oreiller les deux premiers jours.
La nuitée varie entre 3300 et 3600$. 

Le restaurant à une vue splendide,mais il est très petit, mal éclairé, avec un mobilier limite crasseux. En une semaine la carte n’a en rien changé. Pas de buffet au petit déjeuner mais mais nous avons vite opté pour le service en chambre.
Par contre le service conciergerie à été top, le restaurant a une vue splendide, la réception est efficace.
En bref, la publicité est trompeuse. La prochaine fois nous irons ailleurs.

title: I’m a Fan of the Mandarin Oriental!
text: I had never stayed at a Mandarin Oriental before, but was invited to stay here while attending a meeting that was being held at the hotel.  I must say, this place is wonderful.  The people are so friendly and kind - including to our young daughter - and the views are simply amazing.  The rooms are lovely beyond compare.  I’m truly a fan of the Mandarin Oriental now!

title: Great location but hotel is below Mandarin Oriental brand
text: Very underwhelmed unfortunately. Location was great and room sizes are fine.  Pool, gym & spa are good amenities.  But the rooms are very dated and it just doesn't feel like a full service luxury hotel... no tea or coffee facilities in the room, only one restaurant (which is basically in the lobby) and no bar.  (Hotel will say Nesprsso machine & kettle are available 'on request', but there's no sign or information in the room about this, or online on their info menu - & why not just put it in the room?).  The whole place feels like it's skimping, getting by with the minimum.  We were there a week - hardly greeted by doormen, pretty cold service in the restaurant apart from Luis (been there 20 years...).  The staff were pleasant, if not that efficient. I sensed embarrassment... that they all knew it wasn't up to scratch.  We had breakfast credit included but it's been a major issue for it to be credited appropriately to our account, which is just boring, particularly when we have it all in writing.  Rather wished we'd stayed at The Carlyle, which was same price bracket, has lovely location, amazing bar, great restaurant & is renowned for its service.  Disappointed with MO NY - nothing like MO Hong Kong or London.  Perhaps it's about to be closed for renovation....that's what it felt like

title: Exquisite
text: Unparalleled service from valet, to concierge, to in room dining and all amenities. Top shelf everything and being next to the Columbus Circle Shops was an added benefit. Courtesy vehicle to our broadway show was icing on the cake.

title: A charming place for a few days in NYC with the family
text: An excellent hotel located in the perfect part of town for a family holiday and sightseeing. Every person working at the Mandarin Oriental is welcoming and charming, and nothing is too much trouble. The views from the upper floors are breathtaking. Having Columbus Circle shopping mall next door with private access from the hotel is perfect for young teens to go off and explore safely. The restaurant is very light with a good menu selection. It does lack a proper bar - which is sometime nice to escape the kids without leaving the hotel - but the table service bar is fine. Overall a very pleasurable place to spend a few days.

title: The Only Place To Stay In New York!
text: Wonderful experience in a great hotel in a city full of great hotels...this one is the best!  In NYC to celebrate a birthday and the hotel did everything to optimize the experience.  Special call out to the Chef Concierge, Michael for his invaluable assistnace.

title: Great Hotel that always has a great guest experience for all its guests
text: Great hotel. Great staff. Wonderful food and great attention to detail. I had a birthday cake waiting for me on arrival to celebrate my birthday. Rooms are clean and spacious with great views of New York. I can’t wait to go back again. Already booked my next two trips !

title: Amazing stay!!!
text: At check-in you made us feel very happy with your warm welcome. All team members were very attentive and guest-oriented; special thanks to Alexandra Halaris kindness. The room was pristine, clean, welcoming and with all the details of luxury and confort fon an amazing stay. We enjoyed a lot our breakfast time, even more because of the spectacular Central Park views. All in all, it was a fantastic experience that we are looking forward to repeating soon! Thank you so much MONYK team!

title: Fantastic stay
text: Views amazing, service espectacular. Location incredible. Housekeeping service exceptional. The whole team made our stay outstanding. We are looking forward to come back again to Mandarin Oriental New York.

title: Surprising economizing
text: Surprisingly for such an upscale hotel and exorbitant room price one wouldn’t expect cutting corners on really noticeable amenities like one ply toilet tissue and no shampoo, conditioner and shower gel samples. There are bottles attached to the wall in the shower . The staff explanation is that they are saving the planet by not using plastic. Why not little glass bottles? Or available on request? They said they offer soap samples which is clearly not the same product and incredibly perfumey unlike the hair and body products.

title: Gut aber nicht vergleichbar mit anderen Mandarin Oriental Hotels
text:
Die Zimmer waren sauber und gepflegt, jedoch ist deutlich zu erkennen, dass sie in die Jahre gekommen sind. Eine Renovierung könnte dem Ambiente und der Ausstattung einen zeitgemäßen Touch verleihen. Die Möbel und Einrichtungen wirkten etwas abgenutzt und könnten aufgewertet werden, um den aktuellen Standards gerecht zu werden.

Was die Lage angeht, ist das Hotel gut positioniert und bietet eine gute Erreichbarkeit zu verschiedenen Attraktionen und Sehenswürdigkeiten in der Umgebung. Die Ruhe und der Komfort, den das Hotel bietet, tragen zu einem angenehmen Aufenthalt bei.

Insgesamt ist das Hotel eine solide Wahl für Reisende, die nach einem komfortablen Aufenthalt suchen. Mit einer Modernisierung der Zimmer könnte es jedoch zu einem herausragenden Hotel werden.

title: Wonderful stay
text: The hotel treated us with a bottle of Chardonnay and a cake in honor of our 30th anniversary. John, our server for breakfast, was very friendly, took excellent photos and provided useful tips to enhance our experience in NYC.

title: An amazing stay ❤️
text: I loved the friendly staff and the warm welcome from the front desk team Robin and Yarisol ❤️ the concierge team Michael and Vinmore they were really amazing. Thank you to the breakfast team John did a wonderful job with hosting me as his guest and server a delicious breakfast. My stay at MoNYC was great I’ll definitely be back to see that wonderful view of Manhattan.

title: The Best Hotel in NYC
text: The Mandarin is the best hotel in NYC. The location is incredible. Attached to a mall with 8 restaurants (all of which are great) and a whole foods. Right by Central Park and Lincoln Center. The Food and drinks at the MO Lounge are credit. From the Bellmen, to the Concierges to the Front Desk, to Hospitality, everyone does their job perfectly and with a gracious attitude. If you need something or just want something, they get it done. To us, the M.O. is like home because of the way that you are treated every single time.

title: Amazing Manhattan Hotel
text: What a lovely hotel and awesome long fantastic weekend in NYC. Amazing jaw dropping views, excellent service which is very responsive and accommodating (and it’s all about the service) and fab location off Colombus Circle. One of the best luxury hotels in Manhattan. We will be back

title: Excellent hotel for business or pleasure
text:
I was in the Mandarin Oriental for 2 nights on a business trip. It was a very positive experience. Everything was as expected and well run. The hotel occupies the top floors of a high rise building and the lobby is on the 35th floor. The rooms have nice views on the park and there is a very nice restaurant. 
One thing to keep in mind is that for shoppers, 5th ave is about a mile walk away, so if that’s your thing you may want to that. I would definitely return to this hotel.

title: Por el precio; Hay mejores opciones en Nueva York, como el The Peninsula.
text: El servicio varía de acuerdo a quien te atienda. Instalaciones excelentes. Ubicación muy buena. El colchón viejo y malo. La comida del único restaurante que hay no vale la pena, aunque la vista del lugar es espectacular.

title: Nice views. Worth it?
text:
Too many politicians with agressive security and reserved elevators. Breakfast à la carte with too eager waiters, charging whatever they could. Gratuities already included and even so waiting for more. 
Nice room with superb views of NY. Good service.

title: Good Stay
text:
Spent a few nights here.  Rooms are nice in that typical MO style.  Location is pretty great.  On Columbus Circle.  Easy access to subway.  Whole Foods kitty corner from hotel for your organic food needs.  

Teenager lost a pair of travel pants here.  What happened is that the pants must have got caught up in the linens (They did not put them away or hang them as I instructed them to do so.  Teenagers.) when they were cleaning the room.  Looked around the room and in the luggage.  Couldn’t find pants.  Notified front desk.  Told us they would look into it.  We left for our vacation. Two weeks later, we got back to the US.  Hotel called me and left a voicemail that they found the pants.  Got in touch with the head of housekeeping and they sent the pants back home, via FEDEx which must have cost them a bit.  Nice touch.

Booked through Amex.  Nice breakfast (included). Views of Columbus Circle and Billionaire’s Row skinny skyscrapers and Central Park.

title: Super Lage mit hervorragenden Service
text:
Super gelegenes Hotel am Columbia Circle. Man kommt überall tadellos hin. Die Lobby befindet sich im 35. Stock, die Zimmer vom 37. bis 58.Stock.
Betten sind von Mühldorfer und mega kuschelig.
Die Premier Central Park View ist sehr zu empfehlen. Blick auf den Central Park und den Hudson River.
Frühstück auf der 35. Etage mit super Ausblick auf den Central Park. Pro Person ca. 50$. Ein Tee kostet 16$.

title: Sept Long Weekend
text:
Great location. Food is not bad. 
Hotel needs to update inside interior and elevators. 
Gym needs more space and bigger dry sauna.
Otherwise great staff. Spa was good as well.
Great view to Central Park.
Would definitely return in the future.

title: mostly great, BUT...
text:
why do hotels add 18% to every bar tab and restaurant bill, HIDE IT, and then try to get us to ADD TWO MORE TIPS????!!!!

it started during covid and it's still lingering. it's B. S.

the NYC mandarin, which costs over $2,000/night, sneaks 18% onto the food tabs, and then leaves TWO blank lines for TIP and GRATUITY.

i scratch my head at this – and mentioned it because i hate being nickel-and-dimed – and the restaurant manager didn't even apologize. "you can take it off and leave whatever you want".

well, true, but only if you noticed that they slimed it in there in tiny print, well above the 2 - yes TWO - TIP and GRATUITY lines..!

i'm a fan of great service and always tip accordingly, but force-placing 18% and they hoping i don't notice and leave ANOTHER 20% as usual????

B. S.

STOP THIS PRACTICE NOW. or we won't be coming there any more, even though the sunrise views from the 54th floor were as good as anything i've ever seen.

and please: maybe leave the nespresso coffee makers in the rooms, so we don't have to come down to get one..??!! yawn. i prefer the MO in lucerne, switzerland over this one by miles. perhaps the GM from NY needs to go see how hospitality is really done (and for slightly less money)...

title: Very bad
text:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing to express my disappointment and frustration with the poor service I experienced during my recent stay at your hotel. I had high expectations as a loyal customer, but unfortunately, my experience fell far short of what I had anticipated.

Firstly, I would like to address the issue of early check-in. As a hotel representative assured me, I was promised an early check-in at 12 PM. However, upon arrival at 12:30 PM, I was informed that my room was not yet ready. This was particularly inconvenient as my flight had landed at 6 AM, and I was exhausted from the overnight journey.

Furthermore, when my partner and I requested a late check-out, we were met with resistance. Despite our willingness to pay for an additional night, we were forced to vacate the room and pay for an extra night's stay. To make matters worse, the room was not cleaned throughout the day, despite the fact that we had paid for an additional night. This lack of attention to detail and disregard for our comfort was highly disappointing.

Additionally, I would like to highlight the lack of advertised amenities at your hotel. The website clearly stated that there was a restaurant on-site, yet upon arrival, we discovered that it was closed. It is unacceptable that this information was not updated anywhere, leaving us without dining options within the hotel premises. As frequent travelers and members of your loyalty program, my partner and I have stayed at your hotels in Tokyo and Barcelona. However, due to these recurring issues, we are now considering removing ourselves from your loyalty program and seeking alternative accommodations in the future.

I hope that you take my feedback seriously and address these concerns promptly. As a loyal customer, I believe it is essential for you to rectify these issues to maintain your reputation and ensure customer satisfaction. I look forward to hearing from you and hope that you will take the necessary steps to improve your services.

Yours sincerely,

title: New York
text: The hotel is in a good location and has excellent concierge. However it’s looking a bit tired and is very expensive for what they offer in the way of food. The plumbing was faulty and despite asking for it to be mended it wasn’t fixed during our stay. Lovely views from the bar area though

title: Underwhelming experience for the price paid
text:
Deeply disappointing experience, starting from check in.
