Staff who have “never seen the gym” so couldn’t comment what it has, to a Fans of MO room upgrade that “is not available” (but I see on the website I can book the next category up?), breakfast maître d’ sniffling and sneezing with zero interest and telling me to “sit over there and wait” (5 mins) because no one was available to clear a table at 10:30am (do it yourself?). An excellent concierge desk, bellhops, and gym attendant sadly can’t make up for the other staff for whom any request is too much effort and takes far too long.

The beds are quite firm but linen is nice. Bathrooms are spacious and amenities excellent but the shower nozzles are poorly labelled and hot water takes a while to arrive. You must ask for a Nespresso machine in the room. 

The Central Park views are INCREDIBLE. 

The prices on the website hid the actual room cost including taxes,  neglected to mention “breakfast included” actually means a daily credit ($41) that doesn’t cover a single food dish + a coffee! I decided to make coffee in my room and was charged $7 for the milk. It would make for a splendid comedy if it wasn’t supposed to be a five star hotel.

Overall a very poor experience. The tackiness and conniving pricing I’d expect of a lower brand, the unhelpfulness and poor attitude of staff I might expect of your average Eastern European B&B, but with the views of heaven. I would accept such outcomes at a price point 30% lower, but this was not the standard I thought I paid for.

title: Best NYC hotel experience yet!
text: Annual mother-daughter getaway to the US Open - best location and best hotel yet.  Three night stay.  Staff was incredible - door staff got us a car to the theater, fitness center saved my favorite snack, desk and housekeeping could not have been more helpful and accommodating. Early morning coffee/tea cart in the lobby.  And the fragrance in the air throughout the hotel is amazing!  And we were literally steps away from subway access to the tennis center - easiest thing ever.  No more hotel experimenting - we'll be making this our annual NYC hotel destination for the Open.

title: Leider etwas in die Jahre gekommen. Braucht Renovierung
text:
Die Lage des Hotels am südlichen Rand des Central Park ist spitze. Die Fifth Avenue ist in die Distanz. Auch die U-Bahn ist in unmittelbarer Nähe.
Der Blick von den oberen Stockwerken ist atemberaubend.
Leider ist das Hotel und die Inneneinrichtung deutlich in die Jahre gekommen. Der große Name des Mandarin Oriental hält leider nicht, was er verspricht. Es sollte dringend das Inventar aufgehübscht werden.
Im Vergleich zu anderen fünf Sterne Hotels, in New York fällt das Mandarin Oriental leider stark ab.
Ein gutes Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis ist dadurch leider nicht mehr gegeben.

title: Luxurious and fantastic value
text:
Exceptional value. 

This was our second time at MO and I was expecting the same as last time but it was a cut above! We were only returning for the view but this time the staff were wonderful - they treated my toddlers like queens! From the front desk to the maids - every single one of them was worth their weight in gold. Our room was magnificent. Our experience was even better. If you compare the price to other family accommodation in Manhattan is far better. And it's perfect for families as you're on the cusp of everything and right next to the park. We can't wait to come back!

title: The best of NYC
text: Everything one would expect from a 5 star hotel, and more. Made for the finest holiday my family have ever had - an exceptional hotel, with exceptional staff. Wonderful room, with views across the Hudson and into the city were incompatible

title: Amazing  Stay
text: The staff was very attentive and the overall stay was relaxing and amazing! Also my room had a great view of the Hudson River! The hotel property and room was immaculate. I will definitely stay again when I visit NYC!

title: Truly wonderful ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this 5 star hotel. Central Park is right across the street! There are countless number of restaurants nearby and you have access to the shipping center via the 3rd floor. Looking forward to our next visit!

title: I am not coming back! Terrible hotel!
text:
Terrible hotel! Avoid!! I had many many issues!!
 Plus the food at the hotel is bad! I had lunch there and it’s was very bad, And breakfast was the worse!! It’s a menu breakfast with a unpleasant food.
Avoid!

title: Mandarin Oriental Service is top-notch, even in the bar/lounge
text: Stopped in the bar for drinks and appetizers and ended up eating enough for dinner. Nice view, quiet, and good food on a Monday night in December when many places are overrun with tourists. An elegant way to start the week!

title: Good but needs updating
text: I stayed for one week in August with my family of 5, three teenagers, we had two connecting rooms facing the water.  Great views from the rooms and the lobby/restaurant.  Hotel was extremely helpful making the booking and ensuring we had the correct rooms for our family, they even put an extra bed in one of the rooms for us to have a bed each.  Nice pool and gym.  The location of the hotel is excellent, close to everything, and the staff are very helpful and polite.  Down side is that the rooms are very dated, carpets are worn and bathrooms looking a bit tired.  Breakfast was very disappointing, the only restaurant is very small and only has small tables, nothing suitable for a family of 5.  There is no buffet for breakfast and only a small choice from the menu, even less choice if you have dietary restrictions, we ended up having the same breakfast almost every day and it can take a while to arrive which is not ideal with children.

title: Disappointing
text:
We were quite excited by coming to MO New York as we saw the Reviews by far was quite good. However, our experience was not up to par:
- Upon Checkin, we were not recognized nor asked whether we are a MO Fan member. We were also not explained by the breakfast benefit clearly (only quickly say you have 70 dollars, therefore we assumed we had 70 dollars per person per breakfast) we received as a Amex Platinum Member. Therefore it created a kerfuffle upon check out when we see the bill
- We stayed at the MO for 7 nights and we somehow were explicitly told that there was no upgrade. This is also a first time as we use the Amex Platinum Program. However, since it was not a guarantee. We decided to let it go. 
- We had our Breakfast on the 2nd day in the morning, and the quality was very bad. The potato was microwaved and not cooked. We were deeply disappointed and decided not to have breakfast at the MO afterwards, which turned out to be a good thing.
- During our stay the service was up and down. Someday we would have very thorough service, and someday we'd need to ask 4 times for a package delivered to us in order to have someone bring it upstairs. Also our room phone's display had always been blank and we noticed no-one ever fixed it during our stay.
- Upon Checkout, I realized the real problem. First we called the concierge and the front desk, nobody picked up. So we decided to take the luggages downstair by ourselves. During check out, we noticed that there was a lunch bill on the 3th Aug, which was ours, was included in our total bill. The checkout receptionist had to manually remove that lunch, which shows the management mess already. Also I noticed there was a breakfast bill that was 40+ dollars. I did not understand why we were charged by having free breakfast. then the receptionist explained to me that we were only eligible for continental breakfast and 70 dollars per breakfast, not per person. Both of the bill incidents had me sense a scammy tone of this hotel and made me question their professionalism. I had to double check all the bills in the end and made sure my luggage was safely stored. I also had to obtain a paper copy of the bill just in case, which turned out to be very useful later.
- When we were leaving the hotel, the concierge was reluctant even on helping on move the baggage to the Uber. This is definitely not what we expected from MO
- One day after check out, I noticed they silently charged me 42 dollars on my credit card, and I had to call Amex to monitor the transaction. And having the paper bill on hand also helped in this case. Thankfully the charge was not finalized. But I have to say that I choose to stay in MO not to have a little scamming battle with them. That shouldn't be the intention. 
- Overall, I would not recommend anyone who got used to other MO service to stay in this hotel.

title: Service was great.
text: We have stayed in NYC a couple of times this year at other similar hotels. The fall off in service post COVID was obvious at other hotels. The Mandarin was the exception- service was great at check in, doorman, restaurant and concierge. Will stay again.

title: Great hotel
text:
Mandarin oriental hotel NY. 
I stayed in the hotel for four days on business. The hotel is comfortable and offers valuable amenities. Dealing with the staff is always a pleasure. They go out of their way to help when you are in need. 
I was dealing with Mr. Vasquez Andres who was more than the usual. It is that extra personal care that makes a great hotel become the greatest. Mr. Vascuez listened to my concerns  he quickly to charge and did more than I could ever ask for. I am looking forward to my next stay i am sure it will be plesent.

title: La ubicación es muy buena.
text:
El servicio a cuartos,  el del front desk y del concierge merece una felicitación especial. No obstante, el servicio en el restaurante es pobre.
El hotel requiere renovar su decoración y, mientras tanto, el mobiliario de las habitaciones (al menos la que ocupamos) necesita retoque de pintura al detalle: golpes y raspaduras.

title: Mandarin Quality. Ideal for a short stay
text: Very nice place to stay, great food, peak service. Great view across central park, especially at the breakfast/ restaurant. Can recommend the belgian waffles with whipped cream and also the Açai bowl for breakfast, though in general priced steep. Nice Gym and wellness area, loved the pool. Great Bar & drinks.

title: A comfortable welcome after a long flight
text:
We checked in last night and with some trepidation.I read some of the reviews and thought about changing hotels.
I am so glad I didn’t.
The staff are wonderful, bellman check in, concierge and housekeeping.
The room is traditional with every need catered for.
The bathroom luxurious.
Lovely pool. Very nice breakfast
I am surprised at all the negative reviews as we received a complementary night free as part of their summer offer.
People can be so negative and truly this hotel so far has surpassed our expectations. 
So glad I did not change reservation.

title: Out of sync
text: The MO is out of balance. The lobby restaurant was not at the level you might expect. A gorgeous view but poor price quality levels. Rooms get a bit outdated too. Greatest disappointment was that the restaurant and traditional bar are closed after Covid. We travelled every other year to MO NYC but will rethink it next time. Location is perfect.

title: Way off 5 star
text: We moved rooms twice. First room was dirty and run down with chipped paintwork, smashed keypad on the safe and huge blood/red wine stains on the carpet. 2nd room was similar but with what appeared to be dog dirt on the carpet bd the safety latch on the front door smashed off. Eventually we were moved to a suite which was a beautiful room and much appreciated but also in need of renovation. The bar area was woefully understaffed and we walked out twice having waiting at least ten minutes each time to be served.

title: Stunning
text: The nicest hotel we have ever stayed at in NYC. The service was impeccable. The attention to detail was amazing. The hotel genuinely cared about our experience. The views of Central Park were stunning. The location is perfect.

title: Family trip
text:
Everything was amazing. Waitress were very kind and helpful specially Elsa and John 
The room was wonderful and the view to the Central Park amazing 
The room service was perfect my room was always organized by the cleaning persons as sops as I left it they immediately clean it

title: Our Adventure Weekend
text: This is by far one of the nicest hotels in the world. The service, the comfort, the view (we over looked Central Park). The food was exceptional and the bed and pillows were so amazingly comfortable. Centrally located to experience the worlds greatest city!

title: Mediocre Experience
text:
I’ll start with the positive…
Check in was easy and the room was a very generous size for the city. It kind of ends there. 

It was a tough choice to decide between luxe hotel properties in NYC. I settled on the Mandarin because of my extraordinary experience in London. Maybe the bar was set too high by Hyde Park. 

We got in to the room and felt like a quick coffee before heading out. No coffee setup? We called down and were told it could be provided - on demand?! Really?? Soon enough a Nespresso setup was delivered. How many people opt out of coffee? Maybe that’s just me. 

Next, showed up for lunch in the bar (I think there is only the one dining option). There wasn’t anyone at the host’s station so we grabbed a seat.  Soon enough someone awkwardly asked us to vacate the “reserved” seats and they would check to see if they could accommodate us at another table. Eventually we were reseated. Service was lagging and food was overpriced (as can be expected at an establishment like this). 

Hotel decor and interiors were all just average.  Nothing felt like a wow. No part of the experience felt like it justified the price tag - especially when there is so much competition in this city. 

My stay at The NYC Edition in March (for roughly half the cost) far outperformed this experience. The Mandarin can do much better than this.

title: Probably the best NYC hotel
text: Truly an excellent hotel - have previously stayed at the St Regis and The Pierre in Manhattan - no comparison at all. Lovely room, lovely views, and service was head and shoulders above! The breakfasts were wonderful as well!

title: Great stay with incredible views
text: Loved this hotel, the views and the rooms are all incredible but the standout is the staff. The room service was tasty and prompt and everyone was so helpful. We were here for my moms birthday and they really helped make it so special. I would definitely recommend staying here!

title: Very desapointed.
text: Very desapointed. The hotel is too old. Need a refresh as soon as possible. The rooms are too small. The shower doesn’t. Very expensive. It’s not look like in Geneva, Hong Kong, Shanghai and London. Thh group needs to do something diferent in NY

title: Great service and views
text: Beautiful views on the 51st floor. Entire team (except concierges) were amazing and went out of their way to help. In room dining for breakfast was exceptional but lunch and dinner options are limited. Turn down service was a nice added touch.

title: Degrading MO New York. Need to be redone ASAP
text:
A couple of thoughts for the once thought amazing experience the MO New York used to offer, sadly it passed away during the pandemic and it seems that it will never be recovered.

We used to come on a yearly basis and spend a good part of our summers in NYC booked into the hotel that, due to the extremely attentive and amazing staff at that time and services, we actually felt like home far away from home.

Nothing has been upgraded within the amenities or services, it seems extremely stuck in time, where carpets and furniture around the hotel seems to be broken, ripped, kept together in pieces, using ice tongs to close sliding doors, unwashed carpets, prehistoric air purifier on the upper level hallways, leaving the ones on lower levels smelling like old and mould. The TV and remote control it is still the same from 6-8 years ago, with a system not up to date with the modern times where you select movies (that you pay for obviously) that freeze while you watch then you cannot continue it. Bathroom that doesn’t have refreshed amenities everyday as supposed in a hotel of this magnitude, so you end up having to ask daily or going to buy your own to make sure you are set, a blow dryer that is impossibly old (i emphasise the word ‘old’).

The pool amenities and the pool itself has been stuck in time with a disgraceful aspect, again lucky for the location on the 36th floor with beautiful views… but nope. This isn’t a 5 star style and comfort of a relaxing pool or the pool lounge. Same can be said about their fitness rooms.

Furthermore, the staff that currently operates is extremely unresponsive and has a beautiful lack of happiness and professionalism that leaves you with a very unpleasant slight upset feeling after. Their ‘communication’ system apparently is entitled only to them or whoever they chose to do so with, especially through their ‘state of the art’ messaging system via Whatsapp where they either answer or don’t answer at all or their system deletes you as immediately as one day or half a day and you would have to go through the process of validating yourself all over again time after time. Let us not speak of the fast help the provide… because it doesn’t exist :). However, they would love to charge you for every breathing thing possible, but the return of investment?!

Quality does not match the investment.

There are still plenty more to say in regards to this experience which left us with a distaste in our return to NYC, but whoever comes here and knows how a true MO hotel operates or how this one specifically used to operate will surely match the feelings provided.

With all due respect to the rest of Mandarin Oriental hotels and resorts around the world, i think this one should be taken out of the franchise, scale down for a 3-4 star hotel or simply close it for total refurbishment.

I highly recommend other hotels which we will definitely only stay at for the future NYC long trips for business as well as for pleasure as they cater for all the necessary needs. Recommended Baccarat, Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton. Better staff, communication system and services, what sadly they do not have as MO NY is privileged to have is the amazing views of Midtown and Central Park. But with pleasure can be traded not to waste your money on lack of quality and improper staff.

title: Best hotel in Columbus Circle!
text: This hotel is quite remarkable, thanks to the Front Desk service, especially from Jonathan and Mirza!  They both had a great sense of humor as we got lost just figuring out what elevator to take back to our room!  As seniors, it is so reassuring to have a delightful response to our idiosyncrasies as well as highly informative recommendations for things to do as well as transportation instructions, both public and private.  Our room had a Hudson River view and a HUGE bathroom.  While we would have preferred more of the square footage to be devoted to the bedroom, not the bathroom, it was so pleasant a stay that the size seems insignificant.  The Lincoln Center is right next door and we "stargazers" saw Cate Blanchett in the elevator before she gave her hosting duties there for a gala event.  Another plus in a thoroughly enjoyable stay.  At least once a year we visit New York from our little paradise in Carmel, CA and we will definitely stay here again!  This was our first time at this particular Mandarin hotel, but it won't be our last--that's for sure!

title: The best customer service!!!
text:
The best hotelI’ve stayed.
I’ve never had an idea for hat the server ce could be so… excellent!
The cleanest hotel!
The lake couldn’t be better!
The breakfast was delicious; the gym was superb! I hope to come back soon!
Again -a really good experience!

title: Great location
text: Property has a great location. The room was nice but kind of dark. Concierge was great via email before we got there but was of little help during our visit. Breakfast and cocktails are very expensive. While the service at breakfast was great, the food was not that good and the menu was limited. Would probably stay elsewhere next time.

title: No answer of service desk - 5* service?
text:
Nice location but the service does not reflect the high prices required.
In spite of reminders my request to provide the invoice for my stay remains un-answered. The service and choice of dishes during the breakfast not satisfactory. Great view on the central Park and excellent location are definitly the plusses of this stay.

title: While staying at the MONYC for our honeymoon! Our trip was nothing short of grand and amazing. It feels like home
text: The pillows are the fluffiest I’ve experienced, the bed is the softest, the cleanliness was outstanding from the living room to the bathroom. The views are always breathtaking. The stay made us feel special with their efforts of our last minute adjustments and accommodations.

title: Beautiful property
text: The amenities are great. There is something for everyone. The location and the views are second to none. Last the rooms are spacious. The staff goes above and beyond to make you feel like you are at home.

title: Beautiful property
text: Beautiful property excellent location easy access to top designer shops, view over the Central Park was breathtaking at night and day! I did lots of walking and shopping. The staff was extremely helpful and willing to help, the MO hotels are definitely my favorite

title: An unforgettable experience in NYC
text: This hotel is absolutely stunning, with an unbeatable location near Central Park, restaurants, shops, and more. The room views are jaw-dropping, giving you the warmest and most memorable welcome to NYC. The entire team was beyond amazing, but I have to give a special shoutout to the Guest Relations team who truly went above and beyond. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with the most thoughtful amenity and every tiny detail was carefully planned, creating an enchanting experience. The staff was incredibly friendly, making sure we felt right at home. I want to express my deepest gratitude to everyone at the hotel for making our stay unbelievably unforgettable. Thank you!

title: Exceptional Service and Accommodations
text: We have stayed in many luxury hotels  where you expect exceptional service. Some have met our expectations and others have not, especially post the Covid epidemic. Far too many companies have used the pandemic and financial crisis as a way to cut back. Mainly on the little things that make a customers stay pleasant. The simple luxury of returning to your room to a turned down bed with water on the night stand , ice in the bucket and candy on your pillow. The little things that say that you care to pamper your guests. Many companies have used the excuse that it isn’t safe for someone to enter your room as an excuse to eliminate those little touches. We appreciated it.  The staff was pleasant, the room was very clean and had all the amenities we could need. Thank you for going the extra mile.

title: Heated Toilet Seats AND a bidet??? Done.
text: My expectations were high and I was not disappointed. The rooms, the staff, the views, the HEATED TOILET SEATS!! All wonderful. I went on a business trip and invited my parents. It was there first time in NYC and thanks in large part to the Mandarin Oriental, they are now huge fans. Thank you!

title: Excellent
text: Good location and very good views of central park and city site easy to go shopping  centre , walking to Time square  15 minutes radius , walking and running in the Central Park , a lots of theatre around the area.

title: LESS FOR MORE
text:
The service the hotel offer is going down and down, you have less for more.
The spa is now closed 2 days a week, but the price s of the rooms went up. it closed now at 6pm, you van not have access to the Spain you don't book a treatment, and again the prices of the room  went up.

The portions of the food change enormously depending of the Cef of the day.

Thank  god the staff is fantastic, and always helpful from management to bell boy.

Unfortunately the direction is not going the same way, the hotel feel like a ghost there is no life or too much (special events)

title: Was will man mehr
text:
Die Zimmer sind voll ok,,die Bar ist großartig , man hat ja mehrere Möglichkeiten um etwas zu essen und etwas zu trinken. Die Lage ist natürlich ganz großartig 
Wir waren 1 Woche hier und haben uns immer wohlgefühlt

title: Simply devine
text:
On our first trip to this amazing city, we decided to choose this hotel for its location and convenience to major attractions. It’s service is unsurpassed and staff very well trained to make its guests want for nothing.
We were not disappointed in any way and each and everyone we came in contact with went out of their way to make our experience a memorable one. Our room was on the 50th floor overlooking Central Park and the skyline of billionaires row which made for an awesome view. Our accommodations were top drawer and the bed very comfortable which made for a well rested night to tackle the day ahead of site seeing and long walks, yes, take comfortable shoes as from the moment you leave be prepared to put some miles in. 
The hotel offered free transportation in a luxury  Mercedes to within 20 blocks from the hotel so you can be dropped of to any major attractions, a nice touch indeed. And upon returning to the hotel at the end of our day, we always made it a point to stop off at the lobby bar for a night cap where we were always greeted by Daniel who served us with a pleasant smile and conversation, thanks Danny, we will miss you and our conversation during our daily wind downs after each day. You long career there is, I’m sure,  much appreciated by your peers and we wish you continued success. The lobby and bar is located on the 35th floor which made for some outstanding views especially during sunset, the colors of the buildings near by always in change as the sun went down. 
We can’t say enough nice things about our experience here, everything was perfect, the people who worked here, and the amenities were simply devine. Thank you Mandarin Oriental New York, hats off to each and everyone of you.

title: maestoso e splendido
text: hotel meraviglioso nell’uptown di Manhattan ad un passo da central park. I doorman ti accolgono a piano terra e dopodiché la hall con la reception e il lounge si trova al 36° piano e già dal lounge che é attaccato alla hall si può godere della vista mozzafiato su central park e i grattacieli. La piscina con la palestra si trovano al 36° piano sempre con vista sui grattacieli. Colgo l’occasione per ringraziare i concierges Tea e Kenneth per loro gentilezza e disponibilità.

title: Époustouflant ✨
text: Tout est parfait ! Des produit de bains Dyptiques ! Un lit d’un confort incroyable ! Aucun bruit de voisinage ou de Clim , tout est silencieux ! Le restaurant bar à la plus belle vue au monde ! Wawwww Waww waaaww la plus belle vue vertigineuse de News York ✨🇱🇷❤️

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: The best hotel, with the best service, beyond expectations! And always grateful for all the effort they put into their guest. Will always come back and feel like home! Special thanks to Andres, Yarisol, Robin, Anetta and Juan for making us feel like home.

title: NYC5日間滞在
text:
広い部屋にふかふかのスリッパ、毎日細かいところまで行き届いた清掃に、挨拶をかかさないドアマンとルームサービスの電話対応やポーターの方の対応含めて文句なし。ラウンジのマンダリンブレックファーストもオススメです。
M.O. Fan'sになると無料でアーリーチェックインもできるので泊まるならFan'sに入っておきましょう！
中日でラウンジの朝食をいただきましたが、マンダリンオリエンタルらしい中華粥が優しく、ほんのり生姜が効いて美味しかったです。一度は食べてみてください！

title: Wonderful stay
text: Un très bel hôtel avec une vu magnifique sur Central Park. Nous sommes venus à New York pour la première fois pour quelques jours de détente et mon récent anniversaire. Un Énorme Merci à Kenneth pour toute l’attention qu’il a pu nous porter et toute sa gentillesse. Un merci très spécial à Tea pour tout ses conseils, sa bienveillance et sa gentillesse, grâce à ses indications notre fils a passé sa meilleure après midi du voyage en faisant du vélo à Central Park. Je tiens également à remercier Nathaniel lors de notre dîner il a été extrêmement attentif et surtout attentionné envers notre fils.

title: Wohlfühlen mit überwältigender Aussicht
text: Dank der wunderbaren Atmosphäre und dem zuvorkommenden Service haben wir unseren Aufenthalt im MO als super entspannend empfunden. Eine Oase der Ruhe in Manhattan. Die Lage und die Aussicht sind perfekt. Der Pool schien mir auf den Fotos etwas schöner ausgestattet als bei unserem Aufenthalt. Doch auf jeden Fall ist das Haus ausgezeichnet.

title: Un hotel de 5 estrellas con trato de 3
text:
Evidentemente cuando eliges un hotel como este las  expectativas son más altas debido al precio por noche y a la fama del grupo. 
Ya me he alojado en 2 hoteles Mandarín más (el de Madrid y el de Bangkok) y este de NYC no se le acerca ni de lejos a ninguno de los dos. Inclusión del 20% de propina en cualquier servicio del hotel sin aviso previo (entiendo la propina en un servicio que te prestan como restauración, pero desde cuando te cargan de forma obligatoria 100$ de propina más tasas en un masaje terapéutico que solicite en el hotel por dolor de cuello. Desde cuando hay que pagar un 20% más al médico en EEUU. 
Se han vuelto absolutamente locos y es algo que tendrán que revisar porque aunque vayas a pagar una factura alta en un hotel, ya lo tienes asumido, pero a nadie le gusta que le roben a la cara. En una habitación de 1.500$ la noche, tienes que solicitar que te pongan una cafetera que te añaden en cualquier motel de carretera en EEUU y encima te la suben sin café que tienes que volver a pedir. Problemas en el check out y al final tienen que hacerte 2 facturas porque tienen problemas en el procesamiento de pagos….
Vengo mucho a NYC y no volveré a elegir este hotel.

title: First Time to stay MONYC
text: It was a great experience to staying Mandarin Oriental New York hotel. It was the first time I visited New York City. Hotel was convenient. It’s exactly next to Central Park. It just 10 minutes walk to Time Square. There was connection to the shops downstairs which made easier. The view outside the room was amazing. I was so excited and happy to staying this hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. Service was wonderful. I would like to highlight John who working at Lounge. He provided excellent service every day we came for breakfast. He remembered us and talked and shared things with us during our stay. Also Robin who worked at Front Desk was very kind too. He had smiling face all the time. We love this stay and will definitely come back in the future. Thank you so much.

title: Lovely hotel, great location; misleading room label
text:
Lovely hotel with spectacular views, competent and friendly staff. Room service was by far the best meal I've ever had from a late night room service menu.

On the negative side, the room was described as a "suite" but that is a complete misnomer. It was a comfortable room, elegantly furnished but it had no separate area, let alone a separate room, that could justify it being labeled a suite.

title: Underwhelming - MO Lounge spoiled the trip.
text: The stay (lodging) at the hotel was superb.  I can't say enough about it.  Staff was very attentive - especially Robin at the front desk and met every possible request.  The room was apportioned with all of the usual amenities, but it was disappointing there was no coffee maker especially when room service on Sunday morning had a wait time of 45 minutes for an order of solely a pot of coffee.  It was easier to walk across the circle to Starbucks.   The MO Lounge was another story.  The host staff was very personable and attentive, servers were average.  The drinks were good and the view was stellar.  The food is absolutely atrocious.  the pasta was underwhelming, the crispy chicken sandwich was inedible.  It was comprised of all dark meat and I literally had to spit my first bite in the napkin.  We ordered the handmade potato chips as a starter and they were good, but the server never brought (despite several requests) malt vinegar as was touted on the menu.   The redeeming factor was that we were able to find a table on short notice at Rosa Mexicano (a local restaurant not affiliated with the hotel across from Lincoln Center) that had far superior food at about 25% of the price and much happier servers.  If I was solely rating the lodging the score would be a 10.  Honestly, because of the restaurant/lounge experience - I doubt I will be back.

title: The best
text: It will be hard for us to visit any other hotel other than a MO property due to the exceptional service we received during our stay. The cleanliness, prompt service from the staff, room upgrade and more put our stay at the top of list of the best hotel stays to date.

title: Don't be fooled by the brand name! This is not a mandarin oriental hotel the way you think about it
text:
If you have experienced a mandarin oriental hotel before and you think this will be on the same standard, you are making a very expensive mistake.

The only reason this hotel is still open is the location, the views of central park are indeed amazing and you can walk to all central points of interest, but that is as far as the good goes.

The bad and the terrible:

The concierge service: i approached the concierge 5 times and the standard answer was literally "i don't know", the highlight of the terrible service was recommending a steakhouse that served no steaks.

The breakfast lounge: once you have enjoyed the views and need to actually get some food the appeal ends, very limited choices, very basic cooking. What was particularly offensive was  how dirty the tables, carpets and even chairs were, i had to literally clean my seat of crumbs and leftovers while the staff looked at me and offer no help. From there onwards i couldn't stop thinking that if the front is dirty imagine the back...

The room: we booked a large corner room on the top floor, the size and views were amazing. Then it all went downhill, the furniture was old and full of nicks and stains, the carpets are probably the originals from 20 years ago, i opened a window and the dust and spiders that came out scared me into asking the staff to open it. The bed sheets had yellow stains and so did the towels. The amount of dust under the furniture and around the windows, doors, light fittings was clear evidence that housekeeping had not done a full cleaning in a very long time.

What really pushed me over the top was that when my wife complained the service actually went from bad to worst... The room was cleaned but amenities stoped being re filled, towels disappeared, water bottle reduced to half and in general we felt like we were punished for complaining.

I couldn't recommend this hotel to anyone... If i was offered to stay there for free i would skip it! 

This hotel offers location and location only, if you are looking for anything else in your experience stay as far away as possible, you can always go for a drink at the lounge and enjoy the views without spending thousands of dollars in mediocre rooms and service.

title: None
text: I visited your property between March 31 and April 1st.  celebrating our Anniversary with my wife Elizabeth.  We feel immediately at home. Our room was impeccable, with a modern decor, and a beautiful view of the Hudson River. The bed was very comfortable. We were greeted with a nice bottle of champagne and a delicious cake. In the morning we enjoyed breakfast at MOLounge, with an incredible view of Central Park. Elsa and Toni and all the servers treated us like royalty and the food was superb. The next day, we explored the city (we learn how to manage the subway) and at night with stop by Bad Roman just out of curiosity to have some drinks.  There, we had the pleasure to meet Polat Aytemur and we told them that we were staying at the hotel. He immediately asked us how our stay was, gave us his business card if we need something and invite us to visit MOLounge . We did it the next night and Polat greet us with a big smile. Our meal was delicious and the experience incredible  All the staff we interacted with were very helpful and had a great attitude. Our visit was beyond memorable. I would like to thank Alexandra, Polat, the whole staff (Front Desk, Housekeeping, our Guest Relations Agent) I have in my heart a debt of gratitude to all of them at MONYC.  Thank you so very much for providing me an unforgettable stay!

title: Beautiful Views.
text:
Beautiful hotel in an excellent location in walking distance to Central Park and fifth avenue shops. 
Definitely a five star hotel with amazing service and top notch spa albeit expensive - our only gripe was the size of the room which was pretty tight. 
Dinner and Breakfast was of high quality with amazing views of Ny and staff are amazing- all in all a good stay.

title: A below average Mandarin Oriental! Not value for money!
text: Horrible experience! The hotel needs a full renovation!!! We were staying in Premium Suite and the furniture looked like they have not been changed for over 2 decades. Cleaning of the room was average! Ee complained many times for the cleaning! Basically everything was below average, for sure not the standards of a Mandarin Oriental we all know! Food at the only restaurant they had was below average - even the omelette did not taste nice!

title: Not a 5 star... not even close!
text:
The hotel is not a real 5 STAR. I am sorry but it isn`t. It is too expensive for the services offereed. The ONLY positive point of this Mandarin (I have been in Mandarin Madrid, Marrakech and Geneva) is the LOCATION, there rest is a total tragedy. 
Breakfast PRE PAID in my travel agency and they tell (you have only 40 usd per day, per person, in credit for breakfast - NEVES SEEN SUCH RIDICULOUS THING); room is joke and not luxury at all; towels in the bathroom disappeared every single day; the restaurant (where I had dinner) has a lack of choice and the food is not amazing; breakfast service is horrible (employees pay more attention to the people who givem them "extra gratuity") and they just ignore the remaining ones; the blonde girl registering the guests for breakfast has always a sleepy face every single day; carpets on corridors, etc with stains and with a horrible pattern; and I could go on and on and on... Conclusion: I DO NOT recommend Mandarin despite being a Mandarin fan (Madrid and Marrakech mainly).

title: None
text: A good week but not great.  Check-in felt impersonal and our request for late check-out was deferred but later granted when requested by email.  Room was good with decent views apart from the Trump monstrosity in the way.  It was a busy time with Easter and Passover but Hotel coped well although the single restaurant was under stress.

title: None
text:
The property is a little dated. The breakfast was adequate but certainly not what I expect from a 5 star hotel.

Concierge was ok. I've had much more helpful experiences with other establishments.

Bottom line, it's time to update the hotel completely for the rates you are asking. If that happens we will be back for sure to stay.

Best,
Ed Shea

title: Luxury Hotel Experience
text: First time at this hotel. Staff was excellent, friendly, helpful. Room service excellent. Terrific spa. Spacious room. Not as luxurious as I expected. Surprised there was no restaurant or gift shop. Had a lovely view of Central Park. Was attending a weekend of events at Lincoln Center and the hotel is easy walking distance. Also close to great shopping on Fifth Ave.

title: Overrated
text: Upon arrival discovered that the entrance view was a building under construction directly across the street.  Not the hotels fault but not an inviting scene.  The early check-in I had booked was not ready on arrival at 3:00 so had a light lunch.  Received undercooked raw salmon (basically sushi).  How can a chef make that kind of mistake.  Our room was a Premiere Central Park View but was mostly building tops and a sliver of a view of the park.   Experience was not what was promoted.

title: Excellent service
text:
I was there for 3 days on a solo trip , from check in to check out everything was on point.
All the colleagues I interacted with I could see that they were happy to be there and so was I. Everything is also in close proximity.

title: The Pretty Woman experience
text: We were recommended the bar for the great views, excellent cocktails and great service!! Two out of three ain't bad :). To be fair, all staff were courteous and excellent  from greeting us at the taxi through to the bar entrance. The host at the bar though when found out we were not residents resorted to what we can only call the pretty woman experience - you never know who people are and there is no need for such attitude - the hotel is amazing and we love the London one - it didnt spoil it for us as we wouldn't allow it but  beware.......

title: None
text: My only recommendation for Mandarin Oriental - New York is to improve the quality of food and customer service in the hotel restaurant. The restaurant does not match the high level of other services. The quality of the rest of the hotel's services is at a high level.

title: Lounge mit Top-Blick auf den Central Park
text:
Wir haben uns die Lounge des Hotels angesehen und festgestellt, dass von dort aus dem 35. Stockwerk ein wunderbarer Blick auf den Columbus Circle und den Central Park geboten wird.
Wir haben dann aus der relativ kleinen Karte einen Salat und ein „Crispy Chicken Sandwich „ ausgewählt, beides nicht gerade preiswert, aber sehr lecker und von bester Qualität. Ebenso die glasweise erhältlichen Weine. Sehr freundlicher Service.

title: None
text: Time for a facelift. Sad to inform you that the standard of this property has plunged. We have always been a FAN since our first stay in 2016. We pride ourselves to be the ambassadors of MO when we talk to our friends and business associates in the past. They have taken our recommendations and find out for themselves. This trip was not the same.  Asiate is closed and we really enjoyed our dining experience. Hopefully the property will have a fine dining restaurant soon. Spa services were not easily available. Room was dusty. Thankfully, Ms. Yarisol Martinez (front desk supervisor) was so kind to move us to a suite on the 53rd. Floor.

title: Nest of tranquility in NYC
text: Mandarin Oriental in New York City is a nest of tranquility, out of the electric tension of the Big Apple. Definitively great to have a suite on double view : Central Park and Hudson River. The swimming pool is unbelievable and because of Joshua, I had the big privilege to see the sunshine over New York from the pool ! a unbelievable experience (thanks to him !). The spa is very clean and good ! The restaurant and breakfast area is also a key. Many thanks to all the Teams and hope to have the pleasure to come back soon in Mandarin Oriental NYC !

title: Love this hotel and staff + +
text:
This is our home when visiting NY. Stayed here many times.  The location is perfect, property well maintained, amenities are excellent and service is wonderful.   From a service standpoint, the front desk, concierge, doormen, restaurant staff and housekeeping due an excellent job providing discrete professional service.   They go out of their way to ensure your stay is stress free and memorable.   We especially appreciate John who works in the restaurant.  Very engaging and personal yet not imposing. Genuine interest in making your NY visit enjoyable and memorable, with restaurant and activity recommendations if needed.  Sort of like a friendly concierge who happens to also work as a server in the restaurant.  During this last visit, the pastry chef sent us specialized chocolates to our room with personalized cookies and chocolates.   Concierge helped arrange Per Se for us which is almost impossible to book with short notice.  Doormen and bellmen are always there for you and extremely pleasant.  

Only negative is the hotel needs to use different sheets on the beds.  My partner and I find the sheets too stiff and not soft.  

Otherwise 10/10

title: Il y a mieux ailleurs
text:
Déco datée et kitsch, mais la chambre était spacieuse et propre. Le robinet de la douche un vrai casse tête. 
Il n y a pas de free wifi dans l hôtel. C est payant. Plusieurs formules sont proposées (pour 1 heure, 24h ou 3 heures). Je trouve ça scandaleux vue les prix des chambres et le fait que même au Starbucks du coin de la rue le wifi est gratuit pour ses clients…
Deux cappuccino 48 dollars…

title: Very disappointing.
text:
What a disappointment. Mandarin Oriental is synonymous with luxury and impeccable service, we’ve stayed at many around the world. Unfortunately MO New York felt like a 3-4 star hotel: 

It doesn’t feel like much care is taken in keeping things clean and smart - the entrance carpet needs a thorough wash. It’s stained and discoloured.

The hotel is VERY dated. The rooms, the shower (don’t get me started on that), the decor, even the hairdryer. 

The breakfast, lunch and dinner menus are very limited. Nothing special about dining at this hotel unless you get full and satisfied off of Central Park views. 

The spa area is the worst I’ve seen. No beds at the pool. A sauna that barely works. Dated and questionably clean. 

We got shocked whenever we touched ANYTHING in this hotel?! 

The service was average at best. However, special mention to the concierge team who provided great restaurant recommendations and managed to secure difficult bookings. 

The location of the hotel is good, although we found ourselves travelling most days and nights to other parts of the city. Most of NY’s best restaurants are not located ‘close’ to this hotel. If you want to be close to Central Park, and some of the art museums, then great location. 

All in all, wouldn’t recommend MO New York.

title: Lovely Hotel Great location
text: Room was lovely and had the most amazing view.  Staff were all very friendly and helpful.  Only downside was their really good restaurant was under renovation and we didn't realize.  The Lounge restaurant was nice but we were expecting more of a dining experience for our celebration.

title: Mandarin di serie B
text:
Questo Mandarin ci ha deluso.
Camere con vista ma vecchiotte e tristi, letto datato e senza le mitiche e morbidissime lenzuola MO, bagno senza bidet e dalla rubinetteria malandata,asciugamani low profile. Moquette usurata.Manca una macchina del caffè.
Colazione buona e con vista molto bella anche se ti illudono sia compresa quale MO fan. In veritá ti accreditano soli 35$ a testa su di un conto che senza strafare con tasse e servizio arriva sui 70$ per persona.
 NYC , anche a prezzi inferiori, offre molto di meglio.Prima delusione in un Mandarin.Peccato!

title: Excellent séjour au Mandarin NYC
text: Meilleur emplacement pour la découverte de Manhattan! Vue époustouflante sur Central Park et le reste de la ville, service irréprochable. Séjour parfait en tout point! Merci à toutes les équipes notamment le service Housekeeping d’une attention et professionnalisme exceptionnels!

title: Perfect New York Oasis
text: Delightful stay.  MO New York has competent, caring staff in every corner of the operation.  The hotel is sparkling clean.  Unusually for NYC hotels, it is quiet because of its location starting at the 35th floor creating an oasis of calm in this bustling city.

title: Change the receptionist at the bar, she has no customer service
text: Again , the hotel is ok but overpriced and the customer service js so so bad . The receptionist at the  bar is so rude , she has no manners . The place ans tables were empty but they refused ti give you a good tables and when you asked why they said it was reserved, we stayed at the bar for more than four hours and the tables were empty . They should replace the receptionist at the bar with someone who has good customer service and etiquette.

title: Birthday Weekend
text: Stayed at MO for a long weekend! First time there and will never stay anywhere else while in NYC. Before we even got there, fantastic help from concierge with restaurant recommendations. Yvonne was spectacular! She was so kind upon check in and then went the extra mile to make my son's birthday weekend unforgettable. Her attention to detail and extra special surprises were incredible. He will never forget her! The entire MO team was friendly and helpful. Shout out to the excellent housekeeping staff. Everyone went out of their way to make the weekend extra special. The rooms were wonderful, clean, beautiful views, and the location cannot be beat, right next to central park. There are alot of great restaurants within walking range of hotel.

title: Amazing Views
text: Beautiful hotel with fabulous views! Unfortunately I was not able to use Spa because it was fully booked the whole time we were there. Great service from housekeeping team. Concierges were wonderful, helping us to find exactly the right places to go to. Shoutout to the doorman Gabriel. He recognized us every time when we were back to the hotel. And manager of reception Oxana. She is very attentive to the details. We briefly mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary and after the day in the city we found a kind surprise in the room. That was a sweet touch. Hotel is great. We will be back. Thank you.

title: Lovely
text:
Overall a very good stay.

Excellent service at the lounge in the evenings with a menu that presented multiple things I was happy with and interesting drinks.  

Room was spacious, comfortable and had good amenities. 

Concierge staff were very helpful both in advance of and during my stay.

I loved the provision of advance copies of books in the rooms - what a special and novel touch.

Only two real downsides: 1. Rude, bordering on obnoxious front desk representative at the spa.  2. Clueless wait staff at the lounge one morning sitting me down with the sun in my eyes.  Asked if the blind could be lowered, was told it didn't work and could not be lowered, did not offer to move me to another area for comfort.  Staff at a run of the mill Marriott will show more proactivity and care for guests, really not expected at an MO.

title: Very good but below expectations
text:
Great hotel overall, but you would expect a bigger room after paying 800$ a night. Service was great, our room attendant Clarise had everything checked and prep.

Views to Hudson and beloved Central Park are top notch.

If we find a good rate, we might think about coming back.

title: 25th Anniversary Weekend
text: We were treated like royalty from start-to-finish.  This was an unforgettable weekend away to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, and the MONYC staff latched onto that detail, and made our time so special throughout our stay.  Our accommodations were spectacular.  Coordinated, celebration surprises happened every time we returned to the room.  The gym/pool area were fabulous.  Our dining in the lounge was delicious every time, with breathtaking views of Central Park.  Every time we entered the building, it felt like we were coming home.  Sooooo good.  We're so grateful.

title: Great location, but would not stay again.
text:
The hotel is lovely and in a great location. 
I was disappointed with the fact that I was able to book a room for 3 adults ( husband, teenage son and myself) and there was only a double bed, without a sofa bed as expected. During checking in I was asked if wanted to purchase a fold away bed at additional cost  of $95 per night... This extra bed did not fit in the room at all, as it was taking too much space and the room lost it charm completely. 
I've been to many high end hotels around the world and never seen anything like this. Overall happy with the hotel, but most likely would not stay again.

title: Oh my! Heaven on earth!
text:
Oh my! Firstly the location is second to none if you want to be towards uptown. The views from the lounge of Columbus Circle, across south Central Park and down to The Plaza are absolutely incredible both day and night.
The room was lovely with great views (who doesn’t love a bath with a view?), comfy beds, robes and slippers. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but a kettle and plentiful supply of tea bags was delivered almost immediately.
Everyone we encountered was so delightful, you honestly felt as though they couldn’t do enough to help you.
The private elevator to the shopping mall below was fantastic (especially as it was absolutely freezing outside!).
What an absolute gem of a hotel, I long to stay there again.

title: Alto livello, una volta...
text:
Da molti anni scelgo il Mandarin Oriental quando soggiorno a NY. E questa volta devo dire che il livello qualitativo é decisamente peggiorato purtroppo.
Innanzitutto il fatto che ancora non abbia riaperto il ristorante Asiate è inconcepibile: capisco tutti i problemi legati al COVID ma non è pensabile che un hotel del vostro livello offra solo il lounge bar come ristorante...
Parlando del lounge bar e della colazione un appunto sui prezzi, esorbitanti: come fate a giustificare che un double espresso venga fatto pagare $18???
Per quanto riguarda la camera in un hotel di pari livello al giorno d'oggi non mancano mai due cose: la macchina del caffè Nespresso o simile e varie prese USB soprattutto al fianco del letto, cose che non ci sono al MONY.
Contattata la SPA per un servizio manicure mi è stato detto che quella del MO non offre questo servizio e avrei dovuto rivolgermi all'esterno: vi sembra normale questa cosa?
Per tutte le considerazioni di cui sopra credo che la prossima volta che sarò a NY dovrò forzatamente cercare un altro hotel che mi offra lo standard desiderato

title: The perfect choice
text: From its incredibly central location, breathtaking views across Central Park, discrete and intuitive service and faultless breakfast enjoying the Sun rise over the city. I cannot think of a better choice for a New York luxury hotel. I will be back

title: A very good  hotel at a great location
text:
The hotel has a great location ( close to Central Park and shopping streets) , a stunning view from the room ( we took an Hudson  view room) and from the lounge ( Central Park view)  and from the indoor pool and we enjoyed a great and professional service ! 
However the hotel is getting old and a renovation would  be useful.

title: Perfect, as expected
text: Gorgeous hotel. Well trained and friendly staff. Excellent, communicative, effective concierge. The views of Central Park from our room were memorable. The on-site restaurant/bar was beautiful, with excellent food. Great location on the SW corner of the park and directly at a subway stop.

title: The perfection
text:
A drink in the hotel bar on the 35th floor is a particularly pleasant experience. The view of New York and Central Park is grandiose. You have to ask the staff, who are very pleasant, to be placed behind a window to fully enjoy the spectacle of the city and its architecture. Obviously, it hurts a bit the wallet!
To be done without hesitation.

title: None
text: We loved experiencing MONY. The view was very nice. Great location. It was so nice that we receive a Cake and wine for our 23rd Anniversary.  The colleagues were very helpful. Eventhough we have fear of heights we were not uncomfortable. The lifts were very quick.

title: Un nome, una garanzia
text: E’ il tipo di hotel consigliato  per chi voglia soggiornare a New York in modo adeguato. Tutto è molto curato, fin nei dettagli. Atmosfera  glamorous. Personale perfetto e affabile. Champagne e   cheesecake ai lamponi ( una meraviglia) di benvenuto… impossibile essere più coccolati  di così.

title: If there were 10 stars, that is what I would give it
text:
The MO is just remarkable in every way. Great location, right near Central Park and 5th Avenue. And the location is right next to a mall which has many great restaurants including Per Se and The Porter House. You do not have to go outside to get there. That is such a plus.
Service that is amazing in every way. Beauty from the lobby to your room. The rooms are wonderful. Anything you need, they will make it happen. The MO is expensive but what a joy to get what you pay for. I can not say enough great things about this hotel. Oh, the views of Central Park are not too shabby.

title: Best NYC hotel experieince
text: Easily one of the best hotels in NYC. If you are looking to explore midtown it is great. The shopping centre is attached to the hotel and lots of dining options around the hotel. Will explore during the summer when access to the parks will be more desirable.

title: None
text:
Trés bon accueil chambre tres spacieuse surtout pour NYC
Services excellents en particulier l'équipe s'occupant des chambres
Superbe piscine et salle de fitness.
Bémol la restauration qui n'est pas au niveau du standing de l'hôtel

title: None
text: The Mandarin is the only hotel we will ever stay in when we come to Manhattan. We have stayed 4 times now and each time was fantastic. After our first stay I was incredibly impressed with the staff's treatment and remembering us upon our future stays. We are always greeted as if we live there and the accommodations are top notch. Room service and the restaurant in the main lobby are fantastic. The views from the park suites are incredible. I could go on forever about how much we love this hotel.

title: None
text: this was my first stay at New York Mandarin and found that your hotel is the best in Manhattan from location, services, facilities, etc.  Would be much more comfortable if you have a morning buffet for breakfast in addition to ala carto.  The view from the room and the swimming pool was fantastic and I really enjoyed the stay and hope I will be back soon in my next trip.

title: Rundown Room
text: I have stayed in many Mandarin locations around the world and my room in NY was by far the worst. The room looked circa 1980's and am sure hasn't been updated since built. It even had a nasty shower curtain ala a Motel 6. For almost $1,000 per night, there are many better options in NYC.

title: Perfect location
text:
Located next Central Park it is a great location for exploring this part of nyc. The hotel in it self starts at 35th floor and upwards. It is a bit dated but everything works perfect. The best part is the pool and gym, really great. The breakfast is good with a magnificent view, though a bit pricey. What do you thing about a regular coffee for 16,50 dollars. A yogurt bowl with granola and fresh berries for 28 dollars? Well, nyc is expensive but this is 50% more than at four seasons where I stayed the day before. 

Things that puzzled me is that there is no complimentary water in the room, nor tea and coffee. Strange. 
Contacted them regarding this via the suggested qr-code (e.g whatsup), but no reply at all.

title: Fun Birthday Surprise!
text: We live in NYC.  My spouse surprised me with a night at the Mandarin on Columbus Circle for my birthday.  The Mandarin is located 35 floors above Columbus Circle which for many rooms, affords breathtaking views of Central Park.  Our room had a nice view of Central Park.  We were in a suite.  The windowed bathroom was very nice, but the view was of construction.  The toiletries are all made by Diptych.  There was a nice bottle of wine and a lovely cake waiting for me when we entered the suite.  The fitness center with pool is really pretty.  We ordered room service for breakfast that was excellent.  I think that for all of its allure and glamour, they may want to touch up the carpeting and decor overall.

title: Excellent in many ways!
text: Great location of the hotel. Very good breakfast. Very nice attitude Danielle from reception but who is an absolute star is Tea from Concierge - very professional, helpful, smiling - and has extremely good tips on restaurants! Congratulations! :-))

title: nyc visit
text:
always top notch.  this visit did not disappoint.  well done mandarin nyc.
from the location to rooms/service.  hard to beat this hotel.  that is saying a lot with all the five star choices in nyc.  the 35th floor lobby has beautiful views of Central Park and the Manhattan skyline.  great spot to get a bite to eat or drink and relax.

title: Asian Elegance.
text:
The Mandarin Oriental New York is an Asian inspired hotel towering 54 floors above Central Park and Columbus Circle. The hotel benefits from it's sky-bound-tower with floor-to-ceiling windows throughout, affording stunning views of the cityscape.

I enjoyed my Central Park View, King, accented by art and Asian decor with the likes of Buddha sculptures amongst others. The accommodations were luxe with a muted colour palette and floor-to-ceiling windows provided hoovering Central Park views. The seating area with a desk and chaise lounge made the surroundings, homey. Plenty of high-tech room appliances injected every comfort into the stay. The bathroom was sensuous, with granite and marble fixtures, a walk in shower and a deep soaking tub.

The MO Lounge is the all day American Asian restaurant which provides a exemplary dining experience, elaborate ambiance and exceptional dishes along with with well crafted cocktails. The Hand Cut Pasta and the Chinese Egg Noodle Soup were supremo.

Other amenities at the Mandarin were a gorgeous, alluring Spa, a Fitness Center and 75 ft. Lap Pool. This combination of Wellness facilities allowed me to maintain my exercise and health program.

So, if you would relish an Asian inspired hotel with awesome cityscape views.............
.......then try the ................Mandarin Oriental New York.............Asian Elegance.

title: La experiencia haciéndote sentir en casa
text:
Servicio excepcional comida genial atención personalizada las habitaciones geniales la vista de skilinesuite wuauuu
Todo es genial los regalos así como los detalles de bienvenida así como sus amenidades son geniales el árbol ti tipi los chocolates ñas fotos de mi familia wuauuu

title: WEEK-END A NEW-YORK
text:
Très bon hôtel avec un emplacement de rêve.

Certains détails reste cependant à régler.

Personne par exemple ne nous a aidé à monter nos bagages et nous aurions aimé une visite plus personnalisé de l'hôtel...

title: Amazing Views
text: Stayed here for the weekend with my daughter while in town for the Mitski concert at Rockefeller center. The room is small but is beautifully decorated. There is a direct entrance into the mall but the mall is pretty disappointing.  Excellent sushi restaurant around the corner. In room dining for late night snacks was excellent.  We had breakfast at the restaurant with an amazing view of Central Park.

title: Disappointed by garlic
text:
A great venue. Superb views of Columbus Circle and Central Park. 
But  a special occasion spoilt by overly garlicky risotto no garlic free option. Discussed with waiter and reported to Management - no response - probably couldn't care less !

title: Phenomenal experience
text: 10 out of 10! I was greeted and welcomed by Andrez who made sure that my stay was exceptionally well. Anything that was needed was a call away and the concierge offered great suggestions throughout the city. My stay at MONYC is always an incredible experience.

title: Not worth the price (even for NYC)
text:
Tired property in need of update and an actual bar. They have a lounge filled with screaming kids running around and no actual adult bar area. 

The rooms are a good size for NYC but have no modern amenities. No USB outlets and the TV has connectors from the 90’s

title: Stayed for a month, didn’t want to leave
text: Great place to stay, classic MO exceptional service. Central Park facing rooms are the obvious recommendation, you can’t go wrong! Location is great, with the convenience of everything in Columbus Circle being so easily accessible as well.

title: Breathtaking views
text: Elegant surroundings, beautiful views and dedicated staff made for a great stay.  The lounge bar/restaurant also has great views and a good menu.  Opting for a room overlooking Central Park on a high floor is well worth it.

title: None
text:
The location was great. 

I have stayed at your Mandarin Boston, Tokyo (many times), Milan and Lake Como very recently. The Mandarin NYC was not close to the Mandarin standard that I experienced in the other places. The room was dated. No coffee machine. There hotel has no bar (but the hotel signs say "bar" everywhere), and the "restaurant" has a limited menu. So to have drinks or to eat we went out after the 1st day, even for breakfast. So overall, just not a good vibe and the hotel needs work.

title: None
text: love my suite views in the 43 floor, right on the heart of central park and buildings, great location , my suite with two rooms wasn't what I expect ,need a mayor upgrade in this expensive suite ,I hope next time they work on it

title: Séjour décevant..
text:
La présentation de l'hotel est très bonne sur le site web mais l'hotel est plutôt décevant pour un MO.
Je connais bien celui de Paris où j'ai déja sejournée et où je vais souvent diner cher Thierry Marx, le standing est un cran au dessus. Les chambres du MO NY sont petites et les équipements dérisoires : frigo bruyant, pas de machine à café dans la chambre..) Les services de concierges sont très moyennes, j'ai dû relancer à plusieurs reprises pour obtenir une réponse à une question, je n'ai parfois même pas eu de réponse lorsque j'ai demandé une réservation au restaurant du Sofitel NY..
