title: Great Hotel Great Location
text:
My wife and I really enjoyed our visit - the staff were all very friendly and service orientated. Was a little surprised to see you now  have only 1 all day bar / restaurant ........... that said it is a great spot !! Great food and beverages and top service with an Amazing view
The in room amenities are great. Maid knocks on door a little early on a Sunday morning - FYI - understand she need to clean the room however maybe there is another way to organize  
We will be back

title: None
text: I really didn’t care for the bar/restaurant combination.  I prefer to have a separate bar area.  I also thought the bourbon selection was quite limited.  I thought my room was rather dated as well.  I thought the staff was professional.

title: One of New York's top hotels!
text:
The Mandarin Oriental in New York is one of the city's preeminent hotels.  

Overall, the service level is outstanding with many of the staff attentive and professional, as one would expect from the Mandarin Oriental.  I had check-in late, and the check-in staff pointed out there was a WholeFoods downstairs in case I wanted something.  She must of known clearly I was not keen on a huge meal.  Nicely done!   The service staff at the cafe were funny, cherry and attentive - as you would expect having breakfast.  The doormen were super great.  I was wondering if I could get a table at one of the bars in the shopping mall upstairs.  They immediately called the concierge upstairs to check for me.  It was much appreciated.

The hotel is conveniently located at Columbus Circle, which is a huge plus for any runner.  Just cross the street, and viola!, you are in Central Park.  Plus, during cold spells, it is super nice to simply take the elevator down to the enclosed California-style shopping mall.  Some may argue this feature isn't a plus, but given the choice of braving the cold and wind, or simply going downstairs, I'd prefer going downstairs.  Also, a huge benefit is the WholeFoods located in the lower ground floor.  After a long flight, it's nice to be able to grab a salad.  The gym itself is well-maintained with modern equipment, and again, the staff managing the gym were excellent.  

The cafe offers a wonderful, tip-top view of Central Park, Central Park South, and the buildings on the Upper East Side.  Make sure to get a seat at the window.  I always looked forward to the breakfast, which not many restaurants get right.  The toast was always adequately crispy and the eggs at the right consistency.  The chef naturally took pride in his/her work.  The one small issue is that the cafe only opens at 7:00AM.  It would have been great to have opened a bit earlier.  I noticed three guests, including myself, all waiting.

A sign of a great hotel is the staff's attention to details.  The Mandarin is fantastic about the details, without a doubt.  A great example - the complimentary coffee stand in the morning.  As a business traveler, it's so nice to grab a quick coffee and go. The gym offered fresh fruits, which is nice after a workout.  

One small issue was when I was checking in the staff didn't automatically realise I was a registered member of the Mandarin's loyalty program.  This was important because members get a complimentary voucher that can be used at the cafe.  I almost missed the fact I was entitled to this benefit.  I was staying 7 days, so the voucher was in particular valuable.   And then again, when I was checking out, the staff had not recorded I was entitled to the voucher, so had to ask them to correct the final invoice.  Normally, I wouldn't have to check on these things.  

Also, to access the wi-fi, I had to have an account set up.  This was a bit annoying trying to figure it out.  Finally, I had to call the front desk and they promptly gave me the code. Normally, it's just one's room number and surname.  But it wasn't the case.  Adding this extra complexity is slightly weird.  But overall, these are trivial compared to the excellent experience I had.

title: None
text: great location, easy check in/out, prompt valet service, great food and drinks. walking distance to Lincoln Center is a definite plus. We always stay here when we have tickets to the MET. Feel safe in this hotel.

title: A Very Special NYC Hotel
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Mandarin Oriental New York very much.  From our check-in to check-out, the service was excellent, always courteous, friendly and helpful.  Our room had a wonderful view of Central Park and the unique midtown skyline. The small touches including a birthday cake and wine for my wife made our stay even more special.  And our experience at the Mandarin Spa was exceptional.  We had a magnificent and memorable stay at the Mandarin Oriental New York, just as we have had in all the other Mandarin hotels that we have stayed in around the world. Thank you!

title: Need updates inside and out.
text:
I have stayed in many of mandarin oriental hotels including the old one in Hong Kong, as well as the ones managed by mandarin hotel such as palace hotel is Abu Dhabi. I always have pretty good impression about this hotel chain. We even got married in one.  

Recently, we stayed at this one for our special event. I have emailed and called to set up something nice weeks before we check in. However, when we checked, nothing was setup. And the room smells like there was a dead cat there before. There is no water or anything we requested there.

We called to request changing room. Finally we got a another room which looked like a reasonable hotel room late night, needless to say it put negative vibe on our experience. 

The deco of the hotel and rooms are from 1980s.  Everything screams for new updates. The bed is also small, looks like queens size, even we booked King bed.  

We booked central park view room, however, there obstructed view of central park( Trump tower right on your face). 

Spa is decent and they have good skills.  This is probably the positive experience during our stay. 

One can argue this is New York.  You often pay more for less.  Giving the rising safety issues everywhere in nyc, I don't think it justifies the price they charge with the room they have.

Service is so so at best. 

More importantly, this is the worst hotel we have stayed in this chain.

I don't recommend this hotel unless you have business nearby. It tarnishes the hotel chain brand.  I think this hotel desperately need updates.

title: New Favorite NYC Hotel
text:
Great stay over the Columbus day weekend.  Room was comfortable, sparkling clean, and featured a great view of Central Park.  What makes the MO in NYC most special is the friendly, competent and caring people in every corner of the operation.
Very quiet for an NYC hotel as the rooms start at the 37th floor.  Stunningly expensive but worth the premium over its competitors.

title: Melhor vista e melhor localização de Nova York
text:
A localização é simplesmente fantástica, em frente ao Central Park e perto o suficiente do "buchicho" porém longe o bastante para a agitação não incomodar. Adorei o fato de estar coladinho no Shopping Center (e no Whole Foods!!). O MO New York é mais do que estar bem localizado, a VISTA é impressionante, de qualquer lugar da propriedade! Nosso quarto tinha uma vista fabulosa do parque e dos prédios altos (no nascer do sol era UAU). A vista também era maravilhosa do restaurante e da piscina (super pôr do sol). 

Quarto espaçoso para os padrões de NY (Central Park View Room), com decoração sóbria e elegante. Banheiro grande, com banheira, ducha com box e toilette reservado, com portas. Pontos para as amenities de banho da marca francesa Diptyque e para os roupões aveludados. As crianças também receberam mini pantufinhas e mini roupões. E os pandinhas de pelúcia fizeram sucesso com os pequenos. 

Gostamos também do TURNDOWN SERVICE (que é aquela segunda arrumação do quarto). Abertura de cama, fechamento de cortinas, água cortesia e chocolatinho sobre a cama. 

Adoramos a piscina de raia, com mais de 20 metros. Deu para relaxar depois de dias agitados na cidade!! Valeu.

title: Unique à New York
text:
Exceptionnel ! Et au pied de Central Park
Luxueux 
Piscine au sommet de l’hôtel

Excellente situation 
Chambres hyper confortables avec vue sur Central Park
Excellent rapport qualité prix 
Pour un séjour inoubliable à New York, descendez dans ce palais

title: My Go to New York Hotel !
text:
Thank you for another wonderful stay at the Mandarin Oriental New York. 
Honestly a perfect stay - I appreciate the really large rooms and bathrooms (rare in Manhattan) and the wonderful service ! Views of Central Park or the Hudson River are fabulous !
This time my airline lost my luggage and the concierge staff couldn't do enough. They kept in constant communication with the airport and myself, they kept totally on top of it and succeeded in getting my case delivered to them at the hotel and returned to me ! The staff are all great and offer a very personal service which I really love !
We will most certainly be back - wouldn't stay anywhere else !

title: Great location, fantastic concierge team
text: The concierge team were amazing, they managed to get me tickets to the best shows and were always super helpful. The rooms are a good size (for NY) and the view of central park was excellent. Ask for a floor higher than 40 to appreciate the best view.

title: High and Mightly
text: We absolutely LOVED our experience at the Mandarin Oriental.  The location in New York City can't be beat.  It is directly on Columbus Circle right across the street from the beautiful Central Park and just a few blocks from Broadway and Times Square.  The hotel doesn't even begin til the 35th floor so the views from the lobby and every room are stunning.  It is an oasis in the center of the city.  We found the rooms to be luxurious and clean and all the staff was helpful and friendly.  The beds were comfortable and we noticed no noise at all in the halls or surrounding rooms.  Bathrooms were well appointed and meticulously clean.  Loved every second there and would highly recommend it.

title: One of the best hotels in the world
text: We stayed for 5 nights at the Madarin Oriental and I can tell you that the entire stay was amazing. The staff is spectacular. Every single person that we dealt with was kind and efficient and helpful. From the Bellmen to the front desk to the concierge to the maitre d of MO Lounge, everyone was great. I can not remember having a more amazing experience at a hotel. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in Columbus Circle and be at one of the great hotels in the world.

title: La chiusura perfetta del nostro viaggio di nozze
text: Era la parte finale del nostro viaggio di nozze ed abbiamo apprezzato la cura e la gentilezza con cui siamo stati trattati con un upgrade che ha reso tutto davvero speciale. Pulizia quotidiana delle camere e disponibilità del personale hanno reso tutto eccellente con una vista dal piano 54 che è semplicemente unica.

title: None
text:
Our stay at the MandarinOriental  New York  was based on a 100th Birthday celebration for
My Mom and it was all I could have hoped for. Everyone was so accommodating and we were given
a wonderful room on the 54th floor with a beautiful view. 
I used the swimming pool which was a great way to start the day and when I returned to
the room my husband had a mostly healthy and delicious breakfast ordered from Room Service.
We would return to this hotel again if we did not already have an apartment in NYC, but as it happens it was a wonderful treat.
We have stayed in several Mandarin Oriental Hotels, including Barcelona ,Chiangmai. And Hong Kong. Our favorite is my second home in Bangkok. We are fans.

title: Meeting Friends for Dinner & a Show
text: It was a brief but wonderful stay at this lovely hotel. The room was well appointed and clean with a great view.  Nice touches throughout.  My stay was brief and I hope for a longer visit next time.  Every colleague encountered was friendly and helpful.

title: they could have been perfect
text: I am a frequent traveller and as friend and fan guest I would expect a more empathic service. The receptionist at the check in failed in telling me the amount of authorization taken for the incidentals and mislead me about the charges for breakfast ( explaining to me that it was the same price if I had opted out to have in the room). Next day I discovered that there was a charge for room service and I had to ask an allowance on the bill. It looked like the receptionist was rushing in her task. Excellent the knowledge of the concierge( the lady with blond hair) who gave us very good tips on how to move around New York and good recommendation for restaurant in the city. Housekeeping was prompt in her service along with valet service.

title: It’s all about the view
text:
The rooms are nice, but a little tired. There is only a single bar/restaurant/facility in the hotel. It doubles as everything. Breakfast was ok, but nothing to write home about. The best part of the stay was concierge who were exceptional. They really went above and beyond for me. 
The view was also priceless.

title: Grande albergo
text: Abbiamo soggiornato qui per ben otto notti. L’hotel, nel cuore di Manhattan, è splendido. Sala ristorante con vista impagabile su  central park. Camera molto bella con vista sul fiume  hudson . Servizio  eccellente, cinque stelle meritate.

title: Awesome hotel and one of best locations in New York
text:
We have vacated in Mandarin Oriental hotels all over the world so we had high expectations from this wonderful brand. The New York property delivered on every level - located next to Central Park in a quiet part of the city all the staff were exemplary and so welcoming. 

On arrival we had some true personal touches made to the room which were so thoughtful and appreciated by all the family. The staff could not do enough to ensure the stay was so memorable 

The views are stunning over Central Park or the river and the rooms are well appointed, clean and well maintained 

We looked closely at many 5 star hotels in the city to deliver what we expect and chose this property and in my mind it was truly a great experience  and I would highly recommend for your New York stay

title: A short but memorable stay.
text: This was our first stay in the NY MO and we were really pleased. Most of all by the consistently high level of service from most every member of staff we interacted with. The reception team worked with us to secure a late check out, the MO lounge team were very friendly, the concierge found us a good restaurant and got us a table. The breakfast was delivered promptly by a friendly team member, the reception team at the SPA were great. Many staff seemed to have worked for a long time and like their jobs. I appreciated the offer of a hotel car for short journeys.  Our meal in the MO lounge was good as was our room service breakfast. Bed was comfortable.  The room was nice although a tired. When we arrived it was clean expect for some hair in the bathroom. Overall a great experience and I will come back. I hope the new owner keeps the team onside and perhaps invests a bit in upkeep for a lovely hotel.

title: Tired but still above average
text: The mandarin oriental NY used to be my favourite hotel in NY. It is located in a very convenient area for me. It being very close to the park and having access to the shopping centre made it very easy for me. I stayed here again after a number of years and have noticed that the hotel looks quite tired. I think small renovations were done some years ago but nothing that hides the age of the rooms. The furniture is all scratched and dented. You essentially just pay for the location and name. Service was generally friendly. There were some issues like the luggage taking close to an hour to arrive at the room but for NY standards it was handled rather friendly and apologetic.

title: Perfect for NY holiday
text:
Perfect for NY holiday! Is near Central Park.
Good location, good service, food is one of the best ( if you don't care a good brekfast for 2 person cost 200 usd).
I will come back here.
If you come ask for a room with view on Central Park.
Thank you!

title: My Top Hotel In New York
text: Absolutely amazing hotel. The room, staff and all amenities were top notch! The view from the 49th floor looking south downtown and the Hudson River were incredible. The only hotel I will be staying when I'm in New York!

title: Royal Stay
text:
One of the best experience ever in a hotel. Outstanding service! 
You are in the heart of NYC, you can go for a jog in central park, walk to your Broadway Show and shop in walking distance. 
From Dyptique products to the latest amenities, design, location, interior decor everything is top notch!
Personals, concierges, waiters all will makes you feel like you are home and makes you feel like a royal!

title: Perfekter Aufenthalt
text: Wir haben 9 wunderbare Tage im MO NYC verbracht. Die Freundlichkeit und Professionalität des gesamten Personals sind besonders zu betonen. Das Hotel ist an perfekter Lage, die Zimmer sind sehr schön und grosszügig (vor allem die Badezimmer). Eine willkommene Abkühlung von der Sommerhitze bietet der 25M Pool. Die MO Lounge im 35. Stock hat eine tolle Aussicht auch die Stadt und den Central Park. Die Preise für Getränke und Speisen sind m.E. trotz Lage und Haus zu teuer ($ 14 für Kaffee).

title: None
text: Exceptional stay.  The staff was very friendly and immediate service was quite impressive.  Thanks for the opportunity to stay at your facility.  I will be looking for your hotel upon my next stay and in different countries.

title: Ok
text: A little dated but ok. Too many attempts to overly monetize, e.g. basic internet. Good cleaning throughout day. Too pricey in restaurant (sorry). Ok gym, but still not excellent. Great and welcoming staff..........

title: The best stay soo far.
text:
From the room, service and hospitality everything was amazing.
Restaurant with amazing view, spa, bell
Boys, fitness club very welcoming, i booked through amex platinum and it was worth every single penny,
One of the best part is the location which is at central park, many great historic restaurants like russian tea room and others around there.
Subway is just next to the hotel so you can go to any place in new york, 15mins walk from time square, breaksfast service was amazing its always fast and delicious.
Not to forget evening turn down service and instant chat through guest services through the phone system very convineant.

title: Oasis in hot crowded NYC
text: Excellent service at lovely hotel. Premier location. Enjoyable breakfast with sweeping views. Pleasantly surprised with level of service at spa, dining and housekeeping post pandemic, compared to other hotels that have seemed to give up on top notch service. Looking forward to another stay on our next trip to NYC!

title: Summer trip
text: Amazing stay at the M.O. in NYC. From room, to restaurant, to service; all top notch. We are already planning our next vacation at another location! In the heart of NYC right off Columbus Circle is a must visit.

title: Surprising luxurious Mandarin Oriental NY
text: We stayed 5 nights at the Mandarin Oriental New York as the last part to our honeymoon trip to NYC and this property amazed me, Valeria checked us in and made sure we had everything we needed from the first moment, they pay attention to every detail, we had a lovely room with a Hudson view, beautifully appointed, turn down service was my favorite part, they make everything perfect for a good night of sleep, I have to mention Carmen at the fitness center, she’s super nice and makes sure you have everything you need, also Jonathan was very attentive to my requests - a big thank you! And I also have to mention Elsa at the MO lounge, it was a pleasure to see her every morning there! I’m so looking forward to come back to the city and stay at this wonderful property, close to everything you might need (The shops at Colombus Circle are downstairs - Whole Foods, pharmacies, Central Park, what else can you ask for)?

title: Mandarin
text: Excelente hotel, el personal muy amable y servicial. 100 recomendado. La ubicación es de lo mejor, muy accesible a muchos lugares, restaurantes. A un paso del parque central y con un centro comercial al lado del hotel que hace más fácil la estadía.

title: MO NYC not at the level of MO HKG
text:
MO NYC is fine, but I can’t say it is up to the traditional standard of MO HKG and other MO around the world that I have experienced.

Staff are friendly, but still lacking the experience that makes MO special.  

Rooms are outdated and really need an upgrade.

Saying this, I think the overall standard of services in hotels in USA has gone down.  Thus, may not be the MO brand.

title: Take the hassle out of your visit by booking your room at the Mandarin Oriental.
text:
There’s so much potential stress with travel at the moment that you can alleviate one possible source by letting the team at the M. O. NY attend to your every whim. 

Fantastic location. Gracious service. Comfortable and cozy room. They go out of their way to make your stay memorable!

title: Atemberaubender Blick!  Erstklassige Lage!
text:
Wir haben uns sehr wohl im Mandarin Oriental NY gefühlt, obwohl wir vom Eingang anfangs erschrocken waren, da wir im Erdgeschoss eine repräsentative Rezeption erwartet hatten. Es fühlt sich an wie eine Bahnhofshalle. Blumenschmuck und Ausstattung etwas dürftig - wir wußten ja nicht, dass uns die eigentliche, repräsentative  Rezeption im 34.? Stockwerk erwartete. Die Mitarbeiter an der Rezeption waren sehr kundenorientiert und professionell. Das Zimmer war immer sauber, frisches Obst und täglich Wasser prima. Der Zimmer- und Reinigungsservice war stets freundlich und hilfsbereit. Ein Highlight war das Schwimmbad in der 35? Etage. Schon cool, wenn man beim Schwimmen an den Wolkenkratzern vorbei zieht...  Das Pool-Personal war super-freundlich! Abzüge gibt es für die etwas altbackene Ausstattung der Zimmer. Eine grundlegende Renovierung und moderne Einrichtung mit zweckmäßiger Ausstattung für die Unterbringung der Sachen wären wünschenswert und angebracht.  Ebenso wie eine Auswahl deutschsprachiger Fernsehsender. 
Aber unbezahlbar war die erstklassige Lage mit dem Blick auf den Central Park, Columbus Circle und die Skyline von New York.  Sehr cool!

title: Summer return
text: We visited in the winter and were interested in seeing it in the summer. The rooms were good size and clean, the staff were friendly, diligent and helpful. Restaurant was excellent with great views over the park and City. A little over priced.

title: Recommend
text: I definitely recommend mandarin hotel for anybody that wants to stay at a high-end hotel in Manhattan. I spend every weekend at a different upscale hotel and Mandarin Oriental hotel definitely meets your expectations. However, there are a few people that exceed your expectations by going out of their way to make you feel special. Bill at the concierge and the two Daniel’s, one at reception and the other at the restaurant; Najel the mesuse and Jonathan at the gym or among some of those people. Another fact that is expected but is always nice to hear is that most of their staff have stayed with them since they open in 2003 which shows that this hotel chain at their foundation know how to treat people well.

title: None
text: Zimmer, Fitnessbereich und Service waren sehr gut. Einzig die Qualität des Essens im Bar-Restaurant war mäßig und dem Preis nicht angemessen. Für New-Yorker Verhältnisse sicher ein sehr gutes Hotel. Highlights sind die Lage am Central Park und das Schwimmbad im 36. Stock mit 25m-Becken.

title: Top hotel does not provide good experience
text:
1, Booked a $3,100+ suite to celebrate birthday on 6/14/2022,  pre checked a complimentary Welcome Treat, hoping the best experience at this top hotel. Checked in at 3:30 pm, did not see any Welcome Treat when enter the suite. Waited for 1hr, no one delivered anything. Called the front desk was told they need time to prepare something. Waited another 1/2 hr, finally came a bottle of Sonoma County red wine, one small cake and one singed card. The treat was good, but if was delivered within 1/2 hr of my arrival,  I would feel much better. After all was it all about feeling and experience? 

2, As soon as I was ready to pore the wine, I found there were three disgusting finger prints on the body of one of glasses. Either  the glass were never been cleaned properly, or the service people just handled without any care, anyway both were not acceptable. I did both to drink the wine.

3, I searched whole suite did not find coffee machine. Called house keeping was told due to Covid there was no coffee machine, but they could sent one to room. 20mins later machine showed up, but there was no coffee pods, it took anther 20mins for service to bring all the rest. 

4, On second morning ordered in- room breakfast, the omelet egg wrap was 1/2" thick and taste rubbery, theres was no cheese although I ordered Swiss, the filling was so little compare the size of the omelet.  Scrambled egg again taste like made by McDonald. Were all the egg made by machine?

5, Breakfast came with coffee and cream, but they sent heavy cream, have to call them and resent the correct one. Who use heavy cream with coffee? How would they make such mistake?

Your name is on top of the food chain, and you are not shy to charge us at premium, and we expect the ultimate experience, but you're far away from meeting such experience. Shame on you!

title: A visit to remember!
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room was spacious and cozy. The view of the Central Park and the high rises in the distance was breathtaking! Yarisol at the front desk was genuinely kind and patient in answering all our questions. She made a great suggestion about the pool and  we are so happy she mentioned it. My child loved it! We wish the pool hours were a little longer. This is the best way to relax after a long day of sightseeing. Thank you MO!

title: When in New York….
text:
…Great stay at MO NYC! Was in town for a brief 3 night stay in June.
Service and location are simply best in town. What a view. I’ll definitely be back.
The pool is amazing, I wish I have had more time.

title: Vue extraordinaire
text:
Premier séjour dans un hôtel du Groupe Mandarin. Nous avons été ravis de la gentillesse et du professionnalisme des employés. La vue de notre chambre sur Central Park était à couper le souffle, néanmoins la chambre et l'hôtel en lui même commence à être vieillissant... c'est dommage.
Nous recommandons néanmoins cet hôtel.

title: How Covid is affecting everyhting…
text:
The Mandarine Oriental was a splendid hotel. But I went to it in Tokyo and in Shanghai, never in New York. Also I went to the one in Panama.
The room was not wonderful. Curtains and carpets not cleaned enough, I mean truly, laundered and machine washed. They have a policy now where no tea or coffee service, nor amenities like cream, shampoo in little bottles but a “communal” shampoo bottle is in the shower. 
Room service, poor. We loved the cod with miso, but the rest was mediocre. Extra salted spinach for the eggs Florentine, and sad breakfast potatoes. 
The room was noisy. We had people screaming in the corridor , this can happen in any hotel, but the proximity of the door made it problematic. 
We spoke to the manager, he recognized they have issues in the hotel, but you do not see this explained in their advertisement. That is why, people, come to read reviews! Write reviews! It is fundamental! 
Extremely expensive food. Too the point of insulting, I must say.
Last time here.

title: Birthday celebration
text: We really enjoyed our short stay for my daughter's 26th birthday.  The staff really made it special for us.  We will definitely be returning hopefully for a longer stay to fully enjoy the amenities the hotel has to offer.  Everyone of the staff we encountered were very pleasant and  helpful.  Thank you so much for ensuring we had a wonderful time.

title: Excellent customer service
text: Excellent customer service from the front desk to concierge and room service.  Hotel is right in front of Central Park, several subway stations if you plan to catch one, they don’t have an airport shuttle but they do offer transportation if you have a dinner reservation, show or special event to attend.

title: Excellent staff room is ok
text:
The only reason I will give the hotel a 3 star is because we had a reservation confirm for 2 adults and we ended in a bedroom with two twins beds. At the time of check in they offered us two beds and we gladly accept it but the lady didn’t mention the size of the beds. 
So to our surprise this is the room we got see pictures attach. 
Glad we were staying only two nights with a busy schedule so we didn’t even spent time too much time in the room.
I am wondering if that’s why they don’t advertise two beds room in their website but only king beds.  Besides that customer service and room service is really great as well as location and views.

title: Overall very good but just off usual deluxe service
text: Excellent front office and concierge staff and outstanding house keeping. No help or care from door staff at all no help with bags on arrival or departure and breakfast could be better. Spa also closed for some days not helpful

title: Great Stay!!
text:
We enjoyed a wonderful stay here - registration is on the 36th floor and our room was on the 41st floor overlooking Central Park. Stunning views!! Spacious room and bathroom with tub and shower. Location is fantastic for sightseeing. I enjoyed being able to swim every morning in the pool too! 

Staff were all fantastic! Front desk, room service, luggage assistance, and valet parking staff. Everyone was friendly and helpful!

We enjoyed the in-room dining an had breakfast delivered each morning. We even had a couple dinners in-room and enjoyed private dining with our stellar view! Loved the food!!

title: None better!
text: Everyone was amazing -- from the bellmen to the front desk staff to the MO Lounge team!  They were accommodating, friendly, and made our whole family feel warm and welcome.  The housekeeping and in-room dining staff were also great.  We were lucky enough to have been assigned rooms overlooking Central Park, and having that view helped make our trip even more memorable.  We can't wait to return and experience the hospitality of the Mandarin Oriental NY again.

title: None
text: Simply amazing! From check-in, to the fantastic suite, customer serice when I needed a ice bucket. Views are breathraking and very spacious. Front desk agent thats from the DR is so personable and professional!

title: Nowhere better!!!
text:
Great location, amazing views and impeccable service!  

We will stay at MO again for sure- our new favorite NYC hotel.  Walk in Central Park every morning right out the door, walk to Broadway, great restaurants at your doorstep and the staff are extremely courteous, attentive and professional.

title: Top location, good service, but...
None
text: Excellent service and environment at the NY hotel. The experience in Front Desk and Room Service was great.  The food and beverages at the restaurant was delicious, also the food deliver to our room. Would love to come back!!!

title: None
text: Excelente hotel ! Muy buena la estadía en general y el personal muy amable. La habitación tenia un poco de ruido y no fue posible que nos dieran una hora más tardepara el checkout. De resto todo muy bien, la verdad.

title: Keine 5-Sterne
text:
Positiv zu vermelden ist die gute Lage des Hotels und die Aussicht (insbesondere in den Etagen > 50).  Außerdem verfügt das Hotel über einen Fitnessbereich mit einem relativ großen Pool mit Blick auf den Hudson River.

Ansonsten ist die Ausstattung deutlich in die Jahre gekommen (sowohl in den Zimmern als auch in den öffentlichen Bereichen). Auf den Zimmern lediglich ein lauter Kühlschrank - kein Expresso-/ Teeangebot.

Im Restaurant vertraut man allein auf die Central-Park Aussicht (Tische sind nicht eingedeckt,  das à la Carte Frühstück ist anspruchslos und stark überteuert ). Aufgrund der Frühstückserfahrung haben wir uns dort weitere Speisen gespart).

title: DID NOT meet expectations!
text:
DID NOT meet expectations! 
We expected a certain level of Luxury and organization at this price point.
The bed in our room was not comfortable, however we enjoyed the view and we enjoyed the tub. The bath salt was a nice touch. 
In room coffee: Since I did not like the coffee in the restaurant we would drink the coffee in our room one day the coffee was not restock when we called we were told we had to pay, since we were limited to coffee pods (I wish that was clearly stated before we booked the room)!  I had never heard of that at any price point hotel and every month we stay at a hotel. The person told us if we wanted more coffee pods we would be charged!  However she send us more pods but going forward we would be limited. 
The mini bar: Each day we were changed for taking an item from the mini bar when we did not.   It was removed but it was annoying to keep asking for it to be resolved.
Restaurant great view however service was lacking we kept getting the wrong bill and one time I was changed $5 for hot water. However we loved the  waiter John (or maybe it was Jack) a very nice Filipino man was an excellent server he was very helpful in telling us about the history of the Hotel and the building and the area. We met him before we checked in.  He was knowledgeable about the theater.  He always had a very welcoming smile and very engaging.  When we went back we kept asking for him but he was so busy several people kept asking for him.  He did come over to our table to say hello and made us feel very special on our last day.

I would not recommend the Mandarin New York at this time, we were planning to visit the Boston location later this year but due to our experience in New York we are not sure.

title: NIEMALS MEHR- Ein Albtraum!!!!
text:
Eine absolute Katastrophe von A-Z!
Alte winzige Zimmer... Für die Nutzung der Dusche mussten wir den Techniker rufen...mehrfach die Duscharmatur oder den Lichtschalter in der Hand gehabt, da völlig veraltet... Keinerlei Willkommens Goodies, weder für uns noch für die Kinder. Nach einer Beschwerde beim GM meldete sich dieser prompt (das war das Einzige was funktionierte), entschuldigte sich und versprach kleine Aufmerksamkeiten am nächsten Tag... diese kamen leider nie an.. Auch habe ich wiederholt nach einem MO Teddy, der standardmässig in allen MO Hotels an die Kinder verschenkt wird bzw. auf dem Bett auf die Kinder wartet, gefragt... Leider hat das Hotels es trotz 3!Nachfragen in 5 Tagen nicht geschafft meiner Tochter einen aufs Zimmer zu senden, während sämtliche anderen Kinder damit rumliefen....Eine Kaffeemaschine gab es natürlich auch nicht auf den Zimmern... Der Oberknaller war jedoch, dass wir die Zimmer mit Frühstück gebucht hatten und am Ende für 5 Tage über 500 Dollar für das Frühstück zahlen mussten...Für uns heisst Frühstück inklusive das alles inklusive ist bzw. man uns mitteilt, wenn etwas extra kostet... Dies erfuhren wir im MO am Abreisetag mit einer dicken Rechnung. Continental Breakfast inkludiert heisst dass 35 Dollar pro Zimmer verrechnet werden...Ein Espresso kostet schon 12 Dollar...Wir sind es gewohnt üppig zu frühstücken und erwarten in der Luxushotellerie auch ein Luxus- Frühstück... Dies ist hier anders. Ach und einfach morgens aufstehen und frühstücken geht hier auch nicht... Am ersten Morgen fragte man uns , ob wir reserviert hätten, denn man könne nur mit einer Reservierung frühstücken... da wir das nicht wussten und uns natürlich auch niemand informiert hat, mussten wir dann 15 Minuten warten...Auch das habe ich noch nirgends erlebt.. Im Urlaub den Wecker stellen, um zur Frühstücksreservierung zu eilen...Ein Restaurant gibt es im MONYC übrigens auch nicht mehr..auch das wussten wir nicht, da es in den Reisekatalogen noch überall aufgeführt war... Wir sind absolute Multi und Luxus-Traveller und so etwas haben wir weltweit noch nicht erlebt!!!!!!!Auch waren wir zB vom MO Dubai sehr angetan und dort funktionierte alles. Jedoch werden wir nach dieser Erfahrung freiwillig kein MO Hotel mehr buchen. So etwas habe ich in einem 4Seasons oder One and only noch nie erlebt...
Ich kann jedem nur dringend abraten das MONY zu besuchen.... Ein Kellner teilte uns mit, dass es wohl verkauft wurde und deshalb alles im "Schwebezustand" sei... Gehen Sie lieber ins Park Hyatt, Langham, St. Regis, Peninsula-aber nicht hierher...Nicht nur dass das Geld weggeschmissen ist, es hat uns die letzten 5 tage unseres Urlaubs richtig versaut!!!!

title: None
text:
Great Culture. Hotel is a bit hurting on room quality, service and cleanliness.

I have had many great stays at this property. This time was not one of them.
We find each time we go that one more thing is no longer offered, one more service has been cut.
The room service menu is weak at best. We called for turn down service and no one showed up, this happened TWICE.
The next day we called for maid service and they did everything except remove our room service cart.
The rooms are really, really tired, down right beat up. 

I am sorry I wish I had better things to say.

title: Not measuring up to 5 Stars
text:
The Positives: The views are amazing. The valet, desk staff and room service were all friendly and pleasant.  The location grants access to shopping, popular sites, and restaurants. The room and bathroom was spacious.
The Negatives: Cold dinner, Slow Service in the Lounge, Room in need of repairs.
We were refunded our meal and offers were made to make repairs in the room.  Shampoo and Conditioner dispensers were empty upon arrival. 
The experience was not indicative of a 5 star hotel.

title: Missed the Mark
text: Long wait for food in lounge and room service. Room service meal was cold after waiting an hour. Second order came through got another hour later. Unacceptable. Shampoo and conditioner dispensers were empty. Blinds were barely functional. Staff was friendly and we were comped for missteps but the overall experience was frustrating and disappointing. We won’t be returning.

title: The Mattress
text:
We splurged on this property and were very happy with the location and staff- excellent. We were in a Premier Central Park view room and were very happy with the size of the room, the bathroom, the decor and the views.

But there was a serious drawback: the mattress was awful!!  Like nothing we've experienced anywhere in recent memory. Moderate and budget priced chains all have better mattresses than the one at the MO!

There was a very hard (almost metal-like in its rigidity) edge guard which dug into your thighs if you tried to sit on the side even momentarily. The mattress was also too firm and generally uncomfortable. It felt cheap and worn out. I asked the front desk if housekeeping could do something- a topper might've been added- couldn't tell for sure but it wasn't much improved. Just to be clear, we aren't fans either of massive amounts of memory foam or feather toppers- we want a reasonable mattress.

Until the MO replaces their mattresses , we'll continue our search for a hotel in a convenient location during our frequent trips to the city.

title: None
text:
Everything was amazing! the food, massages and people there is really nice.
It was our honeymoon so they left us presents in our room.
We really enjoy our stay and we are definitely going back soon!!!

title: Top notch
text:
Always the best place to stay. 
Room is top notch, staff is courteous.
We did room service for dinner. They were accomodating  by letting us order from both the regular menu and the 
restaurant. The steak was excellent, fries hot and great wine.
I couldn't want more from the MO

title: Estancia en Mandarin Oriental New York
text: Excelente en todos los sentidos. Exceptional service, very friendly staff, making us feel very special, they were anticipating our needs at any time. Big, luxury and beautiful rooms with amazing views. Great location. Big thanks to reception, concierge, restaurant and housekeeping team.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: Comfortable, relaxing and peaceful, exceeding my expectations.   Warm and helpful staff. The gym and pool were fully equipped and not crowded.  Bed turndown with chocolate a lovely touch.    Highly recommend.

title: Mo NYC the most disappointing we have stayed in.
text:
Sadly very underwhelming for an expensive MO.  Not worth the money and we actually cut our stay short and stayed at the Plaza instead.  Everything is a bit tired and scuffed. The room was functional and fine but again underwhelming for the price, just a bit shabby.  The bathroom was nice though.  As Fans of MO we were entitled to a room upgrade which we chose at booking online but on arrival we didn’t get this because the next grade was a suite which they wouldn’t allocate to us.
The Spa was closed still due to covid but the spa at Boston MO was open when we arrived there after NYC.  The swimming pool was disappointing to say the least but the staff poolside were wonderful.  Breakfast room just too small for the hotel and the staff struggled to cope with demand. The location is probably the best thing about the MO NYC

title: Brilliant experience & Best hospitality in NYC
text: Location Location!!! Attention to creating  best in class customer experience i NYC. We enjoyed every minute of our stay. Amazing some of the staff have been there since the day it opened. We shall return.

title: None
text: Great experience. Thank you. They arranged a small cake and 1/2 bottle of champagne for my birthday. Thank you again. Much appreciated. Its great when hotels do nightly turndown. They even put bottled water on each side of the bed with a glass. Very thoughtful

title: Not an option in NYC
text: Unlike other visits to Mandarin. Specially Madrid which is our favorite. NYCis not an option. Lobby is in floor 35. Restaurant to small rooms are small. Service not to the Mandarin standard. Bell service is good   For price better options in NYC.

title: Room For Improvements
text: Classified as a 5-star, but feels more like a nice 4-star. While the views of Central Park are amazing, there is plenty of room for improvement. I usually stay at the Ritz-Carlton near Central Park, a 5-star hotel, and I notice key differences in service. At a 5-star hotel I am usually asked the purpose of my visit in advance to aid in  personalizing my trip. In addition, my expectation when calling the front desk is to be greeted by my name. Neither of these happened during my visit. There is a turn down service  which is nice, but no treat or chocolate was left.  I was given two books but they were random and not specific to any of my interests. While I enjoyed my stay, I most likely will reserve at a true 5-star hotel for the service.

title: None
text: Excellent service. Would consider changing the check in time since the pool also closes at 4pm. That is paying for a service that you cannot use. I don't remember if the hotel allowed us to change the Fans of MO selections but if not they should.

title: Another wonderful MO property
text:
Fine service was expected and delivered. 
Beautiful stay at the hotel.
Everyone is happy to help and it shows.
The concierge was outstanding.  
The rooms were immaculate and well maintained. 
The spa offered a fantastic massage.

title: Yarisol
text:
Yarisol is great - helped us from our reservation stage to amending dates to our actual stay.
Great customer service and really ensured my client was well looked after my client. 
Will definitely recommend a stay here as the team are amazing

title: Best hotel in New York!
text: From the moment we entered the lobby, the Mandarin Oriental exceeded our expectations. We were offered tea to be delivered to our room, and it was simply marvelous. I also have to comment on the front desk staff. Every single one of them was so helpful and professional. We also had a late night drink in the restaurant bar area, and Ryan was so accommodating.

title: Absolute Perfection
text:
Initially planning on travel to Madrid but change in plans 2 weeks prior to travel so re routed to New York. Quickly researched hotels and wanted to stay close to where I had plans to dine and concerned about having to travel thru possible rain and snow. 

I cannot thank you enough for my stay. Peaceful and relaxing in the most spacious room. I slept so well. The view if the Hudson river, esp at sunset will not be forgotten. 

The room and hotel show no signs of age. A sophisticated elegance that stands the test of time. It was nice to meet one of the employees that had been with the hotel since its inception.

Another reason I decided to book at the Mandarin Oriental was for the pool. Perfect temperature and amazing one is able to swim laps without having to stop due to persons/toys blocking the lane. 

Feeling refreshed and revigorated  after my stay and I look forward to returning later this year, esp. since realizing the  Lincoln Center is walking distance.

title: Underwhelmed
text:
Underwhelmed.  Spa closed for majority of my stay.  Business Centre closed for no obvious reason.  Only one restaurant, very slow service, particularly at breakfast.   Room decor a little bit tired, although perfectly functional with a comfortable bed. 
Plus points were the location (which is great) and the helpful concierge team. 
Reception check out was disappointing - I was assured that the airport transfer was included in my bill, but was charged for this the following day (so reception just guessed the answer to my question rather than actually checking it); promised copy of my invoice by email did not follow until I chased it up later.  For the price, should have been better.

title: Great experience. Impeccable service
text: Wonderful experience. Everything you would expect from a first class brand. Impeccable service. The location is ideal for exploring the city with easy access to taxis and public transport. Mandarin Orientals are not cheap but you know that when you book and you get what you pay for.

title: True Customer Service
text: I was fortunate enough to stay at the Mandarin Oriental from 18 to 20 February 2022.  We were greeted immediately by the doorman, who quickly took our bags.  We were registered, ushered to our room within 10 minutes.  Our suite had bowls of fruit and bottles of spring water in each bedroom and living room.  When we ordered breakfast and coffee delivered to the room, it was delivered timely with all the accoutrements.  The staff is friendly and customer oriented.  The food in the cafe was delicious and well prepared.  I highly recommend this hotel and hope to return soon.

title: None
text: Excellent food although 1 dish i did not like.   For restaurant or other services i think you should automatically include the option for the tip in the stay.  option of 20-30%.    Service was excellent and accomodations was good.    Did not like the last night that the food was not removed but partially my fault.

title: None
text: Great time   Great Staff   We stayed 10th to the 13th of February and had the most amazing time. It was our first time visiting this hotel and we had originally planned to go to the Islands but changed destination at the last minute - it was the best decision we made!  The hotel is exceptionally clean, well maintained and Covid safe regarding the sanitation, mask wearing etc.  Our maid visited daily to change the towels, bedding and refill the fridge but you can change this if you wish.

title: Be careful at check out
text: The hotel has excellent location, good rooms. Overall we were satisfied with everything until check out. We were overcharged for mini bar and our breakfast bill. At the end we paid for items we didn’t take from minibar. No one ever replayed to our email to solve this problem.

title: Breathtaking Views
text: My wife and I stayed here back in November 2021 and we brought our 2 year old daughter with us. The staff is very attentive and I was impressed that the doorman proactively asked me if I wanted my Tesla charged overnight. The front desk agent presented my daughter with a teddy bear during check-in, and she still plays with it daily. Room service was high quality, the view from the room was great, and the staff were all friendly.

title: Ok but not good!
text: The low score is the result of the bad service we have received in the breakfast area. In general, the servers in the restaurant were not cheerful and smiling, unlike receptionists and the concierge. 1st day I asked for a side of pork sausage, it tasted like chicken, but they said it was pork when I asked. 2nd day, after a good 6-7 minutes wait to be seated, because there was no hostess to greet us, I asked for the same pork sausage as the side dish but what I received was a completely different sausage (in terms of shape and taste). The 2nd-day sausage was pork :). Also 2nd day, I ordered orange juice, and I never got it. When I asked about it at the end of the breakfast, they said its coming. But I canceled it. All these might sound like minor problems, but this is not Mandarin Oriental service. The reception people were great, and also the concierge staff was great—especially Tea.

title: Magical experience
text:
The hotel went out of their way to make our special occasion as memorable as possible. The room itself was immaculate and had excellent views overlooking Central Park.

All of the little extras included alongside the room also helped to set the hotel apart such as the celebratory treat of champagne and chocolate strawberries on arrival. We cannot thank the staff enough for our stay and we will definitely be back some point in the future.

title: All ok
text:
All ok but bar was a letdown. Room and staff excellent!. Worse hotels in NY but there are better…..great position near park and taxis easy to get.
Probably a good 4 star not a 5 star property. Bed, shower and room all superb. Not much more to say really!

title: Superb Hotel & Service
text: The quality of service was top notch given the staff shortage due to the inclement weather.  All hotel employees were professional and very courteous.  We felt like valued customers and will definitely stay at other Mandarin Oriental Hotels on our future trips.

title: A warm and elegant hotel during a blizzard.
text: We selected the Mandarin Oriental Hotel on Columbus Circle in New York because it is a fine hotel that is close to the Metropolitan Opera. We were there during a large snowstorm. The entrance and sidewalks were clear. The room had a lovely view of Central Park. Housekeeping was provided every night, which is sadly not the case at many properties. We had friends join us for a fine, unhurried breakfast on Sunday morning before leaving. Everything about the hotel was done correctly. On Saturday, because some staff would have had trouble getting in, managers assisted in the lounge, clearing tables and taking orders.

title: Best location in manhattam
text: Covid was taking over NYC and I barely felt like leaving the hotel. Love this place. It's a experience beyond a simple stay. Fantastic view of the Central Park (or Hudson River). Amazing SPA, great brunch also. The restaurant is very popular and is usually very crowded. Must be booked in advance. I can't wait to go back.

title: Great hotel!
text: Great hotel, location etc of course.  But the service is what separated this one from other 5 star hotels in the area. Robin at the front desk, Victor in tech and the woman who headed up in room dining (can’t remember her name) went over and above what was needed and is appreciated.

title: Oase of peace, Even if NY is not that hectic at the moment you feel like stepping into a different world upon entering
text:
First time in a Mandarin Oriental. Absolutely lives up to the expectations.
We had a room with a view on level 50 (5032) and this was more than stunning. 
beautiful hotel. 
great great view.
very peaceful.

title: Central Park View, Premier Suite
text:
It was great.  We are not fans of the Mandarin Oriental, or for that matter, chain hotels in general.  We had an absolutely horrid experience at the Miami Mandarin Oriental, and vowed that we would never darken Mandarin Oriental's doors again.  But we had come to New York to visit Per Se.  You can walk to Per Se without leaving the building, so it was just too convenient to say no.

From the time we walked in the door, the New York Mandarin started changing our minds.  A delightful young man, Andres, checked us in and showed us to our room.  I did not take pictures, because the pictures on the hotel’s website fairly depict the room, and it was as represented.

We booked this trip kind of last minute when Regent Cruise Lines cancelled a cruise and we were scrambling for something to do.  We got a reservation at Per Se and then constructed a little six day adventure from there.  We had three destination restaurants booked: Per Se, Marea, and Peter Lugar.  The concierge helped us fill-in the other three days.  But speaking of the concierge, we could not have asked for better advice than Joel gave us, both on getting tickets to shows, and restaurants that were convenient.

We can attest that the room is comfortable, because other than our Dinners, and two shows, we pretty much stayed in the room—it was in the teens for much of our stay.  Not that uncommon for us to do.  Order room service midmorning for breakfast, watch the market and trade till an early dinner, and then bed.  We have one major criticism of the room—no electric outlets are convenient to the large sofa in the living room.  We could not keep our laptops plugged-in while we worked.  But we worked around it.

Here is a great thing.  There is a Toto in the main bathroom.  Unfortunately, not in the powder room.

The location of the Mandarin could not have been more convenient for our needs.  We went to two shows, both of which were less than a mile away.  Two of our destination restaurants, Per Se and Marea could not have been closer.  And all of the fill-in restaurants the concierge sent us to were a short walk.

All in all, we were very happy with this trip, and New York and the Mandarin will become a regular part of our adventures.

title: Не пять звезд
text: Ценник не соответствует сервису и номеру. В отеле все устаревшее, даже так-просто старый отель без серьёзных обновлений. При заезде в номере не было даже воды как обычно это бывает в отелях 5звезд. Нет в номере ни чайника, ни кофемашины, фен слабый, освещение недостаточное. Холодный пол в ванной, нет ковриков, халат дали только один. Из плюсов только уборка и отличное местоположение прям у парка. При выезде с нас ещё хотели списать 200$ за мини бар, хотя ничего мы оттуда не брали, а просто открыли холодильник посмотреть, что там есть. Сенсор считал так, что мы на 200$ взяли содержимого, хотя конечно же нет, все осталось на своих местах. Пришлось объяснять и ждать, когда проверят.

title: MONY is a must!
text: This was a bucket list stay for me. Stepped out of the cold and into the beauty and warmth of the MONY. Breathtaking view of Central Park from the lobby on the 35th floor - check. Room on the 48th floor with the same amazing view from floor to ceiling windows - check.  Spacious room and bathroom (with separate shower and bathtub, plus water closet in New York - check. Access to the shopping and Jazz in Columbus Circle without having to go outside - check. Five-minute walk to Lincoln Center to see my first opera - check. A 10-minute walk back to MONY, in the snow, in Central Park - check. Wonderful staff throughout the hotel and excellent service - check (I have been the meeting planner for my organization for 25 years and have stayed at a number of 5-star hotels so I tend to notice things that most guests would not).

title: Mandarin Oriental NYC
text: This was by far the best hotel experience we have had. We will be coming back next year.  Great food, service, room and amenities. The front desk helped us with all inquiries and the doormen, cleaning crew and wait staff were some of the best we’ve seen.

title: Best trip ever!
text: everything was perfect! 10 on 10! All the attention you can think of, everything was there! From the perfume when you enter the room, the little note, the chocolate, the Evian water, all the details were there... The Best! xx

title: Great Location, Too Many Disappointments
text:
Several years since last stay, and I'm afraid MO did not live up to five-star standard.  We were particularly disappointed with room assignment.  Booked park view, and front desk tried to fob off a hudson river side room adjacent to the service elevator.  Sorry, no, we'd like what we paid for.  Wound up in a park view on the 42nd floor.  It had terribly inadequate sound insulation, and, we could hear the guests in the room next door crystal clear.  Not what we expected at 5* prices.

Breakfast was a big disappointment.  Supposedly included with AMEX FHR rate, the benefit only covered about half of a modest breakfast.  Menu was dull, food uninspired, and the service painfully slow (the guy at table next to us sat down, ordered, ate, and paid his check in the time between when we ordered and when our food - a smoked salmon bagel and yogurt with fruit - came).  Even more disappointing was the lack of any enforcement of dress standards.  Guy at table next to us was allowed in wearing hotel slippers, and several guests came straight from the fitness center in their sweaty work out clothes.  Mornings two and three, we had a better breakfast at the Smith on Broadway, for less than the price differential between the FHR breakfast benefit and actual breakfast cost.

Note there are no coffee makers in the room.  They do provide free coffee in the lobby, but you have to get there early.  Our last morning, the concierge mentioned we could have requested a Nespresso machine in the room.  Gee, wish they'd mentioned that at check-in.

One positive is the staff are (mostly) exceedingly friendly and helpful.  And the location is hard to beat.  But overall just too many disappointments.

title: Beyond Fluffy Towels
text: My experience this week exceeded all my expectations. The staff were thoughtful, attentive and always went beyond the usual to make sure that I had a grand visit. The property is beautiful and my room was exceptional.  I have a picture of the sunrise over Manhattan from my room that is breathtaking. I can’t wait to return

title: Amazing Customer Service & quiet gem in the NYC.
text: The hotel staff from arrival was amazing. The bell staff, front desk reception, concierge, housekeeping, restaurant, room service were all top notch.  It was our first visit to MO NYC. Every employee was welcoming, friendly and went above and beyond to provide excellent service.  The hotel itself was lovely, very clean, the beds were very comfortable, the service was always quick and efficient. It’s a quiet gem tucked away but yet in a fantastic location.  We hope to stay again in the future.

title: Stay at Mandarin!
text: The stay at Mandarin was lovely and more then perfect! Great staff! Great food! Room lovely! View extraordinary. Location wise it was also more then perfect! Will come back soon. My compliments to this hotel and their lovely staff!

title: Mandarin-Oriental delivers the best in service, views and location.
text: The Mandarin-Oriental is a great hotel with an excellent location and unparalleled views of Central Park.  You can always expect the best service here.  Since staying at the Mandarin I won't stay anywhere else.

title: Far from impressed.
text: Room was clean and staff was attentive, but the hotel is ridiculously over-priced - expected awesome but had nothing better than hotels at one third the price.  The fridge in the room had an assortment of drinks and snacks - we took out a small bottle of liquor which ended up being charged at $130.  When we checked out we were told there were no other charges, but my Amex card was later charged another $126 for snacks from the fridge that we didn't have.  When I called about it, they said we may have vibrated the sensors over the snacks when we opened the fridge.  I suspect that they cater to wealthy people who ignore these little $126charges.  Not nice.

title: Very confortable, clean, excellent location. The staff extremly helpful, and polite!
text: We are a returning guest! What we like at this hotel, and think make it special; rooms with nice view, large bathrooms, clean! The location , in front of the park, you can walk, jogging.The  bar inside the lobby at 35 floor, offers a fantastic view, excellent cocktails , fine dinning. The bedding and towels are as it has to be at a 5 stars hotel. The staff is so helpful, any requirement is fulfill in minutes! We had a Nespresso machine in our room and never run out of coffee, continuously refilling, same with water!  We stayed 11 nights, and feel ...like home, spoiled with kindness and attention from the hotel team. We look forward to return to New York, and stay at this hotel, like we do from 20216th.

title: Vacance
text:
Chambre désuète et vieillissante, accueil moyen, service de restauration moyen, vue sur Central Park moyenne.
Très déçu par rapport aux tarifs quand on paie ces montants là on s'attend à  autre chose.

Soirée du 31 décembre impossible de prendre une coupe de champagne.
Le Trump international hôtel bien mieux positionné avec une vu imprenable sur Central Park sera bien mieux.

title: AMAZING WEEKEND!!
text:
I have been staying at this hotel for 10 years now and this particular stay was my best yet! My family was celebrating my wife's birthday and I really wanted to make it special. I spoke with Andres Vasquez upon booking my reservation and he said he was going to be sure to make this very special.

Andres made it an amazing weekend for my entire family. The service and accommodations he offered for the birthday were absolutely amazing. My wife and kids genuinely had one of the best weekends we can remember in recent years!!
My wife also said that the chocolate birthday cake was the best she had ever tasted (thank you to the chef!).

We are really appreciative to the entire staff for everything!!

title: Nice but limited.
text:
Rooms were nice, good beds (bit cramped but tends to be the way in New York). 
 Service and staff good.  Restaurant choices limited, not really very family oriented regarding facilities etc.  Good location, nice views.

title: No Such Thing as a Free Breakfast!
text:
I specifically booked through American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts because of the amenities promised on the AMEX website.  While the Mandarin in NY provided some of the amenities promised, they failed to provide others.  We were NOT offered a room upgrade as the hotel was sold out, so I get that.  However, regarding the allegedly "Breakfast Included" as per the Fine Hotels and Resorts, the individual at check-in told us that we'd be offered a free continental breakfast worth $35/person (total $70 for my wife and myself).  

The catch is, there is nothing on the menu that would allow you to actually get this sold called breakfast--everything had a high cost.  For example, coffee was $11.  The juice was $15.  A bowl of yogurt and fruit was $23.  It is virtually impossible to get what the AMEX Fine Hotels and Resorts promised in terms of "Breakfast Included".  Our so-called "Breakfast Included" cost a total of $263.63 (including tips, which by the way were a mandatory line item, on top of another line item on the check with space for an additional tip).  

We've used Fine Hotels and Resorts many times and never has the hotel charged us for breakfast like the Mandarin.  The Penninsula in NYC, Beverly Hills, and Paris included breakfast, the Pierre in Manhattan included breakfast.  The Beverly Hills Hotel included breakfast.  All these hotels provided what was promised on the Fine Hotels and Resorts website without the pecuniary proviso that the Mandarin Hotel offered.  

Simply put, the Mandarin should NOT be listed in Fine Hotels and Resorts if they don't abide by the promises made on the Fine Hotels and Resorts web page.

We will not be staying at the Mandarin again via Fine Hotels and Resorts for the simple reason they do not follow the rules promised by AMEX on the Fine Hotels and Resorts website.

title: Mostly excellent, some mistakes and lapses of service. Overpriced by far.
text: Excellent service for the most part, and always the best location in town. Amenities are very good. Staff are all very attentive and helpful.  Getting food in the main lounge can be a very slow and frustrating experience- it can take up to an hour to get your food after ordering.  Just don't eat there if you have a meeting to make or tickets for a concert/show. Also, checkout was needlessly a long process as there was only one person at the front desk and there was a family ahead of us with a huge problem the staff person apparently couldn't solve. Took 15 minutes for another person to wander in and help us. They also charged us for minibar items we didn't use.

title: Not What It Used To Be
text: We've stayed here a number of times before and, unfortunately, our recent experience left a lot to be desired.  First, upon arriving to our room upon check-in, a dirty rubber glove was laying on the bathroom floor.  There was also a laundry tag laying on the carpet in front of the closet.  Second, they have yet to open the main restaurant, so dining was in the lounge area just off the lobby.  We ate there twice and on the second morning, I had to send my omelette back twicec because it was under-cooked the first two times.  Any local diner can get an omelette right for about $10, so one would expect a $35 omelette to be prepared to perfection.  That was not the case.  Admittedly, I wasn't charged for it, but it would have been nice for me to eat my breakfast with my wife, instead of watching her eat and then her watching me eat.  The third issue concerned room service.  The MO website indicates roomservice is from 6 AM.  Upon checkin, desk staff indicated roomserivce started at 6 AM.  However, the night before checkout we called to order room service for the next morning.  We were informed that the earliest we could expect our breakfast would be 6:45.  When asked about the 6 AM start, we were told that's what time staff arrived.  We reluctantly agreed to place the order, but really needed to be out by 7:30 to catch a train, so we knew it would be tight.  The MO has an SMS communication mechanism they encourage MO Fans to use, so I reached out on SMS to try to get breakfast at 6.  (It was only going to be a Continental breakfast, not an elaborately prepared breakfast, which past experience indicated they couldn't do anyway.)  Using SMS I was told inroom dining didn't start taking orders until 6:30 and it would be after 7 AM before we received our breakfast.  When I pointed out that the website and front desk said it started at 6 AM, they ignored me and didn't reply.  If you are going to have an SMS messaging system for your "Fans," use it appropriately.  Finally, the day before check-out we asked the doorman about getting a taxi for the train station the following morning.  He indicated it would not be a problem, just come down that morning and one would be called from the group always parked on Columbus Avenue.  After checkout on Saturday morning, we arrived at the door to find another family waiting on a taxi and no taxis in sight.  We finally called for an Uber and were able to get to our destination on time.  Meanwhile, the family ahead of us finally had a taxi arrive as we were leaving in our Uber.  So, lots of promises but not so much on follow-through for this stay.  Finally, the room we had, a Central Park view room, was showing wear and tear.  The tiled wall between the shower and bathroom door was cracked from the floor to the ceiling.  Pretty disappointed.

title: Service above and beyond!!
text: The GM found out my daughter was having a bday and missing HK (where we are from but stuck away due to quarantine rules). He delivered beautiful red chocolate dipped fortune cookies for her!! Adorable and amazing!

title: Seule la vue est intéressante !
text:
Disons-le clairement : le principal intérêt de cet hôtel et plus particulièrement de son bar résiste dans sa vue spectaculaire sur Central Park et Manhattan. 

Le reste ? 
Le personnel est hautain et pas serviable. 
La déco fait désuète, années 70. 
La qualité des produits servis ne vaut pas les tarifs excessifs proposés. 

Le tout dans un espace pas cosy pas chaleureux pas propice à passer un moment agréable ! 

Alors si vous y allez juste pour profiter de la vie, tentez l’expérience dans un autre rooftop. 
NYC regorge de rooftop beaucoup mieux !

title: En deçà de nos attentes
text:
Situation de l’hôtel et vues exceptionnelles sur Central Park.  Nous avons trouvé le service moyen. Manque de professionnalisme sur la partie restauration, variété des mets sur la carte peu originale, la qualité de la nourriture et rapidité du service en deçà .

title: Dissatisfied - subpar to other MO hotels
text: Considering the enormous price tag our stay was more than disappointing. Standard rooms are not better than at a typical Hyatt or Marriott. Doors and furniture are ticky tacky and in need for refurbishment. Staff is indifferent at best. If you are used to MO hotels in Europe or Asia you will be disappointed. Compared to our stays at the MO in London or Paris this fell short in all terms. Only positive: the view towards the Hudson is great.

title: Perfection
text: Perfect staff, location, view and service!  Concierges Bill and Chris went out of their way to accommodate. Food and drink were great. It’s literally a bunch of Oriole looking to make sure that you have the best time and want for nothing additional.

title: Home away from home
text: It was a true pleasure to return to the MOnyc! Each time that I stay there, I am given the warmest welcome. The entire atmosphere truly feels like FAMILY! It is so amazing to be acknowledged and recognized by so many of the staff members of the hotel. I was greeted and welcomed by Guest relations manager Jonathan Gil who kindly accommodated every need that I required and answers every question that I had! I look forward to my upcoming holiday stay with the MOnyc family! The holiday experience has always been a special treat and I expect this upcoming season to be no different!

title: Incredible stay, made our experience!
text: I am so glad we chose to stay at the MO. The location is perfect, we loved walking around Central Park and the TWC. The staff was so warm and kind throughout our stay. It was my fiancé’s 30th and I really felt they did all they could to make it special. Our room was amazing. Would highly recommend and return!

Thank you

title: Luxury at its finest

The room we had was very spacious and had a lovely view of Central Park.  The food was amazing and the location was perfect.  We definitely look forward to our next trip to New York and staying in the Mandarin once again.

title: Excellent stay.

every aspect of the Mandarin has been well thought out and perfectly executed, making it impossible to go wrong...

title: Mandarin Oriental New York MOWOW
text:
Walking into the lobby of MO you're greeted with an elegant view, and smiling faces.  We were warmly welcomed and assisted to our room, where the ice and champagne glasses were located per our prearranged request. After some challenges getting to NYC due to recent storm Ida's damage, we were at ease while enjoying a glass of bubbly and taking in the stunning view of Columbus Circle from the 46th floor (rm 4608) our room was impeccably cleaned, and turndown was a welcome amenity. (Many luxury hotels have yet to return to providing this service)
evening cocktails and breakfasts were enjoyed at the MO LOUNGE.. again enjoying stunning views of Columbus Circle. 
Our 4 night stay was a welcomed experience as we slowly return to life pre-covid. 
We really appreciated the extra touches taken by the property to make us feel cared for and safe. From the hand sanitizer to the proof of vaccine required to enter MO Lounge. 
Long days at the US Open really made us appreciate the solitude and relaxing space of our room at night. 
A beautiful experience.  Thank you MONYC.

title: Great stay at the Mandarin
text: My wife and I had an amazing experience at MONYC. We were celebrating my 40th birthday and our wedding anniversary, and the staff went above and beyond to help us celebrate. Our room was in great shape and immaculate. The turn down  service was just what we needed after a long day in the city. And the spa treatments were amazing. I will recommend this hotel to all our friends when the travel to NYC.

title: None
text: Very nice hotel. The staff went above and beyond to accommodate me. Front dest staff were very helpful at all times of the day.  The rooms were clean and cozy. The hotel is also in a very nice location. I enjoyed my stay.

title: Relaxing weekend in Manhattan
text: Everything from the beautiful room with magnificent Hudson River and Hudson Yards views to the gorgeous sun down and energetic Qi massage at the SPA was relaxing and enchanting. We enjoyed a wonderful diner at MO Longe, with a nice open Central Park and Columbus Circle views.

title: None

The large, well-appointed bathroom made our stay very comfortable with lovely linens and towels. title: Family stay at center of Manhattan
text: Throughout our stay, we were delighted with every corner and staff we interacted. Valet, bellman, restaurant, frontdesk, housekeeping, all performed fantastically, making me feel valued and respected. It was a great experience. Thanks. This hotel is also centrally located, easy to access to many sites we are interested in, restaurants, museums, walking distance to most of them.

title: Great location for a New York visit
text: Lovely hotel with attentive staff.  We enjoyed both breakfast and cocktails in the hotel lounge.  Overall, the location makes access to the Upper West Side, Central Park, and the rest of the city very easy.

title: Love the city
text:
We stayed at mandarin 2 months ago and we enjoyed every minutes! Great rooms, excellent service and confortable beds.
We are used to travel a lot and mandarin New York was high level. I will suggest to my friends

title: None

The rooms are comfortable

title: Awesome Hotel
text: Awesome location, exceptional service. From checkin, to the host at the lobby bar, to the housekeeping staff; there were no disappointments and everyone went above and beyond. This is the first time post-covid that I've stayed in a hotel with daily housekeeping and turndown service and I forgot how much I missed it. title: Very nice but too expensive.

title: Excelente Hotel
