title: Overpriced, overhyped, poor service
text:
Overpriced, overhyped. Poor service, kept getting worse.
-Paid for Central Park view room, got views of only Trump Hotel (see the image posted).
-Keys didnt work.
-Requested coffee maker- got it without cups and coffee powder!!!
-Gives breakfast credit (not enough for even one person) when two people in the room - thoughtless. Why give such credit which causes more dissatisfaction.

title: 100% Luxury, 0% Snobbery
text:
This was our first stay at the Mandarin Oriental New York but we'll be coming back. That's a given: We already made a reservation for our return visit while still enjoying this one, because we were so pleased and impressed.
Even before we arrived, the team at this hotel handled some very serious matters regarding our stay quickly and efficiently. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel welcome. We were even offered tea which was brought to our room, a lovely gesture, especially after our hours of travel.
Our room, although the simplest available, was anything but simple. It was spacious, tastefully decorated, and the bathroom was a dream! There were plenty of amenities, including robs, slippers, shaving kits, dental kits, and so on.
We ordered in-room dining for breakfast. Excellent food and beverages, delivered at precisely the time we requested. The smoked salmon was delicious!
We were very fortunate to be given a room on the top floor. Spectacular views of the city below and the Hudson River!
Cleanliness, location, responsiveness to guest issues, the Mandarin Oriental New York checked all the boxes brilliantly.
There are some luxury hotels that have traces of snobbery about them just because they are luxe properties. That was not the case here.We couldn't have asked for a better experience.

title: Excellent as usual
text:
MO in New York is located across from the Central Park and next to a shopping mall. Within minutes of walking distance there are a lot of restaurant selections. Excellent location.
Checked in at around 9:30 preparing for luggage storage because I booked the 11:00 reservation at MET museum. Check-in was very fast and the staff was very efficient. She also invited me to join the breakfast at the Lounge.
The Maître D' didn't see that we were there first and seated the only empty window seats to the couple behind us, but promised that when there was window seats open, would change our seat. However, he forgot to do that. We had to ask a waiter to change to the window seat when that couple left. The food in the Lounge is average compared to other MOs; maybe it is because the food service is limited after reopening. Meanwhile, our room was ready within half an hour and all the luggages were sent to the room already. Excellent service!
The upgraded room is clean but lacks a coffee machine. The refrigerator is full of drinks on automatic mode: if the door is not close within 30 seconds, guest will be charged. There is no room for drinks that brought by the guests.
Compared to other MOs in China, this MO does not have an executive lounge, therefore it does not have an option to book the executive rooms with lounge access. Because of the pandemic, restaurants are not fully opened. It is already very good because the Spa, the gym and pool are open, not many New York hotels are able to do that.
Like other MOs, daily house keeping includes cleaning in the morning and turndown service in the evening. It is the familiar "Jasmin" music played on the TV that always reminded me that I am in my very favorite hotel.
House keepers are also attend to details like other MOs. Cables of chargers would be tied together and well organized; bath salt would always be replaced when it was used. When meeting a house keeper in the hallway, she could always call me by my last name...this is how MO is unique and why I love MO!  It reminds me that when I stayed in MO Shanghai, even Mr. Clements Hoerth, the general manager, would recognize me and called my name. It is simply amazing.

title: Fantastic staff, average building
text:
We stayed as a family of four in July 2021, with two young children.   It was clear that as we arrived the hotel was still waking up from being closed for a long time due to Covid.  

Overall we debated whether it was 3 or 4 stars, and decided due to the timing to give the benefit of the doubt with four.  

The room - We had adjoining rooms.  The beds were comfortable, and for a city hotel fairly spacious.  Well equipped with TVs and charging facilities.  However, no coffee machine? We asked and they brought an  nespresso machine but they didn’t refill our capsules each day, so no coffee in the room.  Also, we asked four times for the minibars to be unlocked and eventually gave up.  So a $700 a night room with no minibar and no coffee machine?  Also in terms of decor it feels more 4* than top end 5*, which is what you are paying for.  

The staff - The saving grace for us.  Joel the concierge was fantastic, as were all the other people on the concierge desk.  From the doormen to the check in staff everyone was fantastic, helpful and made up feel welcome.  Housekeeping were also lovely and accommodating of the children.  

The food - Only one restaurant open, limited room service menu.  Not great for a hotel of this standing although yo be fair the food that we did order was good, which you would expect at such high prices.  

The facilities - Large pool for a city hotel, we didn’t really use anything else.  

Noteworthy - Links directly into the mall at Columbus Circle which was good.  

Verdict - Nothing to complain about but we wouldn’t stay there again.  At this price point there’s a lot of hotels and you should expect something special.   Whilst the staff were great the rest of the hotel just isn’t special.

title: Highly recommend The Mandarin Oriental, Manhattan
text:
From the moment we arrived at the hotel until the moment we departed for JFK, the personnel at Mandarin NYC were exceptional.

We experienced a few hiccups that are customary during long trips. Despite being unrelated to our stay at the hotel, the front desk and concierge team handled all of our issues with the utmost courtesy and professionalism. They took on the challenges as if they were their own.

In another instance, our teenage son was having trouble connecting his laptop to the high-speed internet (as opposed to the regular wifi). It was apparently a very unique technical issue that they hadn't faced before. The front desk manager came up to our room within a few minutes to attend to it himself, and then had their IT team on the phone resolving the issue.

We felt as if we were the only guests in the hotel, which is why the Mandarin stands apart.

All of this goes without mentioning the quality of the dining and shopping options, amenities, location, and general atmosphere of the hotel.

title: AMAZING!
text: Always consistent and the awareness of the staff is unprecedented! We’ve enjoyed multiple Mandarin experiences. Their spa, yoga and restaurants are too notch. We will make the Mandarin chain our “go-to” stay in whatever major city we visit!

title: Not a fan of the NYC Mandarin Oriental
text: The service is very good and the room is very comfortable with a great view. However, there is construction going on next to the hotel and even though we are on a very high floor, we can hear all the jack-hammering and digging that is going on. No one advised us that this was the situation. In addition, perhaps because of COVID-19, breakfast was abysmal. It is offered in the bar (not a restaurant) and we were seated at a low table, like a coffee table. We ordered a continental breakfast and were served croissants, fruit, and beverage, with no plate and no condiments, such as butter or jam. We were physically uncomfortable eating at that table and I believe that, for the price, we should have been offered something better in the way of food: more variety in the breads, perhaps yoghurt, and certainly some spreads.

title: Expensive, but you get what you pay for
text:
Very nice experience. Rooms nice though not large. Started on the Central Park side which has beautiful views, however construction had started recently and was quite loud early (7am). Nothing the hotel can do about this of course. However, they did accommodate my request to swap sides to the Hudson view and even let me downgrade to do it.

My own view is that unless you're absolutely set on having a view on Central Park, the Hudson side has nicer rooms, as the layout is more natural and bathroom much nicer.  

Staff were excellent. Breakfast with the view was also great.

title: Great stay
text: Great location, I was able to walk to restaurants and shops around the hotel. The hotel has access to a shopping mall on the 3rd floor so no need to even exit the hotel. Perfect spot to access all types of transportation since it is just a step away from Columbus Circle. The service was excellent and I loved the detail of providing a child size robe and sleepers for my daughter.

title: Wonderful experience
text:
This is quite a hotel. Beautiful, perfect service, very accommodating. They just do everything well.

Slept well as the room was quiet.

I also appreciated that they extended themselves in ways others would not have. A late checkout until 4:30 (!) because they could - was perfect for my return flight. They emptied the minibar so I could use it myself. A room upgrade for joining their loyalty program.

The view in this Central Park View room was excellent - ask for a high floor if you can.

title: NCY Re-opening Excellence
text: Acknowledged re-opening is most difficult. However, the staff did incredibly well making us comfortable during our recent stay.  Once the in room dining hours are expanded it will be wonderful!  The staff is truly exceptional and took great care of us.

title: Weekend Staycation
text:
Just finished a weekend stay at this place and am writing while it’s fresh in my memory.  Am from the city and now live in tri state so have stayed in hotels throughout the city over the years but never in a true five star as the Mandarin is advertised as being.  We stayed here based on location as we were attending a wedding reception in Central Park.

First, we self parked in the attached garage which is literally steps from the hotel entrance.  You can valet with the hotel itself, but decided to just self park.  

Upon entering the main hotel entrance, it is a tad confusing because the entrance is shared with the residences at Mandarin and it isn’t particularly a grand entrance as you would expect from a five star hotel.  It’s more like a nice Manhattan condo.  Regardless, there are a number of enthusiastic and helpful door men and baggage valets there to help.

The main lobby is on 35 so it’s kind of Asian inspired as many hotels throughout Asia do it like that, with lobbies up in the Sky rather than at ground level.  Anyway, upon entrance you are immediately hit with the spectacular views from the picture windows in the lobby bar/lounge area which are nothing short of stunning.  You get nice full CPS and lower park views.  Some blockage from Trump hotel but doesn’t detract from the splendor.  Check in was a breeze from the super friendly hotel personnel.  

We had an upgrade deal to a Central Park view room on 42 and not being jaded by staying here prior I can say the room does look a bit dated from the early 2000s era.  The bed and bedding are not great.  The mattresses flat out need to be replaced.  Period.  End of story.  The RAC rate on my room was over 1200 but we paid far less with a discount rate and upgrade so I wasn’t complaining all that much.  It didn’t hurt my back or anything, it’s just that my bed at home is nicer and that was not expected.  Furnishing are fine and the tv is 4K and rather large.  The minibar is one of those automatic charge ones which is super annoying frankly I really wish hotels stopped using those.  In fairness if you want a separate fridge they offered to give us one but we declined BC I always feel like I have to tip staff on every touch point.

The bathroom was luxurious and fine.  Separate tub and shower and as someone mentioned on here the tubs are slim.  Our room lacked a bidet but rather had a hand bidet, if that’s what you call it.  Overall the size of the room is fine by NYC standards.  One item that I was not expecting is that the windows are not double paned so you get tremendous noontime to afternoon heat from the sun and you also hear construction (during the week) an fire trucks/police vehicles etc. even from Floor 42.  Not something that bothers me that much and being that high it definitely is fainter than many other places I’ve stayed.  Didn’t seem to hear it from the Lobby Bar on 35 so not sure is glass is double paned down there or just that the ambient noise blocked it out.  In fairness again, the street noise in our room was not super loud at night.

The pool was tremendous.  It really is a luxury to not only have a pool in NYC but also a fairly large one like this.  We went three times and no more than three other people were there during our time.  And the guys working that area are fun and friendly guys,  Unfortunately, the hours were awful.  For instance, the pool and gym closed at 4 pm on Sunday.  That’s just plain ridiculous.  The pool area has an amazing view itself of the West Side and Hudson/NJ and at night it’s probably something. I even ordered a wildly overpriced glass of wine while in the pool so it’s just like any resort from that perspective (other than the pool being indoors).

Will say the minibar items were wildly overpriced and I was overcharged for one item but when I called this to their attention they purported to remove it from my bill.

We had room service breakfast one day and it took awhile but it came piping hot and delicious and the attendant set up a really nice table for us so it is first class service, albeit, again, wildly overpriced.  We had breakfast another day in the hotel lounge area itself and they were clearly understaffed and the same breakfast that day was underwhelming and we felt a bit rushed which was disappointing but again, that’s a popular spot with limited space.  In addition, don’t bother making reservations there unless you’re like Mick Jagger BC I made some and they were just ignored,

Their actual restaurant Asiata unfortunately seems to be closed for good so hopefully they can get a replacement for that because the space is very nice.

The hotel is basically on top of the Time Warner Center mall or whatever they call it these days which is itself kind of dated and less than, given all of the closures, including some of the flagship fancy shmancy restaurants in there.  We ate at Momofuku Noodle Shop which was top notch and the Mandarin has its own cool entrance from the Third Floor of the shops so going to and from the restaurants in the mall area is a snap.  There’s also a Whole Foods in the lower level.

The area is Columbus Circle which is lively and gives you access to the Park, MONH, etc.  So it’s a great area.

All in, a solid four plus star hotel only because it seems to be coming back from COVID and the hours restrictions on the amenities are unconscionable at this price point.  We were going to stay at the Park Hyatt solely due to lack of these amenity restrictions but we wanted the views and to that end the Mandarin does not disappoint.  Amazing views and also amazing hospitality all around.  Folks working there really do seem to try to be positive in let’s face it a very negative city these days.

In sum, would replace the mattresses and bedding and get back to full staffing and restore normal amenities hours and replace the main restaurant and this place would easily recapture five star status without a doubt.

title: Excelente
text:
Excelente hotel, muy buen servicio y el personal muy amable. Desayuno muy bueno y variado. Salvo una resina del comedor que no fue amable.
Me perdieron un envío de Amazon pero me hicieron el descuento por el valor gastado.

title: Check your final bill
text: I was quite disappointed with my stay at the MO New York. I was surprised to find out that the Afternoon Tea service is no longer offered. That is usually one of the highlights of my trip. The gym and swimming pool closed at 4pm, which is not ideal. At some point hotels should stop blaming everything on Covid, especially when the hotel rates do not reflect the limitations on amenities. The worst part of my experience is that we ate at the restaurant and the food was horrible, coupled with lack luster customer service from our server. For a $35 burger, I was expecting gourmet and delicious, but instead, I got low quality meat that lacked flavor. To add insult to injury, we elected to charge the meal to our room and we did NOT add a tip on the receipt. While I was checking out on our last day, I reviewed my final hotel bill and noticed that the restaurant charge amount differed what I signed on the receipt. The receptionist broke down the pricing and mentioned a $24 tip. I didn't add a tip, I explained and asked to see the signed receipt where it shows that I wrote in a tip. She immediately removed it from my bill, but stated she didn't have the signed receipt. It is illegal for servers/companies to alter a food bill receipt by changing the tip and total amount. Nevertheless, the reason why I am giving a 4 rating and not a zero, is because the hotel staff were very nice and gave wonderful customer service. The room was cleaned twice a day, which was fantastic. The location was excellent.

title: TOO Many RULES!
text: I’m sorry...this place is very expensive but nicely located. The amenities are too strictly controlled. Can’t use the spa or fitness center without all kinds of reservations/ capacity restrictions/mask use etc.  These regulations have been lifted for a few weeks now. Many hotels in NYC don’t require it, especially on cardio machines in gyms or in massages. They certainly don’t require a reservation to use the gym. Also some people (concierge), harass people about masks, but others don’t.  This makes the whole policy arbitrary and uncomfortable. That’s the point. It doesn’t feel comfortable here for the amount spent. Plenty of other hotels in NYC

title: Wedding stay
text: Too expensive, spa was closed. Didn’t get what you pay for. View is the only thing that was worth it, but still not for over $4k for two nights. We got married and decided to stay there for a couple nights since we weren’t going on a honeymoon right away. Again.. just not worth what was spent given the closure of the highly talked about spa.

title: None
text: Absolutely superb! They were kind, informative, and extremely attentive. Their attention to detail was unparalleled. The concierge was incredibly thorough and provided us with exceptional direction. I would absolutely stay there again!

title: High Priced, reduced services
text: Could not believe bars and room service unavailable after 9-10pm. Use of pool and Fitness Center so limited, we couldn't use pool at all. All this while NYC regs called for almost no such restrictions.

title: OUTDATED Covid Policy!!
text: The Mandarin Oriental is a nice hotel near Columbus circle which is ideally situated and beautifully furnished. Their Covid policy however is woefully dated. They still require full mask in all common areas regardless of vaccine status. Even worse, they expect masks to be worn in the fitness center ...ON THE CARDIO MACHINES. As of MID MAY, all gyms including other NYC hotel fitness facilities are NO LONGER REQUIRING MASKS. In addition, this woeful policy is being unevenly enforced and at times to the detriment of the hotel guests. Mandarin Oriental needs to get with the program and IMMEDIATELY CHANGE THIS POLICY SO THAT THEY CAN ENCOURAGE AND INCENTIVIZE VACCINATED guests to stay here!!  Until they do so, we will not be returning.

title: Visiting hospital
text:
Any other time, visiting this place would have been a pleasure, a little bit “cold “ presentation, dining wasn’t available, not enough staff ,
Would love to visit this hotel again  in a better times, 
definitely would recommend to my friends.

title: Fantastic Service
text:
Service here is second to none!   Everyone from doormen to front desk, concierge, and housekeeping name the experience a pleasant one.  The midtown location couldn’t be more convenient.

Only very small issues were a few items that were supposed to be standard in the room that had to be asked for.  But, as I said, they were extremely minor items and somewhat nit-picky, but when you’re paying small fortune for first class service, I feel that I shouldn’t have to concern myself to  be made aware of the missing items.

title: Very disappointed with my experience
text: Traveled to NYC to celebrate my son's graduation. Stayed at the M.O. four nights. I booked through Amex Fine hotels and resorts program which is supposed to give me a upgrade if available. The front desk confirmed that there was an upgrade available  but I would have to pay an additional $1,000.00. Our room was a room with two twin beds, which was shocking considering the cost of the hotel. Our room was an ADA compliant room with a shower the was built for a wheelchair. No door on the shower just a curtain that got all wet, and stayed wet the hot and cold were reversed and the shower head I just fit under, as it was built for a wheel chair. Many thing in the room were not working including the phone next to the bed, ( I complained about and was told to use the one on the desk and they never fixed it) and the make-up mirror did not work.  I view from my room was not of" the park" it was of the building next to M.O. dog urination station. Furthermore the bar was closed and the restaurant under staffed. Each time I had breakfast there I had to carefully review my bill as I found mistakes very morning and had to bring them to the servers attention. Next time I will select a hotel that cam meet the standards for which they claim.

title: Beautiful hotel with stunning views.
text: The Mandarin Oriental is a beautiful property with great service and gorgeous Central Park views.  Their spa was fantastic even with limited amenities due to Covid.  I look forward to returning in the near future.

title: Perfect stay, except for MO Lounge
text:
I like to visit New York annually, but the pandemic kept me away last year.  For this return visit, I was looking for familiar, fancy-ish experiences.  These included splurge tasting menus at nearby Jean-Georges and Per Se, and a return stay at the Mandarin.  Aside from an imperfect experience at the MO Lounge, the stay was perfect.

Although it had been over 10 years since my last stay here, everything was familiar.  I am a Fan of M.O. and booked online.  I had the pleasure of being assisted by the same pleasant woman (Yahira?) for check-in and check-out, plus she confirmed by phone that I could check-in early.    

The hotel lobby is on the 35th floor, rooms are on floors 38-54.  MO Residences are above that.  The MO Lounge, Asiate Restaurant (currently closed) and Spa are also on 35; the fitness centre, pool and event rooms are on 36.

I was upgraded to a Central Park View room with a lovely view blocked only by the hotel tower named after a former president.  There was a chaise by the window, spring water in glass bottles, a sensored minibar.  Alas, no USB ports by the bed, and the clock radio was not Bluetooth compatible.  The bathroom was large and luxurious and had a TV in the mirror.  

Front desk staff, housekeeping, in-room dining staff and lower lobby staff (doormen) were uniformly excellent.  

My stay included daily breakfast, so I made reservations online for the MO Lounge.  Upon arrival the first morning, I told the waiter (there was no host or any other staff at that time) that I had a reservation.  He said there are no reservations for breakfast, it's first come first served.  It was early; there was only one other table occupied.  The room began to fill fairly quickly, and service slowed until a second person came to help.  I ordered the Smoked Salmon Croque Monsieur, but it did not come as described on the menu (pickles instead of an heirloom tomato salad, no Gruyere cheese).    The kicker was I signed for the meal to my room (I took a photo of this bill), but the charge for this meal on my check-out folio was over $13 more than what I signed for, so someone padded the bill in their favour, which was dishonest and upsetting. 
 I canceled my seemingly "unnecessary" reservations for my remaining 2 breakfasts and enjoyed them via in-room dining instead.  The room service menu had more variety than the MO Lounge menu, the service was better, and although there was a delivery charge, there was no padding.  

Still a pleasant stay, and the hotel is convenient to so many things, especially with the Columbus Circle Metro stop just across the street, Whole Foods downstairs and Per Se upstairs.

title: Amazing Experience
text:
The hotel was beautiful and the staff was exceptional! My husband and I stayed at the New York location last weekend. We decided to just go into the city instead of traveling for the weekend. (It was our 12th wedding anniversary.)  We have stayed in many beautiful hotels all over the world but your hotel (that happened to be in our back yard) was such an amazing experience!
We plan on coming back and spreading the word that going into the city is still great especially if you're staying at the Mandarin Oriental!

title: Brst hotel chain
text:
I have always enjoy the mandarin  Properties,this one of the better ones ( why closed vegas one) 6 star  Service all throughout my stay 
I will be back front desk agent was very help !!! Room service was top notch

title: Como siempre
text: Excelente ubicación, magnificas habitaciones con vistas espectaculares del parque y la ciudad, el servicio eficiente e impecable que distingue a esta cadena de hoteles, fue una gran despedida de NYC justo antes de la entrada del COVID, esperamos pronto poder volver a esta magnifico hotel y a esta excepcional ciudad.

title: Brilliant Stay !
text: Very Nice Hotel in New York. The Hotel is very clean and beautiful. The  Restaurant and public areas are really attractive. The rooms are also very nice. Friendly Staff very helpful during our stay. one of the best services and Place to visit.

title: Just perfect
text: My stay here was perfect, and just before lockdown. Excellent check in, with upgrade to a higher floor, beautiful view, great room service and food. Can’t fault it! I felt completely safe as a lone female traveller. Will stay again and bring my family next time.

title: Amazing place
text:
We have been there with my wife and it was an amazing experience.
Service is top noch, rooms are great. Of course, it comes with a price but in the end, it so great that you forget this detail.

Restaurant is fantastic and we highly recommend this place.

title: The Second Time and Even Better
text: I had stayed at the Mandarin a few years back on work. This time we spent four days in adjoining rooms while visiting family, and travelling with family. It was a fabulous experience. The high point was literally the pool which overlooked a lot of the high rises in Manhattan. The stay seemed in another age, although it was only a little over two months back. I was doing laps while there were a couple of more swimmers. That is something unimaginable in the days of the Covid virus lockdown. The bar has great views of Central Park and they go out of the way to help hotel residents find a good table. My son also used the speakesy and was mighty pleased to invite his friends over. The best touch was placing a carefully selected book by your bedside which was yours to keep. Extremely civilised. The concierge team in the hotel also made some really nice suggestions.

title: The best point !
text:
This is the correct address for this hotel located in one of the best spots in NY.  With a top quality bar / restaurant!

Esse é o endereco correto deste hotel situado em um dos melhores pontos de NY. Com um retaurante / bar da melhor qualidade ! Vale muito a pena conhecer !

title: Very good experience
text:
Wa hed a very good stay in this hotel. The location is perfect, just in front central park. The breakfast in room was very very good, large choice of everything. The indoor pool is great, 20 meters long, and the gym had everything needed.
The room was lovely and very nice view.

title: First trip without the kids!
text:
We thought we would treat ourselves with a short trip to NYC. After much deliberation we took the plunge and stayed at the MO. And it didn’t disappoint. 

Location wise it was within walking distance to wherever we are. 

The rooms were lovely. So nice having a view over NYC whilst having a bath. 

The swimming pool was a nice distraction from the otherwise cold weather in NYC. 

As members of MO we were entitled to breakfast in Asiate. The first time it was a bit disappointing due to miscommunication with the waiter but after that we couldn’t have asked for anything more.

title: Needs up gradations
text:
I generally like the mandarin chain but the New York property really needs to upgrade the rooms, bathroom and the in room entertainment system. All outdated but the price hasn’t changed. 

Quite tricky as far as benefits are concerned, we had a $300 credit but they quite conveniently forgot to mention that the main bar will not extend any credit given by the hotel what a sham. We stayed for four nights and thought we were using our credits but at checkout found that only $32 was used from our $300. Shameful form a five star establishment. 

We were booked to come back again on March 07 but we cancelled. Will avoid this particular property of Mandarin.

title: Not Just a Hotel, But an Experience
text: Spent our 40th wedding anniversary weekend at the MO.  Property and service was nothing sort of spectacular.  Wildly exceeded expectations and look forward to our next stay in the City.  Makes it almost impossible to consider staying someplace else!

title: Perfect Stay
text:
We stayed at the Hotel and it was excellent. We stayed in the "least" expensive room, with views to the river, and even though the hotel offers more "luxurious" rooms and rooms with views to central park, this room was excellent. The views from the 47th floor were amazing.
We arranged for the hotel to pick us up at JFK and the process went smoothly.
Upon arrival our room was ready (we arrived around 11PM)
Room service was perfect every time we used it
The Breakfast is a la carte, no buffet (which for me its a better option)
The views from the restaurant and the bar is impressive, with unobstructed views of Central Park
The service in the hotel is top notch. I agree that the Mandarins in Prague, Paris and Munich are more "luxurious" but this hotel is an excellent choice. The location is perfect and the shopping mall in the first 3 floors provide a lot of options if you don't want to venture off or want an option for lunch that is easy.

title: Run-down Hotel
text: This is such a shameful hotel. I stay at Mandarin Brand hotels all over the world and this hotel offered a horrible experience. It has gone down in quality and service. I will not be back. The photos are inaccurate, the pool looks pretty but in reality is disgusting and you can't even enter the room its in for to long as the chlorine smell is overwhelming. The rooms are disgusting and dirty, the furniture in in horrible shape, the food is disgusting and the staff reflect how run-down this hotel is. The beds are old and uncomfortable, the bathroom is outdated small and sad and the tub is a joke, only a child could fit in, which I wouldn't want to anyways because its dirty.

title: Enjoyed our stay at the Mandarin
text:
Spent one night at this hotel to celebrate my birthday.  Had wonderful service with every employee that we interacted with and enjoyed the view of the Hudson River from our room on the 45th floor.  The location is great, right on Columbus Circle directly adjacent to Central Park.  There are plenty of bike rental options right outside.  The hotel lobby is on the 35th floor of the building complex.  It's also connected to the mall for shopping and dining options.  There are so many things to explore outside of this building, but it's nice to have something connected in case you can't go outside because of the weather.  They have larger rooms for a larger price, but we opted for the smaller size room.  For NYC, it was still ample size to move around the bed.  The bathroom is large and extends the full length of the room.  I've been the MO in SF which I found the room much larger, but this is NYC after all.  

I have a few tips.... 1) regarding their lounge... make reservations if you think you may want to have a drink or eat there.  We got lucky with getting a seat for drinks and dessert, but it appears that it fills up and there isn't a bar that you can just stand around and hang out... you must be seated.  2) Join their free Fan club - it provided us with a few perks like late checkout in the afternoon and a $50 credit towards our food bill.

title: ミニバー
text: ３泊しました。ハドソン川が見え流部屋でした。どこに行くのも便利で、下にホールフーズもありました。買ってきたものをミニバーに入れた際に飲み物の料金がカウントされたらしく、サインしてない請求が後でありました。メールで連絡すると戻してくれました。

title: Great views!!!
text: This is a tuff post to be fair, staff super friendly and remember your name!! Views to die for over the city and Central Park, excellent food and a speak easy bar too which is brilliant..... but the room felt tired whilst being very well appointed. Beds were comfy and the room did have everything you would want, hair dryer, tv in the bathroom, mini bar that was well stocked and again views to die for from the top floor. Shower was excellent and the toilets have heated seats! Great gym and pool too. It is a great hotel that is for sure but it is expensive. I would stay again as the people and food are excellent!

title: MONY Delights
text:
I brought my (89 yo) mum to NYC in a combined business-pleasure trip, and we always stay at MONY except for once in the past.  I would say another excellent stay all around.  

My mum would suggest more lighting in the rooms, which appears too dark in a stay marked by more than half rainy dreary days.  It would be good to keep up with the competition by having modern central controls for all lights, curtain, etc as well.

title: Excellent
text:
Excellent stay, wonderful staff.
Great restaurants, shops, spa, amenities, etc..
Frankly, you can spend a wonderful weekend in the hotel and adjacent Columbus Shops and never have to leave the facility!

title: Columbus Circle Must Stay!
text: Stayed here a few times when business meeting sin NYC ran late.  Excellent facility and great accommodations.  Great restaurants and drinks as well.  While the rooms are costs, you get a LOT for your money including great service.  Book early, especially during holidays, because this place fills quickly.

title: TOP NOTCH!
text: Everything about this hotel was amazing!!!  Rooms were spacious, immaculate and you couldn't hear any noise from the neighboring rooms.  The staff and facilities are exceeded my expectations!  I will plan to return to this hotel again!

title: Not impressed at all.
text: Very pricey, doesn’t have a 24 hour gym (or just won’t staff it), rooms boring. There are two Restaurants - one of which I walked out of as there was no service. Given the prices they charge they need to up the game. Unimpressed and hopefully won’t have to return!

title: Not Worth The Money
text: I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental while in NY for work and some things were very poor for a hotel of this price range. The customer service from the servers at the breakfast restaurant was very poor and we waited a long time for both service and food despite the restaurant not being full. In addition, the food did not taste good either at breakfast or when room service was delivered.

title: Disappointed: Do not waste your money
text: I checked in for two nights and ended up leaving after one. It is insane that a hotel charges 1000 USD + a night to stay in a run down room. The standard room is 10 years old and looks like a standard room at the Hyatt. Do not waste your money. Stay at another hotel. So dissatisfied.

title: Mandarin Oriental was a huge disappointment.
text: After doing so much research and comparison on an array of hotels I decided to stay at the Mandarin Oriental in NYC. I must say that I was very disappointed with the hotel. Several things come to my head at this moment. From the lack of information related to the hotel cars available to us, the Quality of the food from room service (wrong items and un-cook food), the view from the room was not as requested, constantly extremely loud noises coming from the cleaning staff room next to my room and last but not least the lack of good service from the restaurant during breakfast (forgotten breakfast, coffee and missing from the server). Being a New York native and have experienced a 5 star service in various hotels in NYC, the Mandarin Oriental was a huge disappointment.

title: Great hotel and location!
text: Mandarin always comes through!  Very clean rooms, very kind staff.  Love the location at Columbus Circle near Central Park.  You must have a drink at the hotel bar with the unusual and cool drinks!  I will always try to stay here!

title: Mandarin Oriental ein erstklassiges Hotel in New York
text:
Wir waren mit der Familie jetzt das zweite mal im Mandarin Oriental in N. Das Hotel und die MA bieten selbst bei kleineren Problemchen einen ausgezeichneten Service und sind sehr bemüht und in der Lage Unterstützung zu liefern. Hier möchte ich besonders erwähnen, daß es dort eine sehr hilfsbereite und perfekt deutsch sprechende Mitarbeiterin an der Rezeption mit dem Namen "Fidora" gibt, die gern insbesondere deutsche Gäste unterstützt.
Die BAR Aviany sollte man unbedingt meiden, da das Preis-Leistungsverhältnis in keiner Weise stimmt und sich dort auch "besondere" Damen aufhalten, die versuchen angetrunkene Männer auszunehmen.
Dem Gegenüber ist das Restaurant Asiate zwar auch nicht ganz billig, bietet aber exzellenten Service und besonders hochwertige und interessante Speisen und Getränke. Ein muss für jeden anspruchsvollen New York Reisenden.
Alles in Allem ein Hotel der Superklasse.

title: Excellent service
text:
Si le prix des chambres, du restaurant et du bar paraît plutôt cher, surtout qu’il faut y rajouter 15% d’impôts (city et state tax), la perfection du service fait passer la pilule!
De la femme de chambre qui dispose d’un appareil à sécher les chaussures détrempées, du concierge de très bon conseil qui nous a prépayé les billets au Met pour éviter de devoir faire la queue, au bell-boy latino qui m’a indiqué un excellent bar à cigares dans une ville où les fumeurs sont très mal vus, l’excellence du service n’est pas un vain mot!

title: Visit Twice .. great both
text: This is a great place, very well located and you get what you pay for.. busy? Of course it is.. excellent place for food and amazing cocktails. Excellent place for brunch & dinner.Enjoyable view  and friendly service.

title: Terrible Service & Rude Front Desk Employee
text:
This past December I vacationed in NYC for the month. During my time there; I stayed at 3 different hotels. The Mandarin was the worst hotel by far. The star I am giving them is for the pool. 

The first night I was there I wanted to have a glass of champagne in the lobby before dinner. My guest and I went down to the lobby around 7 pm. It was packed with people and there was not a bar available. 

Considering that I went over to the front desk and kindly asked if I could grab a lobby seat and have Champagne in the lobby.  The front desk woman, Anita, loudly in a high pitched voice “Madame! No! You will have to check in with the hostess and wait to be seated in the restuarant!” 

First off, Madame? I am not French or in France. Next this is the first time I’ve asked for a glass of Champagne and someone has said “No!” So forcefully only my life. 

Do you imagine staying at a hotel that charges almost $2k a night and being refused a glass of champagne? Absurd. 

We go check in at the hostess stand and they say it is a 20 minute wait. My guest and I have no choice but to now go sit in the lobby without a refreshment. However, there are people in the lobby with drinks and some drunk girl spills her drink on the table I’m sitting at. See picture below. 

When the drink is spilled Anita comes over, because she sees I am infuriated and mortified. She cleans up the drink and I look at Anita and say “this is disgusting” Anita turns to me and in a high pitched tone borderline yelling “she just spilled it MADAME”! 

At that point Anita should of said nothing and kindly apologized. I asked how they had drinks and we did not. She did not answer the question and walked away. I am blown away at how disgustingly rude she is. 

We ended up finally getting seated. Had one refreshment then headed to dinner. 

After dinner I was headed to my room. Anita happened to be in the elevator with me and did not acknowledge my presence. She was being very kind to the gentleman in the elevator.

She is the rudest person I have ever met.  I vacation often. Never have been treated this poorly. 

This past week I stayed at the Mandarin Boston. The level of service is impeccable there.  Whoever is running that hotel should run a workshop to fix the NYC property.  

In addition to being denied a glass of champagne I asked for a bathrobe when I was at the pool and it took 45 minutes to find one.

title: DATED
text:
Currently here had to clean the dust off my radio  next to nightstand. Wasn't upgraded of course even though I called a day before. Ive stayed  at Mandarin  Tokyo ,London,  Miami this year, this  is not great  at all. The front desk gave us loads of No nicely I couldn't be upgraded or couldn't 
get a drink in the lounge.  Here sneezing my butt off the dust.  I am really  disappointed.

title: Eccellente
text: Sono stata più’ di una volta in questo Hotel e anche con il soggiorno di quest’anno confermo l’eccellenza, Hotel molto curato, breakfast spettacolare con vista su Central Park, stanza super confortevole, e location in Columbus Circus fantastica!

title: Super Panorama-Blick auf die Stadt bei sehr gutem Preis-Leistungsverhältnis
text:
Zimmer sind ordentlich und auf dem neuesten Stand mit Traum-Blick durch die großen Panorama-Scheiben. Es gibt sogar deutsches Fernseh-Programm. 
Das Frühstück ist reichhaltig und wird in schönem Ambiente serviert. Der Panorama-Blick ist dabei so phantastisch, dass manche hier vor ihrem Laptop den halben Arbeitstag verbringen, so dass nachrückende Hungrige zu Stoßzeiten lange vergeblich auf einen freien Frühstückstisch warten müssen. 
Trotzdem ein tolles Hotel!  Wir kommen wieder!

title: Great third-time visit
text: Stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 3 nights, primarily to attend a concert at Carnegie Hall, which was just a short walk away. It was a very pleasant stay. The arrival experience was the best I think I've ever had at any hotel. A woman warmly greeted me in the crowded lower lobby, asked if I was checking in, then when I said yes, she cleared a path for me through the crowd to the elevator, chatting with me in a friendly and casual manner. Then when I got to the front desk on the 35th floor, I was very impressed by Aneta, who was so warm and professional as she checked me in, smiling and talking with me the whole time. There was a minor mixup with my info on file, but the experience was still superb because of Aneta's personable manner. She's definitely a role model. All the staff I encountered at the hotel were friendly and effective, from the concierges to housekeeping to Asiate restaurant at breakfast. In addition to the Carnegie Hall concert, hotel was a great base for exploring MoMA, Central Park, Neue Galerie, Met museum, Lincoln Center, and attending a Broadway show (took the subway right outside hotel). My Central Park view room was great. Wish the lobby was a little bigger but I could usually find a seat. Checkout experience was very good too. When I asked for a copy of MO Magazine to take with me, the front desk woman made sure that I got it. It was an expensive stay but worth it. This was my third visit in about 5 years. Had good meals at Porter House and Bouchon Bakery in attached Time Warner shopping center.

title: Our Home in NYC
text: The Mandarin Oriental, New York is a special place. Located in the heart of Columbus Circle, the property itself is visually stunning. It's conveniently connected to the Time Warner Center shops. The best restaurants and retail are just a few steps away at all times. This was our 5th trip to the property and The service was exceptional once again. Eileen made it another trip to remember for us. They made my wife's birthday very special. An excellent Concierge team too. The only place to stay when in the City. I'm a fan.

title: Situation et vues exceptionnelles
text:
Bien que la décoration de l’hôtel en général (parties communes et chambre) nous a parue assez quelconque, nous avons toutefois eu une fort bonne impression de notre séjour de 3 nuits dans cet établissement. 
Points fort : piscine au 36ème, chambre très propre et bien entretenue, situation proche de Central Park, mais surtout les vues depuis le bar, le restaurant, la chambre, la piscine, etc...
Nous avons par ailleurs dîner au restaurant ASIATE où, en tant que résident de l’hôtel, nous avons pu bénéficier d'une superbe table directement située à la fenêtre. C'est plutôt cher pour un restaurant non étoilé, mais cela vaut largement l'expérience, la nourriture étant très correcte. Il y a également une sélection de vins de qualité au verre, dont du champagne Krug à un prix très intéressant. 
Pour loger du côté de Central Park, cet hôtel est un must.

title: Not as good as other MOs
text: Ok so its New York City and hotels are on every corner but I feel the Mandarin Oriental, usually a stand out property, has got lost amongst them all. The service is good, the view is good, but the hotel just feels more basic than other Mandarins. It needs a good overhaul. Mandarin Oriental service in a Shangri-la hotel was my thought.

title: THE VIEW !!!
text:
The Mandarin Oriental got it all! Location, View, Service, outstanding food, what else??
Sitting on the topfloor facing Central Park is pure magic! The food amazing and the total experience a yearly high light ! Just in front of Columbus Circle next to the Lincoln Center with all that Jazz. It can't get any better!

title: Excellent hotel and staff
text: My family and I recently spent three days in NYC during the Christmas holiday and stayed at this hotel. I have stayed at other Mandarin Oriental hotel and this one did not disappoint.  From check-in, to the service of the Concierge, to restaurant and hotel staff, to check-out we could not have been happier.  The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to almost everything.  Wile some may say what do you expect for the price, it was worth every penny and was beyond my expectation.

title: Christmas celebration
text: From the door man to the receiver was good. Place is clean, including restroom.... Live band music was great. Food was ok.....We had lots of fun. The view from 36th floor was awesome!!! A must see if you're in the city..

title: Amazing Stay In NYC
text: The staff and the service was amazing, extremely pleasant staff and the hotel is just at the perfect location. No city noises easy access in and out with access to shoppes and other restaurants without haven't to leave the building.

title: Desayuno
text: Sin duda la mejor vista de la ciudad. Sin dudas el peor servicio que uno se puede esperar y más en un hotel de esta categoría donde pagas 80 dólares por persona para desayunar. Pésima actitud y comida sin sabor. Se nota que los meseros no tienen ganas parece que se molestan si llegas a consumir en su restaurante. Será que estoy acostumbrado a servicio de VIPS y TOKS de México que no tiene comparación con este lujoso hotel. Para nada recomendable

title: Estancia perfecta, sin un pero
text:
Lo que voy a decir ya lo sabe todo el mundo, pero no por ello me canso de repetirlo: Los Hoteles Mandarin Oriental son una maravilla, y el de NY no es una excepción. 

La recepción está en el piso 35, con lo cual al llegar se dejan las maletas en el lobby y te subes al hacer el check in. Servicio de recepción rápido, simpático y eficiente. Habitaciones inmaculadas.

Aconsejo antes de hacer la reserva el hacerse del programa de viajeros frecuentes de Mandarin Oriental, que es gratuito. Se llama "Fans of M.O." y con ello consigues elegir dos ventajas en cada visita. En mi caso, pedí desayuno gratuito cada día y un late check out, que me dieron hasta las 3 de la tarde.

El metro de Coumbus (linea roja1 en NY) está prácticamente en la puerta, con lo cual vas a todos lados sin necesidad de sufrir el tráfico de NY.

Cuando vuelva a NY,  y tenga que estar en esta zona de midtown o el el west side, repetiré sin duda.

title: Central with perks! But not Perfect.
text: Having booked 2 Central Park View Rooms we were thrilled with one ( views straight down central park south) and ok with the other( interrupted park view). Unfortunately it took two days to get the shower in one of our rooms working. The hotel is perfectly situated for central park, shopping (Time Warner centre,  madison and 5th ave just moments away) , museums etc, with the advantage of free cars anywhere within 20 blocks. Housekeeping are keen( they bang on your door at 8 am so remember to set your "do not disturb." ) It's beautifully kept: my daughter has OCD and used the hotel as a base throughought our trip whenever she felt overwhelmed/ needed to clean up etc.  The highlight for me were the amazing door staff, who took everything and everyone in their stride without batting an eyelid. Well done guys!

title: Great bar and view
text: Always nice to stop at the Mandarin Oriental NY. I've been to the Spa, had lunch at the lovely restaurant and taken a drink at the bar several times. Excellent service, lovely views and not too busy. It is nice to be able to talk to the person you are with. Looking forward to my next visit already.

title: Treat yourself!
text:
I have stayed here twice now. And both times the staff were super Accommodating, rooms were perfectly clean. “I hate finding like random hair and ew” but not this place. 

The view was literally the best I have ever seen! 

 Would def recommend to anyone.

title: Not a Fan
text: My husband and I had such a bad experience we moved hotels.  I had booked this hotel based on the brand name (we have loved the quiet oasis, gorgeous rooms, stellar service at many Mandarins) and the reviews here.  I used Amex Fine hotels and resorts, thank goodness-they got us our money back and found another hotel within five minutes.  I had prepaid and by the time we arrived the room we had booked was $400 less due to a special.  We did not receive an upgrade.  The room was tiny and grubby.  The view was great.  The hotel bar lobby was filled with very loud and drunk people, including one woman calling people the B word in high volume.  Not what I expect from a Mandarin.  I tried to get a different room, but they only one offered was a suite for an additional $600.  The manager, Stacy, was not who I would hire for that position. As we left to check into the Four Seasons, where we got a suite for the same price we were paying for this tiny dirty room, one of the MO employees apologized and guessed the name of the manager.  Evidently many guests are not very happy with her. There are so many fabulous hotels in NY, skip this one.

title: Best hotel
text: The Mandarin Oriental, New York is the finest hotel that my wife and I stay. Our evaluation begins with the staff who make us feel valued and special.  The property is magnificent with all amenities.  Just the best!

title: Never again
text: As a frequent guest of the mo I was very disappointed and will definitely never stay there again. The pick up service didn’t work, the personal is not trained well. All in all a terrible experience. No thank you

title: Great Stay and very friendly staff
text:
We stayed two nights before a cruise from Bayonne NJ.

We had driven the rental car into NYC on a Friday afternoon and had to drop it off at Alamo in the block immediately behind the hotel. Great help from the door and Bellman on arrival looking after the luggage. Front desk is in the 32nd floor.  You have to use a different elevator to get to the upper floors from reception floor. Our room was on the 52nd floor facing south. Great views of southern Manhattan and the Hudson. Room was a reasonable size and clean and the bathroom, with separate shower and bath was very good.

All the staff we encountered were very friendly. We had both breakfasts in Asiate which were very good. Great views of part of Central Park from this restaurant but the remainder is slightly obscured by Trump’s hotel!

We hadn’t done our homework beforehand and didn’t realise it would an issue to get a yellow cab to the cruise port terminal in Bayonne and into New Jersey. However Patrick on the front door was great and arranged a car for us to the cruise port. We then used the same driver to pick us up at the end of cruise and another of his co workers took us to JFK a few days after the cruise, from another hotel.

Great shopping mall beneath the hotel and we ate both evening meals in the Porter House in the mall.

All in all, a lovely stay at a superb hotel and one we would stay again on our return to NYC.

title: Feeling Sentimental about Mandarin Oriental
text: Such a lovely stay. From the second we entered the hotel, it was obvious this property is extraordinary. The view alone brought me to tears.  The staff pours their hearts into all that they do to ensure the stay is memorable and incredible.  I love this hotel!

title: Won’t come back won’t recommend to any human kind
text:
I am MO fans . This is my worst experience in mandarin oriental . Check in staff wasn’t  friendly . Asking question isn’t approachable. Very rude . Assigned a room next to elevator, couldn’t sleep at all night . Order room service saying come at 30 mins but wait for 70 mins . In additional the steak ordered medium but well done . Walk in shower is old and no pressure for hot or cold water . Facilities are out dated . Water drain is slow .

$1000 for a night are you kidding me !!!
Won’t come back don’t go there .

title: Great Manhattan Views lovely lobby restaurant
text: Love the Mandarin Oriental always smells like a crisp spa and wakes you up any time of the day. The Lobby restaurant is got to be our favorite for food, great views of Manhattan...their nuts, snacks, appertizers and tea is so gooood!!!

title: High end hotel
text:
The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. We had a view over the Hudson river, so could watch the sunset from our room in the evening. Towels and beds are super quality. Our housemaid Helen was extremely helpful.

Breakfast at the Asiante opens at 7am, which seems late for those of us who were from the UK and waking up early because of the time difference! However it's very nice but table service only and quite expensive! But like my husband said...you're paying for the view of sunrise over Central Park and the New York skyline!

Everything is walking distance, with lots of restaurants and cafe's nearby. It's a straight walk down to Times Square or Macy's. We also took a taxi to Tao Downtown which is a hip Thai restaurant which was buzzing even on a Thursday night!

The staff are all very friendly and courteous at all times. Really nice people.
We used room service once but again they were quick and efficient.

title: If you plan to stay here don't plan on using the restaurant or lounge
text:
I travelled to NYC Oct 25-28, I booked using my Chase Mastercard that included breakfast. The hotel is beautiful, has beautiful views overlooking Central park and NYC skylines. The restaurant Asiante and lounge Aviary over looks Columbus circle (Central Park South). I went the first morning to go to breakfast with my wife at 9 am. I was told the restaurant was fully booked for breakfast and was told I could go down to the shopping area to have breakfast and some of the food court area restaurants.
Later on that evening we wanted to have a drink in the lounge (Aviary), we were told there were no tables available and we would have to go online to make a reservation, they could not take them there.  The online reservation system had you reserve with a $20 pp deposit.
I have never experienced this before, especially after spending $1000+ per night. Why wasn't I advised/ offered reservation at check in? Why aren't hotel guests given priority? I don't get it, the Mandarin is overrated. When i checked out I wasn't asked how my stay was. Really disappointing. If you want to stay and eat in your 300 sq ft room this place is for you.

title: PARFAIT
text:
Idéalement placé à coté de central park et des différentes lignes de métro
Personnel compétent, souriant, aux petits soins
Chambre et salle de bain confortables

vue époustouflante et inoubliable
petit déjeuner varié et avec la même vue

assez haut pour ne pas entendre les bruits de la ville

En réfléchissant, je n'arrive pas à trouver de défaut ( peut être l'absence de bouilloire dans la chambre...mais dès la remarque faite, une cafétière était dans notre chambre avec du vrai café!)

NB le prix s'oublie, la qualité reste

title: Ein Traum von Hotel
text:
Sicherlich eines der besten Hotels in New York City.
Wansinnig tolle Aussicht über den Central Park und den Hudson.
5 Sterne plus. Ganz tolles Personal. Besonders Yarisol an der Rezeption ist ein wahrer Engel. So viel Herzlichkeit erfährt man selten. Der Spa und die Massagen waren erste Klasse. Unser Suit Upgrade im 50. Stock Dank Yarisol war unvergesslich. Wir kommen sicherlich wieder!!

title: Pessimo servizio di pulizia e rifacimento camera
text:
Ogni giorno anche dopo ripetute chiamate alle 14 del pomeriggio la camera non era rifatta e non solo il servizio non veniva fatto ma il personale rispondeva pure di lamentarsi perché a loro non interessava nulla 
Pessimo hotel da non consigliare

title: Amazing location
text:
Staff location service rooms and views are just sublime 
Great food as well, the hotel is modern compared to most hotels in NY highly recommended for business or family stay.
Thank you Grace for everything on site!

title: Idéal
text:
Hôtel excellent ayant beaucoup d’atouts. L’emplacement est parfait au bord de Central Park car beaucoup de choses sont possibles à pied. L’accueil et le service sont impeccables, le petit déjeuner qui domine la ville est très bien, la vue est sublime côté parc dans les étages élevés.
Seul bémol : il faut éviter de dîner au restaurant car c’est vraiment trop cher pour un repas ordinaire.

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
El hotel es precioso, es muy bien ubicado en Columbus Circle, enfrente el parque central. Las vistas de las habitaciones son preciosas, Son vistas al Rio Hudson o al Central Park.
El lobby del hotel esta en el Piso 35, tiene un desayunador medio pequeño. 
El desayuno promedio sale 30 usd, aunque uno completo con huevos revueltos y tostadas 54usd
El cuarto es inmenso, colchon y almohadas muy buenas. con muy buen baño con amenities.
El personal muy correcto.

title: Wonderful - As always
text: The Mandarin Oriental New York is a first class property.  Great location, friendly attentive staff, great amenities, excellent food, wine, and drinks, nice comfortable and clean rooms.  Sometimes it feels like they know what you need before you ask.  What more can one say?  Just wish there was a Mandarin Oriental at all of my destinations.

title: Several flaws
text:
Service was flawless, they aim to please in every way.
View of park is obstructed by the trump hotel that sits directly infront.
Bed was extremely hard, we were offered a foam mattress topper, not what you expect from a hotel of this price and quality. The blinds were not blockout so room is bright as soon as the sun comes up.

title: Nowhere near as good as other MO's
text: This property is getting a bit tired.  The rooms are small, the first two we were shown were smoky/musty and service isn't at the same level as other hotels in its price point.  There are far better options in NY.

title: Top
text:
Always enjoy coming to this place, the service is so good and the room and amenities are great. The location is also top for going for strolls through Central Park or it’s not far to go shopping on 5th avenue. The view from the lobby is also killer. 
Spa treatments were also good! And the room service as well as the food in the lobby were great. All over 10/10

title: セントラルパーク隣の素晴らしいホテル
text: セントラルパークの南西角すぐにあり、パーク向こうの美術館やミッドタウン地区へ行くのにも、とても便利な場所です。地下鉄の59丁目-コロンバス・サークル駅もすぐです。マンダリンオリエンタルはスタッフの皆様が特別に丁寧でフレンドリーですので、旅行客として心から有難く感じます。建物も部屋も綺麗で清潔です。35階のアジアートでの朝食は、内装も眺望も素敵で素晴らしかったです。部屋からはセントラルパーク南側が一望でき、とても良い滞在でした。NY中心部に泊まる時は必ず再泊したいと思います。

title: Peaceful respite in the city
text:
My spouse and I have stayed here 4-5 times for business and each time we are sad when we leave. The hotel is very conveniently located, right on the Columbus Circle subway station. Being park-adjacent and having access to all of the shops and restaurants (plus Whole Foods) in the building is phenomenal. Food prices are steep but there are plenty of lower cost options nearby and the food at the hotel is really excellent. 

Rooms are beautiful. Impeccably clean. Giant bathrooms with separate tubs and showers. Beds are insanely comfortable. Views are beautiful no matter which way you're facing. Rooms are very quiet.

You cannot go wrong with this hotel.

title: What a View of Central Park! The 35th floor
text:
We went there for my 40th brunch treat. And my oh my for the views. It’s the 35th floor with a full panoramic view of Central Park. 

This was best treat and a must see place. Felt very intimate as there are few seats plus cause it was Sunday morning it wasn’t crazy busy so we were lucky that way. 

High prices but very justified not only for the view but for the perfect hosting from start to finish. Professional, friendly and great service.

Had an amazing time there and will be sure visiting again next time we are in NYC 

Thanks guys and keep the great work 

❤️

title: Вообще не тот сервис
text:
Mandarin Oriental для меня это самый высокий уровень сервиса. Как же я разочаровалась в Нью-Йорке этой сетью Отелей!  Ну нет этой люксозности, как должно быть. При заселении нам не смогли предоставить twin room, сказали принесут дополнительную кровать. Мы заселись в отель в 15 ч, к 21.30 кровати так и не было. Хотела позвонить по телефону на front desk, но телефон не работал. До этого я просила coffee machine в номер, они капсулы принесли, а саму кофеварку нет. Короче, мне пришлось спускаться лично на ресепшн и жаловаться . Так много косяков в один день - it’s too much. Пришли люди, начали чинить телефон, в итоге поменяли на другой, принесли кофемашин, поставили кровать. Но почему этого нельзя было сделать сразу????
Если ты платишь деньги за сервис, ты этот сервис хочешь ощущать. Это не про этот отель. Не рекомендую его.

title: Wonderful hotel with marvellous views of Central Park
text: Wonderfully Located hotel on Columbus Circle with great views of Central Park . The quality of the hotel was everything you’d expect from a luxury hotel. My only biggie was the need for residents to have to book a place on the bar .

title: Some Payment issue
text:
I am a fan of  Mandarin Oriental so l  usually stay Mandarin Oriental in Asia Pacific  Area.
For the first time in New York,  i’ve just visited the lobby  lounge for  resting  and enjoying the  Central park view .
Most everything was perfect.   Friendly but elegant, excellent cocktail, stunning view, etc.
 They  kept my shopping bags in a  polite  very reliable way, I was moved about it .

And finally Check my balance, it was a little trouble.
 They didn’t  accept my jcb card  Jcb card is the most popular card  in Japan.JCB partners with Discover card.

I have Never had an experience like this.
 Because when I stay in Mandarin Oriental, I always use JCB.

 Next time I visit the lobby lounge, I hope it would never happen again

title: Small Room,No Turn Down Service ,Dirty Room
text: The first room that we were given resembled a cheap,small room on a cruise ship.Every time that I walked past the bed I cut the side of my leg on a sharp protruding corner.We had to waste the next morning changing rooms.I asked for nightly turn down service.The hotel refused to accommodate the request and it required multiple phone calls every night to obtain turn down service.The woman at the front desk at the spa was very snotty to me and refused to let me see the spa but offered to have someone show my husband around.The concierge was excellent.Room came with a cold box ,not a refrigerator which I had to argue with them that I needed a refrigerator for insulin.Very poor service for a so called luxury hotel.The restaurant does not stick sugar free syrup and it has to be ordered in.The first time that I ordered it I was told that it was sugar free when in fact it was not .

title: Amazing!
text:
Loved everything about this hotel. Everyone was professional friendly. Any question we had the employees answered right away or made it their main priority to find the answer. Everyone was very welcoming. The location was perfect right next to Central Park. The mall on the first floor was great too! We didn’t use the spa or the pool, but plan to next time we go so I do not have any information on those. 

The lounge on the 35th floor had an amazing view and it was a nice relaxing spot. 

The hotel was decorated nicely and very clean. The rooms were spacious and clean. 

Loved everything and we will be back!

title: A wedding to remember
text: Our son had his wedding at the Mandarin Oriental.  As the parents of the Groom, we stayed the night at the hotel.  I cannot say enough about how outstanding this hotel is.  Every element of the wedding was simply perfect.  But let me compliment Nina, the Catering Sales Manager.  As a funny story although it caused me a panic, shortly prior to the start of the ceremony, the button came off my tuxedo jacket (thanks made to measure, first time wearing from a nameless store but it begins with N)  Anyway, in panic mode, I reach out to Nina.  Without batting an eye, she gets on her cell, calls someone, takes my jacket, and in 10 minutes returns with it all taken care of.  Clearly not in her job description, but she knows and fully understands the hospitality business.  She is absolutely the best.  That's not to say all the other people we interacted with were any less.  I just don't know their names.  Take it as fact as I stay in lots of hotels in a variety of countries, this property is outstanding.  Each and every person we interacted with made you feel as though the only person they had to worry about was you.  Now this is not an inexpensive place to stay, but if you can handle it, you owe it to yourself to experience it at least once.  The location by Central Park South and West is just so beautiful and the views are exquisite if you like a city perspective.  And the suites the groom and the bride had resembled an apartment.  But even a standard room is spacious, well designed, comfortable and nicely appointed.

title: Perfektes Hotel für Kurztrip in Manhattan - Ostern 2014
text: Perfekte Unterkunft, einfacher Check-in, Grandiose Aussicht auf den Central Park, unglaublich gutes Essen im Zimmer - Chicken-Fingers im Bett hat unserem Sohn nach der Anreise aus Europa sehr gefallen, Frühstück sucht seinesgleichen.

title: Experience exceeded my already high expectations
text: The Mandarin Oriental was one of the finest hotels at which my wife and I have ever had the pleasure of staying. The location was great - right across the street from Central Park and the 59th Street subway station. The appearance of the hotel was elegant. Our room, while not very big, was well laid out. The double vanity in the bathroom was especially convenient. The staff throughout the hotel was incredibly pleasant and helpful. For example, our arriving flight was delayed and we hadn't eaten for some time. The receptionist at The Aviary went out of her way to get us into their sister bar, The Office, early so we could get something to eat before our reservation at The Aviary. The staff members in the restaurant, Asiate, were extremely accommodating. We had a spectacular view of Central Park both mornings we went there for breakfast. The fitness center was well-appointed. In general, I had heard great things about this hotel, and I must say, my experience at the hotel actually exceeded my already high expectations.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Beautiful hotel in a wonderful location,  the only flaw you need to take an elevator to arrive to the hotel the reception is on the 35 floor (but on the contrary the room for this reason are all with a good view)  and the air conditioning is too high inside, my suggestion bring a jumper.

title: Great view, perfect staff

We went to New York for the 30th birthday of my fiancée and In-Room Dining Director Mr. Chazen and Front Office Manager Mr. Sugiura helped me to surprise. Thank you so much!

title: The Greatest Luxury Hotel Experience I've Ever Had in Manhattan
text:
As a very frequent monthly traveler to NYC who has stayed at most of the top luxury hotels including Four Seasons, The Plaza, Regis, One Central Park(great green hotel), Lotte Palace Towers, Dominick(best views and food in SOHO) I had the best experience ever.  The lunch and room service was exceptional with lots of options for vegetarians.  
I left my valuables in the room safe by mistake and checked out.  I realized this hours later and when I called and spoke to the concierge/security they advised me they had my items and they would FedEX them to me the next day.  The staff is so honest and helpful I will forever be grateful.  My new favorite spot in the city and fantastic views of central park.

title: Estupendo
text:

La ubicación es fantástica y el hotel tiene un buen servicio
Las vistas al río hudson y central park desde los pisos altos son fantásticas

title: Disappointing for MO standard
text: My most recent stay in New York was at the Peninsula and I didn’t return as the hotel felt tired...we came to the MO and sadly the very same can be said for here too. The room was large and very clean, but furniture was worn and old, and  facilities like the elevators, communal corridors etc all felt old and in need of updating. The gym was ok, as was the pool, but not particularly 5 star. The bar has fabulous views of Central Park but that too felt...tired! Service at the hotel was super and staff are lovely, but if I walked in off the street I would never have said it belonged to this chain. Come on guys, you’ve got the staff, you’ve got the location - bring the hotel up to standard!!

title: The Best in NY
text:
Don’t miss the amazing experience in this excellent hotel.
Exceptional location, friendly staff, tasty food at the breakfast restaurant.
Everything is around you, CVS, Walgreen and the mall is located down the hotel.
The whole food market is in the basement floor and central park is across the street.
This will be my choice in future trips to New York.
Thank you everyone in this awesome place.

title: Excellent
text:
Excellent on so many counts - service, room quality, views, food, spa. 
I definitely would like to go back. The only drawback is that the entire hotel is on very high floors - which some people may not like.  There are porters on the ground floor to help you but in any case you need to use two lifts to get to your room. They welcome you with amazing green tea - be sure to order it. 
If you’d like a classic New York breakfast with spectacular views - this is the place. Very elegant. 
Highly recommended.

title: Great location and facilities
text: Located right on Columbus Circle with Central Park a few meters away. Well appointed hotel with excellent staff. Has a proper pool. Great views of city and park. Comfortable room, well appointed. Lower level shops very convenient.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: The best hotel I stayed at up to now. The view is  spectacular. The only thing that I did not like is the mustard stain on the couch. I thinks they couldn’t remove it in time. I stayed in the penthouse with big living room and view of the Central Park. The bedroom is clean and comfortable.

title: Aging and very expensive Beauty
text:
What should I say - the location and view is just stunning. I got a nice room with a perfect view on the park (except for a part that is blocked by another hotel in front). Unfortunately, all the very high (guess 30 floors) are residential and not rented to guests). I was a quite disappointed to hear that I cannot get an complimentary upgrade from the highest room category to a suite because of an internal policy. Paid upgrade would have doubled the price and given almost no discount on list price.

Rooms and all public spaces seem quite aged and need to be renovated within next years to keep up. In Aviary, all tables have deep scratches, and the room decor is quite worn. Also, you had to switch off lights individually and there is no electric curtains or so. Bathroom doesn't have rain shower. Stuff I'd expect nowadays from top notch hotels.

If the service wouldn't have been this great, fast and welcoming, I would have rated this only with 3. Service was really exceptionally great.

title: Stunning
text: Everything is perfect.  Super-friendly staff. Perfect rooms.  GREAT shower.  Lounge with incredible views overlooking Columbus Circle and Central Park. Wonderful food. Pretty penny, so be prepared for that!  Always a joy.

title: Can't beat the location or the service
text: I stayed at the MONY partly because of its good reputation but mainly because I was in town for three different events and I could easily travel to all of them by subway from the hotel and avoid traffic.  The location is, obviously, super convenient to many attractions and areas of NYC.  My room was surprisingly not-small and it was well appointed, good-looking and comfortable with a beautiful view.  The bathroom layout and shower were great.  The two room service meals I ordered were excellent.  The service was almost perfect.  There is coffee available in the morning either by the front desk on the 35th floor or the restaurant will give you a to-go cup.  I also like that housekeeping puts ice in your ice bucket every day so when you get back to the room at the end of the day, it's there waiting for you.  The only service failure was when I called to housekeeping to ask for a small scissors, and the scissors were never sent.  The gym is adequate but too small; the hotel should re-locate the front desk and expand the gym in that area.  In all, I was very pleased with my stay and will be back.

title: Outstanding service befit of the 5 star
text:
Everything about this hotel works, service is second to none, rooms and quality of furnishings are exactly on par for ultimate luxury. Nothing is too much trouble and make sure you spend some time in the bar with the outstanding views!
Only spent two nights here but will use this hotel again as it’s location is perfect for a typical tourist visit. 
They do have a car service, you just need to ask.

title: Absolute Perfection!
text: My fiancé and I came to the Mandarin Oriental while we were eloping. We had a terrible experience at the hotel that we previously booked so had to check out. I called the Mandarin and their amazing staff got us a fabulous room. They welcomed us with champagne and strawberries, they helped us with every need and they made us feel so special on our special day.

title: Amazing
text: The rooms were amazing -- amenities, views, decor, location.  The public spaces were terrific -- the Aviary, the Office, the spa, the lobby. We were there for less than a week, but it seemed like a sad farewell leaving friends by the time we checked out.  Can't recommend this place enough!

title: Outstanding
text:
