From our initial greeting to the email from the general manager as a follow up of our visit, every encounter with the staff here was five star and caring. 
And the lobby, lounge and restaurant have the greatest views(35th floor overlooking Central Park) in a luxury environment anywhere in Manhattan. 
Our room was superior but not drop dead. 
Next time, we will ask for a corners Hudson River view. 
Can’t wait.

title: Substandard a to be avoided Mandarin
text:
Substandard to be avoided Mandarin

Context: I am a MO Fan, have lived in a MO for more than and stayed under my name or my significant other in many properties. This tells you that the MO is actually on my good side. My significant other pushed her favored hotel, I lived in NY for some time but stayed only in pre-booked hotels ever since. I wanted to check out the MO so I pushed for it.

Our agent booked a room that would get us the MO upgrade to a 950$ room. The upgrade happened. 

Findings:
See attached pictures. I am still totally baffled by the poorly maintained room that was run down, tapestry rolling off,  smears and dust everywhere. The room was gloomy and dreary even with all lights on and the sun out in full. Reality is a mile off the photoshopped web version. That's not unusual, yet I can say that visual gap at the MO in HK is nothing like what I experienced in NY. The same goes for the furniture and bathroom hardware/shower that is made to look high end, yet it's more common to flimsy budget department stores than what one would be used to from high priced premium brand hotels.

Worst of all:
I practically had to live in an elevator shaft due to the constant elevator noise that could be day and night, and EXTREEMLY annoying. 950$ for a room that has an elevator running through it day and night?! My wife had a friend join her, she experienced the same noise in a different room, and my wife was equally annoyed my the rolling elevator sound. So I am not a hypochondriac making a fuss. 

The MO NY did not drop on our list of NY hotels. It's now #1 on the list of to be avoided by all means hotels in NY; within the category of 5 star premium brand hotels. Rooms of the quality we experienced go for around 350$ if you do your homework, which I obviously did not do. 

I hope this feedback leads to a few empty rooms per year and helps others from overpaying for a hotel that's not worth it. 

I am writing this while residing in the MO HK as we speak. That's a real MO!

title: Request Not Honoured (But the view was nice...)
text:
We chose this hotel because it was recommended by various websites as having a great view. I made our reservation over the phone a long time before our trip, asking for a room as high up as possible and near the southern corner of the building. I confirmed this request by email a week later, confirmed it about a month before the trip, then called two days before our arrival to specify our request again. Each time we were told: "We can't hold a specific room for you, but it shouldn't be a problem." When we finally got there, we were given a choice between a room more or less facing south but TEN FLOORS below the top, or a room 4 floors below the top, but facing north. I don't see why the hotel can't honour a simple request for someone who is staying 5 nights in one of the highest categories of rooms.
Once we had checked in and deposited our luggage in the room which did indeed have a nice view (though not the one we were expecting), we went back into the lobby and asked to enter the bar just to take a look for a few seconds. We were told that this WAS NOT POSSIBLE! At the restaurant, the hostess allowed us to take 2 steps in, but then ushered us out! We were told that this is hotel policy, but what did they think we were going to do? Stand on top of the other guests? To be treated as a potential troublemaker when you are just asking for a discreet visit is rather insulting.
On the positive side, when we did enter the restaurant the next morning for breakfast, the staff was very nice, and Brian at the front desk was very helpful.

title: Absolutely LOVED Our Stay at the MO NY!
text:
We had been planning a spring break trip for a little while and settled on NYC. We split our trip into 3 nights near Central Park and 3 nights near the World Trade Center. During our Central Park stay, we chose the Mandarin Oriental New York because of the great reviews, views and pool. Yes - it has an indoor pool!! It is one of very select few hotels in the city that does. And the location can not be beat. Walking distance to Central Park, it is also attached to the Shops at Columbus Circle / Time Warner Center including a Whole Foods. Super convenient!

Service from check in to check out and everything in between has been flawless. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the doormen where they collected our luggage and directed us to the 35th floor for check-in. At check-in, we were given an upgrade to a Premier Central Park view room on the 45th floor by friendly front desk staff because we booked through a travel agent that had access to MO’s “Fan Club” rates. She explained all the perks of the rate at the MO like upgrade at check-in, complimentary breakfast for 2 people, and $100 food or spa credit. 

There is a separate elevator bank that take you to the rooms near the spa. After 7 pm, you have to use your key card. All the rooms at the MO are the same size but with slightly different layouts (except the suites - but they don’t generally comp upgrade to suites, so you gotta shell out money for those). Anyway, since we were there for our kiddo’s birthday week, they gave us a rollaway bed at no extra charge. There were a couple books in the room for the kids that we were able to bring home too. The king bed room was the perfect size to add a rollaway and we still had space to stretch out a tiny bit. The room is big for NYC standards and had a separate bathtub and shower. Online said they had some bathtub toys for kids, but when we called they didn’t have any - just bath safety items (whale themed nonslip mat, knee pad for the parents, spigot cover, drain cover, and thermometer) which was nice too and appreciated. We hardly heard any hallway or outside noise during our stay.

We chose to eat at in-room dining for our breakfast and one of the dinners. The food is always excellent, but they sometimes forgot to bring certain items though they were quick to send them up when we called back. As for coffee - no, there are no coffee makers in the room. You can either buy coffee through room service OR if you call guest services, they will bring you an old school coffee maker and coffee grinds (the maker and coffee arrive separate) so you can make your own coffee. These are not pods, so you kind of had to experiment a little with water and amount of grinds. For us, 2 bottles of drinking water and the entire bowl of coffee brewed the perfect cup of Joe.

Another perk of the hotel is its complimentary house car available to all guests on a first come first served basis within about a 10 block radius. We had the same driver when we went to Times Square for the M&M store and then again a different day to Nobu Fifty Seven. It was such a great service to have a friendly and professional driver available for these trips. He was awesome! Nice small talk conversation and even gave us some helpful tips for our visit. There are also water bottles and wet wipes in the car. Don’t forget to tip - these guys deserve it! Really refreshing, especially after experiencing some not so friendly or professional uber drivers. FYI - the MO car service doesn’t pick back up though, only drop-off service.

And last but not least, the pool and fitness center on the 36th floor. It is open to all guests. It’s not huge, but quite adequate. Attendants check you in on your first visit and then remember you the rest of your stay. There is a fruit tray right outside the pool and an infused water dispenser in the fitness center. The pool is a long narrow lap pool that starts at 3.5’ and ends at 4’. The attendants are also lifeguards so they watch you while you swim or play. They even had a couple kick boards, pool noodles, and toddler life vest you can borrow during your swim. They also check to see if you need any water bottles when you leave. We were super impressed with the amenities and the staff.

Overall, we could not have asked for a better introduction to NYC. The Mandarin Oriental New York was the perfect 5-star hotel for our stay. We are now continuing our stay near the World Trade Center and wish we were back at the MO. The staff, service and amenities just cannot be beat! Thank you for a great stay!

title: Great Views, View is Imperative, VERY EXPENSIVE
text:
This was my second stay at this property within a few months. It's one of the best in NYC. My thoughts are best broken down into the following bullet points:

35th FLOOR/RECEPTION:
- Lobby, reception and bar are top-tier. 
- Francesca (sp?) at the front desk is the best employee at the hotel. Outgoing, warm and enthusiastic she is one of the top reasons for returning.
- The hotel bar (Aviary) is frustrating as it is a bit of a tourist attraction in and of itself. While it's annoying you can't just saunter up to a table, I've had no issues requesting one an hour or two in advance from the concierge. 
- The drinks at the aforementioned Aviary are amazing. Really creative and fun. The price point is expensive to the extreme, especially for the food. They are charging, on average, $20-$30 for a few bites. For 5 of us, each having two drinks and a couple bites, it wound up being $600. I almost fell over.

ROOM:
- When compared to other hotels of this price point, the rooms feel a bit dated: No designated USB ports, lots of light switches as opposed to an integrated system, etc. 
- The bed and linens were a tier or two below what you'd expect. It was hard and springy. Linens rough and unpleasant. Oddly, I was able to move from a "Hudson River view" to a "Central Park View" and the linens in the new room seemed quite a bit softer than the previous ones. It was odd. You'd think they'd be consistent throughout. This newer view also made the room seem quite a bit larger thanks to a revised layout that widened the room while placing the bathroom nearer the corridor. 
- Bathrooms are spacious and nice. You'd think the tubs would be a little larger but they are manageable. 

ETC:
- The laundry is the most expensive I've encountered. Overnight service for a couple shirts and socks came to $200. No idea if it was a billing error or not, but it was insanely expensive for some basic cleaning sans a suit or tux.

title: Lovely hotel - poor check in not typical of exceptional staff care and beautiful rooms
text: A beautiful hotel with exceptional views, lovely rooms and truly first rate service apart from the check in clerk who was stressed by phone calls and failed to alert us to the benefits from the Fan loyalty membership I had arranged.  Spa is exceptional too.  Highly recommended.

title: Exceptional Service
text:
In a city where hotel service can be hit or miss, particularly at the high end, the MO stands out for truly exceptional service.  The staff are gracious, competent, and unfailingly helpful.  More than that though, they truly care about the quality of the guest experience.  My experience was, if they can do something to make your stay better, they will.

The location is fantastic, with Central Park across the street, a private entrance to Time Warner Center, and subway station 100 yards away.  Upper West Side and  the restaurants of Hells Kitchen are a very easy walk away.

Rooms are on the smaller side for a premium hotel, and the Hudson River view rooms are a bit exposed to the hallway for my taste.  If this bothers you, book a Park view instead. Bed was extremely comfortable, and linen and towels are absolutely top quality.

Special thanks to Alex and Yolaris at the front desk, and Christopher at in room dining, all of whom helped make my stay especially pleasant.

I will look forward to returning.

title: Mandarin Oriental will spoil you

text: Overall, I do not think you can beat the location of this hotel.  Check in was wonderful, the lobby is quite impressive. Huge television and décor you would expect from MO.  The bed was not a comfy as I expected for a hotel of this caliber.  Views were stunning and housekeeping did a nice job.  Had issue with room service, and the follow up was not great.  Spa is by far the best in NYC and one of the best in the world.  See separate review of the spa as it is my favorite place on earth. title: 3 Nights in NY
text:
MO is in a class by itself. It is a well managed hotel, very polite staff and lovely spacious rooms and common spaces. Excellent location opposite Central Park, walking distance to the theatre district, Lincoln Center, great shopping within the the multilevel Time Warner building. The westside neighborhood offers very good shopping (chains and boutiques) and local restaurants. 

The view from the room, restaurant and lounge overlook Central Park, the city skyline from Central Park South to 5th Avenue on the east side.

Upon arriving in the ground floor lobby our suitcases were whisked away and we were directed to take an elevator to the 35th floor where we were warmly greeted by reception.  After registration we were escorted to our room on the 42nd floor.  All along the front desk person talked about the hotel and how the access cards work.  Once in the room it was fairly straightforward how things worked and soon thereafter our luggage arrived as did complimentary hot tea.

When booking our reservation we were given a choice of rooms facing Central Park or the Hudson River. As all of the rooms are on high floors they are relatively quiet from any street noise, however,  we did on occasion hear a screaming kid running up the hallway which is surprising as one doesn’t hear any noise from the rooms next door. 

Beside being a spacious room with king bed, there was a long, comfortable chaise lounge by the floor to ceiling windows overlooking the park. The bed was extremely comfortable (not too firm and not too soft) and the edges of the mattress were reinforced to prevent sagging from sitting on the edge of the mattress and rolling over (if sleeping on one’s side). The bed linens and pillow fill were very nice as were the towels.  The room has an accurate thermostat and we were able to set the temperature to our liking.  There is complimentary water and turn down services. My only suggestions would be to add a night light and exhaust fan in the bathroom.

The decor is contemporary with tasteful, oriental accents, indoor plants and orchids, and nothing is over the top. The curated colours, textures and design are elegant, calming and rich.

The restaurant has an excellent array of food offerings and service is of a high standard. We did experience some families with screaming and crying children that were indifferent to others in the lovely restaurant. It’s accepted that young, affluent families stay in nice hotels, however, MO might want to consider a policy for under the age of 12 children where families can dine separately from couples and power meeting breakfasts. It’s a very mellow restaurant and the lack of mindfulness doesn’t project the MO allure.

There is no traditional lobby. Instead MO offers a scenic lounge on the 35th floor adjacent to the restaurant and reception area which is the perfect place for cocktails and small snacks. Reservations for drinks during cocktail hour are recommended especially if you’d like to sit near the window seats.  The  afternoon we arrived, we observed a few very loud children standing on the leather sofas in the lounge. Perhaps MO should consider a safe, designated playroom where children can express themselves without projecting themselves on other guests.    

It was a lovely 3 day weekend and by far the nicest hotel we’ve stayed in NY. As we visit NY quite frequently, we hope to make MO our new go to hotel as it had everything we could hope for and more.

title: Special Place
text:
I am a fan of this hotel collection but never seem to stay with them enough. This hotel in New York is top notch and rivals the best in the city. Location and views from the common areas, restaurants and conference rooms is quite spectacular. 

The condition of the room was outstanding. While not particularly large (nothing is in Manhattan), the art, linens and other amenities were top notch. Service as you might guess was also excellent. 

Impressed and will be back.

title: Un bel ricordo
text:
Ci sono stata qualche anno fa. Ho un ricordo bellissimo... Tutto era perfetto e la suite da sogno...
Ci siamo capitati per caso dopo esser scappati dal Ritz.. Il personale era impeccabile... La vista strepitosa...la pulizia eccellente...

title: Treated like a queen
text: Every time I stay at the Mandarin Oriental, I am treated like royalty coming home.  I am spoiled by the royal treatment, and really don't want to stay at any other hotels.  I can't wait to return.  The hotel is beautiful, comfortable and the staff is fantastic.

title: Everything and more... High 5’s all around
text:
A super experience again at a Mandarin Property...
From the moment we got out of the cab from the airport to the minute we got in the cab, back to the airport every single interaction with anyone on the Mandarin staff crushed it! Crushed it!!!!!
I’d recommend getting reservations for the restaurants and bars because it does get
crowded.
I’m not going to say anything about the SpeakEasy either (oops....) but if you like perfectly made Perfect Manhattans just ask Diane to make you one, or two or three!
Seriously not one bad thing to say and that’s a rarity in hotels of any level. 
Well done and thanks for a great Anniversary/Birthday trip. I’m sad we had to leave....

title: Big fan of Mandarin Oriental
text:
Unfortunately I have not stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in New York but have been to their bar a couple of times.

Like to go here to get a drink and enjoy the nice view of (part of) Central Park.

Having stayed at Mandarin Oriental in Singapore (which was amazing) I am sure a stay here would be fantastic.

title: Total Luxury
text: Spent the weekend at the hotel and it certainly did not disappoint!! The staff could not have been more accommodating.  If you are going to NYC for the weekend this should be your must hotel to stay.  You will not be disappointed.

title: First class hotel.
text: Luxurious hotel well run and sweet. The rooms are smallish, though pretty big by NYC standards. I stayed in a junior suite (which is not a suite, just a bigger room) which was lovely, but then also stayed in the Hudson Suite, which is a magnificent, huge, two room masterpiece with views everywhere. It's on the West side by Columbus Circle, great location to get to everything in midtown and easy to the subway if you're going far downtown. The room service isn't Michelin star but it's good, and the espressos are great. The views top notch, and the overall fell of the rooms super cozy in the best way. It's pricey - not for the faint of heart, but if you can afford it...sigh. I do love this hotel.

title: Night at the Opera
text: Stayed at this hotel when in NYC for the opera at the Met. Staff took care of our every need and made us feel special and welcomed. Especially impressive was the free shuttle to Port Authority when we were tight on time to catch our bus home. The Aviary bar is a must with creative drinks and a great view of Central Park.

title: Great view but certain things should be better
text: I’ve booked a premier room with the park view for this trip. The check-in was a little difficult this time- we couldn’t check in at 3pm since the previous guests smoked at the two rooms they showed us and we didn’t want to have a room with strong smell. When we got back to the hotel at 6pm (when the room was supposed to be ready) and the room still wasn’t ready they offered a discount on one of their suites for the incovenience caused and because we were loyal guests. In the end we checked in a corner suite with the park view. Our suite was spacious and beautiful. They remodeled the rooms about 1.5year ago and the style and the color palette is a bit different than before- not too oriental. We enjoyed the stay and the service was great too.

title: No sense of service
text: When a hotel charges you beyond 500usd per night for a room and tries to charge you an extra 18usd to lend you a iPhone charger for the night I think we can say they ignore what the word service means. Never go there!

title: Mandarin Oriental
text: As always, the Front Office staff especially Manager Kent was very courteous and  welcoming.  They did an excellent job in checking us in and helping us settle down in our suite.  The Bell man was quick to help us with our luggages and delivered  them to our room promptly. This hotel is full of wonderful surprises in terms of suites.  Each time we visited, we found a suite that we loved.  No matter what kind of suite we stayed in,  they were all very spacious and they ALL have spectacular views even though they were very different in size and decorations .  And very importantly, they are ALL on HIGH floors, guaranteeing  you a good night 's sleep :) The air condition was quiet.  The water flow of shower was great.  The Suite was kept very  clean and very well organized.  We loved MO's welcoming amenities.  We loved their Suites.  They are great for a small family as well as for a big family :)The food and the service at Asiate (the restaurant inside the Hotel) were excellent.  I had the Long Island Duck -  the best non-roasted duck ever.  According to my family members, the Lamb Loin and the Wagyu Beef were incredibly delicious too. What is more, the Staff at Mandarin Oriental NYC were wonderful people.  They were incredibly kind and they welcomed you as if you were their families or relatives.Our stay at Mandarin Oriental has been a wonderful and incomparable experience.  Thank you.We will definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and families.  And we will definitely return (hopefully soon) .

title: Localização e quartos excelentes
text: Excelente localização , com vista belíssima e privilegiada da Columbus e central park. Quarto moderno! banheira e ducha, amenities Limpíssimo e serviço impecável! Lazer ou negócios , excelente opção .  até da manhã maravilhoso! Vale incluir na diária

title: An extraordinary hotel
text: This is the second time I have stayed un the Mandarin Oriental NY, and the second time was exacly because of the first. This hotel was a discovery I made just  by accident. Some years ago I was in NY, and I was walking on sixth street when I saw a man dressing like a doorman of a hotel, but the building did not seem like a normal hotel. Inquired, the doorman told that it indeed was a hotel, with a litle difference: it started on the 35th floor! Then I decided to see by myself. What a wonderful lounge,with an incredible view, and when I saw the restaurant I was flabbergasted. As to the rooms and all the other amenities I only have to applaud

title: Beautiful views
text:
I had been wanting to stay at this hotel for a long time because of the views and location (I stay in New York often), however, I always wound up staying elsewhere. That said, the views and location did wind up being amazing, though there was not much else that was outstanding about the hotel. The main restaurant, Asiate, does have a beautiful view and a chef’s tasting menu that was good. The bar next to the restaurant definitely has an incredible view too. FYI check in is on the 35th floor. 

The location is ideal for seeing a show in Times Square, shopping or just going for a walk around Central Park. 

The rooms are average size, and the Hudson River view room has a good sized bathroom with a separate soaking tub overlooking the city. The bathroom does offer nice little extra amenities such Az bath salts, a shaving kit and a dental kit in case you forgot something.

The rooms do not offer complimentary coffee or water, which I find surprising for a hotel that costs over 1k per night.

Overall it was a lovely hotel, but for 1k+ a night there are other hotels in the city that I would return to before returning to this one.

title: A property lacking interest!
text:
I visited this hotel several times in the past and I considered one of the best hotels in town. 
Unfortunately not anymore!
Of course is expensive but that is not the problem
Service is correct but not outstanding. Facilities are not up to date.
Not even a coffeemaker in the room. You can order a coffee for a mere 12$ and some waiting time...
Breakfast is disappointed too. Average food with little variety. Of course good views if you are near the windows.
In summary, this is perhaps the worst mandarín oriental I stayed. But is New York.

title: My home in New York City
text: The Mandarin Oriental, New York City is not only a spectacular property, but it is has the best service in town! Everyone greets you with a smile and makes your stay feel very special. The property is visually stunnnig and located adjacted to Columbus Circle/Time Warner Cente Central Park. Whether for business or pleasure, The only place I will ever stay in NYC.

title: Average
text:
We book a suite for a special occasion and travelled to NY. 
Don't take me wrong, suite was wonderful and totally worth the price.
there was a little bit of lack of atmosphere in the overall building, nut sure if it was due to the very young ( and very fashionable) staff or because of the product or lighting in the building.
we had a couple of drinks in the evening and the view was defenetely an highlight of our stay. 
Next time we may look probably at something slightly more traditional in terms of hotel style but it is a wonderful address anyway !

title: Exceptional
text: My wife and I stayed here for a week. It exceeded our (high) expectations. Excellent in so many ways. The staff at the front desk enhanced our visit to New York. One little problem - a mistaken wake up call at 4am. More care needed! But overall a memorable stay.

title: La più bella vista “su” Central Park.
text: Uno degli alberghi più belli di NY e con un bar incredibile, a picco dal 35 piano su Central Park con un servizio attento come il ristorante attiguo. Vista esagerata , da non mancare.Mercatini di Natale e uno dei centri commerciali più belli in Columbus Circus.

title: Stunning
text: Great location right next to Central Park and Columbus circus. Rooms have a great view as well and the service is outstanding. NY has many great hotels but this definitely stands out. Highly recommend this place and will be back.

title: Amazing location
text:
Great food and service.
Cons Spa policy cancelation (min 24h) so same day cancelation would be charged.
Concierge services average didn't really impressed me compared to other 5 stars I've been in the past

title: Amazing experience the best spa in New York
text: I recently visited the Mandarin Spa, the service is incredible, all the staff treat you like a king, I couldn't recommend this more highly. The pool is amazing, all the facilities are top notch. I will be back soon!

title: Very well run
text:
There's a great deal to be said about a well-run hotel, esp. in the luxury category. When you add to this the fact that the hotel is new and extremely well maintained, the rooms are large (for NYC) and the position is great, it's really an unbeatable combination. We recently spent 3 days here, celebrating our anniversary. Even though we're locals, we wanted to treat ourselves and chose the hotel b/c it has a wonderful spa and a long pool. To our surprise (it's not advertised) it also has a sauna. Although the hotel was full, we were mostly alone in the pool, and the spa was not overly crowded. The rooms with Central Park views were sold out when we booked, but this extremely helpful guy at the front desk found one for us (a room that is normally part of a suite, but was not being used as such). So call them if your room of choice is sold out, they might find a solution. The view towards Central Park is amazing!

A special kudos to house-keeping. I'm not sure we've ever seen bathrooms that shiny or carpets that clean. Also, unlike every other hotel we've stayed in, they organized our toiletries in helpful ways (I'm constantly annoyed when someone un-does my arrangements, but these people made them better). 

We got exactly what we were hoping from our stay here: a few relaxed days with long swimming and gym sessions, a few luxurious hours in the spa, great views, and just steps from two of our favorite bakeries (Bouchon and Kayser). Having stayed in a fair number of expensive but not well run hotels, we fully appreciate the difference great management makes. We'll definitely trust this chain in the future.

title: Top service
text: Every time I go to New York I choose this hotel as it’s very convenient location the bars are the best in town the staff always offered the best service ever and even the hotel is top luxury the miracle is whatever u wear the staff would be always very human and always have a close attitude to the client for them to feel at Home

title: One of the best hotel experiences.
text: Came out for one night for out anniversary . one of the best hotel experiences. room was very clean. great layout .The views were amazing. i definitely will be coming back in the near future. staff was very pleasent . over all great experience.

title: Not worth the money
text: I paid 1400$ for 1 night . They don't even giving you a complimentary coffee machine in the room!!!!!! You only pay for the location.  So do yourself a favor and save the money.  There's a bunch of nice hotels in that area for half the price.

title: Great people with a great hotel
text: Mandarin NY is a great place to stay during a business or leisure trip. In the perfect location too. A bonus is the swimming pool at the hotel. The staff is almost on step a head of your needs and sensible for what is important for you as a guest.

title: Five star experience
text:
Mandarin oriental gives you an excellent and professional service, from the moment you check in to check out. 

Great view over Central Park and Columbus circle. The connoisseur service arranged ticket to the metropolitan as well as helped plan our dinner reservation. 

Pay a visit to The hotel bar, it is excellent and so is the office.

It was also extra special to meet a Swedish staff, who made our stay even more enjoyable.

I highly recommend this elegant five star hotel.

title: As Usual, The Mandarin Oriental Provides an Unparalleled Level of Excellence
text: I cannot say enough positive things about this property and its amenities! Location is great, restaurant is excellent, and staff and helpful and knowledgeable about the city. You don't have to wait for anything from check in to check out your wish is their command. If you are looking for 5 star luxury in Manhattan, this is the place to go!

title: Bigoted Dismissive Staff That Is Most Odd
text: The staff made it clear my party was not welcome because of someone’s heritage. Buying a substantial number of nights at Mandarin Oriental I was surprised. I myself think well of the brand and think the employees were having an off night as offensive as it was. However, the spite was palpable. Noted!

title: Un magnifique Hôtel au cœur de NY!
text:
Nous avons séjourné en Juin dans ce magnifique Hôtel, 

Ma fiancée et moi avons reçu un accueil digne des plus grands établissements!
Que ce soit les portiers, l’accueil, le service de chambre, ou les responsables.

Nous avons à chaque instant ressentis un sentiment d’exclusivité, et de professionnalisme. 
 
Avec un emplacement idéal, sur Central Park. Une vue imprenable sur New-York.

Le petit-déjeuner à été un moment magique, comme le dîner sous cloche le soir dans la chambre, et un moment piscine privilégié au milieu des grattes-ciels.

Nous avons, et ce grâce à l'équipe du  Mandarin Oriental, New York, passé un séjour magique et inoubliable. 

Merci.

title: 抜群の利便性！
text:
優れた利便性が売りのホテルです。どこに行くにも便利で安全なコロンバスサークルの角に位置し、セントラルパークを一望できます。尚且つホテルの3階から繋がっている隣接の商業施設の地下1階にはWhole Foods Marketが入っていて、食材から日用品
、お土産まで手軽に済ませられます。私達は軽食を買ってセントラルパークでピクニックを楽しみました。ルームサービスや施設内の食事は一般的ですが、親切で有能なコンシェルジュが揃っていることは特筆すべき点です。ミュージカルやライブ情報、チケット手配まで適切にこなしてくれますので、是非現地でホットな情報を聞いてみては如何でしょうか。

title: Fantastic
text:
We stayed here for 9 nights and it was amazing. Particularly the service.

The location is excellent right next to Central Park. Restaurant and in room dining also is great.

One of the best hotels we’ve stayed at.

title: Top
text: Great location on South Park west with nice view around. Rooms are spacious and very comfortable, and quite insulated from the surrounding noise. Facilities are in excellent condition but style seems to get oldish. Excellent service and friendly staff. Breakfast was Ok but not great, a bit slow and not offering a wide choice as customary in this hotel category. Gym facilities were well maintained but not overly spacious.

title: A Stay I Would Like To Forget
text:
At $1500/night for an MO flagged hotel in NYC, the management’s lack of response to our difficulties was surprising if not downright awful.

We spent one full week in room 5126 Saturday to Saturday last week in the hotel. The room was noisy all the time because of its proximity to the room service and housekeeping elevator and storage rooms.

We specifically requested a room away from the elevators and housekeeping when we arrived.

We slept very little due to that noise and despite requesting another room or a discount on the terrible room we received, our requests were ignored.

I booked this hotel through AMEX Travel and will not likely repeat the stay even though I make many trips to NYC for work.

I will be advising AMEX of these issues as well.

Suggest others take heed and look for alternatives if the hotel will not provide you a room away from housekeeping, room service and elevators or credit your per night stay due to the inconvenience. 

Not 5 star.....in my experience...Sorry MO.

title: Beautiful hotel!
text: We stayed here for a couple of nights in February. The location was very convenient for the subway and a shopping center on your doorstep if that’s what you enjoy doing. The hotel overlooks Central Park and some rooms are overlooking the Hudson River with a good views of the city. The rooms are beautifully decorated and immaculate. I would highly recommend enjoying a cocktail or two at The Lobby Lounge. Very tasty! We also enjoyed a run through Central Park which was a good way to see all the sights without taking up too much of your day. Definitely worth a visit! High end luxury!

title: Un momento memorable en NYC
text: Si tienen la suerte de estar en una habitación con vista al Central Park y a New Jersey y pueden observar el atardecer desde allí entenderán por que digo que es una experiencia memorable. Este hotel es el epítome del lujo, buen gusto, la atención de los Concierge y la conveniencia de la ubicación hace que sea una opción excelente a la hora de hospedarse en NYC.

title: family holiday
text: The hotel is very centrally located on Columbus Circle right next to the Columbus Mall and across the road from central park. Superb Location. Excellent facility and the staff is very courteous and helpful. The conceirge are one of the best, very helpful and knowledgeable i have seen in the business. The one bedroom suites are superb and beautifully designed with a huge lounge and seating area and spacious nicely designed bedrooms. The bathrooms are very spacious with rain shower cabinets, bathtub and automatic WC. The room service quality of food is also very good and the housekeeping service is outstanding. Overall a superb experience.

title: Fabulous hotel has a fabulous restaurant
text:
One of the best views in NYC...
Food is first rate....expensive....
It is a Peaceful room....quiet...great place to have a conversation..
A romantic dinner....a business meeting 
Great service....
Excellent fish...
Wonderful dessert

title: Bar très cher et décevant
text: Par rapport aux "rooftops", la vue de ce bar n'est pas extraordinaire. Les cocktails sont très chers et il n'est pas possible de commander un cocktail ne figurant pas sur la carte. Nous avons donc opté pour un "Gin and tonic" composé de Chartreuse et de jus de concombre...!!!!

title: Another Wonderful Visit
text: I had the good fortune to be given a stay at the Mandarin Oriental has a birthday gift.  It was my second time staying at the New York property.  It was better than my last visit, if that is possible.  The staff, the decor and the beautiful view from my room of Central Park were fantastic.Very highly recommended!!

title: First class service
text:
Loved this hotel.  Stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip and it exceeded all expectations.  It had a very unique first impression as hotel check-in was located on the 35th floor.
For NYC, the room was very spacious and the unique layout made the bathroom feel really large.  Room had skyline/river/sunset views.
Service was flawless throughout the stay.  Liked the unique Asian flare throughout the hotel. Lots of black and gold with dim lighting.  
Building attached to time warner center and mall do you don’t even have to go outside.  About 1 block away from Central Park.
Would recommend to anyone.

title: M.O bar
text: My boyfriend and I visited the bar for a drink. As a young couple we found the service was impeccable from start to finish as we were served by George who made our experience even better and went over and above

title: Bar caché au 35eme étage
text:
Je vais dans cet hôtel non pas pour y dormir ou y manger mais pour prendre mes cocktails dans un speakeasy. Et oui, si vous allez au 35 eme étage, vous arrivez dans un bar-restaurant avec une superbe vue mais ce n’est pas ça le plus incroyable mais le bar caché.
Et oui juste derrière la cuisine se trouve une porte ou derrière un spongieux bar vous attend avec un personnel aux petits soins et des cocktails à tomber par terre.
La décoration est des années 50 un petit bijou.
Attention tout de même aux tarifs assez élevés $25 pour un cocktail environ.

title: Pure Luxury
text: From the moment I had arrived at the hotel staff had greeted me warmly. Manager on duty showed me to my room and explain all the facilities. I found the bed most comfortable with beautiful linen. I highly recommend staying at Mandarin Oriental NYC.

title: Hotel Mandarin NY
text: Excelente Hotel con una magnífica ubicación entre Central Park y el Rió Hudson . Para los que gustan del shopping existe uno pegado al Hotel así como una estación para tomar el metro . Su ubicación es una invitación a caminar a 15 minutos de la 5a Avenida y la calle 57

title: The best hotel in NYC
text:
Spent three days two nights in New York and the reason why this short trip were so enjoyable for my family and myself, I would said 90% is beacuse we selected one of the best hotel in the city. 
The room is located at 53th floor and the view is amazing. The Aviary is top notch and it's not just a drink in a high end place , its indeed a experience. The staff are friendly and ready to assist. The location is wonderful and convenient. Time square, central park, museums all were few blocks away. We walked to the Majestic theater for the opera in Broadway and walked to Penn station for Amtrak back to Boston. The hop on hop off bus station also 5mins away from the hotel. For people who like me 1st time here, I would said it's really helpful and make your travel much easier than take the taxi or subway. Overall, I wasn't a Fan of NYC as it's quite dirty and jam everywhere but now beacuse of MONYC,I have changed my mind, i will be back...

title: Stunning
text: Visited here today window view of central park next to trump hotel at columbus monument.this place is frequented by sharon stone,morgan freeman etc.even a back exit into shopping mall need to experience this place great staff

title: 最上階54階からのハドソン川のみえる摩天楼の景色は綺麗でした。◎５つ‼️
text: 家族でリバービューに5泊しました。場所はコロンバスサークルにあり、セントラルパークの角にあり、空港からも分かりやすいし、どこに行くにも行きやすい場所です。１階から35階の受付まで直行のエレベーターで行きます。ホテル接客は素晴らしく、滞在中に幾つか頼みましたが、全てきちんと対応して頂きました。感謝‼️お部屋はそれ程広くありませんが十分な広さです。壁一面が鏡で、最上階54階からのハドソン川のみえる摩天楼の景色は綺麗でした。朝、ハドソン川通りニューヨーク港に上がってくる豪華客船が朝日に照らされ素晴らしいでした。周りは治安がよく、リンカーンセンターやブロードウェイも近く夜中まで観劇やバーで楽しんでも安心して帰ってこれる場所でした。確かにプラザなどClassicな有名なホテルもありますが、ここは比較的新しく設備も十分でした。まあ、ＮＹはホテルが高く物価も高いので仕方ありませんが、お値段がもう少し低いといいなーと思いました。

title: Luxury with a view
text: This is undoubtedly the best hotel in New York considering its location, unparallel views of the Central Park from the top, proximity to fine dining and shopping. The staff is one of the friendliest I have encountered and made me feel at home on the other side of the earth from home! And like all Mandarin Oriental, the rooms are superbly and luxuriously comfortable

title: Holiday in NYC
text: Wonderful stay at Mandarin Oriental NYC. Can´t be much better than this. The staff is the best i´ve ever met. Location, view from the room, service was absolutely outstanding. Will be back in the future, for sure

title: Great stay
text: Stayed for the Thanksgiving week and had a great time with my family. We did not know that we needed to book for breakfast this week and that was annoying. Perfect location and very good service. Will be back

title: Incredible
text:
They are truly the standard for incredible service.  They try to bend over backwards-  room service food/coffee, turn-down service, beautiful quiet and luxurious rooms.  Couldn't have been happier.

Also upon check-in they really try to offer you what you're looking for-  they don't say "sorry", or "I'm sorry I have nothing to offer", nothing like that.  They truly strive for happy guests.

title: Best of the Best of the Best!!
text:
Fantastic service from beginning to end , the best way to experience NYC. Incredible views!! I hope to have the opportunity to experience this ultimate luxury experience!!!!
Location is exceptional, walking distance to most destinations in the city fantastic restaurants bars and shopping..

title: Concierge is amazing! Front desk weakest link.
text: Great looking hotel and service has been good. The concierge had been amazingly helpful with securing dinner reservations and lunch suggestions. However, the front desk could make some improvements. I had notified the hotel weeks in advance that I was coming with my family for our babymoon.  However, on arrival the gentleman that was checking me in was disinterested and made no acknowledgement that I was here for a special occasion. Furthermore, the couple next to me was being upgraded and given multiple room choices for their room upgrade. On the other hand,there was no mention of an upgrade for my stay despite my stay being booked with FHR program. Very limited on-site dining options and the only restaurant available for lunch has strict cut off times. We had checked into the hotel at 1:30 pm and went directly to the restaurant at 2:05 pm and was told they were no longer seating for lunch after 2:00 pm. We also had our young son with us and there was no special welcome gesture that we have come to expect from other brands like the Four seasons or The Ritz. The hotel does have a unique place to grab a cocktails at the Aviary bar. Very creative cocktails with great views! Overall, I would likely check out one of the other central Park hotels next time I come to NYC. I still enjoy the Mandarin Oriental brand but this hotel has been my least favorite one.

title: Wonderful !
text:
We had an amazing baby moon!! The entire staff was very friendly! We had a great time with my husband and my dog!!
Breakfast and dinner at the hotel was incredible !!, Great location!!! and the view was fantastic!!

title: Stylish luxury
text: MO NY is beautifully appointed with superb views over Central Park and within easy walking distance of key attractions. The bar vista on floor 35 is a must for an early evening drink and the long pool a real bonus. Over our 3 night stay the staff were invariably courteous, professional and responsive which makes a great difference on vacation, even stretching to looking after our bikes whilst we lunched.  The rooms are elegant and the beds luxuriously comfortable. Why the fallen star? Although our agent booked over 4 months in advance requesting rooms on the same floor for our daughter, we arrived tired after a 14 hour journey to be informed at 4pm, our room would not be ready until well after 5pm (check-in is allegedly 3pm).  We were eventually offered a room 4 floors away from our daughter. The shower was defective in this room. (An engineer eventually came to fix it). We found the next day, the bath taps simply didn’t work.  (An engineer came to fix this).The final day the fuse in the bathroom blew when using the hairdryer. We have stayed at MO many times in other cities - NYC not quite up there.

title: Great view poor service
text:
Someone that we had met in DC had suggested going here for a drink on the bar because the view was really good. They were right about the view it really is a good one from the 35th floor. 

The service however was really rather poor. The colleague who greeted us and showed us to a great seat was lovely and friendly. After at least five minutes another colleague came with some drinks menus and eventually some water. He didn’t seem to reappear and after about ten minutes we got someone else’s attention to order a couple of beers. These even then took quite a while to be served and when the colleague went to pour one of them he did a terrible job, creating a lot of froth and not much beer in the glass! I would have expected any server to be able to pour a beer without too much trouble! 

So it’s definitely worth a trip up to the bar for the view but don’t expect great service. It’s a shame as it has loads of potential and you’d expect better for the very expensive prices.

title: Allies top
text:
War im  MO bereits zum dritten Mal. Wir sind  zuoft enttäuscht von Hotels in NY, dass man froh ist etwas besonderes gefunden zu haben und man gerne wiederkommt.
Natürlich sind die Preise in Manhattan atemberaubend wie der Blick vom 35 Stock des Hotels. Aber in Manhattan habe ich auch die teuerste Currywurst (12 $) jemals gehabt. Da muss man durch!

title: Mandarin Oriental  - NYC
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at this hotel.  The entire staff was extremely friendly, responsive and accommodating.  If any issue came up (we had a small one with room service) it was addressed and corrected even more than was necessary - they went above and beyond to take care of things for us!

title: Disappointing
text: Stayed here on a business trip for one night. The room smelled like BO. I got in late and wanted to order room service. No room service menu in the room. I called down. Absolute chaos. They said they would send someone up with a menu. Never came. A colleague was staying on another floor and I borrowed his menu. The towels were very disappointing for a Mandarin. Not plush resort towels as you would expect. It was a less than ideal stay.

title: Up with the sun.
text: Was initially in a Central Park view room that was small and sadly mostly view of Trump Hotel. Paid upgrade to move to Premiere Central Park Suite, a room that normally goes for 2600 (?!!). The front desk was awesome in arranging my move. Truly great service! However the room itself, you hear a fair amount of noise from above. I’ve never had that in a hotel before. Just shoes on the floor above, endlessly. The much bigger issue is the blackout drapes don’t really black out. I called for someone to help at about 6am when it was already fairly bright, and maintenance agreed it seemed weird for such an expensive suite to have curtains that don’t overlap. He tried (as I did) to push them together but didn’t work. They also left gap at the wall. He offered to come back later with tape to try and tape them to the wall and together. That just seems a little low rent for Mandarin— for something a thousand dollars more than Park Hyatt’s much nicer city view suite (where I didn’t need tape!Service at Hyatt not nearly as good but sleep wins!) So in summation: staff is super nice— manager heard about curtains and at check out apologized saying he wish he knew it was issue at check in (not sure how I’d know before dawn) but small rooms and the suite (at least #4500) can’t sleep much past dawn. Wouldn’t stay here again. Really really REALLY wanted to like it. This pic is as dark as i could get in the room once sun comes up.

title: Good management makes a difference
text:
We had two suits reserved and they both were ready before check in time. First suite the sofa had bunch of stains on it, and the second suite, the sheet on the bed was dirty. I contacted the front desk manager, very responsive and caring, he personally made sure that the issues were taken care of. 
I wasn’t impressed with the hotel restaurant for dinner at all, very short menu and very small portions, but was very good for breakfast.
Overall I had a very good stay at this hotel and would recommend it.

title: Mandarin Oriental NYC
text:
My family has had a wonderful experience staying at Mandarin Oriental, New York. 

The front desk services were excellent.  The Front Office Manager Kent was extremely courteous, professional, and accommodating.  Kent and his team provided our family with lots of help and hospitality during our 3-day stay.   

We dined a few times at the Hotel's restaurant Asiate.  We loved the dinner Tasting Menu and the Sunday Brunch. And we loved the VIEW at the window seats :)  Asiate's services were excellent.   

The Hotel is at a great location.  The panoramic view in the high floor Suite are spectacular. We love everything about  Mandarin Oriental NYC.  We would definitely recommend it to our friends.

title: Vale quanto pesa... no bolso...
text: Os quartos, amplos e extremamente confortáveis, permitem vista para o Rio Hudson ou, melhor ainda, para o Central Park. O banheiro, igualmente amplo, tem aquela ducha sensacional. O hotel tem acesso direto ao Columbus Circle, o que possibilita tomar um delicioso café da manhã no centro comercial, bem como, ir aos restaurantes e fazer compras, as lojas são diversificadas - uma das lojas físicas da Amazon está localizada lá. Se não quiser se hospedar, reserve uma noite para conhecer o restaurante - a vista para o Central Park é espetacular -, principalmente, para um jantar com alguém (muito) especial. Muito próximo de uma grande estação do Metrô e do Central Park, o que garante fácil locomoção e diversão também.

title: Loved this hotel!
text: With its prime location overlooking Central Park and in the center of all activities in Manhattan, the Mandarin Oriental hotel is a great place to stay at while visiting NYC!  You can easily walk to different sites (for us, this included Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Broadway, MoMA, American Museum of Natural History, among many others! -> see my other reviews for comments on these).  Breakfast was delicious; we went down to the Asiate every morning and ordered various items on the menu - all of which we loved.  We also had room service one evening, and it was excellent and comparable to other meals in the city - just that you get to eat in the comfort of your room!  Not to mention that the room was laid out well and the view was incredible!  My only complaint was that in our particular room (not sure if it’s also the case with other rooms), the shower’s controls - hot and cold - are switched, and we didn’t realize this until later in our stay.  This is so minor though, and it didn’t dim our stay at all!  I will recommend this hotel to my friends should they also come to New York.  Don’t even think about it - just book!

title: Très bel hôtel avec vue sur Central Park
text:
Nous avons pass trois nuits au Mandarin Oriental. L'hôtel est parfaitement situé à l'entrée de Central Park. La réception se trouve au 35ème étage de la tour.
Les chambres sont très propres et de standing avec une vue superbe sur New York.
Le petit déjeuner est délicieux (prix à la carte, comptez +- 35$/personne) et offre également une très belle vue sur la ville. La piscine est très agréable après une journée de visite sous 28°C.
Le prix me semble un peu excessif au regard de certains autres hôtels de même catégorie mais bon c'est un hôtel de luxe face à central Park!

title: Drinks in 35 th floor lounge
text: After a bike ride around Central Park we wanted a drink that could take in the views of it all. So after asking in trump tower they sent us here. Wow what a hotel !!! The place is truly stunning. Drinks were great with some truffle popcorn!!!!  Amazing views of Central Park which is the cherry on top .  £1350 a night to stay there is out of my range but if you got it .......

title: Love this Hotel
text: The Mandarin Oriental at Columbus Circle in NYC is an outstanding hotel.  The front desk, bell, housekeeping and wait staff go above & beyond to ensure a perfect stay.  The rooms are spacious and comfortable with great views on any floor.  The hotel is centrally located with valet parking.  A beautiful lobby level lounge and tucked away speakeasy features creative and delicious food & drink.  I would stay at the Mandarin again on my next overnight in NYC.

title: Great location and top notch service
text: This was our second visit to MO New York and although nothing has changed, the good news is that nothing has changed. The hotel is beautiful and well kept, staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and you can’t beat the location. It’s a great place to walk around, Central Park is directly across the street and numerous other sites within a short distance. I’d highly recommend the MO if you’re in NYC

title: Unforgettable Stay
text: We travelled to NY in early morning and front office was really friendly to offer early check in for us. Really appreciate for this great favor!! Also, we had drinks at the speakeasy bar for girls talk. Unforgettable trip with friends and warm sweet home at NY.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: I loved this hotel, having stayed at many hotels in NYC over the years, I'd definitely return to this one.  The location is fabulous, I could have sat and watched the view from my room for hours, over the Hudson River.  The rooms are on the small side but perfectly adequate, the bathrooms are lovely.  The spa is very nice and I enjoyed the pool although there could be a few more chairs around the side.  The view from the bar is fab.

title: Toller Aufenthalt in der Metropole
text:
Es war einfach alles perfekt - tolles Haus, super Service, schöner Ausblick auf den Central Park - sehr zu empfehlen
Unbedingt ein Zimmer mit Central Park Blick buchen!
Beim Frühstück kann ich den New York Lachs Bagel empfehlen ;-)

title: Great stay!
text:
I stayed here for 3 nights for business reasons, and overall it was a great stay!
The amenities and the service was excellent! 

My room was spacious and offered lots of closet and storage space. The bathroom was equally spacious with room to comfortably get ready. 

The location is pretty great  - Accessible from both the mall and from street level. It's super convenient to have Whole Foods and Bouchon Bakery within minutes. It is also above the subway so it was easy to zip to Soho and Downtown. 

My fav part was the gym. It is spacious, clean, and has the latest and greatest equipment. 

It is comparable to the gym at the St Regis and the Peninsula. 

The one inconvenience was that one has to change elevators to get to their rooms..but overall a great stay!

title: Nice but small - stunning view
text:
We like big suites and travel a lot. Mandarin was recommended to us cause of the view. We got a Central Park View Suite. Very nice view. The suite is kind of small for NYC Top Suites and the bathroom really to small. 

So we have seen better suites. But location is top and if you don’t like the Penthouse next door at Trump Hotel it’s worth a try. We wouldn’t go for it again...

title: Perfect Location; Perfect Hotel!
text: Having once lived in Manhattan, I can say that the location of the Mandarin Oriental is perfect for just about anything you wish to do in the City. The view over Central Park from our room was amazing.From check-in to check out, the Hotel staff were courteous, welcoming, and offered suggestions/tips without even being asked! The dining/bar options are fantastic; as is the availability of a fitness center, pool, and spa. The room was impeccable and offered everything to make our stay comfortable. There are no coffeemakers in the rooms, but Room Service quickly spoiled us with  prompt delivery of coffee scheduled the previous night. Sometimes even luxury hotels encounter inefficiencies, quality issues etc., but I can honestly say that everything was absolutely perfect at the Mandarin Oriental. The visit was

title: Mandarin the Magnificent
text: We stayed three nights in July and absolutely loved everything about the hotel.  From the start driving up to the hotel was easy.  Valets took the bags up and car to the garage, no stress.  We go up to the 35th floor for check-in and it was very smooth.  Everyone was super friendly.  Our room was on the 51st floor over looking Central Park and the view was drop dead amazing.  Room was really big and very clean.  Bathroom was posh and large.  Room service was fast and delicious.  We had kids at ages 5 and 1, they were very welcoming in the hotel AND the indoor pool.  Lots of kids there during our stay.  The gym was a bit small but Equinox is downstairs.  Will definitely go back.

title: Путешествие!!!
text: Гостиница достаточно не плохая. Понравилось всё. Но ощущение какое-то не очень. Привыкли жить в безупречных гостиницах. В эту поехали из-за бассейна. Но когда увидели бассейн поняли что купаться в нем не будим. Нет ощущения чистоты. А так все хорошо. Хороший персонал. Очень приветливый и пытается всё сделать чтобы нахождения в этой гостинице было приятным. Всему персоналу большое спасибо.

title: Adios Ritz Carlton Central Park!
text: I am a long time Ritz Carlton Central Park customer but found the rooms ridiculously overpriced for this stay and stayed at the Mandarin Oriental.  The service from arrival to departure was outstanding, our room had a 51st floor view of Central Park was breathtaking, the food and drinks delectable. Housekeeping staff took the time to do little things like wrap our phone power cords with velcro ties, leave a plastic bag to put my toothbrush when I left, etc.  I have been a hard core Ritz Carlton customer; it looks like I am making a change!

title: Потрясающий вид!
text: Смело выбирайте этот отель,если вы приехали в NY за видами,из окон они открываются шикарные!плюс расположение прямо возле центрального парка и в доступности к основным местам посещения. При звезде комплимент! Завтраки оценить не могу, были в других В летнем open-air участвуют звезды первой величины: уже подтвержден приезд Земфиры, Бумбокса, LP, Дельфина, Shumы и Therr Maitz. местах,их в этом городе очень много)

title: Wifi is terrible!
text:
I am surprised that at this kind of room rate, the wifi which is a very basic utility for travelers is at such poor low speed. If you want a higher speed, you have to pay extra! I found it offensive! 
Penny wise pound foolish for such a high end hotel!

title: Amazing drinks
text: We had incredible drinks at the beautiful bar that opened to the corner of Central Park.  Have never experienced such tastes.  Recommend the tequila that is served in a see through type flask.  The bourbon served in a closed plastic bag that wafted everything bagel smells was a crowd pleasure.

title: Very good trip
text:
Spacious rooms with an incredible view of central park. The service was excellent and the rooms were very clean. 
The gym and the pool are immense. I loved the infused water offered at the gym especially after working out, it was very refreshing! 
I enjoyed breakfast at Asiate, particularly the delicious homemade granola while contemplating the impressive view of the heart of New York! 
Very well located in Manhattan, I highly recommend it.

title: The Very Best - MO NYC
text: The Mandarin Oriental, New York City, is both stunning and elegant. Located adjacent to the Time Warner Center, it's extremely convenient and well kept. The staff is professional and goes out of their way. This was my third trip and I intend on returning many more times.

title: Sweeping Lights & Playful Cocktails Take Flight at THE AVIARY
text:
"MICKEY MOUSE looks like he's conducting the lights!" I tell you, the tiny school-girl swinging her arms about at the next table & showing me Mickey in the "The Sorcerer's Apprentice" was absolutely right.  

Since our Mandarin Oriental hotel visit here in New York City, we now stop by whenever we're in the area & have been waiting to try out THE AVIARY, the new lobby bar & small-plate café designed by Chicago cocktail Svengali, Grant Achatz. The Aviary is quite pleasurable & I for one had already been a loyal fan of this grande space for several years.   

Now, gazing up at the sweeping new overhead light installation, it did indeed appear that Mickey Mouse was magically conducting the swirling back & forth-shaped illumination dancing across the ceiling. The Aviary is located in the Mandarin Oriental Hotel lobby which features panoramic views 35 floors over Central Park that regularly melt the heart of even the most seasoned traveler. 

Swirling lines of the ceiling lights are picked up again by sweeping lamp-stands curving up & over massive sectional couches & dropping down-light over the central seating areas. They add dynamic whimsy to an already magnificent space.

Known from the start for its promise of "atomic" cocktails theatrically steaming with dry-ice explosions of brandy & bourbon & tequila, I confessed today that I had never actually seen one of these concoctions being served & only knew them from photos, since I usually come to the hotel at lunch-time. To my delighted surprise, the Bar Manager, Berit Soli-Holt, graciously indulged me with an amazing personal demonstration, up in the bar's staging area. 

The Aviary cocktails are crafted by "liquid chefs" at an expansive bar space displayed behind floor-to-ceiling glass which stretches the length of The Aviary above & behind us, while we guests gaze out at Central Park. As Berit told me the story of The Aviary, she produced wonderful rum-spiced steam rushing over the counter from a slim-necked chemist beaker at the bar. 

All of this inspired me to try out her suggestion of a "Boom," as she called it, with my salad. This is the special cocktail known as "Boom Goes the Dynamite," in which she stirred up a combination of rums, vanilla, violet — with just a gourmet touch of ver-jus and "rooibos," which is some sort of South African herb. After a few minutes of fragrant rum explosion at my table, a straw was playfully served — although I preferred a glass, which was delivered frozen, to best set off the flavors of the drink.

Both times I've enjoyed the chicken sandwich, it has been delivered by the chef himself & combined a spicy fried chicken cutlet dressed with creamy sauce & lightly pickled cucumber slices ever-so-carefully fanned out on a sesame bun. Most dishes — such as my Orchard Salad today — are garnished with colorful flourishes of edible blossoms, often pansies, fresh plucked from the stem. The little movie-savvy princess & her mother were gone by the time I finished a cappuccino, but I will always remember her imaginatively "conducting" the ceiling lights like Mickey Mouse for me.

title: The Best
text: It's exactly what you would expect it to be. Accommodations are top notch. Service is on point. The view from bar is ridiculous. Yes it's expensive but worth every penny. Enjoy! Oh and don't be cheap know what you are getting into - live a little.

title: Great view and location
text: Lovely hotel, enjoyed our stay in a large room for NY with good views over Central Park.  With the hotel being so high you do not get any street noise. The breakfast was included and excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

title: The best bar for drinks!
text: Love the view, the service, the food, the cocktails and the giant “chicharrón” (pork). Perfect to go with friends at the End of the day.  It is in floor 35 looking central park. Ask for a table near the window.

title: Stunning hotel, great restaurant
text: My wife and I visited new york and stayed in the madarin oriental for a friends wedding. I wanted to make it a special trip and the mandarin oriental did not disappoint! I can honestly say this is one of the finest hotels i have stayed in anywhere in the world. The level of service was superb and the staff were friendly and attentive. We had a meal in the hotels restaurant and had the tasting menu. It was the best meal we ate in new york, bearing in mind we ate at Daniels (michellin starred restaurant). On top of the stunning tasting menu we had a gorgeous view of central park. I couldn't recommend either the hotel or the restaurant more highly, truly a 5 star experience, expensive but well worth the money.

title: Great Evening at Mandarin
text: The service, amenities and rooms exceeded my expectations. The rooms, in particular, were large and well-appointed, especially considering that most NYC hotels are quite small. The service was great, and concierge was so helpful. My husband was having an allergic reaction, and a runner was promptly sent out to get him Benadryl. Thank you for a great stay!

title: Used to be my favorite... Clean up the air!
text: Air quality is now awful. Air vents are coated in grime and nastiness. Last visit made me ill. Used to be a time-tested favorite--great views, great location, great service. Ruined by terrible indoor air. Had to leave early.

title: Wanted to stay here for a long time - and it lived up to expectations
text:
I have wanted the oppurtunity to try the Mandarin Oriental for a while.  When I finally had the oppurtunity it lived up to expectations.

Service, room and location were incredible, as was the view of Central Park from our room.  We had breakfast in the room three mornings in a row  and it was great.  All of the staff were very helpful and thoroughly professional, but I want to point out that the doormen were especially helpful in giving us directions and a few recommendations.

We look forward to going back.

title: Amazing Hotel Experience
text: I work a lot in NYC and fortunately I am able to stay at MO NYC on most of my trips there.  This is an amazing hotel and the service is excellent, from the moment that I  arrive and the door men greet me, to the front desk staff that always remember who I am, to the housekeeping that adds special touches like flowers and candy in the room.  The lobby bar is also great and has an amazing view of Central Park.

title: Big room for NYC; awesome lobby bar
text: The entrance may be ground level but the lobby starts on 35th and meeting rooms on the 36th.  The rooms are big, especially the bathrooms with a long, double sink elegant bathroom.  The views from my room - 3824- overlooked a rooftop so not so good, but other directions have awesome views over central park.  The lobby is small, but nice  The bar is amazing with cool views and amazing drink concoctions - some $50 bucks and to be shared.

title: Decent Stay!!
text:
We stayed at the M.O for 3 nights.  Overall the stay was comfortable.  Rooms were nice (albeit bit tired) and bathroom was spacious.  The room was not as nice as the picture on the MO website for our category but comfortable.  One should not expect the service levels of MO in Asia or any nice chain in Asia.  Second, at this price point, I think there are several hotels in NY that are much nicer (such as the Park Hyatt, The Peninsula and St Regis).  We have also stayed at several mid-tier hotels (mostly W’s) and have found the rooms and service to be at least as nice for less than half the price.  

The night we checked in, we were disappointed to see that the bathroom had not been properly cleaned and there were several strands of hair in the shower.  Also, when they did the turn-down service, they did not leave chocolate mint by the hotel – they were happy to bring it if you called and were actually surprised that it wasn’t already there – on all 3 nights.

Breakfast at Asiate was nice.  The Aviary is the best part of the hotel – it is in the hotel but managed by the Alinea group of Chicago.  If you are staying at the hotel, you don’t need to book on Aviary website, which requires a non-refundable deposit.  We ordered BF in room one morning and it the room service would not answer the phone despite long tries.  Eventually, the operator was able to connect – again not what you would expect in a 4-star, let alone the fact that this is a 5-star.

Overall, I would not stay here again given the awesome choices in this awesome city.

title: Amazing hotel best service
text:
The location perfect close to all the best restaurant 
The service was so professional and so nice 
The spa is unbelievable the best 
The room is clean stylish and so beautiful view 
The best breakfast and best bar 
The manager reception Kent is so nice and give the best service 
For sure I gonna come back

title: Una mala relación entre costo y servicio. Una mala sensación.
text: En abril de este año viajamos con mi esposa a New York y habiendo postergado -en el último viaje- alojarnos en éste llamativo hotel, decidimos tener la experiencia. Lamentablemente la elección no fue buena, si bien debo destacar que el Mandarín Oriental es un verdadero cinco estrellas. El problema comienza con la propuesta que hace el hotel, que es mas bien una trampa muy seductora. Contraté el servicio de traslado de lujo que ofrecía el hotel y a mi llegada estaba esperando una Señora que, con cordialidad, nos invitó a esperar 15 minutos en el exterior del aeropuerto JFK hasta que finalmente llegó el Mercedes Benz clase S. Llegamos al Mandarín a las 11 hs. esperando poder acceder a la habitación ya que la propuesta incluía Check-in a mediodía ("sujeto a disponibilidad"). No fue así, la habitación recién estaría disponible a las 16 hs. o en su defecto, por tan sólo 600 dólares diarios más, tenía una subida de categoría y en ese caso sí había una habitación disponible. Quiero resaltar que también la subida de categoría estaba incluido en la propuesta (sin costo adicional) y también era "sujeto a disponibilidad". Esto puede verse en la página del Mandarín Oriental de New York. También estaba incluido el desayuno diario para dos personas. Pues bien, tampoco era tan así, ya que sólo incluís 40 dólares de consumo "a la carta", por persona. Es decir que para el precio del hotel, es algo así como un café, leche, cuatro tostadas y agua e impuestos. Cualquier otra cosa,  debía pagarse aparte, es decir que no había en realidad un desayuno al que estamos acostumbrados en los viajes a Estados Unidos. Eso sí el WIFi efectivamente estaba incluido, sin costo adicional, tal como lo establecía la oferta. En suma, para no caer en una situación de disgusto que me impidiera disfrutar de mi descanso, decidí aceptar que el Mandarín Oriental con su ambigüedad, habría dado cumplimiento a la oferta, en los términos de la propuesta. La estadía me costó el DOBLE de lo previsto. Debí pagar más de 1600 dólares por día tan sólo por la habitación (Suite en el piso 52) y el no-desayuno. Una verdadera decepción. Realmente esperaba más de tan prestigioso lugar. Mi esposa y yo disfrutamos mucho de la estadía pero desayunábamos fuera del hotel y teníamos la disponibilidad económica para pagar ése lujo. En New York hay infinidad de mejores y más auténticas propuestas. La correcta traducción del Mandarín al español es "sujeto a disponibilidad" = "se cobrará como adicional"; y al desayuno faltaría aclarar que se acreditan 40 dólares por persona del menú a la carta. Si hubiera estado con menores, el desayuno sí habría sido un verdadero problema ya que cobraban todo, todo y muy caro.

title: Excellent hôtel, le meilleur de New York, au-dessus de Central Park
text:
Notre we au Mandarin de New York a été excellent. Le cadre est cinématographique. Vous déjeunez dans leur restaurant The Aviary NYC, 35 étages au dessus de Central Park, avec une très belle vue sur Manhattan, vous buvez un verre, le soir, dans leur bar The Office NYC, à la déco feutrée puis le lendemain matin, au petit déjeuner,vous profitez du très beau restaurant Asiate, tout en jetant régulièrement, là encore, quelques coups d'oeil à la multitude de runners qui viennent fouler le bitume de Central Park. 
Les chambres sont parfaites. Le service est très pro et le personnel très agréable.
Le seul hotel de luxe de NY à faire !

title: 紐約最佳酒店
text: 位置很好，在中央公園旁，附近有很好的米其林餐廳和購物商場，服務專業親切，房間很舒適，面中央公園與哈德遜河的房間景色都很美，建議有一天要早起看看日初時寧靜的紐約，會讓自己充滿有能量的一天

title: It is the hotel that you feel you are a city, the most beautiful view you can get in a city
text: I booked the hotel 3 nights through AMEX FHR, the hotel knows to give excellent service, the reception manager took care of me personally and took care of me in a really good way, the view from the room is worth the money and it is an experience of the city to see the city backed up. I recommend only a view suite to the park. The hotel food is really tasty and the breakfast is excellent. The hotel does everything you will be pleased with! The hotel has replaced us with an apartment for a larger one, but the classic nightmare with a view of the park is what I recommend.

title: Almost perfect.
text:
We are great fans of NYC and visit regularly.  This was our first stay at the Mandarin Oriental and I think it is fair to say we will struggle to stay anywhere else now.  Our room was a good size for a New York hotel and had amazing views of Columbus Circle and Central Park.  It only lacked a coffee maker other than that everything we needed was there.  Housekeeping was incredible, they tidied and refreshed with attention to detail such as replacing a small tube of toothpaste when they spotted we had run out and making the bed and changing the towels even though we were a late check out. The best we have ever experienced anywhere in the world.  We ate breakfast in the hotel every morning, it is a table service breakfast so no opportunity to help yourself at the buffet, this makes service a little slow and we had quite a wait one morning although we were given coffee in the lobby as we waited. Orders arrived wrong and we had to send the toast back to ask for it be actually toasted! So maybe a little fine tuning required on the breakfast front.  Other than that guests can dine in the hotel or take a quick spin in the elevator down to floor three where there is a plethora of dining opportunities within Columbus Circle.  The concierge was very helpful and knew the magic words to get tables at restaurants that were packed.  Thanks Concierge team! The Aviary bar in the hotel is great fun with a madcap scientist approach to drinks so we had a slingshot that had to be cracked to reveal the drink, a steaming glass flask that contained a the drink and a ship in a bottle to name but three!  Not cheap but a great bit of theatre, and the drinks a good too.  There is also The Office which is like a speakeasy hidden behind a door.  
There is a well equipped gym, a lap pool and a spa that is right there on floor 35 where you check in rather than hidden in the subterranean depths of the hotel as they very often are.
From Columbus Circle all of New York is at your feet with subway stations nearby and Central Park across the street the location couldn't be better.  We had a great stay and will be back.

title: Fantastic experience in the core of NYC
text: With it's incomparable location and service, Mandarin Oriental is definitely one of the highlight during my journey in NYC. Mahmut was fantastic for my checked in, Fitness and Spa were always excellent as it always be, Wendy helped a lot in my turn-down as she cared about me and offered humidifier proactively when I told her NYC humidity is low compared with my city and I am feeling dry. Check out was proceed professional. Concierge was helpful as well whenever I approached them for some inquiries and needs. I will absolutely come back again.

title: Great Second Stay
text: I wanted to write this review because I had stayed at the Mandarin Oriental, New York one time previously and did not have a great experience.  I decided to try it again, and this time my expectations were exceeded.  The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable.  The rooms were clean, and offered wonderful views over Central Park.  I was snowed in during a blizzard and the Mandarin was the perfect place to be with all the restaurants and the Time Warner Center below to keep me occupied.  The hotel is also steps away from Central Park.  Perhaps management has changed since my first stay, but I am so glad I decided to try it again and will definitely be staying here again on my future visits to New York.

title: Lovely and comfortable
text: We signed up to be "Friends of the Mandarin" and immediately got an upgraded room with a view of Central Park (which is marred, as is so much of modern life, by Trump whose hotel blocks the view of the park). The room was spacious, the bathroom even more spacious for a NYC hotel.  Bathrobes, slippers, and endless attention by the staff made this a memorable and comfortable stay.  The breakfasts were wonderfully prepared. The new lobby bar turned out to have the same view as our room, so there was no point to stopping there.  It was also pleasant, given the bad weather, to have ready access to the Time-Warner mall where we wandered for an hour or two.

title: Great Place in NYC
text: Like most of the other Mandarin Oriental Hotels the one in New York is superb. Perfect Location, very nice ambiance, very professional staff. Only the carpets in my room could be renewed and a Nespresso machine would be fine and can be expected in a Hotel at this class and Price.

title: A Luxurious Oasis
text:
I've had the distinct pleasure of staying at the Mandarin Oriental New York for the past fifteen years.   As soon as I exit my car, I'm swept away into a world of unrivaled beauty and luxury.  I've traveled the world and the staff here is by far the best I've ever encountered.  The amazing Doormen, Concierge Desk, Housekeeping, Room Service, Front Desk Personnel, Security and Management always make me feel incredibly special and welcome.  My needs and wants are taken care of quickly with a smile.  Service on every level is impeccable.  They make me feel like a valued part of their family and it doesn't get any better than that!  The rooms are spotless and beautifully appointed.  The beds are dreamy, views outstanding, shower is amazing, soaking tub is an oasis after a long day of tripping around the City.  I LOVE this hotel!!
Thank you Manny, Pablo, Felix, Ken, Eileen and so many others for your friendship and outstanding service through the years!  
I can't wait to return!

title: Perfect location, staff, hotel, lobby bar, it has it all
text:
Everything about this hotel is done right. The staff, the quick housekeeping and room serivice, the spacious bathrooms and floor to ceiling views-hard to find in NYC.
The lobby bar has a spectacular view of the Park and skyline.  We had a little glitch and the staff was AMAZING in making things right.
