If you want quiet elegance, this is your hotel.  the doorman were spotty in friendliness and resonsiveness , but not a deal breaker.  they could be more welcoming since you don't enter into the hotel lobby itself-compared to some other hotels where you really get a great welcome from the doormen-this could be an area of improvement.  But don't let that stop you from staying here-it was FANTASTIC!! My new favorite location is Columbus Circle.

there is a ton of connstruction going on near Times Square (yuk) and around Madison-so this is a great area, and walking distance to Hell's Kitchen for foodies

Thank you for the great Stay!!

title: Great Hotel by Central Park
text: This was our first time at the Mandarin, and I must say it was excellent on all counts. It's located by Columbus Circle across the street from Central Park. Food is a little pricey, but the quality is there. The room itself was very nice. Spacious bathroom, comfortable bed. Immaculate. Customer Service was spot on to. Room Service was delivered within 25 minutes. I would definitely book here again.

title: Bar de l'hôtel
text: Très belle vue sur centrale Park. Le restaurant n'ayant pas de place, on nous a dirigé vers le bar, cuisine simple mais bonne, un lieu pour se relaxer un peu entre 2 visites,  service courtois. Les prix en rapport avec le lieu.

title: Terrible service, ruined birthday surprise
text: Before travelling to New York, I emailed MO to book in a breakfast in their restaurant, I informed them it was for a special birthday and would like a table by the window. Had a lovely email back from them confirming they had availability. Arrived that morning, no reservation could be found and a very uninterested lady on reception who had no interest in why we were there. Despite trying to tell her we would like a window seat, she showed us to a table furthest away from any windows, facing a bar!! The service was awful and we felt really let down by the hotel, it cost us $100USD for the breakfast and it was mediocre at best, could've spent $20 in Starbucks and at least had a conversation with the barista! We stayed at MO in Kuala Lumpur and this was miles away from this hotel, they need to take some tips from KL on how to treat others. This hotel should be ashamed of themselves, $100 is a lot of money to save up to spend on a special breakfast which was completely ruined. Will never step foot in this hotel again and will not be recommending it to anyone else.

title: Beautiful Property...Horrendous Service
text:
I attended a black tie gala at the Mandarin recently and found the service to be more than lacking. First, during the reception, there were tables filled with empty glasses that were never cleared. Second, we go in to the ballroom for dinner and during the first course, we were not served bread. There was a plate of butter and other tables had bread, yet when we asked the server, she told us it was not being served. When the first course was finished, they half cleared the tables. As the main course was served, one of my friends was on her way back from the ladies room and she was refused service. She waited nearly 20 mins for her dinner. As wine was served during this course, the used my shoulder to balance the bottle. Finally, during the dessert service, the plates were thrown onto the table rather than placed. This meant that the rather delicate mousse was splattered all over my arm. The servers did not apologize nor bring fresh plates. We had to consistently flag down the servers for wine and when I requested tea, instead of coffee, the server rolled her eyes and said she’s be back. By the time she finally arrived with my tea, everything was being cleared. 

The event space was beautiful, it overlooks the park and Columbus Circle, but for the kind of money that was paid to host the event, I am appalled by the quality of service.

title: Great location and fab service
text: This is a very luxurious hotel in a great location on the edge of Central Park and sitting above a shopping centre at Columbus Circle. The rooms are much larger than you would usually find in Manhattan and although our room was a bit dated it was extremely comfortable with great views over the Hudson River and Central Park. The service was as you would expect from a five star hotel, polite and friendly and quietly understated. We were there for a birthday celebration and the hotel even provided a birthday cake. Not cheap but worth every penny!

title: Couldn't get any better
text: Great location, nice pool for doing laps and good gym. The rooms were spacious and extremely comfortable but the clincher was the service.. dare I say it - almost Asian standards of meticulousness, both at front desk and housekeeping. Very very pleasant stay

title: Great hotel! Great service!
text:
This is a fantastic located hotel close to all amenities and attractions! As like all oriental hotels the standard and quality of rooms and food offered is excellent!
The wine selection and cocktails are a must for anyone travelling to NY! 
Great atmosphere and throughly enjoyed my stay here. Many thanks will come again

title: Perfektes Hotel in New York
text: Wirklich sehr gutes Hotel in perfekter Lage am Central Park. Im selben Gebäude finden sich einige Top-Restaurants darunter zwei 3-Sterne Lokale. Zimmer sehr hochwertig, riesiges Badezimmer und Service wirklich top. Gutes Restaurant und zwei tolle Hotelbars, allerdings sind beide sehr gut besucht und ohne Reservierung findet sich kaum ein Platz. Schöner Indoor-Pool im 36. Stock mit guter Aussicht. Wie in New York wohl üblich, kein Frühstücksbuffet, nur "a la carte" - dies aber sehr gut (und teuer) mit Blick auf den Central Park. Ich würde hier wieder wohnen.

title: My favorite place to stay in NYC for business
text: Love the location, love the rooms, love the views. The rooms are small but well-furnished and bathrooms are top-notch. The location is very convenient since you are inside Columbus Circle so there are a variety of restaurant and shopping options without ever having to step outside (if there is inclement weather). Service is fine. There have been a couple snafus with reservations but never anything major. Biggest con is room service menu seems to have exaggerated prices along with their in-hotel restaurant. However, they do have a lovely speakeasy-style bar that serves amazing cocktails and an amazing shareable icecream sundae. The cocktails and dessert are worth the splurge.

title: Nice hotel and good care for clients
text:
We had a lovely stay at this hotel. We were allocated in a Suite facing the Central Park. It was an amazing accommodation, well cleanded daily and had everything you can think of. Upon arrival in the afternoon about 3.30pm the Suite was not ready yet due to any circumstances with another guest. We were tired from the long journey and a bit disappointed since we wished to refresh ourselves and to relax a bit. Nevertheless, the staff took good care of us and we found an agreement with which we could cope. We could move into our Suite then about 1,5h later. Congrats to the Lady on duty which handled the circumstances very well. 
The location of the hotel is just fantastic and we would recommend it any time.

title: 新しいホテルなので、天井高くてきれい。
text: 4/2018の出張の際に4泊。2000年代前半の開業なので、ホテルが新しくきれい。ミッドタウンで普段の私の選択肢に入るホテルの多くが古い建物なので(例：ペニンシュラ、メリディアン、NYLDC、NYパレスなど)、「ここは天井画が高くてきれいだな」と思った。サービス等は他のMandarinと同じく高水準。今回は使っていないが、普通ならジム併設で無料のはずのジャグジーが、ここは有料SPAに併設されているため、有料らしいことが残念。。。

title: Good rooms, great service, aging property
text:
This is my fourth stay at the M.O. in NY. It is one of the nicest properties, especially in that area (Hell's Kitchen/ West side). The style of the rooms is a bit dated but still very clean and well put together. The standard rooms are small with a disproportionate bathroom (the bathroom is about two third size of the rest of the room).

This time I stayed with a city view (vs park) which is fine, however my room (4226) was right in front of the service door and the service personnel kept on banging against my room door.

The quality of the amenities is what you would expect at that price point, perfect.

title: Best in Manhattan
text:
The Mandarin Oriental, New York has exceeded our expectation again! Great job!!!
Just stayed at this property for 4 nights and we had a splendid time. We were upgraded to a Premier View room, overlooking Central Park on the 46th. Floor. The view was breathtaking and I cannot emphasized how much we enjoyed the service and personal attention that the staff at Mandarin Oriental, New York have provided us. I do not write reviews much unless it is well deserved. Having stayed at some of the finest hotels around the vicinity, Mandarin Oriental scored, based on our experience. The room was clean and the amenities were of superior quality. I would like to take this opportunity to express our sincere gratitude to Ms. Yarisol Martinez, the front desk supervisor for her assistance during our entire stay. Having said that, we feel that the service provided by the entire staff at Mandarin Oriental has exceeded our expectation. We would like to stay at The Mandarin Oriental again,the next time we visit New York. We highly recommend

title: Consistently exceptional
text:
One of the best hotels in New York. Very private, excellent service, and the concierge work magic. The rooms are small, but very comfortable and luxurious. The location is wonderful, with two 3 Michelin star restaurants downstairs. 
The only complaint this time around is that the bars seem to always be full. If you are a guest, they make room for you, but its a process and you have to agree to let go of your table by a certain time.

title: A Special Four Nights in the City for Madama Butterfly at The Met..!!
text: My friend & I had the Merc' collect us from JFK, not a hotel car but arranged by the hotel and all went smoothly, whisked into Manhattan and to the MO doors. We pretty much dealt with our own cases and made our way in, we were directed to the lift by somebody inside the ground floor entrance and up we went to the 35 floor. Usually in hotels of this magnitude your bags are whisked and you are ushered to reception by a member of the front door team, this was noticeable but wasn't any major concern. Check-in lady was excellent & efficient and took us up to our Hudson-Twin. I was travelling with my friend and we were in NY for the Opera. Twin rooms are invariably the lower category rooms in deluxe hotels from my experience, this twin was lovely and comfortable, although due for its twenty year refurb now as the decor is looking tired and dated. No fruit in the room but I guess this is because of our lower category room. No heated towel-rail in bathroom or heated floor, which is pretty standard these days in top hotels, but the general layout of the bathroom was good with great shower and bath with a view. The room was very comfortable with quality furnishings and fixtures, albeit nearly twenty years old. The room had a nice walk-in closet with space for our things. Beds/linen top quality, super-comfortable, the glassware, crockery etc was quality, tea/coffee-making facilities in-room were very good, fresh-ground coffee and percolator provided to make lovely fresh coffee instead of those awful 'pod' machine things that many hotels are using these days. Fresh milk provided in silver jug which kept it cool. These were good finer details. There was no magnifying mirror fixture in the bathroom but we phoned down for one and an excellent illuminated portable one was delivered within ten minutes. Excellent body products in the bathroom, re-stocked generously. Housekeeping and turn-down was good, but only received bedtime pillow chocolate on the first of our four nights. Complimentary bottled water generously provided in room. Room service was prompt and the fresh milkshake brought up to my room late at night was delicious. The restaurant was beautiful, it's had a fairly recent make-over and the views of Central Park and Midtown are awesome. Breakfast was delicious, delicious freshly-squeezed Grapefruit juice, delicious Canadian proper bacon, all five star, and the management team and servers are extremely pleasant and professional. We didn't manage to get a window seat on our visits to the restaurant but this was no big deal. We got great views and photo moments from the Ballroom upstairs, it was not in use during our stay and on a couple of mornings after my swim I sneaked in to sit in the window to admire the views! The hotel reception area is beautiful, although it too is due for a modernisation I am led to believe. Concierge guy, William if I remember, was excellent and very knowledgeable about his great City. The Pool was great, big enough for a good workout, the Pool room was a bit on the cold side, not sure if this was because I went down early morning, but with small kids this area would be too cold, air-con blowing cold during winter in a big pool area made for a very cold space. Pool attendants were polite and professional. My morning sauna was not the best, it just got colder and colder and after 30 mins in there I realised it was not working correctly. I went to the guy at the Pool desk and he came and fiddled with it and said it had shut itself down, he said it would be lovely and hot the following morning but it wasn't ever really up to usual Sauna temperatures. Also, the Sauna floor under the boards looked like it hadn't been scrubbed in quite a long time. For a hotel of this rating this basic hygiene slacking was disappointing. Pool changing area and gym were of a good standard with nice ice-cold citrus water machine and fruit basket laid on. There was a slight issue with our usage of the Spa facilities, we'd gone down to use the facilities and was told by a Spa member of staff that the vitality pool and steam room were not working, but then when we got back to our room and rang down and complained to the duty-manager that we hadn't checked into supposedly the best hotel in NY to then learn that the vitality pool & steam room wasn't working, she got straight on the case and we were invited straight back down to use the facilities. It was obvious to me that the Spa member of staff was attempting to reserve the Spa for people coming for treatments and for members maybe, thus attempting to usher hotel guests back to their rooms with lame stories about facilities not working. This is a very poor philosophy as the simple fact is, without paying hotel guests there would be no Spa. I realise that they are offering a deluxe service for Spa treatment customers, but this must not be to the detriment of the hotel guests who rightfully wish to come and have a steam and wallow in the vitality pool. This issue was dealt with promptly by management and my friend and I were welcomed to use the Spa facilities for the duration of our four night stay, and the standard usage charges were wavered for all of our Spa visits, which made amends and reconfirmed my trust in the MO brand. It has to be said that the Spa is now in need of modernisation, the relaxation room/beds are very comfortable and the Spa changing rooms well fitted, but the vitality pool space does now need refurbishment, floor tiles etc need replacing around the vitality pool and in the showers. The steam room is dated although it is a quality steam room, and as usual for MO hotels, the vitality pool is great, hot and powerful, although it did stop a few times and the man had to come and jiggle buttons to get it going again. For all of the little niggles, I still loved my time at the MONY, once the bedrooms, main reception, Spa thermal area etc are modernised, there is no reason why the MO cannot claim to be the best hotel in New York and certainly back up there with Four Seasons, Peninsular and Park Hyatt. I would certainly consider choosing the MO on my next visit to New York... Mark Drinkwater.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: Just a great place...sort of hidden away.  Restaurant has to die for views of Central Park and New York City.  Rooms are lovely and you get that Mandarin Oriental treatment by the staff.  And if you are going to a Jazz at Lincoln Center performance, just a few steps away in the Time Warner Building.

title: Luxurious Set with Superb Central Park Views!
text: Being among the top luxury brands guarantees attentive perfection in details, but the location on the southwest corner of Central Park in addition to Lincoln Center's proximity summarizes for the perfect choice on base for catching up on performances, fashion week events or simply indulging in the amenities! Stayed Summer 2014(-can only appoint as of April 2017 onwards for the review)

title: Excellent Service
text:
This was my first time staying here and I was impressed from the moment I walked in the door. The service was excellent from start to finish. The rooms are quiet and very comfortable. I enjoyed the room service, breakfast and drinks at the lounge, with amazing view of central park. 

Great experience and looking forward to coming back.

title: Luxury at its best
text: We stayed in a suite overlooking the Hudson River. The views were amazing and the suite was so comfortable and luxurious. It had one and a half bathrooms which is so unusual in NYC. We received everything we asked for, from a refrigerator to a nesesspro coffee maker. The rain shower was hot and plentiful, with all beautiful bath amenities. A fruit platter and chocolate cake were thoughtfully presented for my husbands birthday.

title: New York???? Stay here!!!
text:
We were thrilled to get brilliant tickets for Springsteen on Broadway and spent 5 nights at this wonderful hotel within walking distance of theatreland.
We could not fault it in any way. Our well appointed upgraded room overlooking Central Park was everything we could have wished for. The hotel facilities were first class and the friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff were excellent with a special mention for the brilliant concierge Bryam who recommended and got excellent seats for two great Broadway shows and the door staff who pulled out all the stops to get us through the blizzards to see Bruce
We would not stay anywhere else in New York

title: Disappointing bar policy - guests need to book to have a drink!
text: We stayed for 3 nights over a weekend.  The room was tired and the furniture scuffed. On the first night we could not use the bar, because we had not booked a table.  We tried to book a table at the bar on the second night, but were told that they only had availability at 5:45 and 10:45pm. This meant that we were paying premium prices for facilities that predominantly non-guests were using.  It would have been nice to have been told when we booked the hotel that we also needed to book a table at the bar.  When we finally managed to get to the bar, we were under a strict time limit, so not very relaxing.  Next time we will stay somewhere else and just book a table at the bar...

title: Beautiful Brunch
text: Stylish. Friendly. Well orchestrated. Tremendous views.  And wonderful food. Great for locals with guests or those of us fortunate to be in on business. Strongly recommend for a nice and long leisurely dining experience.

title: Customer service training desperately needed!
text: We checked into the Mandarin Oriental before 1PM Sunday 25 February for our long-awaited girlfriend getaway. Our room wasn’t ready, so we decided to have a quick bite at The Aviary NYC before our matinee -- other luxury hotels welcome guests with a bit of bubbly, unfortunately, not Mandarin Oriental. When we got back to MO after dinner, we were given our keys. Our room was on the 48th floor and we had high expectations, until we walked in and found two twin beds! Seriously? Both Hilton and Marriott can accommodate with two queens, or doubles at the very least. We were appalled that a luxury property, with 4-figure nightly rates, provides twin beds to adult guests. The chocolate treat delivered to celebrate the birthday was too little, too late. Upon waking, we found our view blocked by the mirrored side of the building next door. The live orchid in the bathroom was a nice touch; however, one of the lights over the sink was dark and remained so through the duration of our stay. Furthermore, the furniture was oddly placed:  while there was a floor lamp in the corner of the room, there was no chair. There was a tiny chaise at the end of one of the twins, but no chaise at the end of the other. Since we saw no complementary coffee in the lobby, we decided to have breakfast at Asiate. While the food was good, no cold croissant is worth $30 – not even in NYC. Shame on MO! Luckily, The Spa at Mandarin Oriental did not disappoint and we enjoyed a number of awesome services. We had wanted to schedule mani/pedis, but were informed that those services were no longer being offered. That being said, mani/pedi services remain listed in the hardcopy spa brochure in the notebook on the desk. How hard is it to tape over the listing? The next morning we called to see if complementary coffee was offered (of course this 5-star room has no Keurig) and found out that the coffee set-up in the lobby is dismantled at 7AM, but is available ‘upon request’ at the restaurant. One would think with the mission statement: “to delight our guests each and every day” that someone might have brought some up to our room. We thought we we could provide some feedback at checkout, but we were never asked about our stay. The Front Desk could learn some valuable lessons from hotel chains that charge half their rate. MO NYC was opened in 2003, and it appears that they are way past due for some refresher training about the meaning of providing the very best in luxury hospitality.

title: Great location and incredible service
text: This is an incredible hotel that values service and creates a memorable experience for guests. Everything about the visit went smoothly -- reception was great, housekeeping was great, concierge was great, restaurant was great. The service always exceeded expectations -- and I literally mean exceeded. The location couldn't be better sitting right next to Central Park and Midtown. This will be the only place I stay in NYC in the future.

title: Spectacular stay
text: We traveled to NYC for my husbands birthday and decided on the Mandarin Oriental. Our room was beautiful and overlooked Central Park. The concierge got us all the hard to get reservations we requested. They sent a lovely bottle to the room for my husbands birthday. The room was well maintained and looked exactly like the photos. Good towels and sheets. Make sure you check out the Aviary bar and The Office. Can’t say enough wonderful things about our stay. A special thanks to Joel and the concierge team for getting our reservations and broadway tickets.

title: Vista maravilhosa!!
text: Excelente localização, vista maravilhosa do Central Park e acomodações bastante confortáveis! Acesso ao Columbus Circle com lojas e restaurantes por dentro do hotel pelo 3º andar facilita muito a vida.

title: Not what I expected
text:
As soon as I arrived to the hotel I realised they where displaying fake pictures in their web page. The view to the central park, for which I had to pay extra, was extremely ruined by the Trump International black building right in front of the window. This wasnt shown online. When I complained about it, I was told that many guests comolained about the same thing all the time but there was nothing they could do. I felt scammed. #fakeadvertising
The room service always took like 2 hours to come so I decided to start ordering food from restaurants arround the hotel. The food frome these arrived to the hotel door in much less time than the room service.However, the hotel made sure that wasnt the case. They took 30 minutes or more to deliver it from the door to my room, every single time. It is obvious they were doing this to make me stop ordering food outside and continue ordering it to room service.
The gym is extremely small and lacks some essential machines. The indoor pool was very cold; taking into account that the weather was very cold, it should have been warm.
The people who cleaned the rooms were exceedingly invasive, every time I went into my room someone was inside. If I had the "do not disturb" light on (this wouldnt allow them to ring the bell of my room), THEY WOULD KNOCK MY DOOR. Dont you understand the meaning of privacy? 
The decoration of the hotel was horrible, distinctly old, who ever chose it has exceptionally awful taste. 
And last but not least, the elevator system was really slow. It took for me at least 25 minutes to get to the ground floor and I had to take two elevators.

title: Cool
text: Qui si ferma il tempo. Eccezionale in tutto, nella pulizia, nel servizio, nei piatti. Sicuramente tra i migliori cinque Hotel della Grande Mela. Ma il vero punto forte è la vista eccezionale che vi si gode. Assolutamente da provare

title: Otimo Hotel
text: Sempre que fui a NY visitava o Mandarin, o hotel pra visitar é simplesmente fantastico, só que desta vez nao resisti e fiquei como hóspede, o hotel é TOP, digno de entrar no top 3 na minha lista de melhores hoteis de NY, excelente academia, excelente localizaçao, pra mim a melhor de todas, e ótimo atendimento. mas cobra-se o preço.

title: Incredible from all perspectives...
text: ...location just near everything, views of the central part and city, staff super friendly and not snobby, shopping everywhere, directly in Columbus Circle or 5th avenue or...in the building itself...and the building itself, just beautiful. What else do you need for your birthday?

title: Views, bathrooms, cocktails, shopping and great location
text:
There is something about a hotel that starts on the 35th floor. The views are epic. The hotel was full this time so we had a Hudson river view on the 47th floor AMAZING.

My wife loved the bathroom which may be the largest in NYC. It was almost like having his and hers bathroom. Tub up against the view on one side and separate shower on the other side of the bathroom. There were about 5 feet between the sinks of the double vanity and dual pocket doors behind each side of the bed.

 "The Aviary" a sister of the Chicago location by Grant Achatz serves up kicked up bites and cocktails with the craziest spin.  You could also order a Cabernet and look over Central Park from the 35th floor. 
Behind the Aviary is a door which leads to a speakeasy "the Office"  that serves up craft cocktails made from old and rare bottles. They have a private entrance to the " the shops at Columbus Circle" oh by the way Per Se is also in the same building. 
No time the check out the restaurant but next time for sure. We will be back!

Of course its NY so you have to get out there. Park across the street and the closest hotel to the Lincoln Center for performing arts. Cabs, cars, uber all at the ready..

Last but not least great people looking after you while your taking in that intoxicating view..

title: AMAZING Hotel in a Fabulous Location!!!
text: We have stayed at the Mandarin at Columbus Circle 6 or 7 times and it gets better each time.  First of all, the greeting from the staff at the curb with very welcoming and efficient.  I thought it was going to be a hassle to have the lobby of the hotel on the 35th floor but it was not an issue at all.  A quick elevator ride takes you directly to the 35th floor and opens to a beautiful space with a spectacular view!  The rooms we have stayed in are modern and spacious.  If you can afford it, get a park view - well worth it!  You cannot beat the location - Columbus Circle.  Central Park is across the street and we walked for a couple of miles there each morning.  The hotel has direct access from the third floor to great shopping mall that has upscale shops and restaurants and even a Whole Foods in the basement.  The location is also great for getting a cab 24/7, although we walked to most theaters and restaurants.  And I saved the best for last - the spa is SPECTACULAR!  We have facials and massages every time we stay there and their staff is outstanding.  The Mandarin in NYC defines LUXURY!  We love it and so will you!

title: Awesome Hotel
text: This hotel is not only beautiful, but the service and the amenities are outstanding.  In my room were two suggested novels to not only read, but take home as well. The new bar lounge offers super creative drinks and wonderful atmosphere to enjoy them in. The hotel is also directly connected to the indoor mall, which offers great shopping and five star dining, i.e; Bouchon and Per Se etc.  Nice feature, sepecially when weather is inclement. You can't go wrong by staying at the Mandarin!!

title: アジアンホスピタリティ
text: チェーン店で他の国のマンダリンオリエンタルと比べて特に目新しさはありあせんが、非常に心地よいホテルです。

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
I had a lovely stay at the Mandarin Oriental, NYC while in the city for a memorial. 
The hotel is beautiful and the staff is amazing.
I stayed in a King Central Park View room that was perfect (except that I had to look at the Trump Hotel which blocks some of the view). Housekeeping was terrific and very accommodating, as was in-room dining.
I’ll be back!

title: Not up to the 5 star/5 diamond standards
text: Very disappointed! We wanted to give another chance to MO NY on the day before NYE with family.  Our room wasn't ready until 5p.  I had to ask 4 times when it would be and wanted to speak with a manager, no manager spoke with us.  We waited in the lobby.  At a hotel at this caliber, you would expect to be invited a sitting area or outlet and offer drinks as we had 2 8 and 9 year olds.  We had to be an important family appointment at 4:30p and we were already late as we traveled from 3 hours to the City.  Finally after communicating 4 times they checked us into an upgraded room but it was too late and still no manager had apologized or just speak at least someone say hi to my kids (if kids are happy, parents are happy) more over in the room, wall paper was coming out by the closet and in living room area.  Through the hotel smiles  and eye contact have been missing.  No-one addressed us with our last name, nothing special was made to make up to being totally late to our year ly organized family affair, whether or not were satisfied in room, kids were happy or not.  Doormen doesn't even smile and open the door for guests, bellmen brought our luggage late and he was friendly.  My kids told me after this experience that we should have gone to our choice of hotel around the world:  Four Seasons.  This trip made this for sure not to change the hotel choice.

title: Utomordentligt trevligt hotell med perfekt läge
text:
Hotellet är väldigt välskött, rena och trevliga rum! 
Personalen är mycket serviceinriktade och vänliga. Under hela vår vistelse kände vi oss som hemma! 
Läget är ju strålande, nära till Central Park, affärer och även till tunnelbanan om man väljer bort att åka taxi
Vi kan verkligen rekommendera detta hotell om man önskar lyx!

title: Excelente hotel!
text: Excelente hotel, com boa localização,  acesso ao columbus circle, conta com lojas e restaurantes a poucos metros. De frente ao central park. Ótimo atendimento e serviços. Bom para viagem a lazer e também negócios. Excelente infraestrutura para reuniões. Super equipe sempre pronta para o que você precisar.

title: Sensacional!
text:
A localização do Hotel é excelente: o Central Park está a 100 metros de distância, uma estação de metrô é do lado do Hotel e há um shopping com excelentes restaurantes e lojas colado ao hotel. Você pode acessar o shopping sem sair na rua pelo 3o andar do Hotel.

Os quartos são excelentes e o staff muito educado.

Realmente, excelente !

title: Most Enjoyable
text: Stayed two nights at the hotel, as part of a celebration of my wife's Birthday.  went to a matinee on Broadway, onwe dinner with adult family at the Asiatic restaurant and another at Daniels for just the two of us.  We took a room with a view of the Hudson River, the room was excellent, and large bathroom.  The service is as good as it gets need something and it is there.  Location at Columbus Circle was just what we needed.   It is expensive, but you only go around once is this world so sometimes it is great to indulge yourself.

title: Superb location and accommodations
text: Mandarin Oriental is a "known"  entity, which provides top quality accommodations. The NYC Hotel is located in a fantastic location, adjacent to the Time Warner Building with access to great dining and to Central Park.

title: Le meilleur hôtel de NY
text:
Nous avons passé au MO une semaine pour le Nouvel an. C'était notre second séjour dans cet hôtel et une fois de plus nous avons été enchantés de ce choix.
Son emplacement est exceptionnel face à Central Park. AU dessus du Time Warner ce qui offre un bon choix de restaurants. Vous longez Central Park et vous êtes sur la 5ème avenue en 10mn. Vraiment un emplacement idéal.
Service parfait, les portiers toujours souriants. Le manager français répond à tous les besoins, merci à lui qui a rendu notre séjour parfait. Un véritable service de 5 étoiles. Les femmes de chambre font un travail remarquable.
La chambre est toujours aussi belle. Classique avec des touches asiatiques. Sa grande baie vitrée offre une vue magnifique. Optez pour une chambre bien au-dessus du 35 ème. Pour notre part, nous étions au 46ème et c'était parfait. La salle de bain est grande et splendide. Le lit est hyper confortable. Les oreillers sont de qualité. Excellente insonorisation. Nous séjournions durant la tempête de neige et le froid glacial et le chauffage marchait à la perfection ce qui n'est pas toujours le cas dans d'autres hôtels... Wifi excellent et gratuit en créant son profil sur leur site internet.
Seul petite déception lors de ce second séjour, le lounge que j'affectionnais tant a été remplacé par le Bar aviary qui ne privilégie pas la clientèle de l'hôtel pour les réservations. Dommage ! C'est le seul point négatif que je trouve à l'hôtel.
Les prix du MO est très élevés. Mais si vous avez la possibilité de vous offrir une petite escapade dans cet hôtel, vous ne le regretterez pas.

title: Sensational New Year
text: Had an awesome meal in the hotel to start - then went up to the ballroom for New Years' Eve Party (2 from South Africa and 2 from London).   What an awesome experience - at 69 years old I can say hand on heart was the best New Year Party hubby and I have been to.  With all the entertainment, the band, the accessories and the fireworks (and of course the fantastic staff and the wonderful and welcoming people of USA - it was a night to remember....

title: Nice if you’ve got the money
text: First class, no doubt about it.  Nicely located at Columbus Circle near our target, the Lincoln Center.  “Paid” with airplane miles, otherwise out of my league price-wise.  Room was impeccable but I was surprised there was no coffee maker or hot water appliance.  Based on prior reviews, I asked about the price of WiFi, and the desk person comped it (gave it to us free) immediately and without discussion.  View is fabulous, as noted.  Unasked, they gave us the Central Park view, which surprised but pleased me.  We liked the connection to the mall, especially since it was super cold outside.  Perhaps feeling the need for a plebeian experience after the breathtaking cost of the hotel, we had breakfast at the Whole Foods in the basement of the mall - served the need perfectly.  Pool was out of order during our stay due to frozen pipes. We were disappointed with that, but these things happen.  Steam room and hot tub were both comfortably warm at around 100 degrees F, but another degree or two warmer would have been better.  Turning on the TV set as part of the evening turn-down service is a bad idea.  I would have much preferred to walk quietly into their lovely room rather than have to fumble around to find the TV remote and turn the stupid thing off.

title: SkyHøjt..!
text: Det rammer toppen..Toppen af Byen i New Yorks Centrum ved Central Park..Recetionen på 35.etage..Vi boede i excellent værelse på 54.etage..Det er jo at se det hele meget fra oven..Alt fungere på dette dyre men dejlige Hotel. Restauranten også på receptionsetage 35.etage..Stort værelse..Stort veludstyret Badeværelse.Behageligt ventilationsanlæg..store vinduer..Jo- pengene værd-fornemmelssen..!

title: Amazing staff at the front desk
text: Loved the view from the higher floor, but what I loved the most about the hotel was the girl who worked at the front, her name is Stacie Mei, very accommodating. She right away made us feel very welcomed. She was very professional, very patient and very sweet. We have been to lots of 5 star hotels, she definitely stood out going above and beyond taking care of our family and my daughter.

title: Disgusting toilet which took over 24 hours to clean
text: This Mandarin Oriental is in a great location with a great view over Central Park,  and the room and service is generally great. However the toilet was insufficiently cleaned and filth clearly visible on the toilet. Asked the front desk to remedy the afternoon of my check in. They offered to change the room but I declined since I was already unpacked and asked that someone properly clean the toilet. They comped me a breakfast which I appreciated. Came back later that night about 6 hours later and it was still not addressed. The next day I spoke to a manager that the toilet was still filthy and it was taken care of that evening. This was my first time staying at the Mandarin Oriental and honestly I am not impressed with the two tries it took to take care of this issue. Staff was otherwise great but compared to other 5 star hotels I have stayed at, I just can't feel good about my stay here and am hesitant to give my business to this hotel again.

title: Отличный отель в Нью-Йорке!
text:
Хорошее расположение, великолепный вид из окон, высокое качество номеров и гостеприимный персонал.
Этот отель один из немногих, который, в отличии от множеста других отелей отнощащихся к  коассу люкс  в США, по моему мнению к сожалению резко уступающих по своему уровню отелям подобного класса в других странах (особенно в Европе, ОАЭ и Юго-Востоке), действительно соответсвует высокому стандарту во всем, включая обходительность персонала!
Кроме того у него очень хорошая локация и потрясающие виды из окон!

title: Excelente Hotel, Espectacular Localización
text: Un gran hotel, los cuartos son cómodos y tienen mucho espacio para ser NY. Lo mas importante es la localización. Puedes caminar a central park, broadway, quinta avenida etc. El servicio es espectacular. Muy recomendable.

title: Sencillamente perfecto
text: Me alojé en el hotel por 15 días, incluido pasar el fin de año. Todo fue perfecto. Ni una sola observación negativa. Además de la comodidad de la habitación y la increíble vista al Central Park, destaco fundamentalmente la calidad y calidez de todo el staff. El servicio del desayuno que nos permitía comenzar el día con la sonrisa de Federica y su dulzura pero a su vez su eficiencia en la rápida ubicación de los huéspedes. Un apartado para el servicio de concierge: impecable todos, tanto para hacernos una reserva de espectáculo como para sugerirnos lugares para comer a los que nunca hubiéramos ido de no ser por ellos. Queremos destacar especialmente a Bill, que nos dio todos esas sugerencias, sino también porque en un día con características climáticas muy difícil (ciclón con tormenta de nieve) nos asesoró perfectamente sobre qué se podía hacer y que no era conveniente hacer. Perfecto para uno que no conoce el clima de esta ciudad. Sin duda si vuelvo a New York, el lugar será este hotel dónde todo funciona, pero además porque el huésped es tratado maravillosamente.

title: New Year in New York
text:
We have a good New Year vacation in New York. The hotel is next to shopping center very convenient in cold weather. The Central Park is next door and our view from hotel is spectacular.
From this hotel we can walk to Broadway, Time Square easily.
The service is good. Our suite is nice. With AE blacd card program we have free breakfast and incidental.
It is a great vacation and great start for 2018

title: The icebreaker
text: Stayed during the aftermath of the snowbomb for the weekend and was  treated in royal fashion.  The dining, views, relaxation and evening cocktails were a blessed refrain for the igloo outdoors.  The MA was ideal for slipping out for dinner or braving the sub zero weather, central to everything.  Easy asscess to Time Warner Center was fun to get some shopping in without the brutal cold of 5th ave.

title: Relaxing Pre-Christmas Holiday Weekend
text:
We live in New Jersey and checked into the Mandarin Oriental for a 3 day pre-Christmas getaway in New York City and to take in Alvin Ailey at the City Center.

Valet and front desk service is tops.  Everyone was very attentive. Valet greeted us with a smile--we chose to take a limo to NYC from NJ since parking was $ 70.00 a night. After a warm greeting --valet escorted us up to the Lobby. 

Staff at the front desk was very friendly and gave us another warm  welcome and wonderful room. all staff were very accommodating throughout our stay.  We have a Maltese dog and there is a $ 250.00 pet fee,   $ 150.00 per stay and $ 100.00 refundable cleaning fee.

The hotel is within walking distance of the performing arts at City Center and Lincoln Center . The hotel and City was beautifully decorated for the Holidays. We also very much enjoyed the mall-shops at Columbus Circle which we could enter from inside the Hotel. There is a Whole Foods Restaurant and we enjoyed purchasing snacks, fresh juices, and eating from their buffet.

Our room was on the 53rd floor--a Hudson River view room. The room was well designed with spectacular views of the City and New York Skyline. Good views of the Hudson--partially obstructed by other buildings.It came with a $ 75.00 per day meal or Spa allowance.WiFi was included.

The bathroom was wonderful! Large with double sinks, a deep tub with views overlooking the City and Hudson River, and a TV,  and a large and separate shower. 

The King size bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed the magnificent views and sunsets from the room and the bed.

Cleaning could have been better--the room was not automatically vacuumed daily. We had to request it along with a change of linens daily. Housekeeping aims to please and we found Housekeeping will honor requests about cleaning the room, extra pillows, towels, and toiletries, etc. 

Room service was excellent--a broader menu would enhance it. We did not eat at any of the restaurants at the hotel. Elected to try nearby restaurants and really enjoyed Jean Jorges at nearby Trump Tower.

Had a terrific and relaxing massage at the Spa.  Services will be customized for you. Well decorated but does not offer all of the amenities one would expect including individual Jacuzzi tubs, multi-stream showers.  Nice steam room and sauna with cold water shower.

Fabulous pool on a high floor with great city views. Great fitness room and facilities also with spectacular views of NYC.. Free fitness classes offered.

Overall, we highly recommend this hotel and would return. Excellent location. A doctor is on hand and the friendly and caring staff truly tries to accommodate your requests.Very much worth the splurge.

title: No bar, no restaurant available
text:
MO NYC has a comparable standard like the other MOs. Not as good as the one in Bangkok, but equivalent to the hotels in Boston or Miami.
There is one point, which did make us very angry. We have been irritated all days, therefore we have decided to give only 1 star.
After beeing back in the hotel, we are used to have an afternoon tea, or a coffee or even a beer. And I am used to have sometime a dinner in my hotel.
In 5 days, only on 1 day we could get a table for a drink in the lounge - all tables blocked with tourists and people out of the region. We had to go in the cold to find a restsurant or a bar.

And: We had 2 performances in the near MET-Opera  - but had to go to other restaurants for dinner. In the hotel - restaurant, no table has been free. 
According to the reservation desk New Yorker peoble  and tourists like the lounge and the restaurant very much. The management  is proud, that the lounge and the restaurant are new hotspots in NYC. Wonderfull  for New Yorker and for tourists. But what about hotel guests. Not Important enough  ?

title: Albergo bellissimo
text: Albergo bellissimo con vista mozzafiato ,servizio ottimo , ottima la colazione, posizione strategica. Prenotare stanza dal 47 piano in su . Direttamente comunicante con un centro commerciale all interno del quale ci sono ottimi ristoranti .

title: Awesome!!
text: A wonderful NYC experience!! From start to finish, this was a white glove experience and we are excited to come back and visit this amazing hotel once again. The staff, managers, and all around environmental were very impressive.

title: Nice, however ....
text:
Beautiful Hotel with some surprising dints.

Welcome to 2018, where even every Starbucks offers etc. offer complementary Wi-Fi. 
I travel the world and I can tell you that it is unheard of to charge for WiFi! And we are not talking about some budget priced hotel, we are taking about an establishment were you can exceed 100$ p/pax for breakfast. This is just  unacceptable!
The next unpleasant surprise fur me was in the spa. Having walked trough a snow storm in NYC all day, my wife and I were looking forward to a relaxing Jacuzzi session together in the hotels highly acclaimed spa. Unfortunately the facility practices gender separation. Although Having no understanding for this kind of medieval rule,  we nevertheless decided to at least have a short 15 min stay to warm up and satisfy our curiosity. Imagine my shock when after five minutes in the water, two completely nude guys showed up walked around and finally entered the Jacuzzi ! I left that place on the spot and will never be back !

title: Fabulous Mandarin Oriental
text:
We stayed at Mandarin Oriental for our mini 3-day family vacation. This is a very beautiful hotel.  The room and the views were fabulous. This hotel's service is incomparable.  The staff was very courteous, warm and welcoming.  They were very efficient in taking care of customers' needs.  

The food and service at the restaurant Asiate were wonderful too.  We loved the Tasting Menu (dinner)  very much.  

During our stay at Mandarin Oriental, everything exceeded our expectations.  We loved every minute of it. We are definitely coming back to this hotel for our future family vacation.

title: Wonderful hotel in a fantastic location
text: Quick and easy check-in and wow what a location. Views from the dining room are simply breathtaking and the whole hotel has an air of understated sophistication. Escape the crowds of Times Square and enjoy the shopping and restaurant facilities just downstairs in the Time Warner Centre. TOP TIP: Whole Foods in the basement of the TW Centre is awesome - puts UK supermarkets to shame. Happy days.

title: Keine Bewirtung in einem schönen Hotel
text:
Das Mandarin Oriental entspricht weitgehend dem hohen Standard dieser Hotelkette. Die 3 Aufzüge sind aber oft von Personal/Gepäck blockiert.
Sehr ärgerlich und unakzeptabel ist der Zugang für Hausgäste zu dem einzigen Restaurant und der Lounge. Wir haben in 1 Woche 3mal versucht, für Abends einen Tisch im Restaurant zu bekommen: Immer ausgebucht, und zwar überwiegend von Touristen und New Yorkern. Fast aussichtslos ist der Versuch, tagsüber einen Kaffee, Tee oder ein Bier zu bekommen - und das bei Temperaturen um den Gefrierpunkt. Die Lounge ist durch Externe völlig überlaufen. Als Hausgast muss man sich in der kleinen Lobby in die Schlange vor dem Reservation-Counter stellen, um zu fragen, ob man einen Platz bekommen kann. Meistens vergebens. Bei unseren Bescwerden hat man uns gesagt, man sei stolz darauf, dass die Lounge ein Hotspot für die New Yorker ist. Ein Hotel, bei dem es tagsüber für Hausgäste nicht möglich ist, irgend etwas zu trinken, weil man alle Tische an Externe vergibt, verzichtet eher auf Hotelgäste, als auf Laufkundschaft. Deshalb verzichten wir in Zukunft auf dieses Hotel.

title: Great experience but could be improved
text: Stayed for 3 nights around Christmas to NYE. Sizable and comfortable room. Decent view of the park albeit partially blocked by the Trump hotel. Not a huge fan of the decor (nice but feels a bit dated - I’m a much bigger fan of the Four Seasons downtown and the Park Hyatt on the 57th). The service is decent, but didn’t really wow me. Four Seasons will still continue to be my go-to chain.

title: Sloppy service & badly kept property
text:
In summary the property is ageing and it is badly kept. The tub valve was broken and one of the door knobs was broken and actually hazardous (see the pics).

You need to pay for wifi...

Breakfast service was slow. I had to ask 3 times for someone to come and take the order. I was with my 4 year old who was promised a colouring book which never came... The dinning room view is beautiful.

Indoor swimming pool water was cold at 27 degrees celsius and the pool room was also cold which makes for an unpleasant experience overall.

At check out they didnt even ask if everything was ok with the stay, they just want your money and you to move on..
Overall service is very sloppy and unatentious. Not worth staying here.

title: Borderline tired...
text:
Just spent one night at MO NY for a mini staycation. 
Wife and I do that 4-5 times a year since our little one showed up. Nothing like a 24h break in a hotel with a pool and spa -assuming the facilities are really nice.
Sadly, our high expectations were not fully met at the Mandarin. Surprising since I am usually a fan of Asian five star chains or hotels, and stayed at many Mandarin which always gave me full satisfaction.

Arrival:
Lobby elegantly decorated but setup in such a way that you feel like you just stepped into Grand Central Station at rush hour. Very busy every time we went through it (granted it was during the xmas-New year period so one can expect lots of tourists.) But the issue is the long line of people waiting to have access to the tea salon or adjacent lobby bar. And if you feel that because you’re a guest paying close to $1,000 a night you will have some kind of priority when you decide to spend an hour there and soak up the beautiful views over Central Park and Columbus Circle, well think again.
The front desk agent checking you in will waste no time telling you that the hotel has outsourced the management of those two spaces to some obscure Chicago-based company and that should you want to get in, you will have to book a reservation via the concierge. Am I still talking about the only places for drinks in the lobby area? Yes I am.

Room:
We booked a standard room via Amex Plat and we didn’t have an upgrade. Again, no big deal since busy season and we were not really expecting one. After seeing the first room (4818), we asked for another, that would have less of a weird layout. That room was actually accessible, which explains the unusual layout. We were moved to 5332, which while much smaller, was a bit more Mandarin style. Great views from the high floor.
Small-ish bathroom, with only one vanity. And I just don’t get this. 5 Stars hôtel in a very modern building and they couldn’t design the room with a double vanity bathroom? Strange. Not a deal breaker but strange. Room was elegant in the Mandarin-asian zen traditional style. 
But I couldn’t put my finger on what made the overall experience disappointing. I just kept having the feeling that the room/furniture/hallway/wall paint etc...were tired.
The property is definitely ripe for a renovation when you consider other similarly priced properties such as the Baccarat, the Peninsula, Four Seasons Downtown and many more.

In-room Dining:
Ordered dinner before our show at the Dizzy’s jazz club in the same building. One of the dishes, a market salad, had a very fishy taste that both wife and I had a strong reaction about. We didn’t touch it past one bite. Looked at the menu to make sure and no, no fish ingredients listed. Called to indicate the issue. Got some very polite apologies but the dish was not removed from the bill by the time we checked out. I didn’t say anything because its not very elegant but still...

Spa:
Over Asia and other countries, the spa at Mandarin properties have very high reputations so our expectations were high. My massage with Nicolette was excellent but the overall experience was a bit of a letdown. Firstly, the entrance is on the 35th floor, right next to Grand Central mentioned earlier and we debated before heading down whether we should don our plushed bathrobes or get dressed. We opted for jeans. Who walks in Grand Central in a robe? Once in the spa, everyone is very polite and kind. But there again, not sure why, the setup didn’t scream exclusive and elegant spa. Was it the floor to ceiling windows that made the atmosphere cold? The lighting? Anyway, we didn’t feel like we were in a 5 Stars spa in the middle of one of the most expensive cities in the world. Again, this is my subjective opinion.

Pool:
It’s located one flight above the spa and there is conveniently an elevator to bring you there from the spa, without having to go trough Grand Central. But then again, you’re in for a scary experience. This elevator is brutal. You know the kind that you don’t know when it leaves and you’re already there? Well, that’s not one of those. It’s more like a version of riding an elevator in SF in the middle of the BIg One. Everything shakes when you depart and when you arrive, and the trip takes an hour. The pool is a nice size (for NY standards)and the water had a good temperature. What was bizarre is that even though we came from the spa elevator, we were asked to sign in. Why I wonder? All guests from the spa have access to the pool so I missed the point. It just didn’t feel like you were in a Mandarin... Also, there were 3 persons at the desk who were busy tasting chocolates (from Maison du Chocolat, my favorite so I can’t blame them) but once we got to the pool which was empty, we noticed dirty towels on every single bed. None of the desk persons followed us in the pool area and there was only one clean towel on the shelf so I had to go back in and ask for one. Got one, and then we proceded to remove the used towels from a bed so we could put our belongings. Again, not the top notch service I came to expect from properties like the Mandarin.

Fitness:
Located next to the pool area. I decided to check it out after the pool but since I had left my sneakers at the spa reception, i was in for another dreaded elevator ride to get them and use it again to go back. Fitness equipment is excellent, new, and in great working condition. Odd thing was I couldn’t find any towels. No shelves. I saw the basket where you can dispose of the used towel but I’m still perplexed about the missing towels. Was the shelf right there, staring at me and I missed it? Who knows. The point is, towels ina fitness room should be the first thing that your hand encounters.... you should not go on an expedition trying to find one...

Conclusion:
Business in NY is tough. Competition is strong and one has to keep up with standards being raised every day. I get it. And that’s why my review here is a bit severe. I tried many competing properties and the way I see it, in the current state this hotel is in, there are no reasons why we should plan another staycation at the Mandarin. Just too many missed opportunities to leave a lasting impression on guests who are familiar with the brand.

title: Comfortable verging on Luxurious
text:
7 nights in a Hudson river double on the 47th floor, so spectacular views and as comfortable as you would expect for such an establishment.  Fruit bowl much appreciated, as was the daily NYTimes.  Kettle/tea-making provided on request.  The bathroom was particularly good, very spacious with a large shower and lovely bath.  Decor is of course bland, and the carpet was particularly brown and depressing, but these things are to be expected in international hotels.  Some of the public areas are quite dark too and I found it very irritating that there was not a guest bar.  Luckily Gabriels (just across the road) is a an excellent bar/restaurant highly recommended. 
I actually chose this hotel for its lap pool, which did not disappoint.  Had several terrific swim sessions, mostly with the pool to myself.  It is a lovely space to be in, excellent water quality and not too hot.  Designed for swimmers.  Unusual for a hotel pool.  Changing rooms very well appointed, excellent sauna and friendly staff.

title: Above and beyond.
text:
We have really enjoyed our long weekend in NYC.  The Mandarin is located with amazing views over Central Park if your budget can stretch to one of these rooms.  It’s a great way to wake up with the sun rise over the city. 
The hotel staff are so focused on customer care, you really feel you are their number one priority without the “smarm”
Concierge team are knowledgeable about everything you would ever want to know. 
Rooms are not the biggest but it’s New York but the views and floor to ceiling windows give you a real sense of space. 
Our youngest son’s cuddly toy was scooped up with the bedding and three days later after a fully focused search in the hotel and the laundry that The Mandarin use it arrived back safe and well.  We thought that it was gone forever as did our son, who was over the moon when he heard the news that it had been found. Not sure that determination to help exists in other hotels.  He even got a Mandarin Panda to keep him company whilst they tracked down the missing toy. 
The cocktails are a bit over the top but fun and great theatre at the same time, the food that goes with them is delicious.  Well worth a taste but I am sure a normal gin and tonic tastes as good!
Great location.  Great staff.  Great views. Great holiday.

title: Une belle vue au sommet
text: Nous sommes allées boire un verre en haut du Mandarin Oriental de New-York. La vue sur Central Park et sur tout New-york est magnifique. Le cadre est très sympathique, les prix élévés mais vous payez un verre dans un palace en plein Manhattan avec une des plus belles vues de New-York. Le service est un peu long.

title: Wonderful rooms, Amazing bar and 5star service
text: We had am amazing stay in October.  From early luggage drop off to check out service and hotel were amazing.  The bar is very special and Andrew Mandel made out 10 year anniversary trip by organising just what we needed.  Staff make you feel special and that nothing is too much trouble.  Many thanks

title: Great location, great service but needs refurbishment
text:
Average kind of 5 star hotel. 
Standard rooms are very very modest. Suites are better and have better facilities, but have no work desks..

But I guess, as all other hotels in NY - too old, too dark with odd entries.

Fantastic concierge team. Chris Taru , Sanam - highly recommended.

In general very good personnel, reception, bellboys. 

Great location. 

Forgot to mention : amazing breakfast restourant! “Asia” something.

title: NYC MO
text: This was my first time staying at the NYC MO and no regrets.  The Hudson view room though not large compared to other MO properties was well appointed and spacious by NYC standards. Location was superb,  just opposite central park and part of the time warner centre which offers excellent shopping and a supermarket in case you need anything.  I highly recommend a visit to Asiate to try their prix fixe menu and to book early to get a seat by the window (I'd originally wanted to visit per se but couldn't secure a seat. Nevertheless,  I thoroughly enjoyed my meal at Asiate which was tasty and reasonably priced for the quality). Hope to have a chance to return soon!

title: Завышена цена
text: Обычный чуть изношенный отель. Сервис как сервис. Разве что вид на Централ парк хороший. Можно просто прогуляться  и посидеть в баре. Думаю не стоит своих денег. Завтрак вообще ни о чем, есть более интересные места.

title: Disappointing
text:
I've stayed at this hotel in the past and- other than the value- it has been a good experience each time. However, I was in town for just one night to attend a special event at Per Se, and the experience was not as up to par.
The room was clean and neat, and the view was spectacular. However we were woken up at 5:30 AM with a wake up call. This would have been fine, if we actually PLACED a wake up call request, which we had not. We were planning on sleeping in that morning but it was not meant to be. I almost slept through it but they kept calling over and over again!!!
Possibly an honest mistake (albeit a rookie one), but the thing that bothered me about it was the reaction by the staff member when I checked out. She said "sorry," but that was it. And then as she finished checking me out, she laughed and said "next time, we won't wake you up at 5:00 AM!"
TBH, I might have given this hotel 5 stars, but the attitude and discourteous nature of the woman whom I checked out with, just ruined it. The single most important thing a hotel can do is provide a good night's rest. When you can't do that and it's your own fault, you don't have to reduce the charge for the room, but at the very least don't LAUGH about it to the guests!!!!

..."next time, we won't wake you up at 5:00 AM!"

Do you honestly think there will be a "next time"??!!

title: You are not welcome!
text:
I love Mandarin Oriental! But I do not love MO NYC as they do not care about me!

After 16 hours flight from Hong Kong to New York, I reached the hotel at 11:45 am and they could not release my suite before 3 pm! Instead they advised me to go the restaurant next to reception to have a noisy brunch for a couple of hours! Not the best advise for someone tired who was just expecting to reach his room to have a good rest! Finally at 3:10 pm waiting in the lobby, I went back to the reception as I was clearly ignored by the staff!

The room was nice! But the service was minimum... no welcome card, no fruit basket, no coffee machine, no kettle! 

The last day a party happened around and I could hear the noisy music from the room next to mine! 

Well! Not that I would expect for a luxury hotel! Change the manager! Back to the basics!

title: MO_NYC!
text: Had the opportunity to stay this week at the Mandarin Oriental in NYC at Time Warner Center.  Amazing.   Check in lobby on 35th floor. We had a gorgeous dinner in the restaurant in a private room with jaw-dropping views.  Our dinner was exquisite and service was top-notch.  Rooms are gorgeous and well-appointed. I had a lovely view of the Hudson River.  Very comfortable and spacious.  Breakfast was also delicious and the view!!  As for all Mandarin Oriental properties, the staff is warm and inviting, and your every wish is granted.  Fabulous.

title: Awesome
text:
A truly five-star hotel and service 
I don’t usually write reviews on hotels but in this occasion I had to make an exception.
The management team staff service and the food was absolutely sublime.what more can you expect.
Definitely one to stay if you’re in New York

title: Luxurious, pricey
text:
High end hotel, you can feel the 1000$ has to be spent for a night. pool views are one of the best you can get in the city.
staff are nice and considerate
a bit pricey though, should have been 200$ less

title: Hotel & meraviglia
text:
Posto centralissimo con camere stupende e servizio impeccabile 
Vi consiglio di fare l'aperitivo 
Ottimo e con una vista mozzafiato su New York 
10lode 
Ottima posizione per tutto dopo che hai dormito qui non cambierai mai più hotel

title: Great location
text:
Across the road from Central Park and rooms were spacious by New York standards.
Disappointed that no tea/coffee-making facilities in room. For the price I would have expected an espresso machine at least. I was provided with a kettle, but battled to get them to remember to bring milk. Lovely ground coffee brought, but no way to make it, i.e. no cafetière 
Great view from cocktail bar, but food menu ("nibbles" / light snacks) over designed & messed with to make unrecognisable - doesn't work.
Lovely staff, especially reception
We chose this hotel to stay in a high-rise, but will not go again.

title: Best Location and services
text:
Great prime location over view Central Park. The room is comfortable and excellent.  
Services and staffs are impeccable!!  Nice spa and sport facilities.  We enjoy our 3 nights stay.  Friendly and attentive staff.

title: Not my favorite Mandarin Oriental
text:
Starting with the positive features: the location is great, view over the Central Park is spectacular, the entire staff is very attentive and helpful. The restaurant kept booking for us a very nice table by the window for additional 30 min, though the place was busy and the tables were in high demand. Really appreciate. 
However, I certainly can’t pass without noticing certainly uncomfortable issues: 
The place is popular; restaurant and bar are busy serving the external guests. So, it was the first place in the world where I couldn’t have a lobby bar drink at 9 pm. “Fully booked, sir! Really sorry...”. When I came down at 11 pm, the bar had shut down  already. 
So, too busy, too crowded, and the hotel guests can feel there at the party, but not at home.
The premier Central Park view room is not spacious enough and comfortable for two; compared to the same class hotels you get less vacant space and no convenient working zone. 
And the room doesn’t look really fresh, as well.
Really, next time l’d prefer trying another place.

title: Change not always for the best !
text: I stay here for business twice a year for 3-4 days at a clip. Rooms and Staff great ! The change of the Bar area was a big mistake as it is pretentious and not very good. The quality of Brands where at all time low level and trying to create a boutique flavor that slowed service and quality

title: Best hotel location!
text:
The Mandarin and Park Hyatt are my favorite NYC hotels.  The location of the Mandarin is the best, while the rooms at the Park Hyatt are a little nicer.

The spa and staff are amazing here.  And the rooms facing the park have very nice views.

I couldn't find a place to review the Aviary - the lobby restaurant bar.  The Aviary has to be the worst value worst bar/restaurant I have ever been to globally.  I can't tell you how bad it is.  Mandarin Management:  Please fire these guys and go back to the old lobby lounge menu or bring in new people.  You have a fantastic hotel, beyond taking Instagram photos what value does Aviary add.  

Avoid Aviary and eat at the hotel's Asiate restaurant or in room dining or any of the good places in the building at Time Warner Center or across the street.

title: Excellent location, services
text:
Up to the par, 5 stars International Mandarin Oriental hotel chain!! 

I stayed there for 3 nights and quite impressed.  Good bar, spa, nice prime location, next to Central Park, great services. Highly recommended...

title: Overpriced and under serviced
text:
This hotel is among the most expensive in NYC but it is far from the international Mandarin Oriental standard you would expect. Rooms are ok but nothing extraordinary. More like a top of the range Intercon than a Mandarin. Most annoying is the restaurant/lounge/bar facilities of the hotel. One restaurant, one small bar and a lounge area that are "full" the whole time with empty seats marked "reserved". They are playing the stupid game of showing these facilities as being in demand, but for a hotel guest with limited choice for a quick snack or drink you have to suffer this nonsense. Ridiculous, they are clearly targeting the local NYC market at the expense of hotel guests for their public spaces. 
Also having to take two elevators to get to your room from the lobby is an added annoyance. Staff are helpful and polite but that is the only positive. 
A very far cry from the Original Oriental and Mandarin.

title: Прекрасно
text:
Лучший отель в Нью Йорке. Просто любим. Отличное расположение, вкусно безумно. Персонал невероятно дружелюбен. Все отлично. Мечтаем вернуться)
Единственный Отель в городе, где прекрасный номера твин с видом. Другого такого нет.

title: A Stay here, is always a Luxurious Treat!!!
text: The Mandarin Oriental Hotel, is a place of LEGEND!!!!! Upon entering the sumptuous lobby, you are immediately transported to hospitality of a by- gone era, except it is current!! The rooms, bar, restaurant, service, also, exquisite and refined! Have a Lycee Martini, and, let the luxury envelope you!

title: Very nice Hotel!
text: Just stayed 4 nights at the Mandarin and enjoyed our suite overlooking Central Park/59th St.  Coming in was a little difficult as all the taxi in front of the hotel make it hard to get noticed by valet and reception / concierge area was confusing at first but after that all went smoothly and I found the staff very helpful during out stay.  Would recommend this hotel.

title: Cool
text: Ristorante molto chic su Central Park. Piatti molto buoni e ben presentati, buona scelta dei vini. Atmosfera ovattata, ma molto elegante. Personale gentile e preparato. Location da favola con meravigliosa vista del parco.

title: Best view of Central Park ever!
text:
I had not stayed at the Mandarin before but for hotels around Central Park (including the Plaza and Ritz Carlton), this is definitely one to consider.  I not sure all rooms booked would get the view we did but we were “way up there” with an amazing view of Central Park.

The room and bathroom were okay if not somewhat small. Comfortable and well-appointed but the styling cues were lost on me. Taking elevators to the lobby and then to the room wasn’t as inconvenient as I though it might be as very little time was spent waiting for them.

The food in the hotel’s restaurants was good but like the hotel, expensive.  However, there is a world of restaurants at your feet and right outside your door. Having the Park essentially across the street was nice.

The staff was perfect.  Efficient, friendly, and helpful.  Upon returning to NYC, this hotel has definitely made our list and if you don’t mind splurging, you’ll enjoy it too.

title: BUENO, SIN MAS
text:
Realmente es un hotel que no esta a la altura de otros hoteles de la cadena Mandarin.
No me parece aceptable no poder tomar un cafe en el hall sino reservas. Nos paso esto en dos ocasiones, y diciendo que teniamos habitacion nos dijeron que nos subian el cafe a la habitacion............... no es de recibo

title: Very comfy bed
text:
The start of our check in process was not very pleasant. I booked a Central Park View room and was given a city view room. I called and the reception said I was given a corner Central Park room, which is a bigger room. The room (4032, I believe) had mainly city view and only a strip of Central Park view. I was quite disappointed since it looked nothing like the pictures shown on the MO website. I was later changed to 4610, which is a real Central Park view as seen in the pictures. But I find it very odd they would place me in a corner room in the first place. 

Besides that, everything in the hotel was awesome. Very comfy bed and nice bathroom facilities.

title: Excelente
text:
Realmente magnifica ubicación.
Servicio impecable.
Si te encanta N.York desde este hotel te enamoras para siempre.
Increible vista de la ciudad que por cierto siempre te atrapa.
Vale la pena conocer la ciudad desde lo alto.

title: Room in the Sky
text:
Our Hudson River View Suite offered and unbelievable view of the River and the western third of Manhattan.  The room is beautifully appointed.
The hotel offers easy access to shopping at the Time Warner Center. to Time Square, and to Central Park.
The concierge was helpful in arranging a limo to the airport.
The only disappointment was the "Library Bar" behind the front desk that was expensive and nothing special.

title: Great of course, it's MO
text:
The hotel is really nice obviously. I loved the pool area and the rooms. We had a view over Central Park. One of the best views of NYC I've seen.
I usually don't stay in this kind of hotels but I had a good offer that time. I enjoyed every aspect of it.
Does it deserve the price tag? My opinion is no. You can get something almost similar cheaper. But if you can afford it, go for it!

title: Almost amazing.....
text:
I have wanted to stay at a Mandarin Oriental for many years and finally we came to NY for the first time and stayed here. Initial impressions were very good, we had a lovely high room overlooking the river (high up is good if you want to escape the noise and obviously have a great view), the room was clean and had all the facilities and was a good size, although it was a little tired and needed a bit of updating. Bed was very comfortable. Staff were very attentive. The restaurant Asiate was great for breakfast, lots of choice and good service. (but please don't refill my teacup, I am British and I like to pour it myself. I had to guard the teapot!)  The reception and concierge were incredibly helpful, as were the doormen. 
There were a couple of niggles. One afternoon we wanted to sit and have a drink in the Aviary but we weren't allowed to sit by the window as those seats were reserved for 'larger' parties. However the place was empty, but they 'helpfully' said they wouldn't seat anyone by the window directly in front of our allotted table so as not to spoil our view. So why could we not sit by the window then? It remained free for the entirety of our refreshment. My husband and I felt it was a silly rule when the bar was very quiet. 
We went to the spa where we both had a fantastic massage. The only thing that let the side down a little was the pool reception staff were a little unprofessional, they were swearing and mucking about which didn't necessarily bother me, but it might have bothered some guests. 
We went to Asiate one evening and had their tasting menu with the wine. The food was good, but it wasn't as good as I was expecting for the price. I wouldn't recommend the tasting menu and would choose differently if I went again. I didn't feel we had value for money with the wine either. It all felt a bit rushed. However they were accommodating with a menu change for my husband. It just lacked a bit of 'occasion'. 
Having read this back, it sounds a bit harsh, generally speaking we had a great time, just a couple of things that let the side down but certainly didn't alter the fact that we had an incredible time. I would certainly recommend the hotel, but with hindsight I would probably eat out and I would be more insistent about sitting where I wanted in a quiet bar. We had a fantastic experience and New York is a fascinating city.

title: Mandarin service in the heart of the city
text:
Mandarin Oriental New York remains a five-star property and has recently refreshed its dining offerings. This property is an excellent choice for business or leisure travelers looking to star in the heart of New York City.

The rooms are generous (by NYC standards) and well appointed. The bed was quite comfortable with well-pressed linens. There was also a nice seating area with a view of central park. The bathrooms are also spacious. The room feels like a great escape from the hustle and bustle of the city below.

Room service was prompt and of high quality. Breakfast at Asiate was also great - the wait staff was prompt and attentive (without being overbearing.)

The bell staff was courteous and helpful. The same was true for the front desk staff. 

The Mandarin is a top spot for NYC and worth the price.

title: Wow..this is the high life
text: Literally the high life as the mandarin in the top floors of a gorgeous building overlooking central park , the Hudson and nyc. One of the world's finest hotel chains, every detail is attended to. I highly recommend the suites, and you will feel like a king whenever you come back to your room.

I would like to thankfull the housemaid Wendy who was wonderful with us Hi le she was doing the room for the night. She was the most welcoming person ever. We did laugh and exchange a lot with her. She has been really nice and careful  to my friend who hurts her legs by walking too much.

title: Very Nice!
text: My wife and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental New York in which it was pretty much the center of all attractions.  The hotel was first class so save your money when traveling to New York so that you can have a great time throughout the visit.

title: Mandarin Oriental NYC
text: This is a lovely hotel in a great location-right across from central park and attached to the Time Warner/Columbus Circle Building.  Very easy to walk to Times Square.  Service was excellent. Views are scenic and room was a good size.

title: Missing the finer details
text:
This is not my first rodeo at a "5-Star" hotel. The details of a 5-Star hotel are what should make it stand out, and when those details are missed, it's a problem.  Spending $1,000 a night, it's expected those details are not missed.

Check-in was great.  Nothing missed, room ready early, and my wife's feather allergy was accounted for when we got to the room.

Our room was a standard room, overlooking the River.  It was as expected, not too small, but everything is in the room was in tip top shape. Great TV, comfortable bed, large bathroom with 2 sinks, overall, the room was great.

Housekeeping did a great job each day, beds made as expected, towels replaced daily, nothing out of place.

Nightly turn down was not consistent. The first night, there was water left on each bed table, the rest of the stay this did not happen.  The first night, chocolate was left on the pillows, the rest of the night, this did not happen.  It almost seemed that the weekend staff was going through the motions, and didn't follow those steps.

The bar area was under construction and could not be used.  This is really disappointing, and there was no mention of this, except during check-in.  Renovations occur, but have some sort of accommodation for your guests.

Here is where it falls from a 5 to 4-Star hotel.  The doormen.  They are really not helpful.  At least 4 times, no one was there to open the door.  They were standing inside by the Bell Desk.  I understand that there are other guests, but the first impression when coming to the hotel is the most important, and most memorable. There should always be a doorman.  I know when I go to the Mandarin in Miami, I have never opened a door into the hotel and I am always greeted by someone. This did not happen here.

I get that my complaint is a first world problem, but that is a mark that distinguishes the top hotels in the world. The MO-NYC needs the details reviewed.

title: Wonderful
text:
From arrival to departure and everything that goes in the middle, a truly exceptional hotel, that even if for your drinks, lunch or supper....you must visit if in Manhattan.
There is really nothing I can do or say to fault this place...it is truly exceptional

title: Good, but not great. Except when it comes to charging!
text:
The Mandarin Oriental is a nice hotel. Make sure you get a view of the park though, if your budget doesn't run to the extra cost, think about staying elsewhere and save your money. The entrance to the hotel is basically via the loading dock. Arrival isn't a very 5 star experience. Once you work out which elevator to use to get to the reception, things start to become a bit more opulent.
