Breakfast while good, is extortionately expensive. And room service can take a while, so business at Starbucks across the street is booming! 
The pool is lovely, clean and empty of other guests for the most part. The beds are comfy, and bathroom facilities are nice.
There was no lounge while I was there, no where to crash after a hard days shopping for afternoon Tea or coffee, before venturing back out into the city for the evenings entertainment. Instead you were expected to sit in the seating in the very cramped, impersonal reception. Not conducive to relaxation. The billing regime  is slightly odd to. I ended up with three quite large charges on my credit card, two of which eventually vanished. Considering the reputation this hotel chain has, I have to say, overall I was disappointed. And will probably not be returning to a MO property anytime soon. 
P.s Charging for wi-fi when your are already taking a thousand bucks a night for the room is verging on rude!

title: Service restaurant inadequat comptenu du standing de l'hotel
text:
mauvais accueil au restaurant de l'hotel 
le personnel est fort désagréable
personnel qui ne preoccupe pas des clients 
un hotel de ce standing et surtout pour ce prix devrait faire plus d'efforts a l'egard de ces clients ce qui n'est pas le cas !!

title: Brunch avec vue imprenable sur Central park !
text: Le meilleur endroit pour bruncher, avec une vie majestueuse et des serveurs à l'écoute. Les différentes formules sont variées et très bonnes. Le décor de l'hôtel est somptueux ! Tour de CP à faire en vélo juste après ... ne pas manquer durant votre séjour new-yorkais

title: Avaliação Detalhada
The Best Luxury Hotel in Manhattan!
text:
I wish I could give The Mandarin Oriental New York a ten star rating as five stars just isn't enough.  From the moment you arrive, you are treated like the most important guest at the hotel.  The service is First Class in every way....the Bellmen, Concierge, Front Desk Staff, Housekeeping, In-Room Dining and Management are all first rate!  The views are exquisite, the beds and bedding are luxurious, the shower and soaking tubs are amazing.  The attention to detail by the friendly, attentive staff is beyond reproach.  They truly make my visits spectacular....so much so I hate leaving!
Thank you Susanne, Eileen, Felix, Pablo, Gabriel and so many others for your great service and friendship over the years.
I can't wait to return!

title: A view from heaven
text:
Let me start by saying this is the nicest hotel in Manhattan and I have stayed at quite a few. Apart from an excellent restaurant spa and rooms with spectacular views of Central Park, it is well located for museums, park walks, broadway, shopping etc.
However as a businessman that prides my company's value on the people that work there extending and advertising my brand this hotel wins the award. From the driver Achmed, to front desk and Brian, the concierge, the spa masseuse,  specifically to Andrew the Director of the hotel restaurant Asiate. This posh young man and his staff were working so hard to ensure our stay with business guests from Italy we were hosting was perfect, I am tempted to hire them away from this hotel! Dear management at Mandarin Oriental head office,, don't lose these assets, this is what makes 5 stars, not just fancy digs. I will be staying here again, telling all my business associates about this hotel  and that is not my norm, nor writing a referral review.

If you want to have 5 star service while in Manhattan, the staff at this hotel sets it apart.

title: Amazing Staff and Gorgeous Hotel Room
text: Recently arranged an elaborate marriage proposal at the hotel, Kent, Front Office Manager, Ahmaed, Asst Front office Manager and Carlos, Concierge couldn't have been more professional, kind and courteous. Our Central Park suite was stunning and staff is attentive beyond comparison.  I am a native New Yorker, born and bred Upper Eastside ... hands-down this is best hotel in NYC!!

title: Not worth it
text: I've always wanted to stay at this hotel.  We got a decent rate, though still expensive at $750 a night, but splurged while my husband was working in New York.  Front desk was lovely and got us into their new speakeasy for a drink and snacks upon arrival. But unknown to us the bar area was being renovated. Room was decent, but a bit dated with paint peeling in places.  Concierge was hit or miss.  Sometimes they were totally on, but when we needed help on 4th of July, took them 4 hours to get us to their entertainment guru for help finding a fun place to dance and be adults without kids for the night, and by then we had taken care of ourselves and found a cheesy place to have fun.  My spa service was lovely, but I have to say the spa was not as great as I thought it would be.  Front desk didn't seem thrilled to have us there.  I would save my money for shopping next time and stay somewhere else.

title: Amazing 40th Birthday trip
text: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for six nights in the Hudson River view room and it was truly perfect. From the views to the spacious and well appointed room we could not have been happier. The hotel amenities covered everything and even though they have some renovations happening at the minute it really didn't have any impact on our stay. The people who work at the hotel are gorgeous, they cannot do enough for you and make you feel very much at home. Chandra our housekeeper was so lovely and very happy to provide tips on local activities and share her local knowledge and Joel at the concierge performed miracles to organise reservations at some of New Yorks best and Michelin ranked restaurants. The location was ideal for us because even though we do like shopping, we also enjoy going for walks and running so being on Central parks doorstep made our trip very memorable. Thank you so much we had the best trip we could have ever have wished for and the hotel manager who we bumped into without realising he was the manager was very keen to seek our feedback about our trip and stay before he mentioned he was the manager - which is a real sign of his commitment to making sure the hotel is delivering the service and experience his guests desire. We will be back ;)

title: poor breakfat
text: Great hotel with poor breakfast. Had breakfast at the hotel  twice   out of 7 nights and got better quality food at the Dinner next door ! the food is just not good enough to justify the cost and time.............. .

title: Parfait
text: Merveilleux repas que celui que nous avons pris au restaurant " the Asiate " au Mandarin Oriental . Une vue magnifique sur Central Park et un repas fin et délicat pour un prix très abordable , en tout cas si vous évitez les apéritifs et le café aussi cher que pas très bon ...

title: Service defined
text: This was our first stay at the Mandarin NYC, and we were impressed. The service, courteousness, and helpfulness of the staff was incomparable. The facilities were impeccably maintained, the location in Columbus Circle unbeatable, and we had a fabulous time thanks to the great staff at MO NYC, we will definitely be back!

title: Lovely
text:
My family, myself, husband, two daughters, 20 and 18, and son 16 arrived in NewYork from Uk and booked in to our hotel ( not the Mandarin) and were so disappointed. It was awful. 
After ringing the Mandarin Oriental around the corner, we checked out of the first hotel and were greeted by the most wonderful staff at the Mandarin who knew our predicament and made sure we were settled into this lovely hotel with two rooms with fantastic views across the Hudson River. It was so comfortable. 
Beds were amazing, bathroom, shower etc first class. Luxury. 
My only gripe was there was no tea/ coffee facilities in the room and you had to book/ make a reservation to use the bar in the reception area. However after a bit of persuasion, the staff let us go in for an hour for cocktails ( which were gorgeous!) 
We had a great stay in New York made even better by staying at the Mandarin Oriental. First class hotel.

title: Great Hotel - But Beware of Construction
text:
This is my second stay at this property, and both have been wonderful. The hotel is in a great location for both the theater, and upper-West-side attractions.  Rooms are elegant and comfortable. I especially enjoyed having a drink at their new "Office" bar. Service is refined and perfect.

The only issue....there is construction going on outside the hotel which really detracted from the experience - and I suspect that is the reason I received such a good rate.

title: Awesome hotel but under construction...
text: This is a fabulous hotel in a great location at Central Park and Columbus Circle. Awesome service from the front desk to the concierge (especially Sanam she was very helpful !) I would have given the Mandarin an excellent rating but I was a bit disappointed that the lobby bar was closed for renovation and I was not informed that was the situation until I had checked in .... granted they offered alternative arrangements (not sure what it would have been) but we had already unpacked and settled in....  You also have direct access to the Time Warner Center for shopping and dining... there is also an awesome Whole Foods in the basement.

title: Very Good NYC Hotel
text: The Mandarin Oriental NYC is right by the Columbus Circle, very convenient and very good. We have stayed in rooms facing either the Hudson River or the Central Park. The view could greatly improved, if the Trump Hotel is shifted about fifty blocks to the left. The hardware of the hotel combines elements of the MO in Las Vegas such as the open lobby, it also has the grand view like the MO in Tokyo and also the massive size of the DC property.  Service is where it slides quite a bit in comparison. First visit, the receptionist barely made eye contact. The spa is also a real let down, I have had better massage at the local YMCA for fraction of the price.  The spa receptionist was outright rude, and therapist was in a rush and had the touch of a limp fish.  The views of the central park from the restaurant is breathtaking, but when the regular F&B manager is not on duty, the food and service can be all over the place.  Empty coffee pot left unattended, welcome smoothie not served and seating out of order.  One morning, the steak and eggs rubbery and the Japanese breakfast inedible on second try.  Most embarrassing was my hosting of a Sunday brunch; we were fortunate enough to be seated in the side room.  However service was neglected, drinks barely refilled and food mediocre at best.  Upon giving feedback to the substitute manager, we were told "they were busy."  I still like the MO, it has lovely room and a very generous bathroom. The duty managers go above and beyond and readily rectifies short comings.  I just wish the MO service philosophy trickles down stream.  Otherwise, having a cup of coffee, reading the New York Times and just looking at the gorgeous views of the Central Park, makes this place worthwhile staying.

title: Love the hotel but wait until September before you go there
text: There lobby area / bar is currently undergoing renovation. And concurrently, the hotel JV'd with a third party to launch a new trendy bar called The Office (which btw is awesome) next to the reception desk. What it means for regular guests who want to hang out and have a simple coffee/ drink upon arrival, or to meet someone, is that there's no where really to do that now - and that for me is a good issue. Besides this (renovations should be done by Sept I'm told), it remains one of my clear favourites in NYC and would have a five star rating otherwise.

title: Tremendous location and facility
text:
We had the opportunity to stay 5 nights at this property - a first time  with this hotel chain.  It was a New York trip that was a combination of business and pleasure.  We only used the room and did not use the pool, spa or restaurant so cannot make an informed comment about those amenities but they looked fabulous.
The location is wonderful and the Mandarin is a well-run, high-end facility.  We were on the 40th floor in a standard king room with an excellent view.  Everything was luxurious with a tremendous bathroom.  Since I was there for a conference, we did not pay rack rates but received what I have to call a bargain rate compared to what I would have paid for a personal visit.  If you have the desire for a first-class stay in Manhattan, the Mandarin is highly recommended.

title: No brainer for a class A stay
text:
If your like me I spend hours comparing and contrasting hotels not knowing which is the best in a place I am unfamiliar.  I took a chance on this hotel as we knew we wanted to be close to Central Park to run.  The service is top notch. We were greeted by a fantastic valet gentleman, bell man remembered our names even after dinner, front desk gentleman actually walked us up to our room since we were having a conversation about a new restaurant in town..  A little special story, we asked the concierge for change and when he went over to the front desk ladies he shook every one of their hands to say hello it was really classy. ( 7/15 evening) He was working with another concierge Chris who was AWESOME and helped us a ton with restaurants and ideas. These guys really seem to truly want to help you have a great experience. Thanks guys!

The room we had was on the 49th floor great view of the Hudson and city.  The hotel is a GREAT location.  We ran Central Park in the morning and walked 1 mile for a play in the afternoon.  It is so nice to say here and have some quiet after the craziness of Time square.  Rooms have great amenities, toothpaste, shaving cream extra touches which are just nice and not often included anymore. The rooms have an asian flare and are very comfortable.  I would agree with one of the other reviewers that this is a 5 star hotel with a 6 star experience.  Don't overthink it, just book if this hotel if your looking for a higher end experience. Thanks to all the staff for a great stay!

title: LUXE COCKTAIL HAVEN HIGH ABOVE COLUMBUS CIRCLE
text:
NYC'S MANDARIN ORIENTAL is buzzing with excitement as Chicago cuisine visionary, GRANT ACHATZ, launches his exclusive new GASTRO BAR, "THE OFFICE: NYC."

On a recent summer theater stay at the Mandarin Oriental, what a delightful surprise to find this exclusive speak-easy open for business & ready to take very good care of us at cocktail time. We had just delighted in NYC's own "Manhattan-henge" sending startling sunset straight thru the crosstown streets & came home to the hotel to find this new treat. 

Located on our 35th-floor hotel lobby with other Mandarin Oriental courtesy services, including its fragrant spa & the Asiate Restaurant (which still serves my favorite NYC corporate breakfast with eagle-soaring views), this jewel of a cocktail haven is accessed, with the help of the concierge & a reservation, through a velvet-draped hidden passageway. 

"THE OFFICE: NYC" is all about service. Our hosts, Sebastian & Anthony, tucked us into a comfortable dining nook with rich leather seating & dark wood to enjoy discovering this new bar with the feel of a private speak-easy. 

Brass antiques abound, with little secrets appurtenances, like a dancing monkey sculpture & a non-functioning antique radio which swivels open to reveal brandy & crystal highballs ready to pour out the fun. 

Even though a special "THE OFFICE: NYC -- EXTINCT SPIRITS & ANTIQUITIES" menu was served, with liquor arranged by historical decade, the approach with our cocktail order was an emphasis on personal interplay with our bartender. 

Nicholas, quite the drinks-master, scoped out my abiding preference for wine, even over his inventive cocktail suggestions & he graciously provided me with a Château Pressac Saint-Émilion Grand Cru Classé 2007 which was not even on the menu for my drinking pleasure before the Lincoln Center Festival ballet started, performed right there in the hotel building at the Rose Theater. 

What a prince of a wine this was to taste. First of all, classy fruit presented itself in the nose with the rest of its heady almost-caramel fragrance. And then, on the tongue, a well-rounded smooth​, actually​ rather extravagant​ Bordeaux. Although the non-stem wine-glasses are not to my liking, I admit they are​ ​of late​ stylishly cutting-edge.

Lovely ​signature ​etched plates ​& stem-ware are also served with the small plate menu specialties. We enjoyed the Salmon Rillettes dressed with créme fraîche aux fine herbs​ & yellow caviar & buttered buckwheat toast. This was a familiar dish from my grandma's ​table ​& it was even served potted in a ​comfy-looking covered glass dish, with the freshest​-ever​ herbs on top ​& even a few brilliant red flower petals.

To finish with something sweet​ before putting on lipstick for the theater, we had blueberry cobbler with creamy sorbet & drooled with honey that tasted like lavender. 

Next time,​ we want to try​ the​ Prime Rib-eye Tartare, because Nicholas was bragging on the beef ​---​& for me, the special Iberian Ham dish​. The Mandarin Oriental does continue to impress.

title: Six Stars!
text: The Manadarin NYC is an incredible hotel. Great location, and probably the best hotel staff I've ever encountered. Large rooms with great views, especially the park-view rooms. The swimming pool on 16 is a neat treat, although it'd be great if they had a hot tub too. Breakfast at Asiate was delicious, even if the staff there seems to move at their own leisurely pace. Overall, just a wonderful experience that I can't recommend highly enough.

title: Perfect place to stay
text: I stayed in mandarin oriental wz family for 3days, it's fabulous! The location is good, and the view face to Central Park which is amazing. It's very convenience cuz the hotel connect with Columbus mall, all you want to buy just go downstairs. I love mandarin hotels so much. I am a fan.

title: Gem of a hotel
text: I stayed here for my birthday and it was one of the nicest hotels I have have stayed at.  Cant say anything negative. Room beautiful, View wonderful, Restaurant amazing . Just a wonderful experience for my birthday.

title: Incredible Stay for Wedding
text: This is as expected a beautiful hotel in an awesome location right on the corner of the park. We were in town for a wedding (also held at the hotel in the ballrooms) and had a great weekend at MO. Room was nice, though a bit underwhelming when compared with other Mandarin rooms I have stayed in. The service and food in the restaurant was good, but again nothing too special. We were most impressed with the food, service, arrangements, and everything surrounding the wedding. Truly the most beautiful night I have ever been a part of. The Mandarin team was unbelievable throughout and we really enjoyed it.

title: Good but Not MO Good
text:
We like to stay at MO during our holidays - great hotel, great service across the cities we have visited.

This summer we decided to vacation on the east coast and NY is the first leg of the trip - we decided to spend about a week at MO. 

This is a good hotel and service levels are good compared to a number of other NY hotels. But it pales when compared with MO's elsewhere.

Simple stuff like timely housekeeping is absent. Amenities are not replenished...room service is fine but not too much choice (and there have been no attempts to create food outside regular menu - read my review of the Prague MO which was a class apart). It's just not MO experience.

As I said earlier...it's a good place if you are comparing with a normal NY hotel. But if you are expecting a typical MO, this is probably not it.

title: Vue imprenable sur central park
text:
Un hôtel de style classique avec une touche orientale, bénéficiant d'une situation géographique exceptionnelle, central park est à vos pieds. le service est de toute première qualité, de l'accueil au room service en passant par le spa. N'oubliez surtout pas votre maillot de bain pour une inoubliable baignade parmi les grattes ciel new-yorkais.
Une très belle adresse.

title: First time fabulous !
text:
I have stayed at other Mandarin hotels, Hong Kong, London, Vegas but this was the first time staying in New York.

It was wonderful, I stayed in a Hudson view room located on the 51st floor and it was just lovely, from housekeeping daily to turndown nightly was just great.

My only regret was that I didn't spend long in the hotel due to commitments elsewhere so didn't get to dine or drink or even sample the spa but will return in October to spend more leisure time for me.

I must give a very special mention to Billy the concierge who had a shared love of the theatre and our joint love of the show "The Great Comet"....he was more than helpful and please do pass on my thanks to him.

I was shown around other rooms and suites for different views for my next visit by one of the reception staff but sadly have forgotten her name.

All in all the Mandarin continues with its first class service, from the door staff who remembered me by name each time I came in or went out to everyone else....just perfect.

Thank you.

Annee

title: Un dîner au top
text:
Un dîner merveilleux pour notre dernière soirée à New York en famille.
Belle table ronde centrale avec vue panoramique sur Manhattan au coucher du soleil :magique !
Service impeccable 
Des assiettes raffinées et esthétiques, mais un peu juste en quantité.
Très bon vin américain (pinot noir) servi -par contre généreusement -au verre.
Au final une très belle soirée ( avec un prix en rapport..) 
Un bémol : la clim trop fraîche ( on a tous fini en pull!

title: *As Usual - Perfect Stay*
text: What's not to Love?!? - From Check-in, Mandarin Oriental has this fixed to ensure you don't waste any time... escort to your room; if need be.  Go around the hotel and it feels like you've been there for days when you just really arrived moments ago.  Love the Bathroom space and the view is incredible!

title: best service in town
text:
i love the location of mandarin oriental, sitting right between midtown and uptown.   You can walk a bit up to lincoln center for more laidback and residential ambience; and you can also easily get to midtown by walk or take a subway downtown.  
the service was great, i stayed for 9 days and have not encountered any situation where i was unsatisfied.  i am particularly impressed with concierge. it's a service so often overlooked nowadays and mandarin oriental reminded me there are things beyond what yelp and opentable can do.  the concierge staffs had great knowledge of the city, from warning me which subway lines go on construction during weekends to getting me into top restaurants in the city.   Bill at concierge is the best concierge ever, he is always one step ahead of our needs.  i don't think i can say that about any other hotel service i have experienced in the past few years.  
my only complain is the minibar which uses an automated fridge that reminds me of business hotels in japan in the 90s....  the fridge is packed with drinks and left no space for me to use, and once removed from the slot the drinks will be charged to your bill automatically.  i don't understand why a five star hotel in new york city would install that.  
overall, i think this hotel was worth every penny.

title: Visual impressionante
text: O 34º andar do Mandarin Oriental Hotel tem um bar onde se pode comer e beber com um vista do Central Parque. O serviço é atencioso mas frio. O WiFi é pago para quem não está hospedado no hotel o que é uma política pouco simpática mas tudo é superado pelo visual deslumbrante.

title: Ultimate New York Experience
text: We booked one night at the Mandarin Oriental in New York just to have the ultimate New York experience. Wow! We were given a room with a view of the Hudson River on the 51st Floor - it was dizzying and exhilarating and something we will NEVER forget. The Mandarin Oriental is a culture all its own. We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Las Vegas and decided to pursue this one even if it was for just one night. So worth it. The MO is known for its impeccable service. Everything - every moment - from the moment a guest walks in and gets to the lobby on the 35th floor - to checking in - to going into your room - is special. The room is absolutely gorgeous and the view - through a floor to ceiling window - was breathtaking. My teen son and I went for a swim in the indoor pool and had a chance to glimpse the spa. Next time !!!!!! Later in the evening we had drinks in the lobby lounge with relatives - everybody LOVED it - there is an eager crowd of people who frequent this place as the atmosphere is so festive and elegant. There is no doubt in my mind that I have become a Mandarin Oriental devotee. They've got me hooked.

title: Sterling service and kind hearts
text: I have been staying at Mandarin Oriental numerous times over at least a decade and I have always likes the place.  Last night was very special however. This time my family and I are in New York and not even staying in a hotel. My daughter was scheduled to leave in the morning for Boston to attend a summer program for high school kids in Harvard. As sometimes happens when you deal with kids and paperwork, only literally last minute we did figure out she needed a hard copy print out of some form right there and then. And then was well past 1 in the middle of the night. Happily for us, we were next door to MO. Despite the late hour, the gracious reception team offered their help, allowed my nervous teenager to log into their system and got the desired document neatly printed out. Thank you Mandarin Oriental and special thanks to Anita. You guys are the best.

title: Bar brasserie en etage
text:
Vue superbe pour le prix d'un cafe à $10 plus un bon dessert du cite ouest de Central Park 
Tres agreable et reposant à l'heure du dejeuner 
Belle skyline et vue surplombant Columbus Circle à côté de Trump appartements

title: Simply perfect
text: Not a detail is overlooked at this hotel.  It's location is ideal, the rooms are very spacious and quiet and all the hotel staff were extremely kind and caring. The chicken curry I ordered from room service was delicious.  I didn't have a chance to use the spa, but it looked lovely!

title: A night out in my own city
text:
I've always wanted to experience a night of luxury and romance in my hometown.  On a whim, I decided to book a weekend and enjoy the Mandarin Oriental and the spa facilities.  This was one of the most extraordinary and memorable experiences I've had in a long time, and it was a pleasure to have it in my own backyard.

The rooms are luxurious, the views of Central Park and the surrounding skyline is impeccable.  The service was simply the best.  Whether you're staying for a few days or you just want a weekend away, the views alone are so worth the reservation.

title: GREAT VIEWS
text: A very nice five star hotel located by the park. The hotel has great views of the park and the Hudson River. Shopping is located on the first few floors which makes for fun during your down time. hope you agree

title: Excellent location;lovely room and views
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in late April.  Close to the Metropolitan Opera, Central Park, subway and Broadway. Easy walk through the Park to Guggenheim, Frick, and walkable to MoMA. Staff are very courteous.  Bill at Concierge was quite knowledgeable.  Breakfast was a bit mediocre but the view makes up for it.  When we return to NYC, we'll stay here again.

title: Elegant and convenient on the Upper West Side
text: I am a New Yorker as I lived in the Big Apple for more than a decade.  When I return to the city, I usually stay in SoHo at The Crosby, but since I was helping my daughter relocate to the Upper West Side, I needed to stay close and chose the Mandarin Oriental. There was a special promotion with the third night free and I grabbed it.  I was there for 7 nights and basically paid for 5 nights.  Such a deal!  I was also upgraded to a Park view because I booked through American Express (something that I rarely experience with this benefit).  The staff was always accommodating and willing to go the extra mile with a smile.  The room was nicely appointed, large and very comfortable.  However, housekeeping was not always consistent, especially at turndown.  Aside from that small misstep, I could not have been happier or felt more at home away from home.  I will be returning again soon!

title: 優雅な気持ちになれる
text: 主人と二人きりの旅行ははじめてでした。少し不安でしたが、セントラルパークを眺めながらの朝食はとても心和むひと時でした(^^)

title: High Tea
text: My daughters and I had high tea at the Mandarin Oriental yesterday.  We were on a girls trip and it was also my daughter's birthday.  We had a reservation and were seated close to but not at the window.  Our waiter noticed our disappointment and as soon as a a window table was available they moved us which was very thoughtful as we hadn't asked to be moved.  The whole experience was lovely and relaxing.  The service was amazing.  Our scones, sandwiches and sweets were delicious, not to mention the cream and homemade jam.  They presented my daughter with 3 chocolate covered strawberries with a lit candle for a bday treat.  We couldn't finish all of the sweets but took them to enjoy later.  I would highly recommend and plan on returning next visit to NYC.  Thanks for such a pleasurable dining experience!!

title: Service A+, Location A+, Rooms A+, Restaurants A+
text:
I stayed here for two nights while attending a conference.  The hotel is superb - service, rooms, restaurants, location, etc.    Rooms are very comfortable and very quiet (unusual for NYC).  

My only recommendation would be to not charge for the Internet.    Considering rooms are $1250+/night, it doesn't seem appropriate to charge an additional 1% ($10/night) for Internet.  

I would recommend and stay here again.

title: Never Again
text: It was my 60th birthday and I just finished riding my motorcycle to Maine, via Key West and Canada. I normally stay at the  Peninsula, but this time I decided to change it up. During the reservation I was told the suite I booked had a "full Hudson River and Statute of Liberty View.." Not even close! At best, we saw small glimpses of the river and the Statute of Liberty was nowhere to be found. The onsite restaurant is basically a Dennys, at which I never eat, but we elected to try their breakfast. I am certainly not a penny pincher, but for $110 (pancakes, eggs, coffee and on orange juice), I thought it may be delicious. Again, not even close! I stayed in suite 4530 at $1995 per night and found it to be dark, damp and musty. The employees are nice and professional, except for the doorman, that guy is useless. The only other good thing I can articulate is the limo service arranged thru the hotel is the best I have experienced. Lastly, the lobby is on the 35th floor and depending on which elevator you use, one must switch elevators at least twice to gain room access. I feel I wasted almost $7000 for three days at this subpar property.

title: The Very Best
text: I have been coming to the Mandarin Oriental, for years. I have never had anything but the very best of food and service. It is beautiful. I love the atmosphere, the view from the 35th floor, overlooking Central Park and Columbus Circle is stunning. The Mandarin is very gracious and welcoming whether you are coming to stay for weeks or just pop in to see the view. A delightful New York experience.

title: Over the top
text:
Albergo eccezionale, vista imperdibile su Central park, servizio buono 
Ottimo l'accesso diretto al supermercato e ai vari negozi. Per gli uomini un ottimo compromesso per non dover attendere la moglie mentre fa shopping, seduti su una panchina. 
L'albergo dispone di una piscina al 40mo piano (+/-) con una vista imperdibile su tutta New York.

title: Amazing location, amazing hotel, amazing view
text:
We stayed here almost a week in March, 2016 and the views are spectacular. We had a view of Central Park, and it was gorgeous even that time of year.
Make sure you eat at Asiate, and get a table next to the window at dusk where you can see Colomubus Circle light up.
Great location, of course, and the rooms are fabulous.
I found the hotel staff to be friendly, and especially accomodating, as we were celebrating a 16th birthday girl. She was so happy!

title: Beautiful hotel!
text: I love this hotel! Staff very friendly, Spa was very good with 5 star service and room was beautiful and clean! I didn't eat at the restaurant but front desk give me advice where to get the best food. They help to provide complimentary transport to hospital for my father treatment.  My first time at this hotel, but no my last! See you soon!

title: Gorgeous Views of central park
text: Have stayed at almost all the Central park hotels and I loved the views ( much higher than most) and clear unsurpassed views of Central park. Walk straight out the door across the street into the park. Hotel is on higher floors so the check in is very calm and smooth - foyer restaurant is a buzz with large full wall windows.  Had business and dined in the Restaurant against the windows and soaked up New York sky line with really attentive waiting staff. Unobtrusive but focused on what was happening on the table with drinks, food plates etc. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous - pillows - feather duvette - amenitites were well selected and fresh. Breakfast after a long walk in central park had some unique different choices which was refreshing - try the Japanese breakfast box - light delicious and fresh. Seating is different level so you all get to capture the views. If you are looking for under stated luxury - quiet elegance and the true brand of Mandarin Oriental in an iconic location with absolutely high stunning views from many windows then you should stay here. Spring is the best time as its warmer - the park is in full bloom and love the energy of all the dogs walking. Joined a fun run  on the Saturday which gave you a sense of community right off. Concierge at street level are fantastic and well trained and knowledgeable in getting you in the right direction for a Pharmacy or  any item you may require. Made you feel at home when they welcome you back each time - sometimes by name !

title: Mit Familie in der Stadt
text: Wir verbrachten mit unserem vierjährigen Sohn die Zeit vom 18.-22. Mai im Mandarin Oriental New York. Bereits im Vorfeld kontaktierten wir den fabelhaften Concierge wegen Hoteltransfers, Babysitter und Restaurantreservierungen. Alle Probleme könnten gelöst und alle Wünsche erfüllt werden. Das Hotel bietet jeden erdenklichen 5-Sterne Komfort. Die Zimmer sind für NYC-Verhältnisse geräumig, der Ausblick auf den Central Park ist trotz wirklich störendem Trump-Tower grandios. Ich genoss es, jeden Morgen während meine Familie noch schlummerte, durch den Central Park zu joggen. Rund ums Reservoir und zurück ca. 8km. Die Mitarbeiter waren allesamt herzlich freundlich und fachkompetent. Die Speisen, sowohl Frühstück als auch Dinner im"Asiate", selbstverständlich vorzüglich. Das Mandarin war ein sicherer, luxuriöser Hafen vor und während unsererseits Aufenthalts. Es würde uns schwer fallen, bei unserem nächsten Besuch in NYC aufs Mandarin verzichten zu müssen.

title: À la hauteur de la qualité....
text:
Perché au 35eme étage ce resto est incroyable. Quand vous entrez dans l'hôtel on vous dirige vers l'ascenseur réservé au resto. Le cadre est idilique. Le service irréprochable et la nourriture mmmmmm. Attention à la carte des boissons elle contient 34 pages de crus classés et déclassés, le meilleur côtoie le pire et les prix de 125$ à.......75000$.
J'y retournerai

title: 1400 Dollars for a what!?
text:
I have always heard people gush about the mandarin oriental and was curious to see why. My wife and I, came to NY for a family event and figured it would be a good opportunity to see what this hotel is all about.

First things first, 1400 dollars a night for a room, I was expecting the accommodations to be in the same category as the St. Regis. We were escorted to our room, only to realize how cramped and small it was. The view was not particularly great, as we were blocked by tons of buildings and faced the beautifully green looking Hudson River. I thought maybe the bathroom is what people love about this place. I was wrong. While the bathroom is big and luxurious, it is an odd layout with a cheap looking bathtub and toilet. It was very narrow and the doors would not close. The bed was average and had very tough pillows.

When I woke up in the morning, I needed a coffee and figured the room service would be just fine. My coffee was watery and tasted like it sat on the fire since 6am. The only great thing was the late check out for 3pm, as this is very uncommon in NYC hotels.

I am generally not someone who complains however, for this price I was expecting a little more. If you are contemplating spending this type of money, there are far better options.

title: Disappointing
text: The rooms are well equipped but quite small. The maid service was terrible (had to call for evening turndowns and daily room makeup). Food in the restaurant was good, but the service was indifferent and inattentive. Way overpriced for what you get. Will not return.

title: Suite of amazing views and excellent service
text:
Caveat: I did not pay for this hotel room - it was given as perk for hosting a corporate event in the hotel. The Suite was amazing. Beautiful living room/dining room combination with its own bathroom, and the bedroom was large with a nice armchair and footstool to enjoy the city views. It overlooks Central Park and from this Suite, you can also see the River to the West. The shades are electric so you can make it very dark or leave them open and enjoy the day and evening city views. We were lucky to have a full moon that night so we watched it rise over the city.
Breakfast in the room was prompt and the coffee was delicious.

title: Top.....ma bisogna migliorare qualcosina
text:
Bellissima location con vista mozzafiato su Central Park...camere curate,buona colazione anche se la mancanza di un buffet di frutta ed altro e inaccettabile per un posto dove si pagano 1000€ per una notte!
Possono e devono migliorare

title: Beautiful, luxurious with stupendous views of the park
text:
At Luxury Trips by Bea, we try to visit some of the most luxurious hotels in the world and this is without a doubt a must stay at hotel for those who want a little luxury and tranquility in a busy city.  
Asiate is a great restaurant while staying here.
The rooms are spacious, Luxury Trips by Bea stayed here over Christmas and New Year and surprisingly, we were upgraded to a stunning park view (picture attached).
The staff are helpful and multilingual along with super knowledgable.  
100% recommend staying here.

title: Great location
text: We had great service, good food & drinks! Our room wss perfect with a fine view of Central Park & the front desk, concierge, & housekeeping people were so friendly and accomadating! It doesn't get any better than that!

title: Extraordinary and gracious service.
text:
We just returned home from a quick 3 night stay at the MONY. The hotel is beautiful indeed, however, the real deep attraction is the delivery by every staff member of an extraordinary level of understanding of our needs and requests. Every request was managed both competently and graciously. 

The facility is lovely and all food and beverage matches expectations. 

Although the hotel has been on scene for more than a decade they continue to set the standard for a true five star hotel in New York.

title: Un long we en amoireux
text:
Un hôtel très haut de game idéalement situé offrant des vues magnifiques sur New York .
J'ai aimé la qualité des chambres, le détail du souci dans la décoration, et la qualité de la restauration .
Un petit bémol sur les tarifs pratiqués au spa qui pour le coup sont vraiment prohibitifs .
Pour le reste rien à redire , un service conciergerie au top .

title: Hello New York
text:
Fantastic hotel, gorgeous rooms, award winning views, amazing views and location
I really highly recommended this hotel 
The hotel start from the 35 floor until 68 
They have good SPA and amazing restaurants you most book in advance

title: Traumhaftes Wochenende in New York
text: Perfekter kann man in New York nicht wohnen und sich verwöhnen lassen!!! Die Lage am Central Park ist perfekt und der Blick umwerfend! Das Frühstück ist nicht billig (2 Personen ca. 120$), aber der Wahnsinn! Pool im 36 Stock ist die perfekte Erholung nach einem langen Tag in der Stadt. Der Service ist super und die Mitarbeiter wachsam und freundlich! Gerne Wieder!

title: An amazing hotel!
text: My company treated me to a few nights at the Mandarin and it was the most beautiful hotel I have ever visited.  My suite had the most incredible views of the city and the room had every amenity possible!  The facilities at the spa and gym were amazing and super clean and the actual location of the hotel to great restaurants and the subway could not have been better.

title: Ausblick
text: Wunderbare Lage in der Stadt toller Service schöne Zimmer man fühlt sich sofort willkommen. Wir kommen gerne wieder.Das Frühstück können wir leider nicht beurteilen da ein Kaffee im Central Park einfach unschlagbar ist

title: 1 Night
text:
Having an out of town guest who had never been to NYC, they wanted a room with a Central Park view. There were many hotels in the area and this one was far from inexpensive.

Ultimately the room that was supposed to provide an amazing Central Park view, was very good for that, not excellent. However, the city view more than made up for that.
That aside, the room was beautiful and the staff incredibly accommodating on any request (wifi help, ice, and they even provided champagne glasses for our own). 

For those on a budget, it will be worth the 1 night if you want to be lost in luxury.

title: Magnifique vu depuis ce restaurant
text: Depuis ce 35 ième étage c'est époustouflant. vient ensuite le maître des lieux qui nous convient à notre table (réservé absolument) la carte est très attractive et les prix aussi heureusement il y a un menu à 38$ mais comme partout à NY le verre de vin est cher 23$. Total avec taxes et services 100$ par personne. Mais cela vaut vraiment le détour non seulement pour la vu mais aussi pour la cave à vin 3000 bouteilles derrière une vitre beau très très beau. Le restaurant s'appel Asiate (à faire)

title: Exceptional!
text: The staff, room and overall experience was 5 star and first class. I surprised my wife with a night at the Mandarin and it was pure luxury. We enjoyed a very large room with lovely views and the bathroom was surprisingly large side with a comfortable tub. Some might find it a bit pricey but it is in line with the luxury hotels we frequent around the world. We really enjoyed our visit!

title: Prepare to be spoiled
text: Service, room, meeting rooms, food.... all incredible. Special requests were honored in a flash. Service is definitely the high point here - this hotel knows how to make sure each guest feels taken care of. If you can afford the price tag, it is worth it for stunning views of central park.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: The room was amazing as was everything else coming with the hotel. The service was outstanding. The only downside to this hotel was it was quite far from Times Square and some major areas. However, it was worth the semi-long Uber rides to get places! I really enjoyed my stay!

title: Afternoon tea
text:
Nous sommes de très grands fans des afternoon tea et en faisons régulièrement.
Nous connaissions le Mandarin Oriental à Singapour et on s est dit pourquoi pas tester celui de New York.
Réservation faite par mail en précisant que ma femme et ma fille étaient végétariennes et surprise en arrivant ils avaient oublié . De plus, chez eux les afternoon tea se préparent à l avance donc j en déduis pas super frais car pas fait à la minute comme tout grands hôtels .
Thés meme pas servis dans des théières mais dans des tubes en verre. Le thé était tellement tiré qu il en était imbuvable.
Pour ce qui est des miniardises et sandwiches... bof bof.
À part la vue franchement ça n en vaut vraiment pas la peine.
48$ par personne c est trop cher !
Notre prochain afternoon tea sera à Londres dans un mois et aussi au Mandarin Oriental.
Je mettrai évidemment un commentaire de comparaison.
Déçu car on se faisait une joie .

title: Nice view but pricey!
text: Ate breakfast at 'The Lobby Lounge' at MO - New York. Amazing view and a nice breakfast overall but rather pricey(but hey, the view is pretty worth it!). The staff was OK. The interior was modern and fresh. MO is definitely worth a visit but maybe just for a coffee break next time!

title: Lobby bar meet
text: Had a sit down with a friend at the lobby bar. Atmosphere is really nice, love the view and not being repeatedly annoyed or interrupted by servers. I love the Xavier French rosé and tuna tartare, very delicious. Would visit again.

title: Special occasion
text: The view is beautiful but it is very expensive.  The gourmet entrees were delicious, but be prepared for small portions.  The pre fixe was $95 for one 3 course meal.  The restaurant was full yet it wasn't very loud.  The staff was very attentive.

title: Simply the best hotel in NYC.
text: I stayed for a couple of days in a park view suite.  Somehow they managed to get two corners in the suite--one in the living room and one in the bedroom, each with floor to ceiling glass...I really am just writing to say thank you to the staff who made such a big effort for my stay---and really appear to make every guest feel that they care about your stay.  Thank You.  The only thing they could do is add a few more electrical sockets. and maybe save a little less water in the shower.

title: Cocktails in the Sky
text: Recently had cocktails at the Mandarin Oriental in NYC.  The view of Columbus Circle and the skyline from the 35th floor is great.  Excellent Service.  Pricey cocktails, but no different than any other fancy hotel.  Go for a special treat, special occasion, or just a peaceful view in the sky, with drink in hand.  Grab a bite to eat.  Enjoy Afternoon Tea, which I have done a while back.  All service done with just that extra special touch.

title: Un hotel de todo lujo
text: Este hotel es espectacular . En cada paso que das observas detalles inigualables . Las vistas hacia Central Park son maravillosas . Es muy recomendable para estar en la Gran Manzana . Repetiría una y mil veces .

title: Lovely
text: What else can you expect but the best from the Mandarin here in NYC. The room was perfect. The bathroom was on the large side with a huge soaking tub with all the fixings.. Views that can't be matched, room, lobby and restaurants. The service was top notch...

title: Muy buen hotel
text: El hotel es bueno, con habitaciones comodas, baño inmenso y linda vista. lo unico malo en esta oportunidad es que no tenian late check out. por lo demas, muy Buena opcion. La comida para eventos si podria mejorar.

title: Excellent!
text:
Fantastic service from the first moment! The location is great with many sights within walking distance. The bar and restaurant is also really good and offer great views over the park. This is probably one of the best hotels in NYC!

I stayed in a room overlooking Central Park and it was worth the additional charge (compared to a room facing Hudson).

title: Mandarin Oriental
text: Excellent hotel with efficient service and excellent staff.  Rooms are slightly small, but well planned.  Concierge was extremely helpful.  Welcoming and all staff were extremely helpful and professional

title: Home away from home
text: This is home away from home in Manhattan . The view over Central Park are breathtaking, no matter what the season. We spend New York fashion week here, and the staff are like our own family. The spa makes a perfect city getaway and the bedrooms are spacious and elegant.

title: Staff are helpful.
text: I had one night in the luxurious hotel.Actually I've been to stay this chain hotel at Tokyo,Paris,Hong Kong and Taipei Mandarin Oriental hotels.The view  in New York is excellent.You could see the grand Central Park.Nice.

title: Will definitely be back
text:
I have just returned home from an amazing 10 night stay at the Mandarin Oriental, New York. Everything from check in to check out was seemless. The staff are excellent - each and every member of staff we encountered was friendly, knowledgable and happy to help. We stayed in a Hudson View room on the 53rd floor and the views were fabulous. The room was very spacious even by NYC standards as was the amazing bathroom complete with bath, large shower and TV. The level of in room house keeping is very high. I don't know how they manage it but the rooms are cleaned and made up immaculately and yet you never see housekeeping or housekeeping trolleys. I amazed how they do it. The turn down service provided nightly is also excellent as each night you are provided with a letter offering details of the weather forecast for the next day and possible activities for you to consider as well as a quote, or pearl of wisdom about sleep. It's a very nice touch.

We used in room dining a couple of times (breakfast and dinner) and the attention to detail is brilliant. They bring a table complete with linens and flowers and set the table as if you were dining in the restaurant. The food was excellent. 

The only thing that I felt was trying to be too clever and ultimately not working as well as it could was how they operate mini bar services. The mini bar and in room snacks are motion sensitive. Once you pick up and item from its spot you have 30 seconds to put it down or you are charged for it. We had seen this in the in room information which detailed this therefore did not pick anything up however at some point possibly during housekeeping items had been somehow dislodged and these items were now appearing on our bill. This issue was addressed and was a non issue however it seem like a cumbersome feature that is not fool proof.

In terms of location I loved this hotel. It is facing Central Park and more or less above the 59th Street Subway so is excellently appointed with all areas of NYC easily accessible from this location. 

I will definitely be back to this hotel and have plans  to try Mandarin Oriental properties in other locations when I travel.

title: Wonderful hotel in New York
text: This is one of the best hotels I've stayed. What I love most where the amazing views over Central Park. I also loved the location, is very convenient if you want to go to a concert or ballet at Lincoln Center. I enjoyed to have Central Park just downstairs.

title: excellent
text:
Met our son &family in NYC; had 3 bedrooms, plus a living room, for the 6 of us.

Stay was excellent. 

Andrew Archibald (front desk) did a great job with complicated room rearrangement; was always available &courteous.

Maid service was great, morning &night, esp. Chandra. 

Concierge did a great job; booked a restaurant (for 2 adults) at the last moment. Took care of a lost pair of eyeglasses, 'phoned to make sure it got back to us.

Great restaurants. Liked the Japanese breakfast.

Room service service was very good; food not as good as restaurants.

Fini (facial at SPA) is excellent; my wife recommends highly.

Bell desk was very good, Also doormen (taxi w/2 toddlers &stroller can be an issue).

Hotel car to/from airports is very good; not free.

Between the Mandarins in Paris, Munich, and NYC, this is the best.

title: Super hotel - but see my notes
text:
In total a super nice hotel ... as expected since the hotel is among the top-10 most expensive hotels in NYC. 

Here is my notes regarding the hotel. 

INTERNET PAYMENT!!
To pay to use the internet in a five star hotel in 2017 is simply NOT ok. Why dont you also charge for hot water? On a positive note, the WI-FI coverage is super, even in the spa. 

MINIBAR WITH SENSORS
The minibar has automatic sensors that make you pay if you remove items for more than 30 sek. Totally a thing most three-star hotels wouldnt install. 

PAPER 
Newspaper delivered to the door every morning is super nice. 

ICE
Automatically refill of icecubes in the room every day is a nice feature. 

ELEVATOR SECURITY
I noticed that the elevator wants a doorkey in order to stop at your exact floor. It is NOT enough that one person in the elevator has a key. A nice security-feature!

NOT DIRECT VIEW
We paid extra for Central Park View. We got the view but please note that the Trump building stands between you and the park (see picture) This is conviently NOT shown in the hotel-pictures.

title: Room with a view
text: I spent 3 nights at the Mandarin Oriental NY in Feb 2017. I had a room with views on central park from a 39th floor, OUTSTANDING. The breakfast was excellent and the staff very friendly. The location is great as there are many metro lines just by the hotel entrance and it is also perfect if you are keen for a morning run in Central Park.(thing to do)

title: Looooove this hotel!
text: Beautiful and accommodating hotel. Highly recommend staying here. Great fitness center and large indoor pool. Love the lounge at teatime  and Asian breakfasts. Great views since the hotel starts on the 35th floor.

title: Excellent Room Excellent Service
text:
The room is well amenitied and the bed very comfortable. There are functional blackout drapes and nice linen plus toiletries. Of the 2 room types we liked the Park view because we could make it totally dark. The Hudson view has a larger bathroom. Both have stall showers plus tubs.

We found it convenient to have a shopping mall in the building when the weather was bad. There are also 4 restaurants in the mall so you have plenty to choose from. Across the street in the Trump International there is a 3 star Michelin restaurant. Lincoln Center is 3 blocks south and Carnegie Hall 5 blocks northeast. There was a taxi stand on Columbus Circle at the mall entrance so it was easy to get a cab. There is also a subway down stairs plus Central Park across the street.

title: Amazing food with an amazing view
text: I am never one to take photos of my food when it arrives, but this was so impressive I couldn't resist. Presentation was just as amazing as the taste and to top it all off, you have panoramic views of Central Park. 5* service with a very reasonably priced lunch menu. Will definitely return!

title: Nice views
text: Party of 4. Great venue with excellent views. Very good service. Food was elaborated but expensive and I didn't get to appreciate the whole of it. Soups were just ok and gnocchi didn't impress me much.

title: Fantástico
text: Dormí en una suite que me dejó sin palabras , espectacular todos los detalles . Un hotel muy bien ubicado . Personal siempre muy atento y amables . Un desayuno que sin dudas para mí ha sido uno de los mejores de NY.Room Service muy eficiente . Caro pero vale la pena para un capricho de fin de semana en NY.

title: Best Luxury Hotel in New York
text: My husband and I spent the night at the Mandarin Oriental in New York last week and the Mandren is now our favorite hotel. We have had the opportunity to travel the world and we have tried several different hotels in New York City. By far the Mandarin has the most luxurious rooms with the best views of Central Park and the city skyline.  We booked through AMEX FHR and were treated very well!  The staff was great and the spa was the best I've ever been to in all my travels and the restaurant Asiate was just delicious and had the most amazing views.  We are extremely happy with our choice in NYC and we will definitely be back.    We absolutely loved our stay.

title: 좋았습니다.
text: 기념일이라서 카드사 VIP 컨시어지 서비스를 이용해서 이호텔에 묵었습니다. 하지만 너무나 기대했던 탓있지 첫날 서비스는 별로였습니다. 룸상태는 아주 좋았습니다. VIP 컨시어지 서비스 덕분인지 기념일이라서 그런건지 서비스로 와인을 받았습니다. 감사합니다. 위치는 편리한 곳에 위치해있습니다. 고층이라서 뷰가 좋았습니다.

title: Stunning hotel
text: Breathtaking views, exceptional service, a great location, bottomless brunch is an absolute must. A real treat an whilst it's pricey, I felt it reflected value! A piece of heaven, would return at the drop box f a hat!

title: Great view, lovely service
text: Went to the Oriental on recommendation from friends it was lovely; excellent service and a lovely view of a Columbus Circle. Just after dusk, so could only see lights.......not really Central Park.  Two Drinks and nibbles cost us  $120 -and we were only there for about 45 minutes due to needing to leave for Madison square Gardens. Expensive for Aussies but one of those New York experiences.

title: Maravilhoso hotel no Point de New York
text: Sensacional hotel no Best Point de New York.Super próximo do Central Park.Localizacao perfeita.Otimo atendimento .Restaurantes maravilhosos.Solicito quartos Park View. Recepção em local surpreendente.

title: Afternoon Tea Delight
text: My Sister and I had afternoon tea here to celebrate her birthday.  The view over Central Park was fantastic.  The food was delicious and plentiful, especially the ginger scones.  I could not fault the service.  Would thoroughly recommend.

title: Heaven!
text: We recently stayed at the Mandarin for my niece's birthday.  What a treat!  From the outstanding service at check-in, the amazing suite overlooking central park AND the Hudson River, the incredible room service and of course, THE SPA!!!!  Great location, attached to the Time Warner Center in Columbus Circle (shopping, dining, etc.).  In the words of Ferris Bueller, "If you have the means, I highly recommend it!"

title: Spectacular in every way
text:
My wife and I recently stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in NYC as part of our "mini-moon" after our wedding.

Everything about this hotel is spectacular. Checking in was quick and friendly, and the gentleman at the front desk personally brought us to our room. The room  overlooked Central Park and Columbus Circle...and since we were on the 53rd floor, we had an amazing view of the city. The decor was elegant, but comfortable and "home-like," with a very comfortable bed and a large flat-screen TV. The bathroom had a shower (with "normal" and "rainfall" showerheads) and a large tub. There was plenty of closet and drawer space (far more than we needed).

The lounge off to the side of the lobby has wonderful views of the city, as well as delicious food, great drinks, and friendly and attentive staff.  If you get a couch next to the windows you won't want to leave.

We ate breakfast in the restaurant (also on that main lobby floor) and the food was absolutely fantastic. And, of course, the view can't be beat.

We spent one morning at the spa...and we could have easily spent the whole day. The staff was friendly, the massages were rejuvenating, the facilities are amazing, and we even saw a celebrity! (Smiles were exchanged, but we were respectful of their privacy.)

In terms of location...it's tough to beat the Mandarin: it's right on Columbus Circle, across the street from Central Park, within easy walking distance of Broadway shows (we walked to see a show one night), and if the weather is bad you can spend a few hours walking and shopping in the mall on the first couple of floors of the building.  (There are also some fantastic restaurants there.)

Every staff member we encountered - from the gentlemen at the front entrance, to the staff in the lounge and restaurant, to the cleaning staff - was exceedingly polite, very friendly and always helpful.

I've stayed in a lot of nice hotels in NYC, around the country, and around the world, and this was easily one of the best places I've ever stayed.  In fact, we are hoping to make this an annual "anniversary" trip.

Let's be honest: Is the Mandarin Oriental expensive? Absolutely.

Is it worth that expense? Without a doubt.

It is - as my review title states - spectacular in every way.

title: Very nice view of the Park
text:
Modern hotel with great service, very nice rooms and beautiful view. Stayed in the hotel a few time and 
prefer it over other New York hotels. Got an upgrade to a room facing the park. 
I noticed an improvement in the reception service. It was always good but it got even better.
At times (Christmas, for example) prices can get quite steep.

title: MO NYC STAY
text: The Mandarin Oriental Hotel in New York is an exceptional hotel and always feels like home. For the past 13 years it has always exceeded our expectation. The staff are very experienced and the service is impeccable

title: Impressive service, spectacular views, central location
text: Extremely well managed hotel, excellent level of performance in all services, a 75 foot pool in 36th floor ! Interesting presentation of menus like the lounge bar new "east box menu". The Sat & Sun brunch at their Asiate restaurant is a bargain. Enough variety even for our 7 night stay.

title: Great luxury hotel in Columbus Circle
text: While i typically do not use luxury hotels for business, this was the site for a conference.  The quality of service and facilities is what you should be able to expect from a luxury hotel.  Great food, including room service; great staff; great coffee; great water pressure; everything clean and up to date.

title: Perfection
text:
My husband and I decided to splurge and stay at the Mandarin Oriental for two nights to celebrate a special anniversary. Our trip was nothing short of spectacular. The Mandarin was a perfect choice for romance and respite. Here's why:

--the service is really wonderful. Every person we encountered was kind, friendly, and helpful. 
--when the hotel learned of our anniversary, they sent up champagne, sweets, and a congratulatory note. 
--our room was beautiful, the bed was heavenly, the bathroom luxurious, and the Central Park views were spectacular. 
--the location of the hotel cannot be beat. It's a quick walk or train ride to pretty much anywhere. And Central Park is right there! I also think it's advantageous to have the Time Warner shops sharing the building with the hotel as well. We enjoyed some light shopping and picked up treats from Bouchon Bakery. 
--we took advantage of the pool and gym. The pool is really beautiful! It was also empty when we used it so we had it all to ourselves. 
--breakfast at Asiate each morning was a true treat. My husband and I are usually too busy for our own good. It was such a pleasure to start each morning by slowing down and savoring a delicious breakfast in such a peaceful and lovely setting. Service was, of course, perfect.

Although we only stayed for a couple nights, the Mandarin managed to feel like home for us. We hope to return next year too! Thank you for such a memorable stay.

title: Middag med mor o far.....
text: Underbar kväll. De på The Pierre hjälpe oss med bokning.... de ordnade även med hotellets bil tills oss. Väl framme, underbar byggnad att njuta av. Väl upp x antal våningar möter du en fatastisk vy. Middagen som sedan följde är något som måste upplevas. Mat, dryck o service, världsklass 🥂👍🏽🍾

title: The Mandarin Oriental on Central Park is an excellent place to stay.
text: I have only positive things to say about my recent stay at the Mandarin.  I traveled on 2/9/17, the day that a winter storm covered the northeast.  The concierge staff monitored my flight status and made sure that a driver was there to greet me at LGA when my flight finally landed. Bill Hawkins was on duty when I arrived. He and the rest of the concierge staff left a delicious bottle of Pinot Noir in my room - it was a wonderful way to start my stay in my beautiful room (room #4210), overlooking Central Park. Room service staff, restaurant staff, front desk staff, cleaning staff - all excellent. My bed was quite comfortable and my room was clean. The location is great, close to everything. I walked to Exhale Spa and took a great Core Fusion Barre class on Saturday. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Perfect service
text: Really enjoyed the hotel while attending the Westminster dog show this week. Location is great. Service was exceptional. Love the bookmark left on my bedside table for the novel I was reading. Food was great, housekeeping was top notch.

title: A stunning view for Afternoon Tea
text: Highly recommend the afternoon tea here, the views over Central Park are second to none. Food was lovely and the staff were great. A lovely treat. We did not stay in the hotel, we went especially for afternoon tea, definitely recommend.

title: Exceptional Property!
text: Really a top notch hotel, beautiful views of central park, room could not be any more spotless and well appointed. Phenomenal restaurant and cocktail lounge. Everything is so elegant & romantic. Great location in Columbus Circle, service is truly great. The cost is somewhat breathtaking, but this is as good at it gets.

title: Beautiful and lauxeriouse
text: went to a charity event in the ball room on the 36 floor of hotel - the views were breath taking - the smorg served were excellent - a very enjoyable evening at a fantastic hotel settings on the 36 floor overlooking East side and Park

title: LAST MINUTE TRIP
text:
from the minute you pull up to the time you check out....service was first rate...must commend the bell captain for use of hotel car to run an errand rather than a taxi. Front desk very pleasant and helpful.
Service at the lounge was very efficient.

title: Excellent
text: We stayed in a king room with a Hudson River view , room was well appointed and the maid service was efficient . Service at this hotel was exceptional ,staff were pleasant and concierge went above and beyond to accommodate all of our requests . Will stay here again

title: 便利なラグジュアリーホテル
text: ホテルの全体的な印象は良かったですが、お値段がもう少し安ければ次回も利用すると思う。スタンダードの部屋は広くないので価格に見合っていない。

title: Luxury indulgence with best Central Park View     Room service need improvement
text: We have visited MO NYC many times(30 plus times )  since the Columbus Circle  Warner / Time centre opened .   A most convenient location to get key locations  in the city  . Tons of restaurants ( PER SE to MASA) close by .The check in area on 30 plus floors , process is seamless , doorman smart and helpful ( don't confuse with the residence door on left ) The room / suite spacious and well appointed , modern and functional .  Cleaning staff efficient and polite . Exercise room is good not great , the Pool is best in NYC , 25 meter wide ,and spectacular view.  Share with residences . SPA is superb , always has room for guest for massage. . We stayed there for thanksgiving  a few  times , they have a big party for kids the ballroom, where you watched  the parade from high Both lounge and their restaurent have friendly staff and a menu for all ages. Both offer spectacular views . Room service may be a weakness , not on time . One  time ,a nail in the salad ,the chef and  food manager came up to apologize .  We asked for extra rice , a extra scoop charge was 10 dollars !  We were shocked ! The room service was better for the first 5/8 years , then spiral down a bit .  I compared room services to two near by hotel we also visited Trump / Pennisula both better . We have family with grand kids and we used in room dining a lot For that reason , we are shy going back to the hotel.  MO In Hong Kong we visited frequently with our grand kids ,never a problem .  If I come just with my wife and plan to dine out , I do not mind MO at all, still an excellent hotel in every many ways

title: Best Staycation in NYC!
text: What else can you expect but the best from the Mandarin here in NYC.  The room although on the small side was perfect.  The bathroom was on the large side with a huge soaking tub with all the fixings...Tv..Salt..tray for reading everything. Views that can't be matched from the soaking tub, room, lobby and restaurants. The service was top notch and genuine.  The facilities were well maintained and fresh.  Everything about the hotel is perfect to make you feel relaxed and stress free in NYC of all places.

title: Soggiorno perfetto
text: Ho pernottato tre notti nell'insegna della perfezione. L'intero Staff è professionale, pronti a risolvere qualsiasi problema o appagare qualsiasi esigenza. La mia camera aveva una bellissima vista sul Central Park, da mozzare il fiato. Pulizia straordinaria, servizio room keeping due volte al giorno, cambio giornaliero sia della biancheria del letto, che del bagno. A prescindere dai giorni perfetti che ho passato al M.O. la differenza senza dubbio ha fatto lo Staff. Ottima organizzazione. Perfetto!

title: Not Worth the Money
text: I was disappointed in our recent birthday night at the Mandarin Oriental.  My husband and I are frequent travelers, especially in New York City.  We have stayed, for example, at The Eventi, The Bryant Park Hotel, and Nomad.  The Mandarin Oriental was a splurge.  What I found you get for the money is great views and a larger room.  My criticisms are: at 12 noon we requested we get into the room early and it was not ready until almost 2 pm, they charge you for the internet (Yes!!!  They say it won't be on the room charge but it was - though they took it off when we made a fuss.), Requested foam pillows when reservation was made, front desk confirmed the foam pillow request, there were goose down pillows on the bed, (housekeeping did come and change them), the fitness center is not open 24 hours (closes at 9 pm I believe), a small but telling thing - the magnifying mirror in the bathroom is on the counter and not at eye level like at most modern hotels.

title: Wonderful stay in an amazing hotel.
text:
We travelled to NYC and stayed in the mandarin in January 2017. We were adult family members sharing a room. Check in was flawless and we were shown to our river view room on the 56 floor. 
The views were amazing but the room was incredibly small for three adults. That being said, as soon as we informed reception of this we were given a much larger room with amazing views of Central Park. I think they had assumed it was two adults and a child when we booked. The second room was on the 45th floor and was perfect. 
The views from the lounge/bar are truly magnifying burg during the day and at night. We had drinks in the bar on several occasions during our hour night stay and the service was impeccable. The hostess always managed to get us a table at the windows when she got to know we were residents. 
We also ate here at lunchtime on a few occasions and had afternoon tea on the day of departure. The food was consistently good. Hotel is very central, rooms are quiet and the street outside is quite calm compared to a lot of other hotels adjacent to the park. 
Will definitely be returning the next time in in NYC.

title: Couldn't believe how bad this hotel is
text: Can't believe what I paid and what I got. Hotel is very rundown. Feels old and poorly maintained. Very noisy rooms; you could hear all the doors banging from adjacent rooms due to a weirdly strong wind current generated in the hallways. The rooms were super cold (heater wasn't much help) it felt like the cold wind was making its way inside the room also generating more noise. The towels felt like bad quality ones. Also they were very stingy when asking for additional towels. Super small rooms considering the price. Specially the bad room was minuscule. The only plus could be it's "location" and the view from the lobby bar (which by the way was outrageously expensive with bad service). It's a disappointment being a fan of the brand and having stayed in many of their properties.

title: Outstanding service
text:
We stayed here for only one night to celebrate my fiance birthday. Apartment had a great view to the central park.
Front desk, concierge and cleaning ladies were great and execute amazing service.
The only negative point was during the dinner as menu price and billed price were different, and waiter service wasn't good at all. But view at the restaurant was great, for wasn't good either.
I would certainly come back, but for sure wouldn't come back to the restaurant.

title: It is ok...not more...go to the 4 seasons instead
text:
I have tried quite a few Hotels in NYC... the 4 Seasons, The Crosby Street, The Soho Grand, the Andaz...
I was eager to try the Mandarin! After all, it is supposed to be one of the Best in Town... well.. I was disappointed.
Everything about it was so-so to my taste. The food was ok not great. The room was ok, not great. The service was ok, not great. I mean everyone would do his job... but...it doesn't have this extra feeling where you feel you are treated in a special way. The feel the makes you believe that you are the only client that matters in this Hotel. I felt that at the 4 Seasons. No special complaints about the place. I just felt that I was in a "Westin"... nothing special...

title: The Mandarin made my trip to New York the best possible!!!
text:
From the minute I entered the hotel to the minute I left the hotel , I felt very special.
Fabulous service , great and friendly staff willing to go that extra mile .
On arrival my room was not ready and I was shown into the restaurant for a free drink and snack .
The Mandarin is in a superb location with a great bar and restaurant with exceptional views.
My room had an amazing view .

title: Extraordinary Service, Location, and Accomodations
text: I am in NYC frequently to visit family and have never stayed at this hotel.  I usually stay in lower Manhattan or boutique hotels in Brooklyn.  I just love this hotel.  Every person I encountered was professional, polite, and went out of their way to exceed my needs.  So rare today.  My room was comfortable, quiet, and relaxing.  I enjoyed an after dinner drink in the lobby lounge and tea on the afternoon of my departure --  just pinch me.  Both were so enjoyable.  I am already looking forward to my next visit.

title: First Class
text: The hotel is perfectly located right on Columbus Circle.  The rooms were clean, comfortable and well appointed.  The staff was courteous and accommodating.  This was by no means a budget stay, it was expensive, but we got what we paid for.  We had a two bedroom suite, connected to a one bedroom.  My only complaint would be that the TV reception was poor.

title: コンパクトながらゴージャス
text:
宿泊した部屋はハドソンリバービューのスタンダードタイプなので、最もお手頃価格帯で狭いですが、コンパクトな中にもマンダリンオリエンタルらしいゴージャスさがあります。バスタブは窓に向いていて、気分が盛り上がります（たとえ古びたビルの眺めでも）。シャンプー、コンディショナー、ボディローションなどのバス関係はatelier cologne（アトリエ コロン）　というフランスのフレグランスブランドのものでしたが、マンダリン台北で使用されてたいたdyptyque(ディプティック)とは違い中性的な香りで好きになりました。他のアメニティでは、シェイビングキット、歯磨きセット、シャワーキャップ、コットン＆綿棒。バスソルトももちろん用意されています。
ターンダウンには、マンダリンラベルのミネラルウォーターがグラスと一緒に置いてありました。
３Fからタイム・ワーナーセンタービルにつながっているので、ちょっと買い物に出るのも気分的に楽です。
心残りはせっかく予約していたのに体調を崩して体験できなかったスパ。

title: Geweldig eten goed uitzicht
text: Erg goed ontvangst. Vriendelijk en goed opgeleid personeel. Kwaliteit van het eten is goed. Uitzicht over Central park en de stad is erg leuk. De prijzen zijn aan de hoge kant maar zeker waard om te lunchen of te eten. Tel er wel nog 20 procent bedieningsgeld bij. Wij hebben er van genoten.

title: Decepcionante, robo lujoso
text: Decepcionante en todos los sentidos. No vale el precio. Las habitaciones son muy sencillas, no tienen nada especial. Demasiado caro. Las fechas en las que estuvimos el spa estaba cerrado. El wifi se cobra aparte. Las vistas espectaculares pero me fui bastante decepcionada.

title: Amazing mandarin oriental
text: Mandarin Oriental New York was a great experience. The rooms were the perfect size. The service both in the room as well as the front desk and concierge was impeccable. Very courteous and helpful. The health club facility was a little lacking. But overall very highly recommended.

title: Truly outstanding in every aspect.
text:
Having never previously stayed in a Madarin Oriental we had great expectations. 
Our stay was above and beyond our expectations. 
Wow, this place is seriously impressive.
The staff are the best I've ever encountered, they certainly made our stay complete.

title: Все хорошо, кроме счета
text: Очень приветливый персонал. Впервые мне понравилось, как убирают горничные. Ни тронуто ни одного даже ненужного мне предмета или бумажки. Но списали с моего счета дважды за проживание. Пока деньги не вернули.

title: Five night Stay
text:
Fiftieth birthday treat for my husband, myself and our teenage son.
Fabulous location, great views. But disappointed with the rooms. We booked two rooms, both were very small. I had planned to do a special champagne breakfast, in the room  for my husband on his actual birthday but it was just to small, and the rooms were over £2000 a night! 
I phoned the hotel prior to our stay and asked for a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to be placed in our room, on arrival, as a special treat and surprise for my husbands fiftieth birthday. It hadn't been done and when I asked them to do it, It was put in our teenage sons room and not our room. 
Most of the staff were friendly and helpful. 
The rooms are very clean, with nice bathrooms but for me just to small. Tea and coffee facilities might be nice as well. 
We will not be staying here again, as the room size is a big thing for me especially for five nights. It is a shame as we love the Mandarin in London.

title: Amazing view & place - WOW!
text: Loved this property, great rooms, friendly staff, great bar, really excellent location. It simply couldn't get any better and that is why it's the Mandarin, you only get the best. Really loved the concierge, super friendly. Superior views of Central Park, really amazing to stay there. A special treat and experience. If you have time definitely do the spa, wow!

title: Excellent hotel, excellent location
text:
This is the first hotel we've stayed in in a long time that was so attentive and personable. There were so many little things that made a difference between this hotel and those we've stayed in over the past few years. For instance, when our room was cleaned, they folded all of our items that were left out, arranged our shoes and other items, and threw away our trash that was left on the tables. It sounds so small, but even when we've stayed at the JW Marriott, they don't do that. Furthermore, they left bottled water every night at turndown (complimentary), left two complimentary hardback novels to read and take with us, and refreshed our bathroom towels and amenities every day. 
As dumb as it sounds, one of my biggest pet peeves is having low water pressure or a bad shower head in the shower. This is the first hotel in as long as I can remember that had a great shower head and water pressure! In addition, the room temperature was great, and we were able to make it as cold or as warm as we liked. 
Finally, the location of this hotel was perfect for us. We did not want to stay in Times Square, as we preferred to stay a little further away from the crowds and noise. The Mandarin is right across the street from Central Park, it is attached to a fabulous mall, and is in walking distance to a ton of different sites and activities. The subway is right at the hotel, and cabs are easily attainable. One final perk is the car service the hotel offers. Although it's not always available, there were two times when we were going somewhere close, and the doorman offered us the complimentary hotel car rather than calling up a cab for us. Just one of the many wonderful services and attention to detail the hotel offers. I highly recommend the Mandarin!

title: Wow
text:
Wat een hotel! Op de 35e een receptie en de rest met de lift naar je suite. Pure luxe met een prachtig uitzicht over Central Park.
