Onze kamer was groot, had een mooie badkamer en was van alle gemakken voorzien. Perfecte service en zeer vriendelijk conciërge....!

Tnx for having us!

title: Xmas break in NYC
text:
Great location for a property on the edge of central park and convenient for the theatre district .
Has a boutique feel and quite small but has a personal feel . Staff are well trained and provide attentive service .  Dining is quite limited with one main restaurant and the lounge bar and room service offer the same menu which is pretty limited but well prepared and tasty .

title: Amazing hotel in NY
text: Great staff and superior service compared to equivalent 5 star hotels in the city. Breakfast and brunch on weekends are mandatory with breathtaking views of the Central Park. The gym and spa are good but not as impressive as the Shangai's and Tokyo's branches. It's a Mandarin hotel for sure.

title: First Class
text: It was something to be expected from such a brand. Everything was perfect...the services and rooms. I stayed with a big group as we were in NY for an official visit and the staff and management were able to attend to us without any fuss. The security was rather tight as the King of Jordan and his Queen were also staying there but I am not complaining. Would love to stay here again but for a vacation.

title: Great People Average Rooms
text: The people make the stay pleasant and the service is great. The room we ended up in for eight nights was not great at all. It was poorly laid out and the bathroom was cramped. At a high end price for accommodation, this is not worth it.

title: Terribly over priced and horrible customer service
text: I recently stayed at this hotel to celebrate an anniversary with my wife, I couldn't have been more disappointed, even if the stay was free. This hotel honestly couldn't PAY me to stay there again.I expected a 5 star hotel, what my wife and I got was an outdated, overrated unpleasant atmosphere. The front desk girl was nice enough, but not impressive, and the engineering team was an absolute joke. Our toilet was clogged and the heat in our room didn't work, it blew out cold air. I called the operator and they were supposed to send someone up. I had to call 3 times before someone came to our room. They showed up over an hour later, and the man was extremely rude to my wife and I. He unclogged the toilet, using a disgusting plunger and then used the towels in the room to clean up his mess. When I asked him if that was normal, he wouldn't answer me. He was extremely unpleasant, treating me and my wife like we were a nuisance to him. He then told us he needed help with the ac problem, he called another engineer to the room and that engineer wreaked of cigarette smoke. It was absolutely disgusting, my wife and i had to leave the room because we couldn't take it anymore. When we returned, it still smelled of him. I didn't bother calling the front desk because I didn't want anymore terrible service. We just opened the window. I don't remember what the name of the second engineer was, but the first ones name was Billy, or that's what I think the other engineer called him. because of this, this hotel has lost this customer, never again will I stay here.

title: First class all the way
text: Oh!  Gorgeous!  Delightful!  Wonderful!  The lobby is in the 35th floor, so your first impression is looking out at the most amazing view,  Ther is nothing you could ever ask for that you couldn't get here.  Great job.  Great property.

title: Ci ritorno sempre...
text: Ogni volta che vengo a New York mi dico che devo provare qualche altro Hotel ma poi alla fine  sempre al Mandarin mi fermo. Solo la vista su Central Park merita! Posizione comodissima a due passi dalla fifte avenue. Central Park al di la' della strada, il centro di Columbus Circle... e poi stanze curatissime e pulite. Il costo c'e' ma il servizio pure!

title: Not worth the money compared to competition
text:
The hotel hasn't been renovated in a while and some of the staff are a bit rude if you aren't a 70 year old in a full suit. The experience was fine but not what you'd expect for almost $1000 per night even for New York. 

Go to the Lotte Palace Towers or Park Hyatt instead.

title: Panorama fantastico
text: Ci siamo fermati solo per un'aperitivo al ristorante dell'hotel situato agli ultimi piani,panorama mozzafiato su columbus Circle e central park personale accogliente e disponibilissimo prezzi legittimamente alti.consiglio

title: Worth Every Penny
text: We decided to come for our 17th Anniversary. From the exit of our cab to our door this hotel strives to empress! We are staying for two nights but we are planning our return already! Gabriel & Diandra amazing!

title: PERFECTION!!!!!!!!!!
text:
Great job folks!
Keep up the good work.
You guys are on que and I wouldn't change anything at all,,, from the front door greeting with the bellman to the departure!!!
Sincerely,
Richard A Magliocca , Sr.

title: Dinner in lobby bar
text: Took our group of 6 for dinner and drinks after treatments upstairs at the spa. They make any drink you can imagine and service is fantastic. The bar food was great and the ambiance is fun and very cosmopolitan. We loved the roasted edamame and the sliders and fries. The tuna tartare is to die for!  I didn't love the chicken lollipops- too fatty in a very thick deep fried covering like a General Tso's texture. For the 6 of us the bill came to $900 for two rounds of food and 3 of drinks. I'd go back.

title: Hôtel splendide,emplacement au top!
text:
Hôtel vraiment magnifique, emplacement TOP au coin sud ouest de central park à 2 pas du métro.
Literie exceptionnelle. personnel très accueillant.

EXPÉRIENCE À RENOUVELLER

Seuls points négatifs 
WiFi non incluse dans le.prix de la chambre 
Prestations mini bar, spa, petit déjeuner extrêmement cher.

title: Hotel
text:
If there Money is not an issue in your trip highly recommend to stay in the Mandarin Oriental hotel.
Normally Mandarin Oriental hotel is located in best position both for business and shopping.
Staff are professionally trained and welling to serve with extra mile.
Providing good business centre, gym and Spa facilities.
Restaurants also above normal standard.

title: Best Hotel for a Girls Weekend
text: My friends, group of 6, stayed in a suite for the weekend and we had the best service ever. Every staff member (room service, front desk and servers at the lounge) treated everyone with the most attentive and caring service. The view in the lounge and suite were superb. If you are looking for a girls weekend to get pampered in NYC, look no further and stay at the Mandarin!

title: Best Mandarin Oriental Property
text: The highlight of our recent stay at The Mandarin Oriental New York was the service. From the moment we stepped out of the car to our room, we were greeted and treated with a lot of caring and attention. The ambiance was warm and soothing both the lobby and the room. Great restaurants and enjoyed our meals very much. If you want to indulge and have a romantic getaway, I recommend The Mandarin Oriental New York.

title: October 2016 stay
text: The hotel is beautiful and staff is very helpful. We thought the room was a bit small for the price as other hotels in the area had larger rooms but were more reasonable. Bed was comfortable and turn down service was nice.

title: Great conference venue and good testaurant
text:
I was there for half a day to speak at a conference and also had lunch in the Asian restaurant.

The conference room and reception venue was nice. The UN annual meetings were on so all NYC hotels were busy. 

One could see many international official delegates on nearby tables enjoying both the view and the nice food.

I was not very well but the food was so good it energised me and got me to perk up and deliver a good conference speech.

AR.

title: Mandarin NY stay November 20, 2016
text:
Booked a one night stay for business for Saturday November 20. booked my reservation online through the mandarin website. booked a Hudson view room. drove from Baltimore. valet is very efficient although a bit expensive ($84 for one night) . excellent check in as they have the ability to have more than 1-2 front desk help if the line is long. very comfortable room. it is not a big room but everything very smartly organized. even room for a nice sofa by the window,  beautiful TV and easy to operate . my one complaint is the pressure sensitive mini bar. I placed a soft drink in the mini fridge to stay cold. I inadvertently moved some other mini bottles and was charged accordingly (however as always the mandarin staff are first class an customer focused- I explained the situation and was offered a full refund no questions asked) turn down service efficient and un-obtrusive
ordered room service for dinner and breakfast. both fantastic. bed is very comfortable. you close the curtains and the design is so nicely done that the room is pitch dark and this leads to a very comfortable sleep.  I ordered breakfast for 715 am and they arrived 7;12 am. that is the Mandarin Oriental in one experience. check out as usual very efficient and friendly- they knew that I had asked for my car- will stay here again for sure

title: Beautiful hotel & amazing location
text: We had an outstanding stay at the Mandarin Oriental in New York. The staff is so nice and happy. We had a room on the 54th floor, very comfortable with a unique view on Central Park. I won't forget the sunrising behnd the skyline.

title: Gorgeous!
text: Evening event rooms were beautiful- food was good service was ok- they were rushed and bumped into people sitting down a lot as served- view was beautiful and we enjoyed the evening very much! We would have loved to stay but rooms were too expensive

title: Beautiful and very high quality service
text:
This hotel is has a beautiful lobby that provides a stunning view of New York City. It is only second to the Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo. The service is professional with knowledgeable people working at the concierge who are more than eager to help and regularly offer suitable recommendations. 

We were heading towards the Mandarin hotel is Boston upon checking out and they were helpful enough take it upon themselves to inform the Boston branch of our specific requirements for our stay. 

The service of the hotel is perhaps the best service I have come across from all the hotels I have stayed at. I will certainly be staying there again on my next visit!

title: My Perch in New York
text:
The Mandarin Oriental continues to be one of my favorite hotels in New York. As I am a bird watcher, I feel so blessed to be in my perch up on the 35th floor of the  Time Warner building. The restaurant, bar,  and spa are amazing places as well and the service is impeccable. Did I mention Edyta and Fini  in the spa or Ken and Joel at the concierge desk or the view of Central Park in all the seasons?????

Seriously I know this is a big ticket here but you do get what you pay for!  My only criticism is that some times the bar is rented out for special events!  Not fair if you are only here for one night!!

title: セントラルパークを見下ろす眺めは豪華だが
text: 旅程の途中で2泊のみ利用。ロケーションからして泊まってみたかったホテルだが、公園の緑を見下ろす景色は、5番街側からの方が好き。リンカーンセンターが近いので、オペラや音楽鑑賞には便利。高級ホテルなのでサービスの良さは当然のレベル。他に泊まった系列ホテルに比べて、ここという魅力が無い。

title: Tope hotel in New York
text: Stayed at the Mandarin in New York for 3 nights on business. Room has a bath tub overlooking central park. Not quite as nice a view like the old Mandarin in San Fran (now has a different owner) but spectacular nevertheless. It sits on top of a shopping center with upscale retails. Convenient to walk to everything. Expensive but worth it. Restaurant has a nice view as well.

title: Luxus-Hotel in exzellenter Lage in Manhattan
text:
Wir waren für eine Woche dort und haben den Aufenthalt sehr genossen: Atemberaubende Lobby im 35. Stock. Dort hin kommen auch sehr viel fremde Besucher, weil man einen phantastischen Blick auf den Columbus Circle, den Central Park und den nördlichen Broadway hat.

Unser Zimmer war in hervorragendem Zustand. Zwei große luxuriöse Betten, stilvolle Einrichtung mit Schreibtisch und zwei Chaiselongues, um den Blick auf die Stadt und den Hudsonriver zu genießen. Ein großes, sehr neuwertiges Bad aus hellem Marmor. Riesen Dusche. Separate Toilette. Zwei Mal am Tag wird das Zimmer aufgeräumt und gereinigt. Tolles Entertainment-System mit deutschem TV. Sehr schnelles kostenloses WLAN im ganzen Haus für viele Geräte verfügbar. Somit kann man mit WLAN Call kostenlos nach Deutschland telefonieren. Kleine Nachteile: Keine europäische Steckdose. Wir haben einen Wasserkocher vermisst und eine Nespresso-Maschine. Minibar sehr teuer. Aber auf der Strasse gegenüber sind Läden, wo man sich selbst versorgen kann.

Tolle Restaurants. Wir haben es nur einmal genutzt. Sehr gute Qualität. Frühstück haben wir immer in der Stadt genommen. Ich finde die Preise in den Hotels grundsätzlich unangemessen.

Die Mitarbeiter sind außerordentlich freundlich, wenn man etwas von ihnen will. Rezeption und Consierge sehr engagiert. Wir haben ein gratis Late-Checkout bekommen, um den letzten Tag bis zum Abflug noch voll genießen zu können. Um 17 Uhr konnten wir so noch unter die Dusche und dann an den Airport.

Wellness haben wir nicht in Anspruch genommen. Der Pool soll toll sein.

Als Gast wird man in Ruhe gelassen, wenn man nichts "vom Hotel" will. Das kenne ich von anderen MOs anders. Hier wird eher aktiv auf den Gast zugegangen. Uns hat dies nichts ausgemacht. Vielleicht USA Kultur.

Wir nutzen MO-Hotels oft, wenn es möglich ist.

title: 典雅的五星酒店
text: 位在時代華納大廈,緊鄰中央公園西側入口.來到大廳後,一眼望去即是大片落地窗,將美景盡收眼底.特別喜歡這裡房間的大理石衛浴,非常典雅大氣

title: Localização Excelente
text:
Bom hotel, com excelente localização com vista para o Central Park. Suas acomodações são padrão Mandarin que conheço (Singapura, Miami, Las Vegas).
Café da Manhã a La Carte razoável. Pessoal de Serviços atenciosos.

title: Expensive, but everything you would expect from a Mandarin Oriental
text:
I travel a lot for business - approximately 120 days per year.  I am fortunate to stay in some really terrific hotels.  

I chose the Mandarin because it has a 20 (or 25) yard pool.  Seriously, that is how much I love my swimming.  

Pros:
- it really is an exquisite property, modern, high ceilings and excellent staff
- the rooms are quite nice with great linens
- it has a great pool and gym
- the restaurant is very accommodating to "high maintenance" guests - I heard the most ridiculous order being placed over lunch and the server didn't bat an eye; and no it wasn't me

Cons
- pool doesn't open until 6:00 am which is a problem when you have an early morning meeting
- the location is a bit suboptimal if you want to be in thick of things - on Columbus Circle provides great proximity to Central Park but is not convenient for shopping near Rockefeller Centre

title: Colazione con vista
text: Per provare un emozione concedetevi una colazione in questo hotel. La varietà e la qualità del cibo e' unita ad una imperdibile vista su di New York e ...se poi vi capita anche una bella giornata l'esperienza e' indimenticabile.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Checked in at the Mandarin Oriental  NYC where we stayed 2 nights for the Thanksgiving Party where you can  watch the Macy”s Parade from a good vantage point.  The hotel is located on top of Time Warner on Columbus Circle, overlooking Central Park and close to restaurants, shopping and walking distance to the theatres.  There are lots of shops at Time Warner with hotel access on the 35th floor.

Our room is beautiful, spacious with the Hudson River view. It has nice comfortable bed and was given the choice of pillow firmness which was a plus.  The bathroom is spacious  and luxurious with double sinks, has separate tub and showers and water closet, the floors has radiant heat.  It has all the toiletries you will need.

Staff are friendly, knowledgeable and courteous.  Housekeeping did a good job on making up our room. They made sure we have all we needed.

The Hotel has a bar on 35th floor where you can have a nice drink, appetizer and enjoy the beautiful view.

Pricey but  worth it.

title: Marvelous to the Extreme!
text:
We live in New York City and my wife and I treated ourselves to 2 nights at the Mandarin Oriental. This was our anniversary gift to ourselves. It is a 5 star hotel and I would give it 6 if I could. Knowing that we were there for our anniversary and booked through the American Express Fine Hotels Program, we were upgraded to a suite. The room, on the 48th floor, was perfect. The first day there we had breakfast in the restaurant. I was very surprised when the waitress called me by my name. That has never happened in any hotel I have ever been to. When the woman who made up our room saw us in the hall, she also greeted us by using my name. And the same thing happened when we had lunch in the lobby cafe. Most impressive!
In the afternoon, we both had massages in the Spa. What a treat! A hot whirlpool, a steam room, and a fantastic massage. They also have a relaxation lounge that overlooks the city.
The service, the attention to every detail was just perfect.
Now, I hate to degenerate into potty talk but I have to. I can only speak for the room I had but I will assume that the other rooms have the same toilet. It is a Japanese toilet. When I walked into the small toilet room inside the very large bathroom, the toilet seat cover rose on its own. When I sat down, the toilet seat was nice and warm. There is a box on the wall that explains how to operate the toilet. It can shoot water up while you are sitting to clean what ever needs cleaning. Now, to be honest, I didn't try that feature. I like technology but this is something I want to do myself. However, if you go to the Mandarin Oriental and do use the full capabilities of the toilet, I'd really like to read about your experience if you review on Trip Advisor.
I think the present we gave each other was the best anniversary we've ever had.
We saved up for this present because it was very expensive. But we have already decided that we are going back next year and possibly adding an extra day.

title: Uno spettacolo, a partire dalla vista
text: Lusso. Bellezza e classe. Albergo irrinunciabile dove il lusso è palpabile.Qualità del servizio eccellente, dettagli al top. Ogni dollaro speso per questo albergo è un investimento nel benessere. Pura gioia.

title: superbe bar
text:
lieu ideal, meme si un peu cher...., pour prendre un apéro avec vue epoustouflante sur central park
tout est superbe, il suffit de monter directement au 35e étage et apprécier l'endroit,
certes il faut qqfois attendre qu'une place se libère mais vraiment cela en vaut la peine

title: The epitome of opulence in New York City
text: Resting adjacent to Columbus Circle, this hotel is a must go to any business, leisure, traveler to the New York City area. I was recently here for a wedding I was attending and it was breathtaking. I was lucky enough to see the bridal suite, a regular suite on the 42nd floor, as well as numerous of their regular rooms. The accommodations are top notch, the views of Central Park New Jersey the Hudson river all the way up to the George Washington Bridge are breathtaking. The wedding itself at the Mandarin ballroom was one of the best I've ever attended. The catering staff as well as the Mandarin staff handled everything with the  upmost professionalism. They are more than accommodating but remember this is New York City and you are going to pay a price for that. I highly recommend this for any high and traveler, from anywhere all over the world. You will not be disappointed.

title: great
text:
This hotel was superb! We had a wonderful room, very luxurious, with gorgeous views of Central Park.

This hotel is geared toward the business traveler and spa goers. I did not have the opportunity to try the spa, but I hear it is to die for.

The hotel is in the highest floors of the building, so the views were beautiful. Slightly obstructed by the obnoxious Trump hotel.

The hotel is very expensive, but it is top shelf. The service is excellent... the front desk had my name memorized after checking me in... that surprised me when they remembered my name the following day.

The hotel is right at Columbus circle and a short walk to Central Park and about 15 minutes to the theatres.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: Upon arrival were upgraded to a suite. They wished my husband a happy birthday without me even mentioning it was his birthday. Gorgeous room with top end amenities (love the Fresh products). Fantastic views. Staff is fabulous. Great location. We ended up going to the spa at Equinox instead of the hotel which was great for massages.

title: Wedding Week
text: The entire staff of the Mandarin could NOT have done more for us the week of our daughter's wedding.  From accommodating my request for rooms on the same floor, the helpful concierge staff recommending brunch location for Sunday am and arranging transportation throughout our stay, bellmen delivering boxes of photos via cab, helpful front desk staff as guests arrived, bellmen delivering flowers to the brunch venue on Sunday, storing said flowers and cake, lovely staff in the Asiate at breakfast....I could go on and on.  All this and a convenient location....

title: Old, tired, noisy
text:
This Hotel was a great disappointment. It is very expensive. The suites, at 2200+ a night, are just not worth it. 

The staff are not overly friendly, particularly at breakfast, I was woken up early two mornings running by housekeeping noise outside my room at 7am, the corridors are dark and worn, the furniture in the room is old, stained and not very comfortable and I won't be staying here again.

And one more thing...the glass in the windows is pretty thin and the noise from sirens is very loud and they go all night long!!

title: Great time to be in NYC in Oct!
text: Good location, great view, decent size room if that counts for 5 star or luxury in New York City!  Not quite to the taste level of some other Mandarin oriental I have stayed in the past!  Will charge you 5 dollars for five minutes of wifi, could find better ways to charge you for more!!!!

title: NYC Get away
text: A perfect hotel, we did not even want to leave our room. I was so peaceful . The location could be be better easy access to everything we love in NY. The views were amazing and everyone at the hotel was helpful and made us feel special.

title: Great
text: Great place, more than anything the location was Perfect!! It's The Mandarine Hotel, but for the price It was better than what we expected!! Clean, confortable, overall was perfect!! For these who want the Best for the money

title: Outstanding views
text:
I also stay at the Mandarin when in NEw York I find that the views are formidable.
Unfortunately I have noticed a slight change, the rooms could do witha bit of renovation and it would be nice for recurring guests as myself to receive a more personalised touch with fruit in the room for example.

title: The best hotel in New York city
text: I decided to try the St. Regis based on a recommendation, but after a disappointing stay there, I checked out early and moved to the Mandarin.  Talk about a different world. Everything about the experience was terrific.  The views, needless to say, are incredible, but it's really the warmth and friendliness of the staff combined with their amazing attention to detail that sets the hotel apart.  It's not an artificial warmth, either.  Everyone seems genuinely friendly, eager to help, and extremely knowledgeable. The hotel is very expensive but it justifies the price. You'd be very hard-pressed to find anything better, not just in New York, but in the US.  One of the very best hotels in the country.

title: Food with a View!
text: It's starts with outstanding service and just gets better. We came for the view and got so much more! Great sliders with fries and enjoyed a wonderful bottle of wine! You must do this however a little expensive.

title: Best of the best
text:
We moved here from the Carlyle hotel and well what a difference! 

World class hotel - spacious rooms for NYC,  superb park view, the best manicure I've ever had at the spa and very central especially if it's your first time to NYC.

My husband tends to gravitate towards this hotel as he usually stays at the manadarin in Hong Kong and you always know that you will get the best.

Even the room service and tidy up is above and beyond. The concierge is extremely helpful and the breakfast is excellent and the view of Central Park is so beautiful in fall.  It's a great hotel to take advantage of the Park, midtown, upper east and west side are able to be walked too and you can get to soho and downtown via subway fairly quickly. 

The biggest advantage is that it os nice and high and much quieter in terms of traffic and sirens which are always blaring through NYC.

Highly recommended!

title: Amazing from start to finish
text: I was recommended this hotel by a friend who's dad runs a mandarin in Asia having stayed with the group before in Tokyo I knew what to expect sheer excellence from a driver waiting for us at the airport to even getting us a certain type of juice we wanted in our room also the location of the hotel is 1st class we paid a little more for a park view which we loved at night as we where knackerd from all the site seeing and shopping might I add the reception recommended 4 restaraunts and bars for us too go to and each where outstanding also having asked the hotel too sort our day trips which included the Empire State Building and a helicopter trip which is a must if you have the time there was no hassle just sheer effiency.

title: One of the best 5 star hotels with the most amazing Central Park view
text: The view of snowy Central Park and service in the hotel were incredible. Asiate is a must to go and to their lobby bar for breakfast.Their blueberry pancakes are heaven!!!! Everyone is extremely polite, patient and they will truly work with you to accommodate your needs. One of a very few nyc hotels that have absolutely everything you need in a very short walk distance, and on top of that unbeatable view of NYC finest Central Park.

title: Nice afternoon tea but expensive
text: We had a nice afternoon tea, the ginger scones were special but the price was eye-watering (just shy of 200 dollars for afternoon tea, two glasses of their cheapest champagne and a standard tip). We hoped to get a seat near the window but were out of luck and they mixed up our reservation date. The clientele seemed dominated by stern business types which dampened the mood. Service can be improved - the waiter pointed out we were missing our favourite of the listed sandwiches, went to check with chef and never mentioned it again. We were also going to get another drink but after dropping off the menu he never came back. They also said they'd try to move us to a window seat but when the chance arose they just led another couple over. Still, it was good food, great views (if you are near them) and delicate bites, I just think the context of the slight stuffiness/final price puts things into perspective

title: Great location by Central Park
text: Superb hotel location on Central park, sophisticated staff.Outstanding bedroom views with floor to ceiling windows. Greatgym, Ydillique restaurant setting with panoramic view,Chocolate cake is a must.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
Stayed here for a week in a Hudson View room. The view is spectacular. Had adjoining rooms with my teenagers, worked very well, as there was a second door that could be closed, creating your own apartment. They look after you exceedingly well here. Lobby view of the park is worth seeing as is the view from the restaurant. 
Pool is worth using, and has an amazing view too.
I would stay here again.
If you can afford this hotel, you will not regret staying here.

title: Best 5 star hotel in New York
text: I actually cannot think of anything negative about this hotel! Everything from the customer service to the restaurant to the rooms and view are on another level to any other hotel in New York! The rooms are very big for NY standards and the view on Central Park in the restaurant is amazing.

title: Mandarin Oriental Lounge Bar at 35th Floor
text:
Странно, что тут никто не написал про прекрасный бар (и немного кафе-ресторан), который находится в Mandarin Oriental на 35 этаже за зоной ресепшн.
Всякий раз, когда я приезжаю в NYC, я назначаю там встречи со знакомыми из-за его прекрасного расположения и невероятно красивого вида на город (и центральный парк) - оттуда вид на миллион долларов. Совсем необязательно останавливаться в отеле, чтобы сходить в этот Lounge.

Очень советую. Не ради еды, а ради вида и атмосферы. Напитки замечательные, большая карта коктейлей и чайная карта.  Еды там немного, она фьюжн с азиатским акцентом, поэтому советую туда приходить за напитками или десертами. Ну или для того, чтобы удивить знакомых красивым видом города, прекрасным интерьером и выпить по коктейлю.

title: Fantastic view of Centra Park
text: A fantastic experience. We had the city skyline view room, but it also gave us a nice view of Central Park. Perfect location close to metro lines and with walking distance to some of New Yorks greatest sights.

title: Gorgeous views of NYC, spacious rooms.
text: The Mandarin in NYC is definitely one of the best places you can stay in NYC. If you have the freedom of budget for a luxury hotel I would recommend this one for its keen location in Columbus Circle, which is within walking distance to several shops and restaurants and Central Park! But I also love the lobby bar restaurant because of the stunning views. Attending a business event in one of their meeting suites and the food and service was outstanding.

title: Impeccable
text: Mandarin Oriental was, by far, the best hotel I've stayed in. It truly was an experience. Everyone in the hotel made it a point to say hello, ask if I needed anything, etc. The fitness center was fantastic. The room was a showstopper . . . The bathroom was so spa-like. I was more comfortable than I knew I could be in a hotel. I'd love to stay again for any occasion.

title: The best so far
text:
La ubicación es insuperable.
Habitaciones de lujo.
Los pisos mas altos sin alucinantes.
Pileta pre olimpica
Desayuno con muchas opciones
gym de maravillas.
Excelente trato.
Abajo tiene restaurantes de categoria
cvs cerca
Walgreens
Ar&t

title: A great hotel
text: When I was looking for a hotel to stay in New York, I was a bit worried because I've never been to New York before and wanted to stay in a place that I can feel comfortable with an amazing view. I chose Mandarin Oriental and I have one word for this hotel.....fabulous! Great hotel with excellent service. I was glad to choose this hotel and I'm coming back! The view was amazing from the room and the room itself was perfect. Loved it!

title: Beautiful Views
text: We stayed at this magnificent  hotel. The views were fantastic, the staff was amazing . My brother got married and they had the reception there as well. They went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. The only thing I would recommend is that the wi/fi should absolutely be included in the cost of a room that is many, many hundreds of dollars a night....

title: Excellent stay
text: I was upgraded to a Suite with a small additional charge and had excellent stay in New York.  Unfortunately swimming pool was closed, and Spa and Fitness center limited. Staff are extremely helpful and warm.

title: Certainly not up to MOHK standards...
text:
Great location at Columbus Circle with gorgeous views all around, however, hotel is a bit tired and in need of a refurb... Lots of wear and tear on furniture in room and for some reason this hotel just doesn't have the special MO buzz to it... Perhaps my standards are too high by comparing this hotel to the awesome MOHK... In room amenities certainly not on the same level and hotel facilities also lack. 

Tried to visit the bar twice, closed on both occasions for private functions...

Will want to visit again, however, for $750-$1k a night, I may look to some other options such as the St. Regis.

title: Nice view
text: Pricey, glamorous hotel with amazing views of New York City. But that and the Central Park location felt like the main reason for the place's extraordinarily high price. I was also there for work--so it's probably the kind of place you'd only go to if your company paid for it. Compared to other places I've stayed in New York it's not that much better.

title: Sehr schönes Stadthotel
text:
Das Mandarin in NY hat eine tolle Lage, man kommt direkt vom Hotel in ein Einkaufszentrum mit dem Supermarkt "Whole Foods" und draußen läuft man direkt auf den Central Park zu. 
Die Zimmer sind schön, geräumig und sauber. Jeden Abend werden nochmal die Betten gemacht und das Zimmer mit Getränken und Keksen aufgefüllt. Das Schwimmbad ist schön. 
Gegessen haben wir immer außerhalb.

title: Beyond dreadful
text: The worst five star hotel I've ever stayed in!  You can't find a piece of furniture in this hotel that is not scuffed from years of wear and tear.  Any other self respecting hotel would have refurbished years ago.  The room (as with all the hotel) is out dated, faded and tired.  We just attempted to visit the bar only to be told it's closed!  The pool and fitness room are also closed for refurbishment.  We were not advised of this at the time of booking.  Do not be fooled by on line images as the hotel looks nothing like them.  I just don't know how it has maintained its five star status.  I was looking forward to a great week in New York but this hotel has ruined it.

title: Perfect.....
text: This time around the Mandarin oriental hosted our annual board meeting, and the preparations, venue and service was impeccable. But I wouldn't ever have expected anything less from this hotel. They always deliver....

title: Luxury
text: To stay at the Mandarin Oriental is a luxury - locationwise, servicewise, accomodationwise and pricewise. If you care to stay in a walking distance to the MET and to all the very central amenities you are certainly at the right place. If you care for a spacious room, as nice city-view and a friendly, helpful staff, you are at the right place, too. If you care for an open window instead of aircon, a relaxed breakfast with good espresso and an uncomplicated access to your room you better choose somewhere else.

title: The Finest
text: Having stayed here several times over the years, I can recommend this hotel to anyone looking for the finest experience in the hospitality industry! Friendly, professional staff, some of the best views in NYC from both rooms, restaurant and lounge. 5 Star in all aspects and very serene for NYC.

title: Best Location with Best Service
text: I stayed in this hotel in summer 2015 with my family for two weeks, it's one of the best hotel I ever stayed in including Paris GeorgeV and L.A. Four seasons. The service was brilliant, the staff were superb and helpful. Sure we'll come back.

title: Excelente ubicación y vista hacia Central Park
text: Este hotel definitivamente puede presumir de tener unas de las mejores vistas y ubicaciones en Manhattan. Cumple con todo el sello de la cadena Mandarín Oriental, los lujos, el servicio, su bar y la comida son impecables. Su lobby te da la bienvenida con una lujosa vista hacia Central Park misma que te invita a sentarte en el lobby y pedir alguna bebida para disfrutar de la compañía y de la formidable vista.

title: NIce but service could be better and advanced request was not taken into account
text:
We have booked 3 nights from 18 until 21 August in the premier central park view suite, which is really beautiful but at the same time very expensive. First of all I have to share that the hotel is perfect located, the suite were excellent. BUT, the hotel forgot to mention in advance that the swimming pool is closed and the SPA only partly works due to renovation works until October. It should be visible and they should have warn us in advance. And u pay the same price! However the hotel offered us "SPA" possibility in a regular, huge fitness club next to the building but I am sure u don't want to relax there and it is located in lower level, very full and looks bad... 
We asked in advance, that the suite should be located possibly high level! We got a room on level 38 which is the first or second level with rooms in the hotel which it goes up to 54th level, so not the best view at all and it looks over to a huge terrace of the hotel which is below the room, from the side of the room u cannot see the Hudson river neither. So the hotel stuff just ignored our request which by that price is not acceptable. We asked to change, the staff was very helpful and the promised us a new room in 30 minutes. It took 2 hours!!!!!!! After arriving from Europe, tired and I underline that we have asked for that in advance, I have to tell not the best service at all. The front desk manager invited us meanwhile for a drink in the lobby, which amount has been charged to the room... Not very attentive. Then we got finally the room on the 47th level which had a really amazing view and the room was beautiful. We have asked for late check out until 2pm, the hotel was not able to provide this, however we waited 2 hours for the room...
So the hotel is very nice but the service could be much better, even if we stayed at the first time in the hotel which is noted in their computer.

title: Manage your expectations -> not the traditional / Asian Mandarin Oriental Asian service quality & hospitality
text:
I spend half of my life travelling and I expected the same quality of hospitality  that I always get in Asia with Mandarin Oriental. I made a big mistake : I was in NYC and not in Singapore or somewhere else in Asia. 
The rooms are great, the view is great but the service is poor, and not personalised at all. I am sure I was unlucky - the checking staff did manage to block all my credit cards that I use all the time from Australia to China... even in the USA and Canada. Not a great way to start your holidays with your family.... and it is fair to say the staff could not care less.
there was nothing personal throughout our stay. It was all about money...

I would strongly recommend Mandarin Oriental in Asia.... but if you decide to go to NYC you need to reset your expectations and avoid any non US credit cards.

title: Great hotel, but a bit disappointed with the service
text:
The Mandarin Oriental has it all : great location, great views and superb food. Our two adjacent bedrooms were spacious and impeccably maintained. The view is nothing short of amazing. Our rooms were cleaned twice a day and everybody was very polite, especially the housekeeper.

However, the check-in was a nightmare because we had European cards with pins and apparently their software wasn't updated (that's what we were told). The guy tried several times, and as a result our cards ended up being blocked. Lovely. Things got sorted eventually but I was made to feel that it was our problem (it wasn't !), and the bank called as they thought our cards had been compromised. Needless to say, the hotel couldn't care less.

We had a good stay, but there was no tea or coffee facilities and I must admit that I would have liked a coffee when waking up (at 4 or 5 am, because of the jet lag). The in-room dining was good but a bit too long to arrive (45/50 mins).

The hotel gave us a late check-out, which was nice as we could stay in one of the rooms for a couple of hours. They called us when our car to the airport had arrived (in advance, which was fine because we were ready) and we all (I was travelling with husband & children) went to the ground floor (the lobby is on the 35th floor and our bedrooms on the 54th). 
I don't know what happened then, because the staff spent at least 15 mins looking for our car. It was a complete mess, I think that the team downstairs changed shift, and the new guy didn't have a clue, he first told us that the car hadn't arrived, then that it was the wrong time, made us say our name at least 10 times and ran like a headless chicken to the 5 cars waiting for clients without being able to find ours.
Eventually he found the right car (right in front of the entrance) and apologised profusely. I found the whole episode surreal.
In short, I enjoyed my stay but didn't feel like a valued customer -more like a walking purse, actually.

title: Das beste an der Bar ist die Aussicht
text:
Die Sicht von der Bar im 35. Stock war toll. Das angebotene Dim-Sum-Sample war dann allerdings sehr enttäuschend: geschmacklich höchst mittelmässig, die dazu gereichten Saucen eher langweilig, die Dim Sum selber nicht wirklich heiss. 
Auch der Service entsprach nicht unbedingt der Hotelkategorie und dem Preis. Schade.

title: Amazing place
text: Amazing hotel with beautiful views.  Attended a wedding here last night and it was breathtaking. The prices to stay at the facility are very inflated.  The food and the service is wonderful.  A must if you want to splerge.

title: ON TOP OF THE WORLD!
text: The lobby is on the 35th floor, has amazing views and the rooms are all on floors higher than that! Drinks, food and service, in all manner is exquisite and of the highest caliber. The beds and couches are amazingly comfortable and there should be no problem falling asleep. Expensive, but worth every penny. It is an amazing experience in itself!

title: Delusa
text:
Siamo stati qui per festeggiare il mio compleanno e, nonostante aspettative molto alte, ne sono uscita delusa e insoddisfatta. Siamo stati nella sala bar e abbiamo mangiato due fette di torta. Premesso che non discuto i prezzi in quanto li conoscessi già, ma è mancato tutto. Il servizio secondo me non degno di un hotel di lusso, la qualità dei dolci nella norma, posto anonimo. Si salva solo un pochino la vista (ma mi aspettavo un po meglio). La cosa scandalosa è stato che, alla nostra richiesta per il WIFI, ci hanno chiesto 15$ 😱 
INCREDIBILE! A NY trovi Wi-Fi ovunque, anche in metro. Sicuramente non tornerò

title: Amazing Hotel! Amazing stay
text: We stayed for our wedding anniversary. The views were incredible, the staff was amazing and the hotel was gorgeous! We enjoyed the spa so much. It was the best massages we ever had. The room was beautiful and so clean!

title: The only way to stay in NYC
text: The Mandarin Oriental NYC is both visually stunning and luxurious. Its located in Columbus Circle, in the Upper West Side of Manhattan, and is surrounded by high end retailers and fine dining. The staff is professional and helpful. They ensure that all of your needs are met. This property is well managed and maintained. They made a stressful arrival (our flight landed at 1:00 am) into a seamless and enjoyable experience. Eileen went out of her and took great care of us; And Eugene (the night manager) personally escorted us to the lobby for personalized check-in. We appreciate it all and will only stay at MO NYC going forward! Thank you MO NYC - we are fans for life.

title: Excellent Service
text: Room was beautiful, with excellent view of the Hudson river. Shower and tub were roomy and relaxing, housekeeping was excellent. Workout room was well-equipped and attendant was helpful. Convenient shopping on the lower levels, convenient location across from Central Park.

title: Peaceful Oasis in a Busy City
text: First time at the Mandarin in New York, and it is the best hotel I've visited in New York so far.  They have everything wired perfectly--staff, location, rooms, dining, concierge, and bars.  I plan to stay at the Mandarin on my visit for sure.

title: Pas mal
text:
Bel hotel et surtout superbe piscine. Restaurant pour le petit dejeuner cher et pas de buffet. Pas trop pour les enfants "not very child friendly".
Bar tres bon mais la clientele reste celle d'un hotel 5 etoiles a NY donc un peu speciale et pas tres locale.

title: in the heart of nyc
text: i've been to the mandarin hotel many times ,it is consistantly perfect. from the food to the entertainment, to the service,this hotel is a gem,in the heart of n y c .located on 60th street and columbus circle the views from any window are breath taking.

title: Excellent hotel, where you truly relax
text: I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights for the conference, and even though it was a work trip, the stay was a truly relaxing experience. The views are amazing, and you can work or sit in a bathtub with a beautiful view of Manhattan. The rooms are very clean, the staff is courteous. There are fitness center and the pool amenities in the hotel, both have excellent views on the outside. The water is the pool does not have chlorine. Highly recommended!

title: Mostly 1st class service
text: 1st impression, as I arrived fro the airport wasn't stellar. Once I got to the 35th floor and checked in, the service improved. Room was as expected for a 5 star. I will say the hotel did have plenty of outlets for charging of electronics. TV was also a good size. The hotel restaurant, Asiate, was great. Next visit will have to try the Spa.

title: One the Best City Hotel of the World, Perfectly Located, Great Views, Best Staff - Second to None!
text: As a family of five we stayed one week at the Mandarin Oriental New York during our spring vacation. The hotel is perfectly located at Columbus Circle near Central Park, Park Lane and Broad Way with 5th Avenue in walking distance. It is located on the upper floors (36th+) of the Timer Warner Buildings with great views, especially of the Central Park from the top-end bar area on the reception level. The Mandarin staff is authentically friendly, very attentive and helpful. The rooms are decently furnished and decorated with the highest sleeping comfort I have experienced in a hotel. The food either at  the bar, for break first or at the restaurant is far-above average. Try the Wonton Soup and the lemonade at the bar! The hotel is a perfect starting point for exploring New York by walking. Just around the corner the Broadway starts, the shows and theaters are in walking distance to the hotel. Walking along Park Lane passing by the other top-end New York hotels (though none of them surpasses the quality and standards of the Mandarin) you will reach 5th Avenue after a few minutes. Left-hand side, you pass by the Central Park and can jump on a Riksha to explore New York's green lung. I have stayed at other Mandarin hotels before in Washington D.C., London, Munich, Singapore etc. and it is the right place to be. The staff makes you feel at home, every service is of the highest possible quality. The concierges are the best travel consulting firms you can experience. So whenever going to New York, there is definitely no better place to stay and to enjoy a perfect hotel service. It is one of the best managed places I have ever experienced!

title: Bar mit herrlicher Aussicht
text:
Wir genossen in der Bar schon mehrfach einen Sundowner mit herrlicher Aussicht Richtung Central Park in einem feinen Ambiente und sehr aufmerksamen Service. Ein echt schöner und angenehmer Platz!
Auch das Restaurant ist hervorragend geeignet für ein kleines Business Lunch oder auch für private Treffen. Die Preise sind gehoben , aber der perfekte Service in einem dezenten und sehr schönen Ambiente macht das Essen und den Aufenthalt zu einem Highlight!

title: 10 nachten paradijs
text:
Super mooi hotel met perfecte locatie en zeer attente bediening. Het restaurant heeft een zeer indrukwekkend uitzicht. Niets dan goede commentaren over dit prachtige hotel!! 
De kamers zijn perfect van grote, de bedden liggen hemels en mooie uitzichten.

title: Feel like a million bucks! (for only one tenth of one percent of that...)
text:
We got a great deal on Hotels.com, far lower than the posted room rates.  We weren't treated any differently, though I think we had to pay for wifi while others may get it free.  But we had a great time!

The hotel is located in the CNN/Time Warner building, at the center of the action between Central Park and the Theatre District!  Perfect for walks through the park, walking to museums, walking to a show!   We walked a lot, but were easily able to make it back to home base for a change of clothes or a quick rest!

I'm not usually a fancy-pants luxury hotel person, but I might start to be one!

The view was amazing, the room was amazing.  Only complaints - bathroom lacked a privacy fan, bathroom sliding doors were a bit hard to close.

title: Luxury and Convenience at Columbus Circle
text: Enjoyed a five night stay recently in a Skyline View King Room at this high end Columbus Circle property.  Room quality was up to the usual high MO standards – comfortable bed, tasteful decorations, great bathroom and views.  Service was attentive and prompt from the curb to the room, and from staff throughout the hotel.  I especially appreciated the diligence of the concierge staff at securing reservations at several high demand Manhattan restaurants; their advice was spot on, and they succeeded in getting us exactly the times we wanted.  Location was extremely convenient – adjacent to shopping in Time Warner Center, and a quick walk to Central Park, midtown shopping, and Broadway shows.  Will definitely consider for future NY visits.

title: Wonderful place to arrive in NY
text:
Amazing view and setting
Great to start going around the city
Loved morning jogging in Central Park
Service is to the perfection, such a nice welcome everywhere 
Concierge absolutely fantastic for restaurants, advices, tickets , you name it !

title: Замечательно!
text: Шикарный отель! Отличный сервис. Номера очень чистые, есть халаты, тапочки и все, что может понадобиться.  Хорошо работает вай фай, можно загружать видео и смотреть фильмы. Персонал выполняет свою работу на 5+. Все очень понравилось, рекомендую!

title: What a treat
text: I have stayed at Mansarin Iriental in Ny twice, both times to treat myself. It is expensive but WOW! The room, the view, the bed, the robe, the bedfing, and the service   The pool is awesome and with Whole Foods at the bittom level...,i was in heaven. The lobby, bar area, appetuzers, and the fiod was great. I was treated to a pot of jasmin green tea in my room when i checked in. Security is great and lication is perfect: upper west side close to Central park and shopping and restaurants.  The spa is anazing. The only turn off was being charged $25 for wifi. I mean really ? Couldn't you have included it in the $1500 a night room? However i called and they took it off my bill. I mean Really? C''min. Would i stay there again? If i have the moneyYES

title: Afternoon tea with an awesome view
text:
It was a hot and humid New York afternoon at 91F, we went up to the The Lobby Lounge on the 35th floor for an afternoon tea. Our table was at a corner with an awesome view of the south end of the Central Park. We witnessed the change of Manhattan skyline when temperature dropped from 91 to 85F and the storm rolled in. The panoramic view of both sunny and rainy day in the heart of Manhattan was breathtaking!
Selection of sandwiches and desserts were great, homemade jam and warm scones hit just the right spot. 
It's a worthwhile experience for just US$48 per person for an afternoon tea but do remember to make reservation before you go.
